title: Details at the Dominick
text: The housekeeping and other staff were very attentive and quick with service. The bed was pillows were super comfortable and we appreciated having the button controlled blackout curtains. During the day we had a fantastic view of the skyline.

title: The best hotel in New York
text: We picked the hotel based on the reviews and were absolutely delighted with our stay. This is a fantastic hotel- the staff, the rooms, the location, the whole experience is 5 star. The area is full of fantastic restaurants, bars and the general buzz of Soho- perfect access to the subway (almost directly outside the hotel), a handy convenience store and pharmacy opposite. Room wise, we went for the so-hi and requested a corner room- has great views over lower Manhattan, the Hudson River, and you can manoeuvre yourself to also see up towards Midtown. I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough for if you’re considering a stay in New York!

title: Amazing stay!
text: My husband and I had an incredible stay. We had a gorgeous room, this is an awesome location, the in room dining is awesome, the staff is incredible, the spa was wonderful, the restaurants are amazing, we can’t wait to come back! Thank you for an amazing trip!

title: Great Stay
text: We had a great stay and would certainly stay at this hotel again. Good location and facilities were great. The Vestry hotel exceeded our expectations. Definitely would recommend getting dinner here if staying at the hotel. All of the service was exceptional.

title: Great stay in SOHO
text: This was suggested by a friend and it was great. Service was A plus. Stanley in particular was great. Highly recommend staying here. Great location and the concierge is also excellent. Walking distance to amazing shopping and restaurants and convenient if you are flying out of Newark.

title: Great service at Dominick Hotel
text: Our stay at the Dominik hotel was excellent. From the time we checked in Mohendra at the concierge desk took care of us like we were old clients. He worked with us to get us upgraded and let us preview the suites before we committed. His effort and care made our stay even more enjoyable. We will definitely visit again and look for him.

title: Great place to stay!
text: The bed is very comfortable. The entire staff is extremely attentive and friendly. From the moment you arrive, throughout your stay and during departure service was stellar and prompt. The hotel is very clean and well run. Close to shops and restaurants. Highly recommended!

title: Back again
text:
This is now our 11th visit to The Domonick and we are always happy there.
The staff are great - friendly and efficient.  The location is perfect for our needs.
The hotel is quiet and comfortable, and there are always small welcoming touches.
Thank you.

title: 5 star experience!
text: We had a great experience at The Dominick. It was our proposal trip and we’re so glad we chose to stay here. Mohendra initially assisted us at check in and the process was so smooth. He was kind, extremely helpful and went above and beyond. Will definitely stay again!

title: Amazing view
text:
Amazing staff, food, and room. The view was nothing less than spectacular (37th Floor).

In room coffee was nespresso - nice and easy.

Shower was so powerful, hot water was hot!

Food prices were not bad - lobster tail for breakfast was a delight!

title: Great stay
text: We are big fans of the Dominick.  The hotel is comfortable, friendly and professional staff - plenty of them and the room is nice size and very comfortable. luxurious bathroom.  The hotel is perfectly located in SoHo.  Easy walk to shops and restaurants.  We had another great stay!

title: Good Hotel, location and staff
text: The location is very good at the doors of Soho.All the staff are very attentive . I had my daugther with fever and they offered e free doctor and give me a late checkout free until our departure. Cassandra had very good attention with us. reccomendable

title: Rocky Start, All-Star Finish!
text:
**UPDATED**

I originally posted with an issue regarding my disappointment with my accomodation, as well as my tire being flat (this service is outsourced, so it is not directly the hotel's fault). However, Victor, the hotel manager reached out and was very kind about the whole situation. I am confident this one experience is a fluke, given the consistent level of service everyone here seems to rave about. I will be returning just based on the service, compassion, and professionalism I received. Highly recommend!

title: Not as good as previous stays
text: we've stayed at the Dominick many times however this stay was not as good. our first night was very noisy from the street... 2 of the 4 elevators were not working so it took forever to wait for an elevator and when it would come it was packed with people. it would take us 3-4 elevators each time to find an elevator that had room to take us downstairs. while we were advised that brunch was served until 2pm in the mezzanine, we were told upon arrival at 1:40pm that the kitchen closed at 1:30pm. given how many times we stayed at this hotel the Dominick could have done more at checkout to compensate us.

title: Great Service
text: Gaby at the front desk was so nice and helpful! She deserves a shoutout for the level of service I received. I always stay here for work because of the level of service in general. They have given me gifts and upgrades for staying multiple times in a row, they handle my uber eats orders well, and always respond to my requests quickly.

title: Will make this a "go to" hotel for my NYC excursions.
text:
The Dominick was a very hip and polished hotel.  We loved our accommodations , the staff was great, the gym was top notch and just everything about it was excellent.
Loved the location as well!  Right on Spring Street just blocks away from great shopping, restaurants etc.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel and staff. Our room was on the 29th floor with great views of the city and Hudson. The floor to ceiling glass was great in the bathroom. My wife enjoyed a bath with a view. Easy to access all of the city by walking or taxi. Highly recommend.

title: 10/10 high end luxury
text: By far, the nicest hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in! The service was impeccable, the atmosphere was elevated, the suite was amazing; we couldn’t have been happier! What stood out most for me was that the hotel allowed us to use their umbrellas because it was rainy the only full day that we were there and we didn’t think to bring umbrellas with us on our vacation. Truly an elevated experience that was worth every penny!

title: Fantastic Experience!
text:
This was my first time staying at the Dominick Hotel and the experience was fantastic! I was in town for a family celebration and traveling with my mother and teenage daughter. We could not get over how kind and accommodating all of the staff were during our stay! We checked in with Shon who was awesome, Robert told us about where to find coffee in the building, the concierge drew us a map and told us the best places to eat within walking distance of the hotel, and the doorman  took the time to get us into an Uber with umbrellas in the pouring rain. I am a school  teacher and I give the Dominick an A++! 
The Dominick will be our hotel whenever we return to NYC!

title: Great stay in The Dominick!
text: Great location and very friendly staff. Chilly in the lobby when it's cold outside.  The front doors are heavy to open if the doorman doesn't get there first.  Elevators are slow but a sign said they are in the process of being renovated. Bathroom does not have a door to close it off from bedroom.

title: Average - pushy staff
text: So this is the second time I stayed at the hotel. The first time was amazing. However, the first time and the second time front desk staff was very short staffed and took a very long time to check out. Also, the cleaning staff knocked on my door several times when the do not disturb  sign was on the door to double check what time I was checking out regardless of when I had told him it was gonna be a late check out. I found this kind of scary - as I was in the middle of changing mg clothes and also found them pushy for asking me when I was leaving after I had told front desk at check in what time I was leaving. Not sure if I will stay again. The location is good. But it really should not be part of fine hotels and resorts but perhaps the hotel collection.

title: An excellent value for a family stay!
text:
We were in NYC for a wedding and reserved a two bedroom Skyline Suite - it was a very fare value for the space and convenience for a family stay. The master bedroom bathroom was large and beautiful - perfect for getting ready for an event while the living room area was perfect for room service snacks -  felt like a small apartment! The staff was very accommodating and when we had a little hiccup, the hotel manager, Mr. Caguindagan stepped in to rectify it - thank you Victor!
The hotel is in walking distance to many of the attractions in the SoHo area and has a nice, albeit small, but comfortable pool to relax by after a day of shopping, most rooms have nice views, and the hotel offers upscale amenities - spa, pool, restaurants, valet, etc... If anyone is complaining, it's because they are cheap like the women I observed while checking in making frivolous complaints while asking for an 'American Express upgrade' because she was entitled to a better room that she didn't want to pay for - oh brother...

title: Beautiful Central Soho Destination
text: The Dominick did not disappoint!  Every staff member was so gracious and helpful.  The room was wonderful and we had amazing and beautiful city views.  I looked at many hotels in Soho before selecting the Dominick and I am so happy that I did.  We will definitely be returning on a future trip to New York!!

title: Great stay at The Dominick
text: Had a great stay at The Dominick this past week. Our suite was spacious, especially for a 7 night stay for two people, and we had a spectacular view over the Hudson. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. Easy walk to Soho and beyond.. Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful!
text: Wonderful hotel.  First class service from start to finish!  Mohendra at the registration desk - exceptional.  The gentleman who greeted me upon arrival and ensured we had our car when we were ready to leave…service with an actual smile.  Room was clean, bright, comfortable stay.  Highly recommend!

title: Great girls trip!!
text: Fabulous experience. Great location, we were able to hop on a subway or easily walk to any location we desired. The staff was amazing and very attentive. Not to mention the views! We were in the 39th floor and could see the city plus the bridges. Will defend stay here again!

title: World Class service.
text: Everything about this hotel is five diamond!  The service was immaculate.  The staff is beyond friendly and accommodating.  The room product is amazing.  I LOVE the big bathrooms and tubs with windows.  The bed linens are so comfortable, and you cannot beat the views.  I was in love the minute I walked in the door! I LOVE the new Sisley Spa.  It was such a beautiful space and the treatments there were amongst the best I've had anywhere in my travels.  Well done to all the team members at this beautiful urban oasis.

title: Will stay here again.
text: The staff is the best.  They were so friendly and helpful.  Everyone went the extra mile on everything (added some bonuses for birthday celebrations).  The room view was spectacular.  It is in a great location, although you can't completely avoid the construction noise anywhere in NYC.  The restaurants and bar were fabulous.  Very chill vibe.  Valet was easy.

title: Great People/Not Great Accommodations
text: I thought that the people at the Dominick were nice, friendly, and  efficient. My room was clean but dated and the AC system was loud. The engineers told me it was on the quieter side for the hotel. The location is perfect. The sad part was that the bed was old and mushy and saggy. I did not sleep well and woke up constantly because of the bad bed. The person who checked me out did not ask if I had a good stay. If they complete a room overhaul this could become my NY go to. Currently, it does not deserve the 5 stars.

title: Exceptional
text: Beautiful and immaculate facility.  The staff was attentive, welcoming and made the experience very personal with their care from the front door, to check in to check out.  Room was clean and beautiful!  Shower was great and the bed was so comfortable.  The view though was incredible, found myself staring out at the skyline.

title: Soho style
text: We stayed 9 nights in March. Our original rooms mattress was a bit soft so they moved us complimentary to a suite. The suite was amazing, seperate lounge room and guest toilet, massive bed and bathroom. Coffee machine and microwave. The suite had everything but maybe a kettle for tea would be good in the suites. Starbucks is opposite and it’s walking distance to shops in SoHo and little Italy or tribeca. Quick subway trip to uptown. Trader joes for groceries across the road as well. Great location nice and quiet yet 5 minutes from everything

title: One of a kind service
text: Everything from check in to checkout was exceptional. The service, attentiveness, and care went above my expectations! I also enjoyed a 60 minutes massage at their spa and I didn’t want to leave. Even down to the lovely housekeeping lady who I ran into on the way back to my room - beyond kind of a human. I will be back

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I have stayed at the Dominick more than once.  I came to the city to find an apartment for my daughter and will return every time I visit.  I LOVE this hotel.  The hotel is clean and the food is top-notch.  The rooms are well-appointed and the view cannot be beat!

title: Outstanding service!
text: Stayed here for the first time and had a spectacular experience. They have an amazing team who are friendly and accommodating. My flight got delayed and got to the hotel at midnight, Cassandra, got me checked-in quickly and made sure my entire stay was comfortable. Thanks so much for the outstanding service!

title: Relaxing and fun family time
text: Excellent location and great staff. The beds are perfect (not an overfull sandbag!) and relatively quiet area at night. A few small issues with wear and tear in the room, but nothing really major. Soaking tub is AMAZING and we did it even realize there was an additional half bath in our suite until the end of day 1!!

title: Fantastic Stay
text: The Dominick was a fabulous hotel and we were looked after really well. It was comfortable, the service was great and well priced! The beds were really comfortable, great showers and the robes were cosy. I will certainly be returning. Thank you!

title: Amazing staff
text: Mohendra was the absolute best!! Upon arrival for my first visit he was personable and accommodating and made a great first impression! Outstanding service on his behalf. The hotel room he put me in was great and exceeded my expectations !!

title: Close to home
text:
Another extremely pleasant stay. I commented to my partner on how every employee is so welcoming and friendly. They really go out of their way to make it like home. 
This trip I also used the Sisley spa. I would also recommend. 
I will continue to come back!

title: A week at the Dominck
text: It's part of the NYC experience. Didn't disappoint. A great location with a phenomenal staff who is determined to make your stay an experience to be remembered. Easy access to West Side Highway for running, 30-minute walk to the west village, and a short trip to Newark Airport and LGA. Always my go-to spot for business trip stays.

title: Our son gifted us this stay for Christmas.  We arrived for a one night stay, and dinner at eataly.
text: My wife enjoyed the pillow top mattress and pillows. We were very impressed with all the employees, from when we arrived up until we departed everything and everyone was polite and professional. We would highly recommend the Dominick to all of are family and friends.

title: The best.
text: Absolutely the best. This was my second time here and it’s just the best. Every person I interacted With was above and beyond. A special shout out to Gabby at the front desk, I don’t think I’ve met a kinder more genuine person at a hotel stay. I came by myself for a one night mom getaway after time. She was so understanding, welcoming and amazing. I have a pleasure of checking out with her the next day, and my experience was the same. It is such a special thing to me people that are so genuinely happy to be where they are and support. The same for Toya in the Sisley Spa and my esthetician Catlin. And Jonathan at breakfast. The room was amazing, the bed so cozy. The bathrooms are giant for a New York hotel room. Hope to come back again.

title: Location great. Rooms were good
text: Great location to the hudson river and soho. The rooms felt slightly updated, were clean and spacious. Wasn’t overly impressed. Could have been more sparkly clean if more attention to detail was paid. Valet and hotel staff were all nice. Also liked the gym and techongym tredmills.

title: THE BEST OF THE BEST.
text: Hands down the best hotel sleep I've had in over 25 years of traveling the world.  Incredible staff, quiet and lovely rooms, lots of meal options for different requirements in the restaurant.  Location is perfect.  I'd live there if they'd let me.

title: Fabulous NYC Stay
text:
Great boutique 5 star hotel in Soho!! Very centrally located with wonderful staff and beautiful lobby.  The only thing I would complain about is the charge a $15 Admin Fee for room service which made no sense and I had them remove from my bill.
Would highly recommend.

title: Professional
text: Great experience, staff pleasant and friendly. Clean, great parking in area. Nice restaurant, little pricey but worth the price. The spa Sisley was everything. Receptionist very courteous and friendly. Would recommend if you don’t want to be in the heart of city.

title: Exceptional Service!! Thank you Cassandra!
text: During my recent stay, I was truly impressed by the outstanding service provided by Cassandra. From the moment I arrived, she greeted me with warmth and professionalism, ensuring a smooth check-in process and providing helpful recommendations throughout my stay. She consistently went above and beyond to assist with any requests and handle challenging situations with grace and composure. Her dedication to excellence and genuine care for guests made my experience truly memorable.

title: Soho experience
text:
Excellent location, finally a modern structure . Clean, nice view . No noise of the streets . Recommended for solo or couple . Business oriented. You can drop the car in ne of the close parking and walk the most fascinating district of NY. Several good restaurant in a walk
King distance

title: Excellent space and service
text: Very luxurious - nice big bathroom with separate tub - big room overall. They provided extra espresso for us. Amazing view of the Hudson. Had dinner at Vestry the day we arrived. The doormen were friendly and helpful. We had a couples massage that was so relaxing.  Super happy we stayed here and will stay again next time

title: Nice hotel
text:
I enjoyed almost everything about the hotel. The decoration is beautiful, the staff is super friendly and worried about our needs, the room is very confortable and the location is amazing. What I didn't like: the pillows, the lights in the bathroom (impossible to make up with the lights in just one side!!!), the lifts take so long
and the bar at the seventh floor is so, so charmless, if we want to eat or drink something we don't feel like going to a place like that. And the breakfast unfortunately either is fully booked or you pay a little fortune if you want it in your room.
But I liked the experience and would stay there again.

title: Exceeded expectations!
text: The staff at this hotel are amazing! The rooms are larger than typical NYC hotel rooms and have lots of storage. The bathrooms are also quite large. The Dominick definitely exceeded our expectations but it was really the staff that made it extra special!

title: Work trip home away from home
text:
Amazing rooms. Soft beds. Extra special staff home away from
Home… I have stayed here for over 12 years and this will always be where we stay for work and vacation trips. From
The door men to the wait staff you are treated with nothing but top notch attention.

title: Customer Service
text:
The team was incredible. I travel often into NYC for business from LA and take the red eye. As a result, I often need an early check in and only like to stay with fine hotels and resorts. 

This morning, the front desk team Neferteri & Sydeka were super helpful in accommodating my request to check in early so I could get some much needed sleep before meetings. 

I know the team did not need to do that but going above and beyond is what makes me keep coming back to this hotel.

title: Love this place
text: It was a wonderful stay with amazing service and great environment. I was able to upgrade my room at a very reasonable price and everyone was kind and attentive. The room was spacious and had great views. It was also nice and quiet. I have no idea if there was guest next to us which was very peaceful.

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text: We had such a wonderful experience at The Dominick Hotel. Our suite was absolutely amazing.  It was so spacious, classy and very comfortable. The view was simply astonishing and the sunsets were to die for. The breakfast was extremely delicious and tasty. They had all kinds of fruits and pastries and it was honestly one of the best meals we have ever had. The staff was incredibly kind and they were always ready and really happy to help and assist us. The concierge team gave us some amazing restaurant recommendations, tips on what to do and really helped us get around the city. Special thanks to Mohendra who always checked on us and made sure everything was okay. He made us truly feel like royalty and did everything possible to welcome us in the most special and perfect way. On my daugther’s birthday they left balloons, flowers and some treats in our room, which made her feel so much loved and made her day memorable. We are also really thankful to Sean Lynch who made all this possible and made our stay unforgettable.

title: This Place Has It ALL!
text:
We love the Dominick! Staff, ambience, location, this place has it ALL.  From the doormen to the front desk staff, to the fabulous cocktails at its restaurant, The Vestry (have the dirty martini), this is our go-to place when in New York. The Dominick or bust!
Thank you for an amazijng stay, always.

title: SoHo’s best luxury hotel value
text: Well appointed room with  a large elegant bathroom and a beautiful view.  The facility is modern and the service level is impressive. The fitness center is undersized for a hotel of this size. Only three treadmills which led to a roll of the dice on availability. In today’s Manhattan hotel market an excellent value.

title: Luxury hotel with luxury fees
text: Wonderful stay at the The Dominick! Staff was wonderful, beautiful views, comfy beds and amenities, great turn down service and amazing spa services and amenities. With all that being said I personally would only stay here again if I really wanted to splurge. They tack on an administrative fee or service fee on literally EVERYTHING. One hamburger and a coke from room service was $80($15 for and admin fee?) and $1000 for a couples massage and fit scrub(fees there as well). I get paying more for luxury but for $1200 a night room I would think they are getting paid there. It’s more principle to me so I wont stay there again. But if that doesn’t bother you very nice!

title: The most wonderful experience - highly recommend.
text: Absolutely wonderful stay at The Dominick from start to finish. The service was impeccable and we felt welcomed and comfortable at all times. We had an amazing SoHi suite which had plenty of room for a family of four. The views are out of this world. We had breakfast at the hotel every day and the food was quick and delicious, served with a smile. Coming back to The Dominick after a long day out sight seeing was truly like coming home. Thank you to all the staff, especially Mohendra who made us smile every day. Housekeeping deserve a shout out for clean rooms and unobtrusive service. Can’t recommend this hotel highly enough and would not stay anywhere else. Thank you!

title: Lovely stay
text:
Beautiful hotel in a great location. We enjoyed convenient dining at the 3 restaurants and in-room dining. 
The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable with excellent storage.
All the staff were attentive and helpful.
The 2 small drawbacks were lengthy wait times at the elevators and lack of a door between the bathroom and bedroom.

title: With Love
text: Gabby is undoubtedly the most exceptional front desk clerk I have ever had the pleasure of encountering. Her friendly demeanor and genuine hospitality are truly remarkable. Furthermore, I must mention that the ambience of the hotel is absolutely impeccable. The Dominik has without a doubt become one of my favorite places to stay.

title: Hotel oasis where you're cared for like Family!
text: The Dominick is one of my all-time favorite hotels.  The location, amenities (healthy food, great gym, attentive staff, cleanliness) and spacious rooms are great whether you're exploring the city or you're on the run with back-to-back work meetings and commitments.  Gabriela treats each and every guest like family and is a welcoming light upon arrival, regardless of when you're checking in.  She offers incredible suggestions, ensures you're getting the best possible room configuration and is quick to offer upgrades. I checked in late last night (1AM!) and haven't been to the property in over 2 years, Gabriela remembered me by name, knew my room preferences and helped settle me into the perfect room for this trip.  She is the epitome of customer-first service and care.  I will keep coming back!

title: Gorgeous building and great service
text: Excellent service, terrific rooms and of course great views. Cassandra was very helpful and accommodating. Short walk to the water or to some great restaurants and live music bars. Exercise room is open 24/7 and has good selection and plenty of size

title: Amazing Stay During Business Trip
text: Had an amazing stay at the Dominick while traveling for work. The staff was fantastic and welcoming. Mohendra was extremely helpful at the front desk, finding a way to keep my same room despite having added an extra night in another reservation previously. I will be back for sure.

title: Repeat Guest
text:
I am a loyal returning guest at the Dominick Hotel. I love the rooms the design, the spacious everything, the staff is warm. My wife can even practice her Polish language with one of the doormen :-) 
The hotel is on Spring street and every visit we discover new places and the good old NYC feeling.

title: A+ property
text: Gorgeous hotel, comfy room, and truly gracious staff. Great experience from check-in through checkout. Rooms are more spacious than most NY hotels. And the neighborhood is full of great dining and shopping opportunities after work. Highly recommended.

title: Location location location
text:
This was the second time my wife and I stayed in this hotel. The location alone makes this a perfect place. 

The reception staff was very professional, especially Gabriella helping us to get a connecting room in a short notice for our daughter to stay. The rest of the hotel staff were all very courteous. 

We stayed in one of the SoHi suites. It had a great view and generally met our expectations. The only thing we found strange about this room is that the bath room did not have a door. Blame the architects for that. 

All in all an excellent experience.

title: Sophisticated, Modern Hotel
text: The Dominick is a beautifully appointed hotel located in a great neighborhood in lower Manhattan. There are no end of good restaurants and the view from our room was the magnificent World Trade One. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to any need we had. We would highly recommend this fine hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

title: A perfect staycation
text: We had a wonderful time celebrating my boyfriends birthday while staying at the Dominick. From check in to check out the hotel staff took care of us. The sisley paris spa was also a wonderful time with a relaxing couples massage, and I will definitely be back.

title: Exceptional Hotel, Impeccable service, Excellent location!
text:
Every time I stay in The Dominick, visiting my son in NYC, I always get impeccable service from the staff in all areas- greeting at door, check in & out, porter, housekeeping, room service- very classic, classy, professional, friendly services you hardly get these days especially from some other modern soho area hotels with too young staff. 
Last week was my recent stay at the Dominick. Check in process with Miss Neferteri at front desk was above & beyond. She was not only let me check in early but upgraded mine to a beautiful suite with amazing views! 
Their rooms are comfy with Nespresso Machine, microwave, and the fridge (which you don’t automatically get charged when you move around hotel’s refreshments in order to stock up your own), and painfully strong water pressure shower (so essential for busy travelers)!!

After my 4 night stay, my flight back home was at 00:50am and AGAIN, Mr. Mohendra Halall at front desk allowed me a very late chk out so I could relax a little more & take a shower before my long 14hrs flight back to Seoul. I suggest to look for Neferteri or Mohendra if you need any help or to make changes. They always do their best to make your stay comfortable. 
I can’t wait to be back to this hotel next time I visit my son in Spring!

*** 1min. walk to subway, CVS, Trader Joes, Starbucks right in front, many great restaurants, bars, galleries, and shops nearby.

title: Nice room, great staff
text: The staff are all so nice and helpful, and the room was a great size, with a nice view. Would have loved an iron or steamer in the room when I arrived, but it was provided as soon as I requested it. Housekeeping were lovely and provided me with extra water every time, as they could see I was really getting through the bottles! Stanley on the door was also especially lovely, and every time I left or returned, he would make me feel so welcome with a nice quip. Really great stay.

title: The most amazing stay!
text: The Dominick was one of the nicest stays I've had at hotel in a while. The service was 10/10, as was the service and attention to detail. My room was fantastic (the bed was so comfortable) and I had a beautiful view. I will definitely be coming back!

title: Luxurious hotel, excellent service, great views!
text: Great Service, warm atmosphere, clean, luxurious, and great views. We went for a weekend in the city meeting friends there. We had a conjoining suite. The free coffee, concierge, turn down service, were all little things that made our experience a great one.

title: Over the top hospitality
text: The hotel showed extreme hospitality when my husband became sick and we had to take him to hospital by ambulance.  We had to extend our stay, and the hotel staff couldn't have been kinder with their assistance.  We stay at the Dominick frequently, and have never had a bad experience.

title: Beautiful hotel, conveniently located.
text: Beautiful hotel, comfortable room and amazing views (we did upgrade a bit).  Convenient location (near subway, Trader Joe’s, and not too far from NYU).  A bit of a splurge for us, but worth it.  I also like that it’s not far from the water, great for morning walks.

title: Warm and welcoming
text:
From the front desk attendant - Neferteri (adorable!!) to the bartenders at Vestry - everyone was so accommodating and friendly - the restaurant (Vestry) was absolutely delicious - great variety on offerings both food and drink - rooms were beautiful, especially the bathroom with the giant tub.  The gym was nice but that was the only reason I didn't give a 5 rating - the Lululemon Studio Mirror was not working and I was unable to connect with my Studio app because they wouldn't give me the password to the wifi that the mirror was running on.  No biggie because the IT guy was super nice about it.  
The location was super - across the street from a Starbucks and just down the block from a killer Italian restaurant - Cafe Altro.  
Will definitely be staying here again.

title: Amazing staff and views!
text:
The staff was amazing, so welcoming, and knowledgeable. Very courteous and helped us make last-minute reservations for dinner during NYC restaurant week :D 

The room was great, with really nice views. The breakfast was delicious, and I would most definitely stay here again. 

One con (that wasn't actually that big of a deal) was that the furniture was a little dated, and the shower was very small. Also - there was no door on the bathroom.

title: Our Fifth Stay!
text: This is our fifth trip to New York City's Dominick Hotel in under a year and each of our experiences has been first-rate. The room and bathroom are immaculately clean; turn-down service is prompt and reliable; and the restaurant, excellent. Of special note is the always friendly and willing-to-do-anything-to make-your-stay-more-enjoyable staff. A special shout-out to Mohendra (we can call him "Mo") Halall at the front desk: a gentleman who will treat you like family.

title: Great Experience.
text: Breathtaking views and a personalized experience. The Dominick Hotel knows hospitality extremely well. It was a memorable stay, and we truly enjoyed it. The rooms are plush and cozy. It is also close to some good French cafes.

title: Amazing view
text: We absolutely loved the hotel and  we loved our beautiful room with amazing views. Excellent front desk personnel , the two lovely ladies were beyond great we thank you for making our stay so special. Looking forward to our next visit. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Room with a View!
text:
Really like staying at The Dominick, the staff are very professional and so friendly from Doormen to Housekeeping and everyone I met in-between.

The location is great - walk everywhere and subway just a short walk away.
Have not tried the Restaurant yet as there are so many options close by to choose from. Love the fact you have a CVS/Trader Joes and Coffee Shop on the street.

The room itself was very comfortable and spacious by NYC standards and we lapped up the lux touches.

Could do with a better sound offering as the BT speaker is a tad small.

title: 5 Star hotel & experience at The Dominick
text: The Dominick did not disappoint. The staff was exceptional.  Everyone even greeted me by name throughout my stay. My room was delightful, with lovely furnishings, very clean & spacious with outstanding views.

title: Great Location, Great Accommodation
text: Best customer service we have experienced. The front desk staff was incredibly kid friendly, provided us with a room upgrade and accommodated all of our needs. This was our second time staying at the Dominik and we will definitely be returning for our annual visit to NYC!

title: Definitely will be a repeat visit in the future.
text:
Above and beyond with the level of service and comfort.  Went to dinner each night of our stay to come back to a bucket of ice full, bed made, fresh towels and bottle water & after dinner candy next to our bed.
The room was well heated and comfortable.  Low noise at night with only a low noise from the elevator behind our room.

title: Fantastic
text: Everyone, from start to finish, went above and beyond to make this one of the most enjoyable stays ever!  The room was beautiful and clean.  Some of the friendliest staff I’ve ever encountered.  It’s been a long time since we’ve stayed in NYC, but after this weekend we’ll definitely be back!

title: Best place to stay in SoHo
text: I love this hotel and stay whenever in NYC.   It offers modern luxury, huge rooms, large windows, BIG bathrooms and the front desk staff is top-notch.   It is 2 blocks to Spring St subway and Starbucks across the street.   Steps to all the Soho restaurants and shops.   Highly recommend for value & service

title: Decent Sized Rooms and a 5-Star Hotel - A Rarity in NYC
text: Very nice hotel for business or pleasure. My wife and I always stay here or the Beekman when we come up on weekends. The Beekman is nice, but the financial district is lacking in many ways. Nicer to stay in the Tribeca/Soho/WV area even if always a bit more pricey.

title: New York Trip
text: My husband and I recently traveled to New York for pleasure. We stayed at the Dominick for 5 nights in a suite. The room was incredible with spectacular views of the city. The staff is very polite and attentive. This is our 3rd stay and we love it

title: Wonderful start to finish!
text:
So many superlatives for The Dominic Hotel! From the moment that I entered the lobby that was beautifully decorated for the holidays, I knew that it was going to be a stand out experience and memorable stay. 

Our guest room and bathroom were both extremely well-appointed, very spacious and had abundant storage. The furnishings, bedding, décor and curtains were gorgeous and provided a comfortable and luxurious environment as well as a beautiful aesthetic.
 
I was also impressed by each & every staff member & wish that I could recall all names but, from the doorman who greeted me to the front desk personnel and concierge to the housekeeping person. Since we had a few special requests and worked directly with Gabriela, she was lovely & very helpful. 

We look forward to being spoiled by the amenities, beautiful surroundings and wonderful staff at The Dominick again sometime soon.

title: Tiffany - Luxury Ambassador SUPER HELPFUL!
text: I haven't even checked in yet and I have to say Tiffany the LUXURY AMBASSADOR is AMAZING! She has been so helpful with helping me plan my fiancés birthday. I could not recommend her enough for all she has done for me. I am so excited and can not wait to write about how amazing this hotel is when my trip is over for all she has helped planned for me. Would defiantly recommend her to anyone! :)

title: Nice stay at Soho
text:
All was good, but I suggestI to improve the facilities of the room with boiler and slippers (in a five star hotel cannot to be missing).
The view by room was fantastic. The staff at the lobby was very  kind and professional. Very appreciated the room service

title: Nicer hotels are a lot cheaper
text: The great things are clean and view. The bad is the destination fee and the cost. They charge $45 for a destination fee that covers internet, coffee/tea service and spa retail credit. Well the internet that is free doesn’t cover being able to streaming additional money for that service and there is a minimum spend of $150 at the spa! Also, the tv technology is outdated no way to stream content. You can only mirror your phone/tablet. Personally, you can stay at better hotels for a lot cheaper.

title: Perfect!
text: Everything was perfect. Could not have been better. Great atmosphere. Warm, friendly staff. Large room with comfortable bedding and a large bathroom with all the amenities. A well respected Spa which I plan to use on my next visit. And the breakfast on the mezzanine with a full menu, which I had two mornings, was perfectly prepared and absolutely delicious. For those who just need coffee and a bite, they also have that on the seventh floor. I did not have time to eat dinner in the dining room, but I look forward to doing so on my next trip. I will be back!!

title: Beware of “bellman/ houseman” in your rooms before you enter
text:
A random stranger walks out of our room when we are about to tap our card to open the room door. Does not introduce himself. Seems like an employee, and just walks out of our room. Confused, my partner and I look at each other wondering, who is this??! We call the front desk to tell the situation- they look at the log and first say it was the “bellman”- then change it to “houseman”. The manager, (she said her name was Gwendyllon no name tag) calls back and says it was the “houseman”, we get skeptical of this back and forth change of titles, and they quickly offer us another room.  We agree for the new room, but we really wanted to know- what was the so-called “houseman” doing in our room, and does not introduce himself nor does he have any housekeeping items on him. We decide to look at the other room which was a total downgrade from the previous corner room that the nice lady at the lobby gave us.
Since we did not get the answers we were looking for and did NOT want to settle for a downgrade of a room we go downstairs to talk to the lobby staff/manager. Instead of explaining the situation and giving me answers on who the stranger was and what he was doing in the room, she keeps pointing out that we offered you another room. When asked about the “bellman/houseman”, her answers are defensive saying it is how it is. She says it was “Mike the houseman” who does routine checks of the rooms before guests come in. The manager does not seem to understand on how to communicate nor was making us feel at ease of this situation! I don’t know what to trust! Their explanation was very sketchy- 1 hour of my life wasted trying to figure out who this person is in my room.

title: Fantastic hotel, neighborhood and views.
text:
Spent two nights here at the Dominck for a suprise birthday trip for my wife.   Pretty much loved everything about the stay.   Welcoming doorman.  Fast check in.   I picked a SoHi room, and the first choice was an east facing room, but I asked for a north facing room (to see Midtown, Empire State, Hudson Yards) or a south facing room (to see Freedom tower, Lower Manhattan).   We ended up with a south facing corner room and the view was fantastic.     
Usually when we come to New York, we stay in Midtown.  But we wanted to start branching out to other areas, and cam across this hotel in Soho.   We loved this location.  When you go outside, instead of the madness and crush of people in midtown, you get a totally different vibe with people walking their dogs, kids in strollers, low rise residences instead of skysrpaers, but still has TONS of great restaurants, bars, shopping, bakeries, etc.   10 minute uber ride and  your near Midtown,  10 minute uber ride the other way and your near the World Trade and City Hall.    Great in between choice.    

Beds were comfy, no issue with elevators, concierge was helpful, and they left some fancy cupcakes out to recognize my wife's birthday, which was a real nice choice.    
Happy to answer any questions.

title: We love the Dominick Hotel.
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Dominick in January 2024. The staff are friendly and helpful.  The rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  Great location in Soho close to wonderful restaurants and shopping.

title: Good hotel
text:
Good location soho, and the service is nice and good management.
Consiglio a tutti se dovete stare in zona soho a New York, molto ottima la location per spostarsi a piedi nelle vie di soho e tribecca. 
Room service eccezionale, palestra un po piccola ma accettabile

title: great stay!
text: The Dominick is a Great hotel and is in a great location.  They have a friendly, helpful staff with great recommendations on places to go, eat, and see.  We would definitely stay again on a future trip.

title: A Perfect Staycation!
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for New Year's Eve and it was amazing! The rooms are some of the biggest I have stayed at in NYC and the views are phenomenal! The location is close to a bunch of great shops and restaurants. Service was incredible. I also thoroughly enjoyed the Sisley Spa - receiving one of the best massages I have gotten in a while. Cannot recommend this property enough!

title: Beautiful Views and Great Service
text: I stayed in the Tribeca suite and it was incredible! Everything was very clean and comfortable. The views are unmatched and everyone at the hotel from check in to check out was so friendly and attentive. Would definitely stay here again!

title: NYE Celebration in NYC
text:
The nicest staff from check in to turndown service!  So accommodating for us and our fur animal.
 They brought us treats, a bed and bowls for him.  
We cannot wait to go back and stay again for another staycation!

title: Outstanding hotel and staff!
text:
It was our second stay at The Dominick. There were 5 of us (adults) and we had a gorgeous 2 bedroom, SoHi suite with the most amazing views of the water and the city. 
The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring, shopping, and eating out but is in a less frenetic area of the city. Plenty of really good restaurants are situated locally but it is also very easy to travel further afield. 
And the service is outstanding. Every, single staff member is exceptional. Perfect!

title: Amazing view
text: Amazing view. One of the best in NYc. We have been looking in various hotels for a good manhattan skyline view. This hotels offers the best. The rooms are spacious.  Room interior design a bit old fashioned. But the view compensates for everything you miss.

title: The best 5*Hotel in Downtown NYC
text: The Dominick is a AAA 5* Hotel and  in Downtown undoubtedly has the best unobstructed views over NYC. We come one a year since many years and the service from the Doormen to Housekeeping is amazing. They treat you as a friend coming back home. Thank you The Dominick staff for what you do to exceed guests expectations.

title: 12 out of 10 recommend
text: I write this review as I sit in a luxurious soaking tub, swathed in Diptyque bubbles, drinking a lovely sparkling wine, looking at the Empire State Building and 6th Ave. (This after devouring a delicious cupcake with the hubs on his bday). The staff has been incredibly welcoming and accommodating. Tiffany (a luxury ambassador) made us feel truly special. Marek handled our vehicle with care while welcoming us warmly to the hotel. And our bellhop (his name is escaping me! It started with an E I believe…) was so attentive, ensuring that I would have the correct espresso in my room in the morning. All in all… would recommend in a heartbeat and I don’t believe I would want to stay anywhere else when visiting the village/soho area.

title: Well trained staff create a great experience
text: The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Everyone from doormen to front desk to cleaning staff was polite, friendly and helpful. The room amenities were high end.  The light blocking curtains very effective. The carpeting needs updating as it is getting shabby and some small items need fixing such as light switches but our stay was very comfortable. I would encourage the garage they use to put in a charger for EVs.

title: Good Place To Stay Downtown
text: The rooms are large, the location is convenient to SoHo and a quick train to midtown. Restaurant on mezzanine and gym are adequate. Staff is friendly. Highly recommend. If you get a higher floor, you'll have a nice view as this is one of the taller buildings in the area.

title: Great views, not great sleep......
text: Our suite was beautiful with outstanding views. Our only complaint is that the street noise even all the way up on the 36th floor was VERY loud. Horns honking and loud engines until the wee hours of the morning only to be followed by more of the same starting around 5:30 or 6:00 am.

title: cigarette smoke
text: they put me an a room that stinked of cigarette smoke and told me it’s $300 a night extra.  I always come to this hotel and get a free upgrade or pay a small amount to upgrade. never $300.  they knew the room smelled of smoke. all the windows were open when I came into the room.  the women who checked me in was extremely rude as well very condescending. i’m so disappointed in this hotel. it’s gone way downhill.  and the fact they were willing to put me in a room that reeked of cigarette smoke was the worst part.   I mean it was so bad.  !

title: Understated upscale choice with great views
text: I’m still here! I wanted to recognize the great staff. Everyone has been so friendly. The rooms are great—well laid out with everything you need (except maybe more usb outlets and hooks for hanging, etc ). We chose a Hudson Square room. The hotel is definitely upscale boutique. From the doormen to the bellmen to the front desk and housekeeping the staff is knowledgeable and approachable. The staff at the 7th floor cafe took great care of us, too. The PBX operators were patient with all calls when we needed something! We met the director of IT—and though we didn’t need his services, he was so congenial and seems like a great asset to the hotel. This is a great location if you need to be all over Manhattan. While we were here for holiday shopping and sightseeing , a friend had recommended it as a great choice for business, as well.

title: A great hotel to spend with family in NYC at Christmas time.
text: Excellent staff across all individuals we interacted with. Gabby was exceptional in assisting our entire family of 10 with reservations! Will definitely plan on future stays at this fine hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed and have adequate space.

title: Wonderful.
text: Everyone is friendly the rooms are clean and very comfortable. The bed are very comfortable.The staff is helpful thought out the hotel,The only thing that  upset me was  when ordering breakfast they didn't provide a cup of coffee with your meal. without and extra charges, My stay was 5 day and breakfast was high priced and a cup of coffee should be included with your meal not separate.I stayed in 4302 and spent over $16,000 and needed my coffee with my breakfast which should have been part of my breakfast automatically. I feel a cup of coffee is a small thing that won't break the bank of the hotel,

title: Terrific hotel
text:
Terrific staff. Room view over the Hudson. 

SoHo out the front door. Tip. Early morning walk around soho and tribeca was amazing. The gym is nice but getting to know some of the area was great. There are a bunch of small restaurants and shops to poke around in and the financial district and World Trade Center are near.

title: Another great stay at The Dominick !
text: Another great stay at The Dominick hotel !  The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and the service provided by hotel staff was outstanding as always !  This is my fourth or fifth visit to the hotel and each time I have stayed I have been blown away by the views of the city/waterfront from the rooms, how well decorated and comfortable the rooms are, along with the professionalism and friendliness of the staff. The hotel is conveniently located near all of the great shopping and restaurants in the Soho area. I highly recommend this hotel !

title: Great Amex Preferred Hotel Option in Soho
text: Great location in Soho… close to shopping, eating and the subway. Big rooms w great views from high floors. Super comfy beds and nice robes. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. My only suggestion is the bathroom only has one sink w not great lighting which made it hard for two people to get ready… but the big windows in the rooms provide great light so it would be nice to have a mirror in that room maybe. Other then that it was wonderful… highly recommend.

title: 35th Anniversary
text:
Comfortable bedding 
Good breakfast 
Specially treat us with good champagne for our anniversary 
Hotel crews are very kind and available whenever we need them 
Location is perfect for us to travel soho and Brooklyn area

title: Pleasant stay in SoHo
text: From the moment we arrived, the team at Dominick made us feel welcome. From the front desk staff, the doormen, bellmen, and the concierge, everyone we encountered was first class. The staff even allowed us to store my wife’s breastmilk in their freezer since we didn’t have enough room in our fridge. The rooms were well appointed and the beds were very comfortable with a view to kill.  I wouldn’t hesitate to stay at the Dominick again!

title: Luxurious splurge
text: I was here for only a few days. Amex platinum members get some extra goodies, including a room upgrade! Excellent customer service, spectacular views, & super attentive staff. In-room dining experience was worth it. Room amenities excellent-Nescafé maker was nice to have! Lots of amenities. Highly recommend.

title: Enjoyable stay with a great view
text: Our stay at the Dominick Hotel was fantastic. All of the staff were really friendly. I was particularly happy that the woman who checked me in was able to accommodate my request for a corner room unit with an amazing view of lower Manhattan. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Stay!!
text: Wonderful hotel. The front desk staff, including Mojendra, were very nice and helpful, as well as patient and paid attention to detail. From the moment I reserved the hotel, I had questions that required me contacting the hotel prior to checking in, and everyone was always pleasant and accommodating. The same for when you check in as well as during your stay.  I would definitely stay there again next time I am in New York. I stayed in a 2 bedroom sohi suite with another couple and the room was spacious (for New York) and the views were beautiful. Bathrooms were great and clean. Room service was a bit on the expensive side, but that is not surprising. The food did come quickly and tasted good. Location is fantastic and walking distance to shops and restaurants, away from the craziness of times square. I do not have any complaints and highly recommend staying in this hotel.

title: A stay I look forward to
text:
The entire team at this hotel is so gracious and kind. Someone always around to help and support. One of the few places I find considers the small things that make a difference. 
 I look forward to my stay at this hotel

title: Hotel almost got it right
text: Stay was great until last day. Water was out throughout the entire building for a while and when it came back on, it was brown. Check out experience was nothing to be desired. Waited a long time before I was acknowledge and stood in line for a while just to check out which took all of 2 seconds. Great location and nice hotel. Positive experience up until the last day which lead to the 2 stars.

title: An Amazing Experience
text: I had a lovely stay at the Dominick! The rooms were of great size, very clean, with great amenities! The front desk staff (shout out to Nefertiri) was great and the Guest Services team was phenomenal.

title: December 2023 NYC stay
text: Excellent hotel. Nice ambience, location and the staff members treat us very kind. The room was spacious and so  beautiful.  Definitely were gonna stay here next time we visit NYC. The doorman was so nice and polite. The Vestry restaurant was absolutely fabulous.

title: My new favorite hotel, with the best staff ever!!
text:
This was my first time staying at The Dominick and I LOVED it!  The room was stunning, the views were stunning, the amenities were fantastic!  But the best part was the staff! They were so friendly, made me feel special from the moment we checked in.  When they found out it was a special trip for a career celebration they made it even more special and accomodated an extra surprise guest that I had without batting an eye
. Mohendra at the front desk was the best ever! So kind, so invested in making our stay superb. The rest of the staff was also amazing.  I will stay there again and can't recommend it highly enough!

title: SMOKY Room
text:
Checked in today. My room smelled like cigarette smoke so I was moved to another room that smells like bleach. The whole moving rooms process was incredibly frustrating and took forever.
I  was told that they're fully committed for the night and that there are no other rooms available. I stay here often and find it hard to believe in a large hotel like this that there isn't another room they could put me in given my loyalty to the hotel. My sense is they did not want to put me in a higher level room. 
The place is tired too. I took this photo of the hallway during my 20 minute wait outside my new room for the key.
Very very disappointed.

title: Favorite hotel in SOHO
text: Had a wonderful holiday vacation and stay at the amazing Dominick Hotel. The cleanliness of not only the rooms, but the entire hotel did not go unnoticed. The staff was worm and friendly. Marek, one of the bellhops, could not have been more friendly and helpful.  It's also located across the street from a fun, kid themed place called Color Factory, which I highly recommend to families, especially if it's raining. Kudos to all the employees at the Dominick for striving to make sure their guests are treated with respect and care.

title: Best Hotel in SOHO
text: Entire Atmosphere of the hotel is incredible and the staff matches it!  The room was perfect and it is nice for  a hotel to still have turn down service. The restaurants and bars have great vibes and the food is excellent.  The location allows you to walk to some great restaurants and bars as well.

title: Natal em Ny
text:
Atendimento especial do funcionário no check in Mo. Super prestativo, forneceu todas as informações necessárias do hotel bem como da região . Prestativo e super educado.
Hotel bem localizado com restaurantes e lojas perto. Fácil acesso ao metrô e a táxi .

title: Lovely hotel, great service and location
text: Wonderful spacious room/suite with a very comfy bed abd pillows. Nice sized bathroom and shower with a separate tub. Loved the service. Great views and location. Everyone was really helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again.

title: Welcoming!
text: I’ve visited many times this fall. It looks and smells beautiful with all the lovely flowers.  Gabriela always greets me with warmth & a smile.  She and Tiffany go out of their way to make each visit special!

title: A Great Stay
text: Everyone was great!  Check-in, bellmen, concierge, breakfast wait-staff and cleaning staff were all exceptional.  Room was spacious, clean and shower was hot.  Only imporvement I would make is a door between the bedroom and the bathroom so that if one person is sleeping, the other does not wake them by turning on the bathroom light or showering.

title: Volveremos!
text:
Tuvimos las mejores vistas desde nuestra habitación, la cual fue perfecta. La cama, colchón y almohada, querrás llevártelas a casa!
La zona es excepcional y merece la pena recorrerla con tranquilidad. El personal es también genial!
Gimnasio perfecto para el día a día.

title: A weekend at the Dominick Hotel
text: My wife and I checked into the Dominick Hotel to celebrate her birthday.  Mohendra at the front desk welcomed us as if we were old friends.   The entire staff was lovely and the hotel was beautiful, quiet and worth every penny we paid.   We highly recommend it.

title: Terrible.
text: Worst experience Ive ever had at a hotel. Elevators took 20 mins. Rooms and bathrooms we booked were dirty. Housekeeping wouldnt remove trash or glasses. Manager doesn’t care about customer service and quite frankly isn’t worth the money. Def not a 5-star property.

title: Great service and location
text: Lo e the location and modern style of this property. Service was excellent. We were in the city for a longer time and were able to enjoy The Vestry for cocktails and dinner a few times. Outstanding! We look forward to returning as this is our go to destination in New York. Room and maid service especially efficient, worth noting

title: Never again- Best Friends First Time to NYC Ruined
text:
This is my first one star review - and it took a lot of mess ups to make me write it. First, this was my best friend’s first time in NYC for her birthday trip. We thought we would splurge a little extra for this special occasion. When we first arrived a touch after 8pm on a Friday night, there was no doorman. No one to helped us out of our car, welcomed us, or offered to take our bags. We went to check in, and again, no bellhop, and no one at the front desk offered to call one down. So, we lugged our bags over to the elevators, which took approximately 20 minutes to arrive! When we unpacked, we looked around for somewhere to have a drink. I think it’s important for guests to understand there is no “bar”, just a few restaurants that need reservations. 

Throughout our stay, we ordered a few complimentary items (pillows, blanket, dental kit). Only the pillows were delivered, the other items were ignored with no explanation.  We had also read there was a guest car service that could be used if our designation was within 2 miles. When we called down to reserve it for dinner, we were notified that the car service was out of service/unavailable. 

When we went to check out, we waited 30+minutes for an elevator that wasn’t sardine-packed with other guests trying to get to get to the lobby. We finally got on an elevator when someone suggested we cram in (even though the elevator was going up) because it was impossible to get on any other way. The elevator stopped on every floor, opening up to more distraught guests just trying to get down to the lobby to check out. I saw one woman opting to walk down almost 20 flights of stairs rather than wait. This is no way a “5 star” hotel. I wouldn’t recommend this over-priced motel to my grade school bully. I can’t wrap my mind around what this $45 a night designation covers other than straight up theft. I highly recommend looking for another place to stay.

title: Time To Renovate
text: Was expecting a five star experience but sorely disappointed. Hotel needs major upgrades and renovations. Long lines to simply enter the elevators, lights that don’t work in the room, inoperable safe, (replaced after 4 requests), this is a tired hotel, not even close to five star standards. The staff was mostly sympathetic and helpful to some degree.

title: Unique positive experience.
text:
Comfortable bed and soft pillows. 
Peaceful sleep.  
Room service was great, everything placed in proper order and detailed. 
The city view was espectacular at night time and during the day as well. 
The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful.

title: Superb Service
text: I missed my flight and had to find a last minute accommodation and went to The Dominick and a wonderful lady named Cassandra was able to accommodate me and make sure I was very well taken of. She was so nice and polite and her customer service was top tier. The Dominick is now my go to for sure.

title: Great location.   Great staff.
text: I am a frequent guest at the Dominick and I like it so much that I keep on coming.

title: Extraordinarily good
text: Great staff and service. Rooms are nicely designed, decorated and clean. Beds extremely comfortable. Love coffee on the 7th floor. We stay there numerous times a year and find it consistently amazing

title: Horrible experience!!!
text: My wife and I were physically harassed by another guest upon check-in for no reason.  It took too much time for security to intervene but the upsetting thing is that the hotel refused to vacate the aggressor guest from the hotel after the incident.  The entire incident was monitored by the security camera of the hotel and the security manager admitted that he saw the incident in the recorded video.  Needless to say that our stay was not pleasant and we were afraid that we will encounter that guest again during our stay.   Not a professional team.  Very disappointing.

title: 5 star Experience
text: Great view of the city … All staff treated us like Royalty… This was Best service I have ever received from a Hotel. I will stay here on my next trip and maybe look for the same hotel in other cities I travel to.

title: An excellent NYC Hotel, restaurant can improve
text: Very nice property in very good location.  Room was outstanding with views over New York City.  The restaurant was the weak link here with odd cuban-asian food and mediocre service.  The lobby and other areas of the hotel were excellent spaces for all travelers.

title: Great service
text: Great customer service. Everyone is so helpful and friendly. Cassandra is the best, she helped me with all my needs and made my stay even greater. I look forward to coming back. Thank you to all the staff at The Dominick

title: at home in fine elegance
text: the thing that stands out aside from al the amazing infrastructure amenities - everything works and is immaculately clean - the 24 hour room service - complimentary nespresso - etc, is the refreshing, authentically real, yet not stuffy, service from staff / starting with the amazing miss cassandra at check in - professional, efficient AND kind - truly remarkably personable - i felt a virtual hug after my long journey -  to the super attentive housekeeper and the security and front door staff that make you feel like an old friend coming to sit at their favorite bar stool at cheers.  for me, it feels like a modern step back in time when service professionals seem like old friends - the dominic staff makes me feel like i am sitting on my front stoop in the marigny in new orleans drinking champagne with my neighbors while cheering on our beloved new orleans saints. thank y’all!!

title: Amazing experience and I will definitely be back!
text: This was my first time staying at this hotel and I absolutely loved it! Every member of the hotel staff that I encountered from the door persons, to the the bellhops, the front desk, concierge, restaurant staff, and housekeeping staff was so kind and genuinely welcoming and wanting to help. Jose at checkout was exceptionally kind. I also loved the room size (esp for NYc) and views as well as the decor and cleanliness. The food was excellent (especially the gnocchi at Vestry). And of course, the location can’t be beat. I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in NYC but this is my new favorite place and I will definitely be back next time I’m in the city!

title: Great service and great location
text: I stay here quite often for business travel. The hotel is in a good location with really great service that makes you feel right at home. The rooms are very spacious with modern decor and nice sized tub.

title: Always spot on!!!!
text: This property never let us down Majandra out. The front desk is always a gentleman and happy to direct us to restaurants and whatever’s happening in the neighborhood that weekend this is our home away from home

title: Asegúrate de reservar habitación con vista a la ciudad no a unas ventanas
text: El lobby es muy fancy, se nos perdió una pijama lo cual no está bien, no era un artículo costoso pero porque desaparecería, la habitación cómoda nuestra vista daba a un edificio así que ten cuidado de reservar las más costosas porque las standar no tienen vista más que a las ventanas de un edifico. La cama muy suave, la ducha extraordinaria habitación espaciosa y tina muy linda.

title: The views!
text: Great staff super helpful, they were very welcoming! clean rooms and common areas. We had a comfortable bed and amazing views. A lot of amenities gym, business center, 2 restaurants inside the hotel.

title: Best of the Best!!!
text: Best of the best!! I truly enjoyed my stay at The Dominick. The attention to detail and service were above and beyond any place I’ve ever stayed. And, the views from my room were extraordinary!! I will definitely stay again in the future.

title: Excellent Staff
text: The customer service was superb.The view from our 2 bedroom suite was the best I’ve ever had at any hotel in NYC in my life.  We stayed on the highest floor just under the penthouse. All the employees were very friendly and not “snooty” as you’d find at some very nice hotels like this in New York City. We did find hair in our food when we ordered really late (at around 11:30pm), but when we ordered at dinner time we had no issues. They gave us a credit and were very nice about it also saying that sort of thing never happens. The luxury concierge division went above and beyond! I would return in a heartbeat.

title: A True Oasis
text: First time staying there and I will be back. The room was super clean. The front desk attendant was so sweet and knowledgeable. He suggested that I upgrade to the higher skyline floor and he was right! The views were perfect. He also allowed me to do a late checkout so I had more time to enjoy the amenities. The spa was perfect! Lynsey had magic hands (ask for her and tip her well because she deserves it). The women at the front desk of the spa were also so nice. I forgot I was in NY for a minute. Everyone was pleasant and made sure my stay was perfect. I will definitely be back!

title: Great option for business travelers, and personal trips. Great staff, and ambiance.
text: Very clean, modern hotel with a nice ambiance. Good location to A-C-E subway line that can help you get uptown and downtown. It was quite noisy during my stay due to some construction, but nothing off putting by NYC standards. The team there was very polite, helpful, and accommodating. Will be staying there again soon,

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Great Customer Service with an amazing staff! Really enjoyed the view from our room as well as the great turn down service!  Will be staying at The Dominick again on my next trip to New York City in December.

title: Back to the Best
text: After 2 months or so returned to the Dominick and as usual everyone there, particularly, Gabriela, made sure I was well taken care of. It is so refreshing to see so many familiar faces. Feels like home away from home. And of course the device was top notch.  Will be back

title: Fabulous stay!
text:
Incredible hotel! Easily one of the best located hotels I’ve stayed at for work as of late. Perfect for walking all around. 

Special shout-out to Gabriela at the front desk. She’s a gem. 

Definitely will stay again.

title: 12/10 Experience
text: The most amazing hotel and hospitality! Raquel at the front desk blew our minds with how wonderful and accommodating she was. She went above and beyond for us and made our one night stay as memorable as it could be! Everything about this hotel was perfect and we will absolutely be back…and mainly because of Raquel!

title: Great Experience
text:
This SOHO hotel has a very good location and the high floor rooms have an extraordinary view from the city.
The staff is amazing, specially the receptionist, bellboys and housekeeping. 
Every time that i go for business or pleasure i choose this hotel.

title: Highly overrated
text:
We never, ever write negative reviews, but this hotel is extremely overrated.  Beginning at check-in where we were given an "upgraded" room so mediocre it made us question what their basic room features.  The noise begins outside your door from service people at about 6:30am.  By 8:30 they have knocked to clean your room.  Too early for vacationers and a weekend.  One sink in the bathroom too, meaning taking turns.  The shower door did not close and needed repair.  
The restaurant for breakfast is noisy, the food is pedestrian.  Although it was included, we didn't return.  
The pool is empty at this time of year, there is no meaningful service on the 7th floor terrace, and yet they assessed a "resort fee" which isn't divulged until checkout.  
The doormen said hello but were not interested in offering any assistance.  
We were tempted to check out and go elsewhere and should have.  Definitely not worth over $3500 for 3 nights for a small room with one sink in the bathroom.  Dreadful lighting, too.
Beware.  NYC has so many fabulous hotels, there is no reason to stay here.

title: Great experience
text:
Service. It was exceptional. I had forgotten to pack a few items of clothing and ended up ordering them for curbside pickup at Bloomingdales hoping that our driver from LGA would stop for a pick up. He said it was too far out of the way so he couldn't. We asked the concierge at the Dominick for help. He offered a courier service to us at a very reasonable price. It turned out the concierge misunderstood that it was actually the Bloomingdales on Lex and not in Soho. No matter. A short while later, just as we were getting ready to head to dinner, the courier (a very helpful young lady) showed up at our door, looking exhausted, with my items. It truly saved me from stretching the limits of Le Bernadin's dress code that evening. The remainder of the weekend was emblematic of that experience. Breakfast room service was excellent and delivered precisely on time each morning. Anytime we needed anything--steamer, blow dryer, etc.--there was a knock on our door with the item in less than five minutes. The concierge, doormen, everyone were very eager to assist with anything we might need.

Hotel amenities. My wife and I used the fitness center. It is small with a limited number of machines. The machines are high end however and given that this is a boutique establishment I would imagine there rarely is a wait to use them. My wife got a facial and a massage at the Spa and said both were amazing.

Some of the previous reviews talk about the furniture, interior design, etc. being somewhat jaded and dated. I suppose that could be true depending on what reservation class is booked. Our room on the 31st floor was very spacious with a great view. Furniture was beautiful and modern. Not dated at all. All aspects of the interior of the room were just as advertised on the hotel website. The only thing that I would point out is that while the commode room, which located in the bathroom next to the shower,  does have an opaque glass door to it, the bathroom as a whole is not separated in any way from the main room. Just FYI, in case that could be important to anyone.

Location is excellent. Walking distance to many shops and restaurants. If you're looking to travel to mid-town or further, it's not difficult to get a cab right away in front of the hotel. There is a subway stop a couple blocks away as well.

Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Dominick. Some of those that left negative reviews mention that this is not a "5 star" hotel. The concept of 5 star vs 4 star is antiquated IMO. It's true that one's experience at a "5 star" NYC hotel that costs $2-3K a night might be better than one's experience at this hotel. That said, dollar for dollar, based on our experience, I believe it would difficult to find a better high end hotel in NYC.

title: Top notch experience !
text:
My stay at the Dominick Hotel was extra special . Suzette Berdin Otalora made my stay  an absolute pleasure! She welcomed me at the hotel entrance  and  the  Frontdesk   Sydeka who assisted me
In my  check in are both very helpful and knowledgeable. The service.. from the cleaning or my room,  Frontdesk, Restaurant everything is fantastic! I highly recommend this hotel and  will stay there again next time I visit NYC . Thank you again Suzette !

title: Couples weekend getaway
text: Friendly staff, very welcoming.  Great amenities and well kept hotel.  Excellent location.  Room had amazing city view.  Very clean.  Turndown service each night is a great touch.  Enjoyed the complimentary coffee bar on the 7th floor. Will stay again.

title: Loved It!
text: Excellent views, excellent location, excellent staff. We had the corner suite on the 30th floor and it was comfortable for our family of 4. We have stayed at many hotels in the Soho area and this has been our best experience thus far.

title: Wonderful experience every time
text:
Having stayed at the Dominick Hotel for the fourth time in just the past two months, I can't help but feel like I've found a second home in New York City. This hotel's commitment to delivering genuine 5-star service has left an indelible mark on me. It all begins with the warm welcome from the bellhops, who seem to always remember you. Their kindness is truly remarkable. They always go the extra mile to making sure you have water after a long night out or searching for an umbrella, even when they think they’re all gone, they’re manage to find you one so you don’t have to walk in the rain. 

As I step up to the front desk, the staff's friendly and genuine greetings make me feel like an old friend returning. But it's not just the staff at the entrance that makes this place exceptional.

The housekeepers, who go above and beyond, have a way of making me feel like more than just a guest; they make me feel like family. They've turned what could be an ordinary hotel stay into something special, something that keeps me coming back. In my frequent trips to the city, I've experienced a wide range of 4 and 5-star hotels, but I can honestly say that the Dominick's service stands on its own, if not surpassing renowned establishments like the Ritz and the Four Seasons.

I'm not one to leave reviews often, but when a place like the Dominick goes above and beyond, it's only right to acknowledge it. I genuinely look forward to returning here. It's more than just a hotel; it's a place where the staff has made me feel like part of their extended family. The kind of place where, over time, they remember you and ensure your stay is nothing short of extraordinary.

title: Great business stay at the Dominick
text: First time here. Great hotel with fantastic views and excellent service. Mohendra in the front desk was exceptional and provided good guidance. Gym is in good size with sufficient variety of equipment.

title: Good but becareful when you book…
text:
Large room, Great bathroom, great products (dyptique) …
BUT … noisy room and above all, we booked for three and when we arrived the check-in office told us that we have to pay an extra charge if we want a additional bed for our daughter ! Meaning : you have to sleep all three in the same bed !! This is my first time ever that a so-called 5 stars hotel tells me that !!
Fortunately, as we strongly disagreed, the office found a solution. But the spirit remains unacceptable.

title: Stunning view great location
text:
Slaying view, truly breathtaking 
Good position 
Nice room (clean and such)
Theres no bathroom door, familys and larger groups of people may not appreciate that 
Slight organization problems, but otherwise very good

title: Gaby at the front deck is so helpful.
text:
The hotel is absolutely incredible and undoubtedly deserves a solid 5-star rating. What makes it even more remarkable is the exceptional service provided by Gaby during the check-in process. Her warm and welcoming smile instantly makes you feel like a cherished member of the family. Gaby's genuine hospitality is a rare gem that elevates the entire guest experience.

From the moment you step through the doors, the ambiance exudes luxury and comfort. The rooms are spacious, impeccably clean, and beautifully appointed, ensuring a delightful stay. The amenities and services provided are top-notch, living up to the reputation of a true 5-star establishment.

I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Gaby's personal touch, along with the hotel's overall excellence, makes for an unforgettable and truly enjoyable stay. Whether you're on a business trip or a leisurely vacation, this hotel surpasses expectations. You'll leave with a deep appreciation for the warmth and quality that define this establishment.
