It's a testament to the exceptional standards of hospitality and a place I wholeheartedly endorse for anyone seeking a remarkable hotel experience.

title: I’ll Be Back
text: This hotel was very nice, and has absolutely amazing  service! It’s set in the perfect location and the in-room dining was divine.  I will absolutely stay at the Dominick again… for business or pleasure.

title: Pay to play in SoHo
text: Excellent facility with generous room size and great housekeeping and amenities . Very expensive in that New York sort of way. The fitness facility is undersized for a hotel of this scale but the West Side walk/run promenade is a few short blocks away.

title: BEST HOTEL IN SOHO.
text: I love this hotel! I will be coming back very soon. They staff was very accommodating, and very nice. The location speaks volume! This by far is they best hotel in SOHO. I loved how the suite separated and gave the kids their space and us adults as well.

title: Another wonderful visit
text:
Great service in all areas! The doormen, the front desk, room service all wonderful. I received an upgrade to a beautiful suite. Spotlessly clean and comfy. Wonderful shampoo, shower gel and conditioner, smells so good! 
Everything was great, this is the only hotel I stay when in soho!

title: Great hotel with fabulous views
text:
We were on the 28th floor and the views of the city were fabulous....hotel bedroom was excellent, superbly furnished and with a bath with a full city view.  Hotel staff were super helpful and very efficient in all they did !
The only irritant is the destination fee which at $45 + tax per night on top of what had already been paid for the room was extortionate. I understand now that this is a NY standard but it is really annoying as it purports to be for services which are expected of this class of hotel - just a money-making scheme. The hotel manager was understanding of the annoyance and was very helpful when I raised this on departure (it was a bit of  shock !)

title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff
text: This is our second stay here and it certainly won't be our last.  The rooms are beautiful, the views are amazing, and the staff is uniformly lovely.  Special shout out to Gabi at reception who was especially helpful and welcoming.

title: Mother daughter getaway.
text: Everything was wonderful! The beds, linens & pillows were dreamy 😊 The entire staff so professional & friendly. My daughter and I had a wonderful experience at the spa. We will definitely be back! Thank you.

title: Perfect in Every Way
text: From the bellman to the front desk agent to the food service staff, every team member at The Dominick was friendly, welcoming, and helpful.  The corner suite offered an incredible view of the Hudson and the city.  The food was INCREDIBLE.  We had breakfast here every day and each meal was truly exceptional.  The room service was the best I've ever had.  They really went the extra mile here.

title: Nice location great staff
text: Nice room. Clean. Nothing over the top.  We were surprised for 750 a night that the rooms were as small as they are.   This may be a determining factor on future visits to the city as the competing hotels like the knickerbocker are half the price and have far larger rooms.  Same amenities

title: As always, great stay.
text: Clean throughout, friendly and professional staff, perfect and safe feeling location! Close to the holland tunnel so it’s easy to avoid traffic if you’re on your way to Newark Airport. Amenities were too! Spa was pretty great.

title: Outstanding hotel
text:
We had the pleasure of staying at The Dominick this August, and it turned out to be a true lifesaver when our original hotel unexpectedly closed its doors! At first, we were worried that our family's long-awaited trip to NYC might take a turn for the worse, however, from the moment we arrived and were warmly greeted by the doorman, our worries were dispelled. The reception staff went above and beyond in extending their hospitality, providing us with exceptional service throughout our stay. Our rooms were not only impeccably clean but also generously stocked with luxurious Bulgari lotions and shampoos. 

The hotel's prime location in SOHO was a dream, with fantastic restaurants just a stroll away and easy access to the subway. Having a Starbucks right across the street and Trader Joe's just a few shops down was an added bonus. The kids had a blast at the pool, while my husband I chilled by the bar.

The Dominick exceeded our expectations and made our stay truly memorable; it's definitely our top choice for accommodations in the Big Apple!

title: Great place to stay with friends or family!
text: Beautiful hotel with comfortable and clean rooms, beds, bathroom.  The amenities (gym, terrace, coffee in the morning) were wonderful as was the staff.  The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful.  Great location!  Would 100% stay there again.

title: So comfy you sleep like a baby
text: The reception staff is warm and welcoming. The room has a great view of the river. The bed and pillows are so comfortable that I slept like a baby. No tossing or turning to find the right location. The walk-in closet is a plus. Made unpacking and packing easy and orderly.

title: Best view of the city. Wonderful staff!
text: We were on the 37th floor, and the view of the city couldn’t be beat! A special shout out to the concierge, staff, Lindsey and Cullen who helped us plan a great trip for our granddaughter’s first time to New York. Also, thank you to the bell staff who are very friendly and greeted us by name every morning and night when we returned. We loved our stay at the Dominick and can’t wait to return.

title: Great Service
text:
We were moving from anotehr hotel which we were not happy with and Neferteri at Reception really helped us significantly in arranging a room which was perfect for the whole family. 
Room was huge and the team took great care of us through our stay.

title: Stay 10/2023
text:
Excellent hotel with amazing service.  Initially got a room facing the river and it was an upgraded room thru AMEX.  It however was showing its age with warped wood veneer and the side bed table cabinet was broken.
We did get an upper floor corner room but at a higher added fee.  None the less worth it as the room was excellent.  Views of the river and the Empire State bldg.  
We will stay again but comer rooms are the way to go!

title: Great place to stay in SoHo!
text: Really fun stay at the Dominick.  They have a great staff across the board.  Very welcoming, friendly and helpful.   The rooms are a good size and very comfortable.  Bathrooms are spacious and well-appointed.  I love the giant bathtub.  The hotel can get crowded - it is large - but it is overall quiet and comfortable.

title: Great location and a very nice hotel.
text:
Great location and really good hotel, unfortunately we didn’t have hot water for two days, we stayed in room 3411.

There are nice touches like Diptique toiletries, and complimentary tea and coffee in the morning.

Rooms are spacious and bathrooms had a bath.

Not a five star hotel but a really good four star, however, we would stay again and enjoy your stay.

Location is perfect. We ate the restaurant, food was incredible and service from all aspects of the hotel was great too.

title: Great NYC getway
text: Great location in Soho and Meatpackers districts. I really liked the big bath with the view across the city and Hudson River. All the trendy eateries and diners were all close. And some great little wine bars tucked away in the area.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
The hotel staff - from doormen to check-in to the restaurant - was friendly and helpful. Our room had a beautiful view from the 30th floor.
….and a super comfy mattress. We could easily walk to coffee bars, shops, and restaurants.

title: Where the bad erases all the good points
text:
I tried to scour many hotels within the SoHo area and was tossing between ModernHaus and The Dominick. I ended up booking with Dominick because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. (I always feel that some of these reviews are highly inaccurate, so here's an unbiased review).

Let's start with the good - perfect location (very near good restaurants and shopping areas, church, supermarket, drug store and most importantly the subway). Plus the fact that they had very good breakfast and very good in food dining.

I loved the room and the fact that they didn't scrimp on amenities was almost the icing on the cake.

Unfortunately, the bad superseded the good. We were assigned a connecting room. Beside me was a very rowdy woman and I don't know if it was a family or couple that was occupying that adjacent room. And their voice - it was like there was so much chaos occurring at 630 AM. I mean, there is nothing more irritating than paper thin walls. And this hotel has that.
You can even hear the trains running underneath from the 23rd floor (where we were staying). The cleaning ladies and crew were also busy knocking at the neighbors' doors and they were so noising that we even the sign outside the door of DO NOT DISTURB was disturbing. 

While our room was far from the elevator, the noise was imperceptibly a big turn off. It was sad that in spite of the pomp and beauty of the hotel, and its amenities and perks, the noise was irritating. 

Each time I attempted to pick up the phone to complain to the manger, the noise would subside. There was even a family that was fighting in the corridor with the young daughter being called a bitch by the mother! Imagine in the middle of the hallway, I could hear all the raucous. Seriously, this is a five star hotel? 

Would I return to this hotel? Maybe. Is it worth the price? Well, the rooms are big and the amenities are excellent. But I came for a vacation. Get some rest and enough sleep. The noise was not worth it.

title: Birthday weekend
text: We stayed at the Dominick with 2 other couples to celebrate my husband’s birthday.  Mahindra at the front desk made sure we could get right into the room and upgraded our suite to a better view.  Every staff member greeted us all weekend.  Fully equipped suite with all the details like plenty of hangers and Nespresso machine.  The doorman said it was our home away from home, and it felt like it!

title: Incredible first time experience!
text: Loved loved loved our stay from the moment we checked in with Raquel; she  is amazing!  Service and professionalism all around was wonderful!  Menu is great; many healthy options. We look forward to returning in the near future.  Thank you again!!

title: Thank you for taking such a great care of us, as always 🙏🙏🙏
text:
I have been to the Dominic few times in the past two years and enjoyed the experience.
Every time the Dominic team surprise me with a better service.
The room is very clean and comfortable, the service is behind all expectations.
Thank you Dominic 🙏

title: Great stay!
text: Gaby at the front desk is a consummate professional.   I travel to this hotel regularly for business and incredibly remembers me by name every time I arrive. She makes sure my stay is flawless on every visit snd makes me feel welcomed.  This is why I return to this hotel each time.

title: Very satisfying stay.
text: Great amenities, clean room, very comfortable, nice view of the river, and some tasty petits-four were provided to me, as a returning customer. The Dominick is a great hotel. I would recommend staying there anytime.

title: Wonderful weekend
text: Loved the hotel. The staff is wonderful and the spa is absolutely fabulous!!!  We look forward to our next visit. We really enjoyed our entire visit. The location is great too. We walked to most of the places we visited.

title: Girls just wanna have fun
text:
The electronic drapes didn’t work in some of the rooms
The room was good but different duvets were in the rooms some more plush
We had a lovely stay

The negative was the lack of help with ANY reservations and lack of communication. In this regard
We were able to snag our own reservations that we had asked for help with which was extremely disappointing
We were celebrating a 40th birthday and there was no special attention for the milestone

title: Nice modern hotel. Good experience and good location. Needs refurbishing though.
text: Hotel is in a great location with beautiful views. Modern interior. However they do need a bit if a refresh. Carpets are old and should be replaced along with the furniture. We stayed in a two bedroom suit and it needs to be updated.  Restaurant Vestry is good and shopping is close by. Staff is friendly.

title: Amazing stay!
text: My short but sweet overnight stay at The Dominick was exceptional. From the extremely friendly staff and early check in so I can freshen up and get ready for a business meeting to the turndown service was beyond expected. Rooms are also spacious which is a rarity in NYC hotels. I will definitely return. Thank you again for the hospitality!

title: Incrível!
text:
Melhor hotel que já fiquei em Ny, localização espetacular! Tudo incrível, decoração, atendimento, quarto enorme… limpeza impecável! Recomendo 100% esse hotel!
Se procura conforto, localização e luxo com ótimo custo benefício, esse é o hotel certo!

title: Great people at the Dominick Hotel!
text: Everyone I encountered at the Dominick was helpful and friendly. From the doorman to front desk to the friendly room staff.  A very nice stay.  The room was clean and very comfortable.  I would definitely stay again when visiting soho or lower Manhattan.

title: A perfect stay
text: Perfect. Room is large, comfortable and everything works. Beautiful views of the city. Location is excellent and every member of the staff is warm and helpful while not being intrusive. Gym has exceelent equipment.  I have already booked my next stay.

title: Excellent customer service ( Thank you Gabby!)
text: I have loved my stay at the Dominick. I really enjoyed all of their amenities and special touches like their turn down service with lavender chocolates. The best part of my stay was the excellent customer service I experienced. Gabby made sure I had the best 21st birthday week ever. She made I had everything I needed and more. This was an unforgettable experience!

title: A+ minus one detail
text: We had the best experience minus one detail. Make sure you don't get the room right next to the floor service doors. They are squeaky and slam all night. We did notify the front desk hoping they would fix the noisy door and it seemed to be a little better. Other than that, it was an awesome hotel! Excellent staff and very comfortable.

title: Great Room
text: Our room was spacious with a great view of the city! The pillows and bed were so comfortable!  We had so much fun doing the Street Art Search by Artist Paul Richard it was a great way to explore SOHO the only thing was that your staff did not know anything about it I think it is a great thing to let your guest know that your hotel offers this fun activity!

title: Would stay again
text: Super experience in this amazing hotel! Great location, incredible views, a lot of restaurants and bars nearby, great staff. Very convenient for the purpose of our trip. This was our second time staying here and we will be back!

title: HORRIBLE RECEPTION  BAD PRICE NO DISCOUNT THAT IS ONLINE  1 HOUR TO GET CAR
text:
RECEPTION UNFRIENDLY
EXTREMELEY OVERPRICED WITH NO DISCOUNTED RATE IF REPEAT CUSTOMER
VALET HORRIBLE WAITIED 1 HOUR FOR MY CAR
SAUNA CLOSED 
SPA OPEN TOO LATE TO ENJOY
POOL CLOSED
HONESTLY HORRIBLE FOR THE PRICE

title: Unparalleled Elegance
text:
From check in until departure was unprecedented. My son and I checked in early on Friday morning. The housekeeping staff was checking my  room when we arrived. She would not allow me into the room behind her. Most would consider that an issue…..she said I have to close the door and let you use the key. That level of attention and detail to guest security won me over, I was there 15 minutes and knew this was going to be an incredible stay. 
Front desk, incredible. Door men should perform on Broadway. They all created a three day stay that my son and I will never forget.

title: Would definitely stay here again
text: Room was clean, staff were friendly, and service was excellent. We had a room on the 29th floor with a city view. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying here again in the future.

title: Great stay
text: We really enjoyed our stay. Hotel rooms were spacious and clean. We enjoyed a view of the Empire State building. Plenty of things to walk to nearby in Soho. The rooms were well appointed and the staff were friendly and helpful. Looking forward to visiting again in the future.

title: Unparalleled  Service
text:
The experience here is something very special. The rooms, the service, the dining and spa - just all of it! 
Stanley, one of the very well-mannered doormen, was absolutely fantastic. Conversational, kind, and immediately made us feel welcome and at home. 
We will be back!

title: Worst hotel service I've ever had.
text:
I have never written a bad review in my life but this was just too much for me! I have never been treated so poorly for so much money.  It started before check in.  We had reserved 3 suites and multiple rooms for a wedding weekend.  I personally had reserved two of the suites and a room so I was paying a lot of money.  I requested that tow tables be brought to the suite for makeup and hair consultants.  I was told I would be charged 1500 dollars for that.  I was appalled.  I also asked about food delivery and told I could not have food delivered so I had to use their room service or catering.  We ordered a pot f coffee for 15 people.  An hour later, when it still hadn't arrived, we called down to inquire.  It finally arrived about 15 minutes later.  The charge was 140 dollars.  Are you kidding?  No bagel, no muffin, just coffee. I had wanted tea too but I was told it was 12 dollars per cup so i didn't order it.  That same Saturday morning, when I arrived at the suite, the bridesmaid, staying there showed me her pillow with a HUGE stain on it!  Disgusting!  And impossible to miss when changing sheets!  
The next morning I called for my car, gave my ticket number and a "description" of the car as requested.  I was told the ticket and description didn't match.  It was the description of my car and the ticket they gave me!  I went to the concierge who had the same response but was going to pursue it when my husband saw my car brought to the front.  I don't know how they figured it all out but we left.  My son was still waiting for our other car but since he had called at the same time and was not told of any issue, we assumed he's be right behind us.  one hour and twenty minutes later, the car was brough out.  Even the door man was appalled and kept inquiring and apologizing.  On Monday morning, I received the Dominick's standard survey regarding my stay and I assumed I would get a response from someone.  On Monday afternoon, I got an email from the person who had handles our group reservation and I shared the same feedback with her later that same day.  Yesterday, I received my notification from American Express regarding all the extra charges but to date, not a word back from anyone at the Dominick.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel with all accommodations you would want when staying in NYC. All staff are extremely friendly & always around to help. Room was extremely comfortable & big washrooms allowed us to use all the space we could possibly need during our stay.

title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, lots of fees, need to work on service
text: Very mixed feelings about our trip.  Hotel design, rooms, and views were amazing.  Valet parking was expensive.  Tacked on amenity fees were not valuable to us since we had no time to use the spa but still had to pay them.  Multiple small service needs were not met to expectations for paying a high rate for a suite room.  Requested in advance a mini-fridge in room..was not there...was told it would arrive in 5 minutes but waited 45 minutes for it to show up.  Requested luggage rack service at checkout, was told it would be there in 5-10 minutes, waited 45 minutes then took care of it myself.  Breakfast was delicious, but waited an hour for food to be served with a party of seven people.  Would we go back?  I'm not sure, would likely try another place to see if these service issues are hotel specific or not.

title: I’ll be back!
text:
Wonderful staff and service. Any problems were resolved quickly.
Great location and delicious food. The room was fabulous. Drinks by the pool were a fun way to enjoy the end of a busy day. 
A beautiful hotel in every way.

title: Hotel is perfectly situated in SOHO but is real need of a refresh as it is "showing" its age in both look and smell.
text: We checked in on a Wednesday and had purchased a Sofi King room on a higher floor with a view of the Hudson. When we got to the room on the 35th floor there was a distinct odor. (Musty/Stale) There was a housekeeping person near our room and I asked him to come and confirm this was not normal and he thought that perhaps it was the A/C filter. I went down to front desk and asked that they have someone take a look and correct the problem. They assured me that someone would investigate and get back to me. Fast forward to Thursday and then Friday and still no resolution. There were no other room options as it was US Open and Fashion Week in NYC. On Friday I asked again and they said they would escalate to management and that I should expect a follow up phone call. Unfortunately, no follow up call ever came and the odor lingered. When I checked out on Sunday the front desk asked if I ever received the call and after letting them know that I had not they gave me a small credit on my bill. For over $900 per night you expect more. The rooms are dated, the amenities in the room are sparse and the lobby has not been updated in a long time. Great location but would not stay here again.

title: Very good service by Mohendra
text: I want to point out the great service we got from Mohendra at the recaption. After there was a mistake with a double city fee charge - he helped us with a smile and we left with a good feeling. Thank you Mo!

title: Excellent
text: We loved this hotel. Great value for what you get which is a big clean modern room in SOHO. Great location as well. There is a Starbucks, Trader Joe’s and CVS directly across the street which is super convenient. Quick walk to most things we wanted to do in Manhattan.

title: Great spot
text: Always top-notch.  Rooms are beautiful with great views.  Staff is always friendly.  We ordered breakfast in bed and it was on time, and very good.  We did not sample the restaurant or bar during this visit.

title: Great place!
text: A great place to relax and enjoy the NYC skyline! And to explore NYC from SOHO. We stayed there as a family and felt very comfortable. Great location and service, great staff! We would love to come back!

title: Luxurious Cocoon!
text:
The room and the view were wonderful and so was everyone who worked at the hotel!
The property is a luxurious cocoon in the bustling city. The location is superb. We will be back in a month for another stay at the Dominick!

title: Great spot
text: Mo made our experience, helpful staff, great views, convenient location. If you’re looking for a hotel in the SoHO area this is the place to stay. Make sure to ask for Mo at the counter, he made the experience

title: Nice but not wowed
text: We booked a 2 bedroom suite so my families could enjoy a communal space with a common area. It was advertised as 2 rooms connected by a common walk way but not set up like that initially which was confusing. We needed to speak to someone at the front desk to clear up the confusion. The accommodation were nice but needed some updating like the toilet paper holder was loose and the paper roll kept falling off. The food was excellent especially at Vestry.

title: US Open Home Base
text: Comfortable, large room.  Bed, bedding and toiletries amazing and 5 star.  Great local for walking and getting to subway.  Pool was a nice touch even just to have a morning cup of coffee. Service and staff on point!

title: Inoubliable
text:
Chambre exceptionnelle, accueil chaleureux et professionnel, un grand hôtel.
La vue du 37eme étage était incroyable.
La situation de l'hôtel parfaite à soho, à deux pas de Greenwich et de meatpacking au nord et de Tribeca au sud.
New York dans des conditions parfaites.

title: Great views, but not much else
text:
We upgraded to a penthouse suite for an extra $1200 a night and tbh, whilst the views were mind bendingly good .. that's sorta where it ended. The room smelled a little off, but I'll come to that later.  We ordered room service with 2 kids, and left the trays outside the room. 12 hours later... When we came home, still there. For that much money .. I expect decent housekeeping. 

Yesterday we were about to go out the the theatre, and so ordered room service again. As we were leaving .. housekeeping asked if we wanted a turn down service. We explained we were just leaving and yes, that would be lovely, please take the trolley with our empties. 

Came back at 10.30pm, to the room smelling of stale food... And all of the plates, and debris still there in theiddle of the lounge. It suddenly clicked why the whole suite smelled a bit. They just weren't doing their jobs properly. I only ordered room service twice, and was let down twice. 

When I complained politely to the manager (apparently front desk weren't able to print a simple bill off for me to check the night before leaving .. I had to leave my kids and travel 44 floors down to speak to him personally and press the button).. he just said sorry, I'll feed it back. No comp, no discount next time. He sounded jaded and apologized a little unconvincingly. For a ten grand bill for a few days, I do expect turndown and my room to be serviced properly. . That's part of the contract. 

As you can see from my other reviews.. I rarely leave a poor one. Contrarily.. I'm delighted to gush about the staff. It was just a mediocre hotel with great views and room sizes. Just don't expect much more.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: We booked the skyline view 2-bedroom suite for the weekend. The skyline sunrises and sunsets were incredible!  We were greatly satisfied with the staff and hotel as well as the cleanliness, amenities, and experience that we were provided. We especially loved the pool!

title: Great Hotel !!
text: This was my first stay at The Dominick Hotel and it was fantastic !  It’s the rare 5 Star Hotel in the middle of Soho, it’s beautifully decorated, the staff is excellent and the room was spacious and well decorated ( I had a Junior Suite). There is a nice restaurant right off of the lobby and there is a great chill out area on the 7th floor with a small bar, ample seating inside and seats around a nice small pool, which was a big surprise. There are so many shops, places to see and nice restaurants near the hotel, that there is a lot to do !  I definitely will come back to this hotel on my next visit to NYC.  I highly recommend the Dominick hotel for your next visit ti NYC.

title: We booked the reservation from another family member that recommended we stay there.
text:
The room was impecible and clean.  Amenties in bathroom was top quality.
The bed was sooo comfortable after the 7 miles my daughter and I put on the first day.  We had such a good night sleep.  Everyone staff member was very friendly and accommodating.  We will  stay there again.  Thank You!

title: Perfect Soho location, amazing  views, attentive service.  Absolutely loved it
text: Perfect Soho location.  Attentive and professional service.  Amazing views!  This hotel is the total package if you want uptown elegance and Soho cool.  We come to NYC 4 to 5 times a year and we have finally found our new home.  Thank you to The Dominick!

title: Friendly Service
text: The entire staff was so friendly and helpful. From the moment I checked in to the moment I left, everyone I interacted with was so kind, thoughtful and generous. Gabby at the front desk was so welcoming and ensured I was able to check in early when I arrived. The room was so well kept and had amazing views of the city. This was my first stay at The Dominick, but I will definitely be back and I would recommend staying here for work or leisure.

title: Beautiful hotel but beware of the bathroom
text: We stayed 5-nights at this hotel. The Dominick was beautiful and the staff was very accommodating. Upon entering, the hotel smells wonderful and looks very elegant. It gave us a warm and inviting feeling immediately. The room was stylish, modern, spacious, and clean. The view was fairly nice of the city at night considering its location, and I loved the auto-open/close feature of the curtains on the bedside table. The bed was large, extremely comfortable and soft. Overall, I gave it 4 stars and not 5 for a few reasons: (1) The shower was not designed with efficiency in mind and is a hazard, in my opinion. The showerhead is a wand that faced towards the door of the shower. When turned on, sprayed so hard, it would flood through the opening in the corners of the glass door and onto the marble floor. We had to put an abundance of towels down to soak up the water after every shower. Water on marble floor makes it incredibly slick, so it's as if you're ice skating barefoot if not soaked up immediately. It's a lawsuit waiting to happen. If you tried to turn the shower head left or right away from the door, it then sprayed onto the bottles of shampoo fixed into the wall or into the only two very small shelves (which held just two travel sized body washes and a washcloth). Of course, it still sprayed so hard, water would splash off of the shelf/bottles that it would push water through the opening in the glass door onto the marble floor. There is also an overhead (straight above you) "rain" shower, but if you have long hair like me, you may not want it wet during every shower, and therefore, you must use the wand. (2) The ice bucket always had little particles in it but I believe it came from the ice machine/ice. We switched out the bucket and refilled the ice a few times hoping to get clean ice but every time, it had brown particles in it. Don't use the ice in your drinks, but for chilling only. (3) The bedside lamps were broken. Not only were there pieces missing from both lamps but the lights sometimes would not turn on, and the outlet to charge your electronics was very worn and would not hold a charge for very long. (4) Other small inconveniences were that the room refrigerator was not cold at all and the couch was a little outdated. Lastly, it was my fiancé's birthday and I had ordered strawberries and champagne at booking to be delivered to the room. Unfortunately, it was never delivered because when they tried to deliver it, we had the DND sign on the door. There was not a note left on the door or another attempt as far as I know. When I inquired about it the following day, I was refunded for that cost and they also gave us a food and beverage comp for the restaurants/bars at the hotel, which we were appreciative they did. My experience at this hotel, despite the few issues above was overall very nice! It was comfortable, upscale, and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to other guests but would certainly caution them about the bathroom floor.

title: Unparalleled experience!
text: I travel the world and I have to say that my experience at The Dominick Hotel is truly unparalleled...mainly because of the staff. I have been going there for years now, and no matter how many months go by the staff always remembers me by name and goes out of their way to make me feel special on each visit. I have to say that Gabriella at the front desk is absolutely the best...she is so kind and professional..and is one of the main reasons I go back! Not only do I always get a warm welcome back from her, but she always remembers my favorite rooms and goes out of her way to make my visit special. In today's world it is this kind of experience that makes me only choose to go back to the Dominick every time I am in NYC. Also, the rooms are larger than other NYC hotels and views are amazing!

title: Great hotel in great location with lovely pool and excellent service
text: Very comfortable hotel with great service. And rhe addded benefit of a great pool where we were always able to find a seat and spend some time during hottest part of the day. Right on spring street so close to so many restaurants, coffee shops and shops. Love it here!

title: Spacious, comfortable and friendly
text: The rooms are spacious with plenty of counter space in the bathrooms. The beds are extremely comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful - Gabby at reception has helped me multiple times and is a pleasure to see. A perfect hotel for business travel or couples with a great location, ample amenities and a very comfortable stay!

title: Upsold upon arrival and felt scammed.
text: After deciding to splurge on this expensive hotel, I was excited to arrive.  I was due a free room upgrade.  The gentleman at the desk only tried to upsell me on a more expensive room and never mentioned what I was entitled to.  Arriving tired and hot with kids in tow, I wasn't on my game, but I didn't expect to have to be.  I just wanted to be welcomed and to relax.  Instead I felt scammed.  Do better Dominick.  Welcome your guests instead of trying to scam them.

title: Fantastic experience!
text: Fantastic hotel!! Amazing location in Soho, great service, all around top experience. I would highly recommend the hotel. We will be going back there soon.  Everything in the hotel was really top notch

title: Great night
text: The overall experience was great. The only downside was that the view in my room was not satisfactory. I own a chase sapphire preferred and I am eligible for free room upgrades but because of the website I purchased the room I was unable to. The positives were the beautiful bed, amazing decor in lobby, the 3 restaurants were stunning with one of them having a pool! Customer service was on par as well

title: Excellent
text: I liked very much my experience at the Dominick Hotel. At first I stayed in a room (1403) where I could hear a lot of noise from a construction they were doing at the street (just in the corner of the hotel) I couldn't sleep. I called the reception and they promptly changed for another and bigger room (911) where I could not hear anything. All the staff was courteous and polite. I liked the staying, cleaning and location!!!!

title: Truly special
text:
This hotel is without doubt one of the best, if not the best hotel in downtown NYC.
The rooms are huge, the views are incredible, the bathroom products are the most luxurious, the beds and linen are also top quality BUT what makes The Dominick is the people.
Mohendra at the front desk, George in the Luxury Ambassador team and everyone working at the pool/terrace bar are a credit to the hotel and went out of their way to make everyone feel special.
A truly special place

title: Well worth staying here!
text:
This hotel is wonderful! 
The location is great for all of Chealsea, Soho, Meat packing district. 
Bed is insane! Views are magical if you get a higher floor (we had 12 I think)
Breakfast is poor unless you get room service but it comes with a large room charge for delivering it, however for a lazy morning, I recommend the room service, try the french toast with berry's and cream - my goodness, stuff of dreams!
Don't bother eating at the restaurant downstairs, it is in the Michelin guide, food was just ok but we paid cash and they then charged our card via the hotel, we tried to bring it up and were accused of fraud. Was the only negative and I write this as if they are different venues hence my review being so positive. 
Rooftop pool is great fun, drinks flow, music on, toilets clean. Great place to chill with friends. 
My only negative is the lobby staff could be more welcoming and helpful.
However, I'd happily come back.

title: BRB
text:
Stayed here in Feb as well as August 2023 and the service is amazing and check in process with Gabriela was flawless. She also went above & beyond to make sure my upgrade was seamless. Housekeeping as well as in room dining was exceptional too. Rooms are nice too, I love the sohi river suites (hudson view).
I'll be back 100%

title: beautiful business in ny
text: The staff from check in, room service, maintenance, and doormen were over the top in attention to guests needs. the rooms (my second stay)  are  exemplary. Cant say enough about the views.  Finally,  but not least,  love the Bar and the beautiful crystal must have a cocktails in the filigree glasses

title: Bathroom door
text:
The check in, breakfast server and checkout personnel were all great.
The location of the hotel is ideal for visiting lower Manhattan.
The room is OK (starting to look tired) but the concept of not having a door that separates the bathroom is terrible.

title: 5 stars
text: Staff was awesome in all aspects. Convenient location with everything you could possibly want to walk to. Gym was fantastic. Great destination for couples. Can’t think of anything I would want to improve.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Fantastic hotel.  Very well located in the Soho area.  The suite is very comfortable, modern, and with all the facilities.  The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.  In short, a 100% recommended hotel.

title: Treated like royalty
text: We knew we had chosen the right hotel after meeting Gaby at the front desk. She greeted us with enthusiasm and poise. She treated us with such care, we felt like royalty.  We will definitely be back.

title: Great food, service and room.
text: Customer service was totally above bar. Everyone was extremely friendly and the room was very nice and big big NYC standards. Will def be back. The food was good and the location can’t be beat. It’s on the expensive side but good value for money

title: The best, once again!
text: Best service! Best location. I love the neighborhood! Had fun in the pool. Great housekeeping service. Found a parking spot right near  hotel. So friendly with my Maltese, Lola. I wish we could have stayed longer!

title: Magical Stay at The Dominick!
text: This was our first stay at The Dominick but it certainly won’t be our last. The service at the hotel was impeccable. I’ve never encountered better service. We were upgraded to a beautiful corner room with amazing views. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the rooms were clean and a great size, particularly for Manhattan. We loved that the neighborhood was a little quieter and there were many great restaurants and bakeries in walking distance. We will absolutely be back!

title: comfort meets luxury in NYC
text: For years this has been my favorite hotel in NYC. Perfect size hotel where they always make you feel welcome. Service is warm and professional. Marek is always there to welcome and help. Rooms are spacious with beautiful views.

title: Clean with great views
text: The room was brights and clean. The bathroom was immaculate. Location of the hotel is good, but busy. Views were beautiful and beds were comfortable. Mini fridge had great options. Service was good.

title: Absolutely Spectacular Soho experience
text: Amazing views and service! Perfect downtown location. Super comfortable beds. The pool area is just lovely with a great restaurant to enjoy. Everywhere you go the staff is attentive and accommodating. Loved every second of our stay!

title: Great stay!
text: Service is top notch. Everything about my stay was accommodating. Food is good and beds are comfortable. Staff makes sure all needs are taken care of. Views of the city are perfect and location allows for easy navigation around soho.

title: J.S
text: Sehr schönes Hotel. Einer der wenigen hotels in new york mit einem pool. Wir hatten 2bedroom suite sehr schön auf beiden seiten soho und worldtradecenter view! Soho zum schoppen 5min zu fuss! Sehr schöner hotel! Lobby auch sehr schön! Zimmer Wurden immer sehr dchön sauber gemacht

title: Even better than usual
text: Great trip at the Dominick, especially thanks to Gaby at the front desk who made us feel like we were coming home and made sure we got a great room.  All the staff we met was friendly and helpful, we can wait for our next stay !

title: SoHo heaven!
text: Favorite hotel in SoHo.  Huge rooms, large bathrooms (with double sinks, separate soaking tub, and a large window - so rare In NYC).    Rooms are quiet and hotel service is top-notch.   Fantastic location barely 2 blocks to the Spring St subway station.   Walk to all the great SoHo restaurants amd shopping.

title: Best views and rooms in Soho
text: Best views in town and best-located luxury hotel in Soho. Rooms are great and spacious and you wake up with the best views you can imagine. Perfect for business, trips, Families or couples getaways. We always choose Dominick Hotel.

title: Stay here!
text: The staff at the hotel could not have been more gracious and welcoming!! Gaby took such good care of us, as this was my birthday week celebration. Marek at the front door makes you feel like you’re home. The rooms are beautifully appointed and kept immaculately clean. Love this hotel and will stay here again!

title: Best in the City
text: Excellent customer service, incredibly comfortable bed, and wonderful amenities. We were greeted for a late night check-in, but treated to an incredible team that assisted us with our bags, valeted our oversized vehicle, and provided all the details needed to make our stay easy. We will absolutely be back soon!

title: Dominick hotel is the best hotel in NYC
text: The Dominick Hotel is my new favorite hotel in NYC.  The smell of the lobby is very welcoming, especially after walking around on the hot New York City streets.  Greeted by the friendliest check-in I have ever experienced.  The room walk-in has music playing to make you feel really welcome.  Very clean, bright, and cozy.  The views in the hotels are incredible and they have remote blinds.  Nespresso is in the room for those that need their coffee when they get ready, not to mention the nicest Turkish towels you have ever felt in a hotel room.  Body products 10/10.  Bed 10/10.  Room Cleanliness 10/10.  I never sleep well in a hotel the first night and I spelt like a baby in this room.  I have traveled to new york over 60 times in my life and this is the best hotel experience I have ever had in this city.  The doorman Chris was the nicest Doorman I have ever come across at any hotel.  Thank you Dominick Hotel keep up the good work.

title: Good hotel
text: Lovely staff and nice hotel. Good location in Soho. The vestry restaurant was good too. Stayed at the 34th floor and the view was great. Couldn’t figure out the light switches in the room and breakfast was not included, otherwise fab.

title: Hotel Desk (Cassandra) goes the extra mile (actually many extra miles)
text: Had a great short stay at the Dominick with my 14 year old daughter.  We took in Soho shops, broadway plays, ground zero, ferry to Staten Island, fine dining, hotel dining (by the 7th floor pool) and local pizza.  The Vanderbilt junior suite is fantastic — Wrap-around views of Hudson River, Wall Street and Soho.  But the best part:  My 89 year old mom from the Bronx left her full set of keys with my daughter by mistake, which we discovered late night before an early morning departure.  When I was inquiring about fedex options, Cassandra at the desk said she too was from the Bronx (not that near my mom), and that she would drive the keys to my mom when her shift ended.  And would not accept any payment.  So that turned an already fine stay into a perfect one.  Thanks Cassandra.

title: Excellent service! Mohendra Halall is great
text: I had the greatest experience during my stay at the Dominick in Soho. Mohendra Halall was EXCELLENT. He made sure my stay was as comfortable as possible and game changing service. Definitely plan on returning!

title: Awesome Family Weekend!
text: Awesome hotel and experience. Great rooms, great pool and amazing service.  We came into NYC for a fun family weekend and this hotel did not disappoint.  I loved the size of the room and the service of the staff was top notch

title: Great stay
text: Very enjoyable stay. This is my "go to" NYC hotel. Great shops and restaurants close by. Room was great with great view. Love the in room expresso machine.  Front desk and staff all pleasant and accommodating. Will be back.

title: Best Hotel in lower manhattan
text: Second time staying here and we love it!  This time was a staycation gift from our Mom (my sister and I live in Manhattan).  We used the pool and it was so nice and service was fantastic.  Second time at the spa and it is one of the best ever massage treatments.  The room is spacious and the robes are so soft.  Everything about this hotel is 5 star.

title: The best in Tribeca!
text:
Very accommodating staff, spacious well maintained rooms, overall a great experience!  

I needed to make a last minute change to my reservation, and the front desk was very helpful in presenting options and recommending a solution.

I've stayed at the Dominick a couple times, and will happily stay there again.

title: The Dominick is my home in NYC - for good reasons!
text:
My experience at this hotel was nothing short of exceptional. Situated in a prime location, the hotel offers breathtaking views that are simply unmatched. The rooms, adorned with luxurious amenities, provide an unparalleled level of comfort and elegance.

One aspect that truly sets this hotel apart is the impeccable service. Throughout my stay, I had the pleasure of being assisted by Gabriela Bucheli, a remarkable staff member who went above and beyond to ensure every aspect of my visit was flawless. From remembering my name to promptly resolving any concerns that arose, Gabriela's enthusiasm and genuine love for her job were evident in every interaction.

I have frequented the Dominick on numerous occasions, and it has undeniably become my home away from home in New York City. The combination of its prime location, deluxe rooms, awe-inspiring views, and personalized service makes it an unbeatable choice for anyone seeking an unforgettable stay in the Big Apple.

In summary, if you're looking for a truly exceptional hotel experience, I wholeheartedly recommend the Dominick. It will surpass your expectations and provide an extraordinary stay that will leave you longing to return.

title: Incredible Experience!!!
text:
Very good service, Gabriela put atention in each little details.
Beatiful and modern, the best option to stay in SOHO. Great  views of Manhattan. I came with my wife but is very good option to come with all the family.
Very good ubication, service and great actitude of all the crew

title: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN SOHO
text: Amazing staff, beautiful facilities, and so close to everything. I can't wait for my next stay. From the moment we walked in and greeted, we felt right at home. The Dominick provided a luxury feel and ambiance while providing a "you are right at home" kind of service!

title: Incredible views and more, but in need of TLC
text: This is my third visit to this hotel. I love: the location; the truly spacious rooms; the service; the view from every floor (incredible!); pool and gym; and, the well stocked mini bar. But the hotel is a little tired now. Air con failed on the first night, the electrical cable for the tv was hanging out of the wall, the walls and floors are scuffed.. some TLC needed. Overall however, I would stay again.

title: Spacious stay in Soho
text: Spacious stay in Soho! We arrived with 5 teenage girls ready to celebrate a 16th birthday in the City.  We booked a two room suite which gave us plenty of space - two huge full bathrooms plus a half bath.  Parents had privacy in the king bedroom, separated from the girls who took the larger area with another king plus living area with pullout.  Gabriela B. at the front desk was so welcoming and accommodating, a true standout that positioned us for success right at the beginning.  Extra robes, slippers, and wrap around great views made it all the more special.  This will be our go to in Soho from now on.

title: Will be returning for another great stay
text: Beautiful, boutique hotel in great neighborhood.  Impeccably maintained, great amenities and food.  The best part about it is the staff - friendly, hospitable and consummate hospitality professionals.  We will definitely be staying at The Dominick again.

title: The Dominick Hotel
text: The room was very comfortable - bed and pillows excellent!  Staff from the minute we got there til the minute we left were the nicest and friendliest of any hotel we have stayed at. I would  absolutely  stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

title: Good hotel, bad city
text: Good place and service. Unfortunately located in a really bad city(NY). If you really need to be in NY, this is a good place to stay. But don’t go to NY if you can avoid it. It is a broken city. Smell of trash, vape and pot all over. Bums and homeless people everywhere.

title: Large, quiet room; polite staff.
text:
Large room, very quiet. Service is good and the food is also good. The room was well equipped with a large work desk and fast internet available (not free). Staff is friendly, helpful and polite.

The only minus was the elevators. I think one was not working and it can take quite a bit of time to go up or down (once over 10 minutes).

title: Outstanding Hotel and Service
text: From the moment I arrived the service and attention to detail was outstanding. The staff is exceptionally friendly and professional and everyone was extremely helpful. Check in was quick and efficient, when I went to my room it was extremely clean, well organized and very well stocked.  Anything you could want in a high end hotel room was there, the Bulgari toiletries were also a nice touch. This was my first stay at the Dominick but it will definitely not be my last. Every aspect of my stay was exceptional.

title: Excellence
text: L’excellence est le maître mot de cet hôtel. Le personnel est disponible, la chambre extraordinaire sur une vue hudson magnifique. Nous avons apprécié la piscine au 7eme étage pour nos filles. Les petites attentions font vraiment de cet hôtel un moment magique.

title: All I can say is “wow”
text:
All I can say is “wow”!  I stay in Manhattan every weekend and chose The Dominick somewhat at random.  We ended up hanging by the pool, doing the spa, and getting breakfast in bed the next morning.  We loved the room, pool, spa, restaurant, location, but most of all loved the warm attitude of all the employees

The manager of the pool area could not have been more attentive and helpful 

Will definitely be coming back!

title: Beautiful
text: From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, the service is unmatched. Everyone was so polite it’s refreshing. The hotel itself is gorgeous, and the view is spectacular. Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here.

title: Great space, great service & great views
text:
Great space for families - stayed in the 2 bedroom corner rooms - 3810 & 3811
Sleeping areas were great / social areas were great. 
2 & 1/2 bathrooms plenty of closet space and wet bar. 
Had the opportunity to be there for the 4th of July. We had a privileged unobstructed view of the fireworks. 
The pool area was great for our 6 year old kids. 
Staff was prompt and courteous.

title: Dominick Never Disappoints!
text: We first stayed at the Dominick (when it was called the Trump Soho - boo) in 2012 which was our first trip to NYC. Our kids were both under 10 years old then and we selected this hotel because it was one of the few that had an outdoor pool.  This hotel was a brilliant find for us then and remains so now.  Back then we could all fit in a one bedroom suite.  The kids are in their late teens now, and so we have expanded to the SoHi 2 bedroom suite.   I think we've stayed at the Dominick about 6 or 7 times since 2012 -- we love NYC for a 3 to 5 day vacation from Ontario, Canada --  and have brought my parents with us twice.  We love this hotel, including its location, and will keep returning.  This time I did notice that it is becoming worn -  at least the suite that we were in (3010/3011) which definitely needs a refresh.  The carpet has some stains, and the furniture/cabinetry is looking a little banged up.    Still a lovely hotel with great service.  We also really liked the changes to the seating around the pool.  Didn't love the poolside menu, but understand that we are not foodies.

title: We'll be staying again!
text: Large room!  All staff very friendly. Stanley at the front door especially. 7th floor deck bar was very pretty. Beautiful flowers planted all around. Breakfast at the restaurant was delicious.  Lunch recommendation from another doorman was excellent. The Dominick is walking distance to many restaurants.

title: SoHi in Soho
text: Staff is amazing and very accommodating. Hotel is modern with a warm vibe! Super well located in Soho! Already planning next visit? Soho is really the place to be with restaurants in walking distance! Shopping is wonderful with all the best!

title: Oasis in the City
text: Had another nice trip in NYC. Stayed at this hotel which is one of my favorites whenever I am in town. We arrived very late after a night out with wife for my bday. Cassandra checked us in and she was so happy even at that hour, really everyone who works there seems genuinely nice - the doorman at night was even chatting with me while we were waiting to check in even though we had no need for help with bags. Don't usually write reviews but this hotel is really tops for me when staying in NY. Checks all the boxes for a NY stay.

title: Lovely stay
text: Wonderful hotel - spacious rooms, great views, great tub! Didn't get a chance to take advantage of the spa or the pool, but we checked out the space which was beautiful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Engagement!
text: Me and my girlfriend checked in July 1st and the women checking in that day could not  have been more wonderful. I proposed to my girlfriend in the hotel that night and the employees couldn’t have been more accommodating. The room itself was stunning, the views from the 1 bedroom skyline view really topped off the weekend. This was one of the best weekends ever thanks to the Dominick hotel and thank you to all the staff on July 1st.

title: Great views, comfortable quarters, all the amenities
text: When I walk in to my room, it feels like I’m home. The bed is luxuriously comfortable, I love the soaking bathtub and rain forest shower. And the customer service is impeccable. It’s why I keep coming back.

title: THE VIEWS!
text:
Came for a staycation (to see and  enjoy some culture this summer ) 
The suite was SPECTACULAR. The hotel felt BRAND NEW. So modern, and spotless. We were shocked to find out it's been around for 13 years. 
Definitely would stay here again.  Incredible views .

title: Nice stay in a good hotel
text: SoHi View King room was surprisingly spacious. Friendly personnel. Nice gym with adequate and good-quality equipment. Breakfast was good but a bit pricy. Spring St. subway station 200m away from the hotel! SoHo was a nice location to stay as we had not been there before.

title: VIP treatment!
text: Service is always amazing at The Dominick! They treat you like you are VIP. The beds are so comfortable and every room I have stayed has a great view. The bath products are the best and there are just so many extra touches that make each stay great. I stay here about 1x month and I have never had less than wonderful experience.

title: Great location.....NOT 5 STAR
text:
The location is great downtown, but as far as being a 5-star hotel, it is far from that. 
Let me start off by saying that this is not our 1st experience at The Dominick but this one was far from our best. Arrival was as expected with the doormen and Eddie helping us with our luggage, both were great! 
The check-in process was normal as usual, very nice welcome! After this is where it all went downhill. Upon arriving at our room, we noticed it was looking out into a brick building, really wish their website made it a point that if you weren't in a SoHi room, expect to get absolutely no view whatsoever. Obviously before we unpacked, we called down to see about getting a different room with a better view, they obliged with an upcharge of $150/night which I did agree too. When we got to the new room, the view was stunning, overlooking the Hudson with a good view of the Freedom Tower.
The room was ok, nothing special and not the type of furnishings you’d expect in a 5-star, but like I said we stayed there before and knew what we were getting. These rooms are all electronic, with curtains and lights able to be used with the touch of a button that’s near the bed or a switch at the entry door. Well needless to say not one thing was working. Curtains wouldn’t open or close nor would the lights come on. I managed to shut the curtains by pulling on them like Guest Services (1st time I was called by the wrong name) suggested I do. 5-star LOL!! After they were shut, they would not reopen so I again called down to Guest Services (2nd Time called by the wrong name and immediately after I asked them to correct it). They finally send up an engineer to work on the problem, now keep in mind that we were only in the room about ½ hour before I had to call down about it, one would think a 5-star hotel would ask if we’d like a different room at this point (the hotel was nowhere near full)! The engineer arrives and manages to get the curtains open and rig it so they can be used manually, but he needed to get behind the bed to swap out a plug, at which point we decide just to have them come back when we weren’t in the room. Another opportunity was lost to ask us if we’d like a different room. 
At this point, a little frustrated, we decided to go out to have a bite to eat and have a few drinks, we called down the concierge to get some recommendations, but the phone would just ring and no one would answer. We instead get guest services (3rd time being called by the wrong name) who states, the concierge must be busy or on the other line and asks if it would be alright if they call us back, which wasn’t a problem, except they never called us back…. even gave them our cell phone number. 
Later that evening we returned to the hotel about 11:15 PM with plans to have a drink at the Bar, their One Michelin star restaurant, the Vestry.  We were shocked to find out that they close the bar at 11PM on a Saturday night. Again, I do realize that we were there after close, but there were still people in the restaurant, one would think they’d invite us in for a nightcap cocktail. We then asked the reception desk if there was another place in the hotel to grab a drink and we were informed that The Vestry is the only place at that time. Maybe they could have asked us if we wanted a bottle of champagne or wine sent up to the room, but nope! We soon returned to the room and called down for room service (4th time of being called by the wrong name) to order some dessert and some tea. We decided to order a hot fudge sundae with nuts, well we were told there’s no nuts nor hot fudge, really in the middle of June at a 5-star hotel!!!
The next day we have some plans for the morning hours and then decide that it would be a nice day for the pool, the pool area is gorgeous and there aren’t many hotels in the city which do offer a roof top pool. This is an extremely nice touch for a hotel in the city! Before going to the pool, we decided to call down guest services (5th time being called by the wrong name) and have them send the engineer up to fix what is wrong with the room, which they assured us would be fixed. Well after returning to the room from the pool, it was a great surprise to see that the room was made up but again the controls were still not working. I know the engineer was there, bc we crossed paths, but it never got fixed. 
Next day is check out day! We call down (again called by the wrong name) and ask for the bellman to come pick up our luggage and have the car ready. This all went well also, so I guess the only times this hotel is worth its $800/night price tag is when you’re arriving or leaving. If you plan to spend that much on a hotel, do yourself a favor and spend an extra $100 or so and stay at The Pierre or Trump International, much better maintained and very well-trained staff.

title: Will never stay anywhere else. Best hotel and service I. NYC
text: Absolutely love this hotel. My fave 5-star in the city. Don’t think I’ll ever stay anywhere else. Excellent corner suites with incredible views of southern Manhattan and Hudson River/NJ. I come every late June with the fam so my wife and I can ship the kids off to camp for the summer, then she and I hang out to enjoy the best of the city. Staff always provides impeccable service with great vibes, and they always bend over backwards to accommodate us. On this week’s trip, I particularly want to point out two employees. First, Ariel at the front desk who helped us at 2 am when we arrived. We had booked what we thought was our usual corner suite through Expedia but instead Expedia booked a regular suite. Fortunately, Ariel rescued us by giving us a corner, but also made me laugh with her great sense of humor — a welcome relief after a long day of traveling. I also want to thank Tenzin, the 7th floor poolside bartender/employee who kept me entertained for two consecutive mornings while we watched the rain pour down. Her warm and friendly personality saved me from sheer boredom. Thank you all! Best, Ramon G.

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
text: This hotel offers the best of everything. Best views, best location, best service. The staff takes good care of you and is genuinely friendly. We’ve been coming to NYC every year for the last 3 years and this is the only place we ever want to stay. Tajeena at the Front Desk went above and beyond to make sure we could stay in our room when we extended our stay by two days. Thank you Tajeena!! You saved us a huge hassle of having to pack and move to a new room which would have been a big inconvenience.

title: No complaints
text: The bath shower combo was much needed. The double vanity was a plus. Excellent customer service from the doorman to the front desk to housekeepers. A must stay wherever we are back in New York. Even the in-room dining was spectacular so we eat breakfast in the room everyday for our entire 5 day trip. Couldn’t ask for a better birthday experience.

title: Very good hotel headed to great
text: As a seasoned traveler with a refined palate and appreciation for sophisticated design, I must say The Dominick in NYC's Tribeca neighborhood exceeded my expectations. From the moment we arrived, the attentive doorman and bellmen set the tone for a luxurious stay. The building itself is a stunning masterpiece, boasting breathtaking views that left us in awe. Our well-appointed room was not only spacious but also beautifully designed with a contemporary flair. While the front desk staffing and elevator service could use improvement, the Michelin-starred restaurant and exceptional breakfast and lunch options more than made up for any inconveniences. We plan on returning to The Dominick and highly recommend it to fellow travelers seeking a refined and elegant experience.

title: Best of Soho!
text: Love this hotel. I can’t say enough great things about it. Friendly staff, beautiful room, great food and perfect location. This is our third visit. Dog and child friendly. We will definitely be back.

title: Good time in the Big Apple
text:
The Dominick is our favorite place to stay in the city. The Service is always great. 
Nice, Big rooms for NYC. Rooms were cleaned everyday, which is not always the case these days. Can’t wait to go back next month.

title: Love this hotel, the location, the staff, the coziness is the room
text: Absolutely love this hotel.  The views, the amenities, the staff..a super awesome experience. Walking distance to the coolest NYC neighborhoods..SOHO, Tribeca, Greenwich, shopping, Broadway!  The Hudson River walk

title: My go-to hotel in Soho
text: Great location in SoHo, large roooms/suites, amazing views, all the staff really friendly. Loved the bar at Vestry and rooftop pool deck with Hawaiian snacks. Definitely returning and staying here. When I go to NYC for business, I tend to stay in midtown hotels but when I come for fun I love the Dominick.

title: Amazing views
text: We booked a Sohi 2 bed corner suite and the views were quite incredible. Views of the Hudson and midtown Manhattan and especially at night time really took our breath away. Location is great. Food was very good though expensive with all the add ons.  Staff in general were friendly enough but there were a couple of staff who weren’t that friendly, in fact bordering on curt, particularly at breakfast.  Children’s control for the drapes didn’t work. Rang reception three times to ask about fixing it but no one answered which was a bit strange and we then just forgot about it. But overall, it is a lovely hotel with amazing views of the city and in a cool location.

title: SoHo Luxury Hotel
text:
The property is fundamentally luxurious. The staff was professional, the materials used in the interior are very nice, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The best part was the views out of the room. Even my bathroom had stunning views of midtown. The location is excellent as well!

Some updates seem necessary though. Having to choose which "tier" of internet I wanted for each day felt more like a budget airline than a luxury experience. For a hotel of this caliber, I expect something as basic as WiFi to just work without additional effort from guests. I also found the pool area weird. As a hotel guest, I expect to just use the pool, but there was always a staff member with a "why are you here?" gatekeeper kind of vibe. For drinks near the pool, the speed of service and quality of product was a definite miss.

The exercise room was great, and the quality of the equipment seemed top-tier.

title: Great view, location, and room
text: Fantastic hotel. Great views. Great smell. Super comfortable bed. Great location in NYC. This is our go to hotel when we visit NYC. I do recommend getting a SOHI room as the views are worth the additional cost.

title: The place to stay in Tribeca
text: This was a combo business and family trip, my wife. I go to NY frequently and almost always stay at the Dominick. Great location, just a few blocks from the park and piers along the Hudson River and right in Tribeca and Greenwich Village. Rooms are comfortable, views are great, but best of all the staff is the most helpful warm group of people you could imagine, from the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping. Particular thanks to Gabriela, Jenny, and Mohendra at the front desk, and Igor in housekeeping.

title: Great room/experience
text: Arrived very late to check in and received the warmest inviting greeting from Gabby. She provided me with the most beautiful room-an upgrade that made my nyc experience the best ever. Thank you Gabby. Can’t wait to return

title: Fabulous Hotel!!
text: I have been visiting NYC for decades and have never had a better stay at any other hotel. The hotel is beautiful and well-located in Soho within easy walk of all Soho shopping and attractions. The room was huge by NYC standards and very modern and well appointed. The staff is exceptional; whatever course they have been given on customer service and hospitality should be taught in every hotel! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! This will be my "go to" stay whenever in NYC again.

title: Must Stay!
text: Top notch customer service! Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. The rooms have the most stunning views and we loved the rooftop pool/lounge area. Hotel food was excellent and the check-in/check-out process was so easy. The hotel is in a prime location, we were able to walk to all our favorite restaurants, bars and shops. Will definitely stay again soon!!!

title: Wonderful - can't wait to return.
text: Spectacular views of the city and Hudson River.  Large, spacious room with luxurious bathroom. Most engaging, friendly and helpful hotel staff we have ever encountered on site. Great location: restaurants, stores and subway within steps of the front door.

title: Great location, perfect hotel!
text:
Love this hotel! Great service from
All the staff. Doormen are wonderful, front desk is great! Housekeeping is very efficient and does a wonderful job day and turndown service. I like a higher room to help from the street noise. Room service is good, but they charge $15 “admin”fee , then 18% gratuity on top of the food cost. I didn’t realize that, I like to order a pot of coffee in the morning or juice, and an extra $15 is a bit much. Other than that, I love this hotel.

title: Terrific NYC hotel with amazing customer service!
text: This hotel gives Fantastic customer service, fabulous view, convenient location especially if you need to get to Newark airport easily. My husband and I could not have been greeted more warmly by Gabby at the front desk upon our arrival. Coincidently, I had spoken to Gabby a few days prior to arrival to request a late check out since we had a late flight out the next day. Not only did she remember our conversation, she had remembered when we were due to arrive and since we booked thru through Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts program, she made sure to hold an upgraded room to one with a beautiful view on a high floor. The gentleman who brought us our luggage made sure to get us anything we needed. Everyone was so accommodating. I will say, the room was not large and if you are staying for a while the closet and drawer space leaves a lot to be desired, but for a night or two- no problem. The bathroom was well appointed with a stall shower and a tub. I think this is a terrific NYC hotel and I look forward to my return visit!

title: Thank you Tamilla ,
text:
We stayed in 42nd floor with that amazing corner suite view, we had a fab. Time , 
I want to write  special thanks to Tamia who was cleaning our floor , I am amaze  with her because not only she was a excellent employee at the same time honest and kind, 
She find my niece’s ring under the bed and left it with a very kind note , 
Thank you Tamia❤️💖💖

title: PERFECTION!
text: The rooms are wonderfully equipped with everything a traveler would want/need.  The size of the room far surpasses other room sizes for comparable or even higher star hotels.    I was allowed to check-in early and got the room I requested.  All-in-all, A WONDERFUL stay!!

title: The Dominick Experience
text:
Pros: The hotel is in a good location it is right next to SoHo. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are huge compared to most in the city. 

Cons: I had to switch rooms - in the first room the deadbolt lock didn’t work as it was misaligned. I will admit the switching of rooms was very easy after maintenance said it couldn’t be fixed. It was just a little bit annoying since it was late. The second room had stains on the floor - not a huge deal, but it would have been nice if the carpet was deep cleaned. 

My main con at this hotel was the elevators. One of the elevators was sat at the lobby floor with the doors open so I went to walk. When walking in it the doors shut on me. They hit off my shoulders and hit my hand hurting me. I was initially in shock and felt like I was going to cry.  Then I realized my thumb was in a lot of pain. Surely, no elevator should do this? Especially not a guest elevator! I took advil for the pain and went down to the reception and asked for ice. They were initially more interested in logging it for their record than getting me ice. No one asked if I was okay. At check out the lady just printed my invoice off she didn’t ask if I’d had a nice stay or mention the incident either. 

My thumb still has a lump on it that hurts if touched/ knocked and I now hate going in elevators!! 

I would maybe stay here in the future. However, I felt the situation wasn’t handled amazingly.

title: Excellent service
text: We had an excellent stay at The Dominick! Joyce, one of the housekeepers, was absolutely fantastic. She was so kind, and by the second afternoon she knew all of our names. She took great care of us during our stay. Marek out front was also super helpful. Great recommendations for dining in the area. He never steered us wrong once!

title: Terrible
text: Terrible no service, restaurant closed earlier, driver sissy show up. Reception wasn’t answering many times. Will not repeat.. high price for low service.. big discussion with checking out. I feel sorry for the staff.

title: Amazing New York experience
text: Staying at The Dominick was an outstanding experience in every way. The reception staff was happy to accommodate our request for a corner room and the view we had was spectacular. The room itself was comfy and spacious with a beautiful bathroom. Hotel is also conveniently located between Upper and Lower Manhattan, making it easy to explore New York.

title: The Dominick Hotel
text:
Great location to stay
        The Dominick Hotel= This Posh  high - rise hotel is a mile from one world. Trade center and 12 minute walk from washington Square Park.
Offering floor- to- celling windows with city or hudson river. The refined rooms feature flat - screen TV's Nespresso machines and free wi fi plus ipod docks. Sooking tubs. And rainfall showers suites and living rooms. Some have whirpool tubs.
Theres a chic restaurant - serving contemporary American dishes a hip lounge / bar with a mid century theme. Other Amenities include a fitness center a spa with a hammam and seasonal outdoors  pool with a bar theres also a balkroom meeting space and valet parking...
46- story hotel in Soho with expansive city views Rooms. Feature designer. Furniture. Many with floor to celling windows..

title: 10 stars!
text: Everyone was incredible! The hotel came highly recommended and it did not disappoint! The staff was attentive, accommodating, friendly, anticipatory, etc… only disappointment was that my stay wasn’t longer!

title: Great Service and Great Location
text: The hotel is in a prime location!  Rooms are very spacious and the staff is friendly and efficient!   Everyone I encountered - especially Mariano and Sean - were  welcoming and accommodation!  I highly recommend this property!!

title: fantastic stay at the dominick
text: This was a lovely experience staying at the Dominick.  Staff were so helpful, calm beautiful lobby, nice gym, a calm oasis in the middle of the city and a fantastic neighborhood.  I wish that I could have stayed a few more days!

title: Hip hotel, well located with friendly staff albeit some first world annoyances
text: Extremely well located hotel close to the heart of the village.  Rooms clean, well sized and kitted out, friendly staff at front desk, pool/bar area good and very hip vibe generally.  Some of the gym equipment (Peloton bikes) was annoyingly out of action despite multiple requests to fix pedals, the shower in my room seemed to be either boiling hot or freezing cold (my colleague had the same problem in his room) and the curtains in my room were stuck.  Breakfast is ala carte only, coffee was not good and vibe there was strangely not as friendly as elsewhere.   Despite some minor disappointments, it was nevertheless a very good experience and I would go back.

title: The Luxury Hotel of NYC!
text:
I would give this hotel 6 out of 5 stars if I could. It was an incredible experience to stay at the Dominic. It's a perfect location in SoHo. Not too far from uptown or downtown.  All the staff took care of us and went above and beyond. The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. It was also very quiet. The bed was comfortable. All the furnishings were clean, neat, comfortable. The soaking tub was amazing. I loved the technology in the room as well.
The fitness center had all the options. I could do my usual workout routine without much deviation.
Last but not least, I had the most incredible view of the city.

title: We Love NY & The Dominick
text: We (59/14) had a wonderful week in The Dominick. Everything was fine, that's why it isn't easy to find something special. The whole staff was unbelievable friendly in every minute of our stay.  It starts with some friendly messages before arriving, it continues with a really really friendly personal  Check in, we got a perfect room with incredible view, the housekeeping was excellent, the doorman, the employees in the pool/spa, the pool ... still everything. The Location is perfect ... I don't know, what to say more - thx for beautiful days, RR

title: Great hotel, good location and friendly staff
text:
We recently spent four nights at The Dominick. It’s in a great location. All the staff were so helpful and friendly for our entire stay. 
I must mention the Housekeeping staff. Our room was immaculate, always fresh towels and replenished coffee and water. A few times we were getting ready to go out when the turn down service arrived, they didn’t hesitate to come back once we’d ventured out for the evening. 
We’ve stayed in several 5* hotels in New York over the years and The Dominick has been the best. I wouldn’t hesitate to go back and recommend this hotel to friends. 
Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: small and overpriced
text:
The room was too small. We originally had a 538 sq ft room booked and upon arrival they advised us to upgrade to a better room with a better view. We accepted and we were shocked to see that the room given to us was very small and barely 400sq ft. 

The soap had a terrible smell. The shower gel too and is very difficult to get out of those bottle on the wall. the shower is tiny. everything was cramped in the bathroom. There is only one low sink and the water spills out on you when you are washing your hands. 

The bed room was small. the bed is very soft and the pillow even softer. making it very uncomfortable to sleep if you have any type of body ache or back pain. 
the famous view they said they upgraded us for is coming from a tiny window half covered by a sofa. overall very disappointing. for 800 usd paid for a room this was outrageous. 

to top everything we tried to have breakfast at the mezzanine cafe, and the bill came out to be 190 usd without gratuities for 2 persons. I could not even understand that bill. on the breakfast menu it comes that the american breakfast is 38 usd and the continental 30 usd. we did not want everything on there so we decided to just ask for part of the continental and part of the american. my husband had a pot of yogurt(14 us) 4 pastries (16 us)  2 coffees ( 18 ) , an orange juice (12 us) , I had approximately the same and the overall without gratuities was 190... I could not even believe it. 

I just paid and left disgusted. 

the only good thing here was the staff being friendly.

title: The hotel lets itself down with its pricing chicanery.
text: Apart from all else, what needs to be said about this hotel is that it has become too tricky for its own good. It does itself a disservice.
