What the hotel offers for the resort charge is inconsequential and deceptive when it comes to the "lowest tier high speed" internet service; which is presented in tiny writing and not "high speed". Instead the guest is asked to pay $14.99 per day for a proper "high Speed" connection. The food and beverage in the breakfast room is monumentally overpriced and of average quality, hence the offer of a breakfast food credit to the value of approximately $100 per day.  Overall the hotel is good but it lets itself down with this pricing chicanery. When the numbers are run, i'm not sure there isn't better value to be had elsewhere. Otherwise the hotel is quite good.

title: Gem of the City
text: Amazing staff service from the time we checked in. The room was clean with upgraded amenities. Spa was wonderful and enjoyed the breakfast. We had a high level suite with Instagram worthy views. Can’t wait to come back.

title: Friend Trip to the Big Apple.
text: The most perfect location, amazing rooms (fluffiest pillow/comfiest bed) and the best service! Rooftop pool and bar was a great place to relax after a long day of walking. We especially loved Stanley the doorman. Highly recommend.

title: Great experience!
text:
The hotel has an excellent location. 
The rooms are Very comfortable and spacious, bathroom as well.
The healthy club is very well equipped.
The staff is absolutely fantastic and willing to make your experience as good as possible.

title: May stay
text: Excellent hotel in a nice location! Great room with nice views. Room was on a high floor and it was whisper quiet with little to no street noise. Very comfortable bed and clean room with nice amenities. Gabby at the front desk is the best. Would definitely stay here again.

title: We didn't think we'd spend much time at the hotel but....
text: The view was stunning. We didn't think we'd spend much time at the hotel but our room was so easy to relax in and the view so expansive we tended to linger and start the day a little later than planned.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Convenient places for food, drink and incidentals all nearby.

title: Great NYC stay
text: Great stay. Rooms cleaned twice a day. Lots of space, especially for a Manhattan hotel. Great location! Convenient to subway. Walking distance to lots of great stuff. Mini fridge in room.  Large bathroom.

title: Beautiful views
text: This hotel was fantastic. Beautiful skyline views from our room. The staff was wonderful, especially Stanley, who greeted us warmly and made sure we had everything we could possibly need. We would absolutely stay here again.

title: A great stay!
text: We had a great experience!  We had a couples get away for a night. Stanley took great care of us! Easy in/easy out.  The hotel is beautiful and everyone is very accommodating.  Will definitely stay again! Thank you so much!

title: A wonderful hotel
text: The view was fantastic and I had a lot of peace and quiet to work and see friends. The service was excellent. I’ll be back! The spa was also amazing and contributed to my restful stay. I enjoyed the room service too.

title: Spectacular Staycation 🌆⭐️
text: We went on a staycation for Spring break. The Dominick did not disappoint, the hotel was beautiful, the rooms were clean and the view just spectacular. The kids (tween and teens) didn't want to leave the room. Cute little restaurants and shops in the area, all within walking distance. Will definitely return.

title: Very good! but the room's view was blocked
text:
It was very good. I only had two minor complaints. 

During my stay, I booked the Sohi view one-bedroom suite, which was stunning. However, the view from my room did not entirely match the website's images. As shown in the attached photo, a white pole and a TV obstructed almost half of the window. After rechecking the website after my stay, I realized that the 360 view option included an image of the room with the white pole and TV.

- When I first arrived, I noticed the glass on the kitchen table and one of the nightstands was dirty. However, the housekeeping staff cleaned them on their next shift. They did an outstanding job cleaning the room twice a day.

- The staff in the entire establishment were extraordinarily friendly and helpful. Shoutout to Francisco!

- The three restaurants inside the hotel were really good. Excellent customer service.

- The tub and shower were awesome.

- The spa was outstanding. Sauna, massage, shower, etc. Amazing customer service!

- In-room dining can be requested via Ipad and was fast.

- The mini bar has good selections. 

- YouTube, Hulu, etc., can be connected to the TV.

title: Weekend in city
text: Kind staff, large rooms, turn down service.  Lobby clean and fresh.  Largest rooms you will normally see in the city.  Quick attention to detail.  Great hotel bar. Will stay here again when I return.

title: 34 Stock, Megablick, Toplage, Top freundliches Persona: Mr. lMohendra *****
text:
34 Stock, Traumblick, Top Sauber, Super Roomservice, Fitnesscenter , Toller sehr sehr freundlicher Empfang, 
Mohendra war ein sehr freundlicher überaus Wunscherfüllender Empfangsmanager, bis auf die fürchterlich alten Kopfkissen und der etwas in die Jahre gekommenen Möblierung und leider dem geschlossenen Pool war alles Tip top!

title: Incredible home away from home
text: We love the Dominick.  The location is fantastic....it's perfect for walks, bike rides along the west side highway, restaurants and shopping.  The staff is outstanding....very attentive from the front desk to housekeeping to door staff, all are very welcoming and service oriented.  The rooms and suites are perfectly appointed and the views are fabulous.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: I was extremely impressed with the Dominick hotel and can't wait to return.  We arrived at 11:00 pm and there were 2-3 people at the front desk who were all welcoming, helpful and informative (usually at that time of night there is 1 person working the front desk and there is most likely 1 person ahead of you taking forever).  The room was beautiful and immaculate, the products were all luxury, the staff was outstanding. Wish I was there longer than 22 hours.

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing views of the NYC skyline.
text: This was the first time we stayed at the Dominick. We arrived early and were able to get an early check-in, which we were surprised to get since our stay was over the weekend. The staff was very friendly and immediately made us feel right at home. The hotel décor was beautiful and our room and our view of the NYC skyline was fantastic! The Dominick is our new choice hotel for our trips to NYC.

title: 5 stars again !
text:
Again it was an excellent stay! At the last minute we decided to stop by for 2 nights coming back from Caribbean vacation, and were received as the whole
hôtel were waiting for us for a month ! 
Super amenities and the best view in Manathan.

title: Always first class
text:
We have now stayed at the Dominick 5 times, and every time we are very happy with everything.  The place is clean and comfortable, the staff are first class (professional, polite, well trained), and the room is very comfortable.
If you are looking for accommodation in this part of town the Dominick is hard to beat.  We are returning next month.

title: Quick visit in SOHO
text: As always, clean, quite and comfortable. Location is very convenient to many great restaurants and shops. Breakfast and coffee on the Mezzanine was served till 11:45am!!  Who does that!!  Was great.

title: Almost perfect!
text: Lovely property. Had a couple of engineering issues (broken AC, broken toilet) but were fixed immediately. That and the room service comment are the only reason we didn't give 5 stars. The room was spacious for NYC, the service was thorough and responsive. Wish the the room service did not charge so many extra fees so we could have used it ($150 for 2 breakfast entrees and some coffee was a bit unreasonable). Otherwise, great visit!

title: Amazing views
text: Fantastic hotel with amazing views. Hotel staff was the absolute best!  We enjoyed every minute of our stay.  Each night I went to sleep with a smile on my face because I was in such an incredible hotel with a tremendous view.

title: Best views in the city and may few steps from the heart of SoHo
text: Booking experience fantastic, great room, great view, great location. As a returning customer, the staff service was again ok, with two exceptions who were excellent (Concierge and Bell). It is a very first world problem but  just not at the level you'd expect.

title: Always a good stay
text: The staff was very helpful and attentive, will be back again soon.  Our room was near the elevator, although it was convenient, you can hear it so I probably would not request to be near the elevator.

title: East view very warm in the morning.
text: My room had an East facing view that was very warm in the morning. The a/c wasn’t strong enough to keep up with the demand. So it resulted in closing the darkening shades in the morning and losing the fabulous view.

title: Double charged us!
text: I have received better costumer service at a 2 star hotel then at the Dominick hotel! My boyfriend was double charged for a 2 night stay and trying to get ahold of someone to talk to is nearly impossible! You have to leave a message and wait for them to call you back, in which they don't.  The hotel was beautiful and had great views, but we ended up bring our own luggage to our room after waiting an hour for someone to bring it to us. I get that every where is short staffed, so that isn't a big deal. But what is a big deal is being doubled charged for an expensive hotel and no body can seem to take 5 mins out of there day to talk to us! So I don't recommend for the average working American to stay here, because if you get doubled charge plan on never seeing that money again!

title: Perfect Business Stay for Lower Manhattan
text:
The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Very modern in design and in room technology. But also very welcoming and comfortable to stay in. The staff was friendly and helpful without being overly solicitous. 

Given the location in Manhattan, I would recommend if you're a light sleeper like I am asking for a quieter room. The hotel itself is well insulated. But lower Manhattan inevitably has construction and cars honking in traffic.

title: The Dominick Hotel - Don't Miss
text:
Don't miss the Dominick if you are staying in Manhattan. It's a world class experience that starts at the front desk with Gaby, who is one of the most welcoming and helpful people you could hope to meet. The doormen are always there with a smile and ready to offer a helping hand. It's the perfect combination of an elegant setting and presentation with a staff that gives the hotel experience a touch of warmth that feels like home. 

For you Starbucks fans, there's one right across the street in case you want to grab and go and Michelin star Vestry is part of the hotel. Perfectly situated in Soho it's a short walk to great restaurants and bars. Enjoy.

title: Very Nice Stay
text: The staff was incredible nice. The room, which was on the 36th floor was a SoHi room, was spacious fir NY. The furniture was definitely dated and worn but liveable. The turn down service with ice land chocolates was a nice touch. The only real true negative was the lack of a cocktail bar/lounge. The only place to grab a drink was at the small restaurant that had about 4 bar seats

title: fun NY weekend
text:
The Dominick is well located, in Soho, very close to subway to get anywhere.  The rooms were spacious and the view was AMAZING.  It was very quiet for a NY hotel. The staff, especially cleaning staff, were efficient and very nice.  Enjoyed the gym and the complementary coffee on the 7th floor.
I would say the decor is a bit dark and dated in the common areas and bed is not as firm as we like,

title: Fantastic location!
text: Great location! Rooms very spacious and well appointed. Fitness center has three Peloton bikes and other great equipment. Staff all very kind and accommodating. Great shops, restaurants all walkable.

title: The Dominick is Wonderful
text: Staff and facilities aware world class one of the best views of New York I've ever seen from a hotel room. And, walking right into Soho for the restaurants and shopping makes this an incredible location.

title: Best hotel in SoHo
text:
I've stayed at the Dominick now 3 or 4 times. I've tried other similarly priced hotels in SoHo and this is by far the best option. The rooms are large for NYC standards, they have a ton of light and the fragrances and soaps they use smell amazing.

The staff is always very helpful, and last time I was there Sean at the front desk made sure I had an awesome stay.

title: Home from Home
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at The Dominick, from the moment we arrived we felt at home, and relaxed. 
Every member of staff were so friendly and helpful.

Our room was wonderful, overlooking the Hudson and over to New Jersey. We had every amenity we needed, and anything else was just a phone call away.

The location was great, with many great local restaurants, and stores. We spent many hours walking around exploring. The subway couldn't be any closer.

We would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice place great attention from Gabriel at the front desk
text:
This is probably the 5th time in the hotel. Nice place great food. Distinguished Guests.
I was really impressed by the attention and service experience at the front desk! Gabriel was very helpful and friendly!
I recommend it next time you visit NY

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We have been staying at this hotel for years. It is very much “home away from home” the rooms are great; the location is perfect. It always has perfect service.  There are several wonderful restaurants close by, along with lots of shopping .  Many of these locations have had the same people working there for years. We love the area and the hotel and highly recommend.

title: Magical
text: From the moment we checked in with Marlene to the moment we departed assisted by Stanley it was the dream experience - a hotel is nothing without its staff and at every interaction the staff went above and beyond to help us make everlasting memories

title: Skip Midtown and Stay Somewhere Classy
text: Wonderful hotel in a great part of town - close to Trader Joe’s, CVS, and dozens of restaurants.  Our room was of ample size with 1.5 baths, a nice shower, a comfortable bed, and very nice decor.   The room had lots of natural light with a great view of the West Side and the river.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Will definitely return for our next NYC visit!

title: Amazing view and service!
text: This was definitely one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in as a family.  The room was gorgeous and has spectacular views of the city and river.  The staff was super friendly and helpful and the rooms were modern and clean! We never had to wait for an elevator and the room was cleaned every day with more than enough towels.  We had children with us so had two connecting rooms with a living area as well as two refrigerators and microwaves.  There was originally two mini bars but we asked them to be removed to make the space usable and they immediately cleared the stuff out.  The hotel was also conveniently located by a CVS and a Breakfast  grab and go - everything you need when traveling with kids 🤣. Close to the subway, traveling uptown and downtown was easy! We'd definitely stay here again.

title: Mother+Daughter Weekend In NYC
text:
The hotel building is a beauty and the views are spectacular -- we stayed on the 41st floor and the views did not disappoint!

The rooms are spacious and large for New York standards.

The gym is a good size and full of varied and excellent equipment.

The Mezzanine restaurant is good, not great -- the breakfast was mediocre and the space is awkward.

title: Great Customer Service Team
text: The customer experience from the moment I entered the hotel was next level. Lead by the leadership of Mohendra at the front desk; he helped us get situated quickly and was extremely nice. This team is next level when it comes to the customer experience.

title: First class all the way!
text: This hotel has the best staff and is walking distance to the best shopping, restaurants and nightlife.  The rooms are well appointed and so spacious. It is so hard to find large rooms in the city but this hotel doesn’t skimp on square footage. I would highly recommend. We only stay at the Dominick!

title: Best Customer Service !!!
text: Excellent service by all. Gabriela at reception always ensures you are taken care of and feel special along with the room service staff!!!  Thank you for the amazing customer service!!!  I look forward to returning next month and to recommending the Dominick

title: No Place Else Will Do!
text:
I have not written a review in a while but I feel compelled to share how amazing my stay ALWAYS is when I come to NY and book a room at the Dominick. 

It’s centered around being greeted by my favorite person, Gabby, who is the most pleasant, professional and caring Receptionist that I have ever met. I’ve traveled the world but coming here feels like home thanks to an individual who cares to remember my name and share a smile. 

The rooms are gorgeously appointed and I always leave smelling like my favorite scent, BVLGARI au the blanc. A Michelin Star restaurant can be accessed at the entrance and is always available for guests. 

What more can I say. It’s been over 10 years of frequenting this establishment and I’ll never look for any other place to stay when in the city.

title: Highly recommend The Dominick
text: Had another great stay at the Dominick.  The rooms are so comfortable and very good size so you never feel cramped.  We had the Hudson suite room which comfortably slept 3 of us!  The front desk staff was super helpful too, including Gabriela Bucheli!  Location is perfect to explore SOHO!

title: Anniversary
text: My wife and I had a terrific stay!  I surprised her for our anniversary and she loved the hotel. We were both pleased with the accommodations (clean and comfy)!  And the hotel staff was excellent (5 stars plus)!  And what a great location … SoHo has so many wonderful restaurants and shops!  Highly recommend!!!

title: A SoHo Gem!!
text: I can’t say enough about this wonderful gem located in the center of SoHo. We spent one night here in early March to celebrate our daughter’s 16th birthday. We had a 2 bedroom Skyline suite, which exceeded our expectations - lovely, spacious, with gorgeous city views - and another King room, which was also beautiful. Our every request was easily accommodated, including rooms next door to one another. Check-in with Ida was a breeze and upon arrival to our rooms, we were greeted with a birthday dish of chocolate covered strawberries for our daughter and then later, chocolates when we returned from dinner. Two friendly, extremely hospitable bellmen escorted us to our rooms and took time to explain the suite’s many features, as well as give us some suggestions for shopping and dining. The hotel is steps away from the cobblestone streets of SoHo and the most amazing shopping you can imagine. The next morning, we had a delicious breakfast at Cafe Mez, one of the hotel’s beautiful restaurants and stayed until checkout at 12 pm. What a perfect place to celebrate our daughter’s milestone birthday! We will definitely be returning for another stay soon!!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed at The Dominick while visiting our oldest daughter at NYU. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and very helpful. The view from our room was beautiful! Eddie was especially helpful while showing us to our room, the features of the room, and he made dinner reservations for us at a restaurant he recommended which was delightful. While staying at the hotel, we also had dinner at The Vestry and it was superb. We will definitely stay at The Dominick again soon!

title: I love the Dominick!
text: I love the Dominick! Beautiful property and exceptional service! Gabby is amazingly helpful and accommodating. The rooms are lovely and comfortable! Location also can’t be beat in soho! Looking forward to continuing to come back here on business and personal trips!

title: Great location, well appointed and comfortable rooms, and friendly staff - what more could you want?
text: Very pleasant stay in a well appointed hotel, at a great location with very friendly  staff throughout. There were also a lot of little touches in our room to make our stay more comfortable which is appreciated, and all the services (internet, gym etc) worked well

title: Exceptional Experience, where comfort, quality, and service are at the core of your stay.
text: The hotel staff was very accommodating from guest services to the front door staff. The room was clean and enjoyable, and the retail amenities around the hotel were great! The Dominick has become my goto hotel whenever I’m in New York City.

title: Incredible, top notch experience for the family
text: The service is absolutely fantastic. Front desk, housekeeping, doormen, room service….everything and everyone! Hotel is beautiful, clean, upscale and comfortable. 3 days with the family and we all loved our stay. One bedroom suite on high floor with unobstructed views of Hudson, Freedom Tower and full south and western views. Can’t wait to come back soon.

title: Best service I've ever experienced whilst staying at a hotel, worldwide.
text: The service - spectacular. The food at the Vestry - exquisite. The staff - personable, friendly, respectful, and hospitable. I had the honor of working with Gabriella at the front desk. My flight was delayed and she made accommodations for me without question and with so much understanding. Will be back next time I travel to NYC! Thank you!!

title: Valentine’s Day getaway
text: Beat views of the city ever in nyc. Definitely get a room 30 floors or higher. The only thing that kept this from being a perfect rating was the noise. All of the surrounding room doors need working on, they all slam and close super fast and hard. You can hear them from down the hallway and especially next to your room. The walls are already super thin and you can hear conversations from the room next to you so be aware of that. The tub in upper floor are spectacular big enough for two adults 5’11 and 6ft tall to stretch out and submerge. House keeping is also great.

title: Consistent
text: The Dominick never disappoints. We were here in December and decided to return in February. The rooms are spacious and the views are amazing. The service is everything you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. We can't wait to come back!

title: Overall great stay
text: Nice large, well appointed rooms. Bedding and pillows are very soft and fluffy. Snacks/sodas/liquors in the room were overpriced in my opinion. A 12oz Coca-cola can was priced at $10. Overall though, great experience and nice hotel.

title: Perfection
text: First, location is absolutely great - within 2 minute walk to 2 subway lines means most of Manhattan is a quick trip away.  The building and rooms are immaculate and the check-in was a breeze and service throughout our stay was top notch.   Everyone was friendly and inviting.   The King Sohi suite was worth the splurge.  The only mild complaints were (1) no bathroom door, although the potty was separated by a glass partition and (2) more noise than I expected, especially given our room was 36 floors up.      VIEWS for miles and miles....

title: The most helpful staff
text: Gabby at the front desk is an absolute gem! She went beyond to help me fix a mishap in my reservations. Truly make my work trip much more enjoyable. Always with a smile and warm greeting! The rest of the staff has been lovely as well. They really elevate the stay at The Dominick.

title: Excellent staff and room
text: Highly recommended. Food, staff and room was great. Vestry was very elegant, the views from the room was amazing and the staff was perfect. I highly recommend the experience. I was pleasantly surprised.

title: Hotel and Staff Top Notch
text:
We have had the pleasure of staying at the Dominick a few times now. The staff is really what sets this hotel apart. Mohendra at the front desk really went above and beyond to ensure we had an enjoyable comfortable stay and made the check in a breeze. The rooms are spacious , beautifully appointed with the most amazing views. The doorman Chris, Elvis and Christopher greet you upon arrival with a warm welcome.   They also have the best recommendations for things to do and see in the city.  If you are looking for a luxurious , comfortable and convenient base for your next  visit to NYC , you have found it.  5 stars all the way around. We can not wait to go back! 
Clint & Debi -San Diego, CA

title: Amazing to say the least
text: My boyfriend and I needed a little mini weekend away and decided to do a stay at the Dominick and I am so glad we did. We did not want to leave the hotel at all. The bath tub with the view was so relaxing and the room overall was beautiful. We stayed at the Sohi room and it was truly a great experience. The staff were also so kind and welcoming. We will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful experience !
text: Really enjoyed our stay at the Dominic! The location is perfect. Room is clean and large and it had an  view of the Hudson. Service was impeccable for any need. Bar at the Vespry was wonderful, great bartender, and the in room dining was wonderful. My only suggestion would be for security purposes to make sure you needed a key card to access the elevators. Unlike many hotels, you do not need a key card to access the elevator at any point.

title: Best Staff
text: The hotel is obviously great but what really makes it so great is its wonderful staff, led by the amazing Hector Aquino! He has always made sure that all my needs are met and every time I come back to the hotel I feel like I'm being treated like family! Cant wait to go back.

title: My experience
text: Amazing service & hospitality.  Will for sure go again. Really felt taken care of by staff.  The building was great, the rooms were beautiful & even the food was exquisite.  Truly enjoyed the swuggestiond for what to do in the city as well.  5 stars

title: Excellent stay
text: The Dominick is our preference for all our visits to New York. The rooms, the location and the staff are all perfect just with one word. The room we stayed was big, clean and had a beautiful Hudson River view. The staff is always very polite and all experts in their jobs. The location is in walking distance to most beautiful restaurants in NYC.

title: Service Excellence
text: The bed was the most comfortable I’ve ever experienced in a hotel.  The service was impeccable from the moment I arrived to my departure. The location and view from the room was breathtaking.  Will definitely come back.

title: Excellent Hotel and People
text: I have had the pleasure of staying at The Dominick in Soho for the past 11 years.  I am in town most weeks for work, and the reason I keep coming back is twofold: (1) the hotel and facilities and location are top notch; and (2) most important, the people who work there are as classy and professional as they come, and they make me feel like an old friend.  I specifically highlight Raquel, Nefertiti, and Sydeka from the front desk, and Francisco who assists guests in the lobby.  Every week for years they have done the many little things that make traveling less stressful and more enjoyable.  They are gold and should be treated well by the hotel because people like this are not easy to find.  I am grateful to know them and to see them every week.  If you see this, team, thanks from Jim.

title: Excellent Stay at the Dominick Hotel
text:
I stayed at the Dominick during my recent business trip to NYC, and I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean, and loaded with a variety of amenities. The in-house restaurant and bar was is also highly recommended.

Additionally, the staff were fantastic as well. Particularly, Marlene. She was highly professional, exceedingly polite, and genuinely friendly. Thank you for all the tips and recommendations, Marlene. 

Dan.

title: Loved our Stay!
text: Our stay at The Dominick was wonderful from the moment we arrived to the moment we (sadly) left. Gabriella at the front desk was incredibly warm and efficiently arranged for an upgrade. We had stunning views from our corner suite, and friends were able to visit us in our room due to the lovely sitting area. They were amazed by the beauty of our room and views! The staff were all wonderful: very professional and attentive, from the welcoming doormen, to the concierge staff, to the cleaning team. A special thank you to them, including Mona who helped me distribute tips to her staff. We will be coming back, again and again!

title: Will stay here again
text: Excellent location, staff and an even better room! Will definitely return as it’s now one of our favorite places to stay! Room service was efficient and food tasted great. Nice view of the city from the 28th floor!!

title: Soho Vibes
text: Everything about my stay was exceptional. Beautiful hotel, friendly and helpful staff, great location. Valet parking made it easy to drive into the city and not worry about parking. I’d gladly stay here again.

title: A Few Bumps
text:
At check-in, we were told that our  IPrefer Member reservation could not be found. Luckily,  I had a screenshot of the details. I mentioned that the reason we booked through the partner website was the complimentary breakfast and 30,000 points added as part of a CYBER Monday promo.  So the nicest way to put it: these details were disbelieved. Hmm. He kept checking with his manager who was otherwise engaged, and couldn’t come out to help. The oddest part was being told that this kind of problem ‘Never happens’, and that complimentary breakfast is seldom offered. I asked whether they had many folks stopping in and angling for a free breakfast ? Why would I make it up ;-)  So we were assigned a room, and told the breakfast scheme would be handled later. OK. Only when I was able to find proof of the offer ( another screenshot ) was that honored.  Not a great first impression. I was waiting for the polygraph. Yikes. 
We travel a LOT and are always prepared for a destination fee, but The Dominick’s is $50/night. On the high side, I’d say. Management did write a note and sent up spring water and tiny chocolate cakes, which were appreciated. Jonathan, in the Breakfast Room was top-notch !  But all in all, likely won’t return.

title: Nice, but another mandatory "destination fee"
text: Our suite was spacious and modern, although it was a bit tricky to figure out the lighting system.  Sadly, the Dominick imposes a mandatory "destination fee" that disguises the actual per night cost unless you read the rate information carefully.  The fee supposedly includes coffee on the 7th floor, but I found only an urn of pre-made regular coffee- no decaf offered.  The front desk staff admitted that there should have been decaf as well.  The fee soured us on the experience.

title: Happy Smiley  staff
text:
When you get off a long flight and inch through traffic you want fast, efficient and  happy people to welcome and check you in. Gabby changed my mood and made the stay better.
Staff are great and hotel for the price is excellent

title: Still the best option for the area but still INSANELY dark rooms
text:
I was remarkably upgraded and that was a treat. I have been staying here for a long time (since the former name which shall not be named :) ) and the rooms/decor is well maintained and still okay.  The pump shampoo/conditioner is GREAT GREAT GREAT. You have some of the best housekeeping in the industry. They set the bar.

NEEDS:
-You need TEA in the rooms. I drink coffee but like TEA too.
-Better lighting in bathroom. The mirror light only lights HALF of the face. For women who put on make up and do hair this is insanely frustrating. And I get up before light- so no window light to use. PLEASE this is a huge one.
-The plugs in the lights bedside didn't work/charge
- A little 'graffiti' on the wall in the bathroom FYI.
-Your doormen are hit or miss. I never once had someone open those insanely heavy doors for me. Not when leaving or entering. And yes, doormen standing right there. Seems they only focus on helping with luggage to get tips. 

Thank you for being amazing.
Marcy Massura (Back in February, March and April!)

title: Home away from home
text: I regularly frequent the Dominick on business and it is the only place I will stay across the city even for personal travel! The accommodations are clean and the entire staff continues to make it feel like home especially Gabby. The location is perfect with amazing restaurants and shopping near by. I highly recommend for your next stay!

title: Great experience
text: I stay here regularly for business and always have a good experience. The Dominick is a beautiful hotel.  Rooms are large, nice and clean with floor to ceiling windows.  In my most recent trip, Gabby at the front desk was awesome:  helpful, efficient and very friendly.

title: Fantastic stay…
text: A quick note to say a huge thanks for taking care of me on my recent trip. Firstly, excellent location, rooms are tip top and the amenities are plentiful. Front desk is awesome. As a frequent visitor, I’ve gotten to know Gabriella  and team well. Gabriella specifically is amazing. Everything is swift and floor-less. Her manner is professional and friendly. Always lovely to see a friendly face, she is a true ambassador to the hotel. It’s my first choice in NY. Thanks Dominic / and special thanks to Gabriella for making everything seamless. I always recommend the hotel to friends and colleagues.

title: Exceptional!
text:
We were hesitant to try to new hotel, but we had found the St. Regis staff to be rather cold with off putting on our last stay, and we prefer being further downtown. It was a breath of fresh air to be at The Dominick! Every person we encountered—doormen, bellmen, front desk, bartender, housekeeping—was really pleasant. We stayed in a Skyline two bedroom suit and it was nicely appointed, clean, and comfortable with great views. One thing that I LOVE is the complete guest control over the heat/AC, so you can pick the temp that you prefer to be comfortable. The in room Nespresso is very convenient, and even the hair dryer is high performance. Linens are top notch, toiletries are Bulgari (same au thé blanc as the Ritz). Water pressure is excellent, and the bathrooms are very nice. The beds are medium firmness and the pillows are very soft and thin, for people who care about such things. If you’re allergic to dogs and asthmatic like me, this hotel is pet friendly but it’s not overrun by dogs like Kimptons. It’s NYC, so expect some noise; if honking car horns and yelling construction workers bug you, bring earplugs. My only complaint is that it’s dimly lit and there is literally no good lighting for makeup application after dusk; the bathroom mirror is lit from the left side so it’s hard to get direct light. I ended up going from room to room, lamp to lamp to see if I applied properly. If you wear makeup, bring a lighted mirror. The neighborhood can’t be beat with tons of good restaurants right there. Overall, this is an excellent hotel, and if you’re looking to ball out, the Skyline suites are beautiful. For us, this is now officially “our” hotel to which we will return for all our NYC trips. Many thanks to everyone at The Dominick
 for making our anniversary trip wonderful!

title: Disappointed couples getaway
text:
As a world traveler, I frequent spaces that provide high end accommodations. My previous stay was the Bellagio penthouse suite in October 2022, everything about the stay, service and amenities were superb. 
My husband and I travel once a month for romantic getaways after 20 years of marriage, adult kids graduated and gone and my private practice is merely running itself. This is our time to create new memories for this phase of our life. First romantic trip of this year “The Dominick”. 
Upon arrival this hotel appeared average; as follows the room which is suppose to be a suite is average ( basic). The only suite feature in this room is the private bar w/private prices.  The alcohol featured doesn’t reflect this room quality. My room doesn’t even include wine glasses, you have to call room service to get it, and it takes at least 40 plus minutes. Cafe is closed, the large restaurant onsite closed and the other eatery on site is subpar and had no host. My burger is still saying moo on the nightstand. There are drawings on the bathroom wall ( looks like maintenance may have done the drawings). The bed isn’t comfortable at all, the mattress is hard, it feels worn. The bedding given it is the dead of winter in NYC is inadequate. The price point is not commensurate with a 5 star/diamond hotel. When I checked in late last night, I desired to check right out. My husband insists we stay given we paid in full at check in and he doesn’t want to try trekking through NYC to find another room for one more day.  Next time we will not be selecting this establishment. Forbes allegedly named this as a fine establishment. Perhaps that distinction was bestowed in error. On the plus side the bathtub is very deep. There is a television on the wall of the bathroom ( not in the mirror). The doors use keys not your mobile device. The decor is dated inside the room. The door man from tonight did grab the door, he just stood there looking at us. The robes aren’t plush and the slippers are none  descript . By far this hotel has been one of the worst hotels , for which I stayed in the last 10 years. Essentially this place isn’t worth the money I paid in my opinion.  Upon evaluating perhaps it is the view I am paying for to look at the Hudson, as that is the only feature that is okay. I so wanted to love this place , as it was the reviews that drew us in.  I considered trying to reserve their penthouse or just switch rooms in the hotel. My spouse is a laid back individual, he recommended we just stay gone all day and return only to sleep. I am a person that travels for the hotel , food and theater. Essentially I am the person that spends more time in the room than out. My rooms are the vacation .  The reason I will spend $500 to $6000 a night is for the experience. Next go around here will be at The Beekman.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: The hotel is wonderful! We will stay there in the future! The location is perfect for shopping, eating, and enjoying the city ambiance. The attention the staff gave to every detail was so impressive. We felt completely cared for and pampered! The room was immaculate and everyone we came in contact with was so pleasant! Definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Raquel makes the Dominick the perfect hotel for a quick visit, especially for business
text:
The Dominick is the best hotel if you are looking for fantastic service. 

Raquel is the ultimate concierge. Be sure to ask for her: her experience and knowledge about the area is unparalleled and her recommendations on local restaurants were instrumental in hosting my executive meetings locally.  I now won’t stay anywhere else if I’m in town.

title: Reach for the stars?
text:
Rating this property as five star is way overstated. One desk clerk checking guests in took 30 minutes 3rd in-line, 
The rooms are large but worn, poorly decorated, dysfunctional plumbing, and appliances. However, the prices get close to some of NYC’s best. 
My wife said, “give it a chance”, there must be something special? Frankly, we never found it, no saving graces, but much closer to our children, we visit at least once a month. 
The understaffed personnel were very nice and accommodating, but need a better product. Our twin four year old twin granddaughters loved the lunchtime French Fries. 

The Uber or taxi ride we were trying to eliminate is a small inconvenience for the glorious food comfort and services of NYC real 5 Star hotels. 
Looking forward to returning to your hotel room can make or break a trip.

title: Nice hotel but…
text:
The hotel is nicely located, rooms are big for NYC standards, the view from your room are fantastic.
But: you don’t feel at home. Front desk impersonal, concierge sent us to an inappropriate restaurant, the cleaning lady knocked every day at 9:00 at our door, the bar is even not worth calling it a bar.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location next to 1 subway and on spring street which has an array of shops, bars and restaurants.  The hotel is lacking the buzz of a bar but is calm and relaxed, staff friendly and efficient.  The rooms are great, spacious with all amenities you need; great views of Empire State etc.  also located right by citibikes to get around.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for us.  Would stay here again and aside from a ‘cool’ bar the hotel has all you need.

title: Fantastic room & service
text:
I travel to NYC for work all the time and wish I knew about the Dominick a long time ago. I typically stay at 5 star hotels farther north near Central Park. I think the Dominick is better than any of them. My room has floor to ceiling windows where I can see the WTC and Empire State Building. I have a massive bath where I also have a view of the Empire state building and a TV. I found the room very impressive to walk into whereas the other luxury hotels I've stayed in seemed a bit old fashioned for my taste...those other hotels also charge WAY too much based on legacy rather than added value. 

The service here is world class and I don't say that lightly. When I checked in at the beginning of the week, I had 2 personal issues that I needed to tend to, and the hotel was extremely helpful with both. The term "above and beyond" doesn't do it justice. It was so good that I'm switching my hotel for NYC travel here and I'll follow up with another review to prove it. My wife and kids would also love this place!

title: Great suite and service
text:
The suite and the attached room were fantastic; as was the service; and the room service food. The massage that I had at the spa was the best deep tissue massage I have ever had for its therapeutic effect.

Our rooms had spectacular views of the Hudson and the skyline.

Reception staff were friendly, helpful and efficient.

I would recommend the Dominick to all who are looking for fabulous accomodation and friendly service/

title: Superb service and the room was spectacular!
text: We had zero complaints about this hotel and we stayed about a week! Andrew made an impressive initial experience for us. The spa was AMAZING! I had the best deep tissue massage of my life! El Ta'Koy, the hotel restaurant, had delicious Hawaiian food and the staff was there was the BEST! I loved the times we were there. They were so attentive, kind and helpful for NY newbies like us. The beef short rib taco was so tender and packed full of flavor, and the tuna taco was super fresh!

title: Very Disappointing!
text:
The Dominick is easily the worse 5-Star hotel that we’ve patronized. Checking into the hotel was lengthy. After each slowly processed check-in, that agent appeared to take a 2-3 minute break after processing each client.

Our SoHi King Room was the smallest hotel room that we’ve had. The water leaked out of the shower such that we used a towel to wipe the water to avoid slipping. There were no paintings in the room, but there were marks on the wall where a painting had been. When a manager came to our room to inspect, he admitted that there should be a painting in the room, but that he had none available.

We dined in the restaurant once for breakfast. The food was maybe slightly better than average, but the table was so small, there was insufficient room for the plates.

We endured the Dominick for 4 nights. This hotel warrants a 3-star hotel rating, at best.

title: How bad can it get?
text:
We had spent a long weekend and we’re heading home to Brasil.
Checked out of the hotel, leaving our bags with them in left luggage
Flight was at night and we had car booked at 1830.
Luggage on a trolley in the lobby
Security zero as someone was able to walk into the lobby and steal one of the hand baggage’s from the trolley
Well chosen as it was the prize, with passports, money, jewels, electronics etc
Needless to say, cannot travel without passport. Another three days spent at the hotel. On their account, but what about reimbursement for the belongings? We are in January 2023 and only recently received an offer of 984 usd. It does not even cover the cost of the bag, let alone the contents.
The hotel has passed the problem to the insurance company and has washed its hands!
The insurance company wants receipts of family heirlooms from 60 years ago! 
Photos have been sent!
Nothing doing more than 7 months after the event!
Is this what a diamond award, five class hotel should be doing?

Absolutely beyond belief! Clear responsibility but no offer!

Would this have happened when it was the Trump hotel?

title: Beautiful Hotel & Friendly Staff
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Dominick a number of times, I highly recommend this beautiful hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and clean. In the summer during our stay we enjoyed drinks and food by the pool, and over NYE we enjoyed in room dining. Special shout out to Darius, assistant director of the front desk, for all the individual attention and making us feel so welcomed! We will be back!

title: Nice place to celebrate an anniversary
text: Good location and nice hotel.  Cleaning and wait  staff were very friendly, front of the house not so much. Had a beautiful view from our room  of midtown and the river. Had a complementary mini-bar credit and bottle of wine on our anniversary  which was a pleasant surprise.

title: A Happy Birthday
text: Arrived for a 1 night getaway stay for my wife's birthday - was upgraded to a room on the 34th floor, beautiful room with great city views.  Staff from the bellmen and valets to the front desk to the 7th floor restaurant were very friendly and helpful.  Used the in-room tablet to order breakfast - worked well...all in all we had a great stay, would definitely stay here again...

title: A Classy Experience in a Perfect Location
text: This hotel has huge, extra clean, well-appointed rooms with floor to ceiling windows and high ceilings. Rooms have huge bathtubs that are right up against a window for a to-die-for Lower Manhattan view and you cannot get that anywhere else in town. You can see the beautiful details on the nearby vintage buildings and the NJ shoreline right on the Hudson. I feel that you get great bang for the buck in terms of NYC luxury hotel prices (especially if you book on hotels.com) and you have a couple of great restaurants in the building—The Vestry in the lobby which has a Michelin starred chef and El Ta’Koy which serves Hawaiian style cuisine on the 7th Floor right next to the pool area. (In the summer you can get their floor while lying by the pool.) The Soho/Tribeca borderline location of The Dominick puts you within five or ten minutes walking distance from both The West Village and Chinatown which are pretty much the two neighborhoods most untouched by modern developers and the most interesting because of their long histories. This hotel is a winner! You can grab snacks right across the street at a Trader Joe’s and heat them in the microwave in your room. There are also small refrigerators and Nespresso machines provided. Oh, I do love the Bulgari toiletries as well. I will be back. (P.S.  El Ta’Koy has luau nights once or twice per month during the summer that are super fun and you can attend whether you are staying at the hotel or not!)

title: Nice pool
text:
I`ve stayed here before and the things i felt lacked then lacked again. 

The hotel is super nice and has a great gym, spacious rooms and an incredible pool. But it does not have the staff like say The Carlyle, The Peninsula or other 5 star hotels in the city. Its a bit cold and distant when it comes to the service. 

Hotel is a 5star hotel when it comes to looks and amenities, but is not a 5 star hotel when it comes to service, food and drink quality.  Espcially when considering th epremium prices they charge for food and drinks.

title: Great location
text: We arrived the day after Christmas Day and the hotel was buzzing but not overcrowded. It really has a nice boutique feel to the space, but has all the amenities you would want in a larger hotel. Restaurant/bar, spa, 24-hour room service, gym. We could not stop talking about the comfortable beds. Everyone we encountered was so friendly and helpful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and maybe in warmer weather to enjoy the pool.

title: Non tornerei, da un hotel da 1.000 euro a notte mi aspetto molto di più.
text: L'hotel vale il prezzo solo ed esclusivamente per la vista sull'East River e sui grattacieli di Lower Manahattan, e per il ristornate stellato al suo interno, il Vestry. Per il resto: gli spazi comuni sono molto piccoli, foyer compreso, l'arredo e in generale le stanze sono "vissute", decisamente troppo per un hotel da 1.000 euro a notte, ci sono dotazioni che erano moderne 15 anni fa, tipo il video in bagno, ora sono datate e mal funzionanti; il riscaldamento ci ha fatto impazzire per tutto il soggiorno perché non partiva e abbiamo dovuto chiamare moltissime volte i tecnici, anche a tarda sera. In camera c'è un Ipad in dotazione che non funzionava e nonostante la segnalazione non l'hanno mai sostituito, quindi per ordinare il servizio in camera dopo teatro siamo dovuti scendere alla reception. Il personale si innervosisce quando gli fai notare ciò che non va, ma ho apprezzato il biglietto di scuse del manager, all'ennesima segnalazione di problemi con il riscaldamento. Decisamente non tornerei.

title: Nice room that had a lot that didn’t  work or was hard to figure out
text:
We were upgraded to a different room but paid $150 a nite for it. We agreed to but I’ve never paid for an upgrade before any where. The lighting system was hard to use and even w all lights in the master bath was still pretty dark. The service at the breakfast restaurant was extremely slow. 
We had a comfortable bed and a beautiful view. Not sure it was worth the extra charge though.

title: Our Favorite Hotel In NYC
text:
The staff is welcoming and worthy of a five star hotel.  Check in is easy, friendly and the entire team in the lobby makes you feel at home.  We enjoyed the brunch and took great advantage of the magnificent spa. 

My daughter had a special garment that she wanted to wear out and it got wrinkled during travel.  Housekeeping brought up an iron in 5 minutes.

title: Fantastic winter stay
text:
The hotel was phenomenal. We had the 2 bedroom
Suite which was spacious, beautiful and clean. Floor to ceiling windows. Automated drapes. Views of the Hudson/NJ.  Tvs in every room, including bathrooms. There was a ton of space for hanging clothes (double wardrobes in each room). 
The staff was polite and attentive. 
There are many hotels rated 5 star that dont live up to the rating but this one does.
Location is great with excellent cafes for breakfast and some of the top NYC restaurants in walking distance (Lupa, Carbone).

title: Beautiful and Warm Welcome
text: We stayed at The Dominick Hotel for 5 days and it was a great experience. Gabriela Bucheli took really great care of us upon arrival. Our room had great views of the city and the Hudson, room was clean and had great amenities. The hotel has great customer service and I highly recommend if you are looking for a 5 star experience.

title: Very accomodating for a work + family trip!
text: Great hotel for both a work and family trip! I travelled to NYC in November for a few days of work meetings and had my family join for the weekend. Gabriela took great care in checking me in and was able to accomodate an upgrade as my wife and young son were joining me for part of my stay. She also provided a cute welcome gift for my son. The entire team was helpful with luggage, bringing up water for baby bottles and with reservations. Overall, it was a pleasure to stay here!

title: Great stay
text: Everything about the stay was truly great. I traveled with my 7 year old daughter and everyone was so kind and engaging with her. It made her feel so special. The service was outstanding and staff extraordinary. Room was clean, modern, comfortable and well prepared.

title: Best View and Service in New York
text:
Hi,

We stayed at The Dominick Hotel for two nights, the room on the 39th floor made our stay, the second best thing is the concierge service, they got us the reservations to the best restaurants in very short notice.

Areas of Improvement, I only mention this because we will be going back and I would like the hotel to improve.
The Spa level(not the spa itself, just when you get out of the elevator in this level) has some odor, needs to be investigated and corrected. 
The restaurant right out side the Spa could use a little improvement.

Happy Holidays :)

title: Christmas in New York
text: Splendid view on the Hudson River! spacious and comfortable room smiling staff. great neighborhood a lot of shops and restaurant. fortunately because there is none at the hotel except for breakfast. only downside the exorbitant prices of the spa which discourages you from going there!

title: Perfect location for the holiday season
text: Excellent hotel with first class service and great location.  Lots of nearby restaurants and fabulous views from the room.  It was the perfect location locally or head south to Chinatown and 9/11 Museum or north to Rockerfeller Plaza and west he Rockettes show.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This was our second time staying at the Dominick. What a great hotel with spectacular city views. The staff is customer centric and our stay was just perfect.  Highly highly recommend if you are looking for a 5 star experience.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: Can I just say Really Really big Shout out to Nicole from Guest services, My boyfriend and I had a 2 night stay here on December 3rd for his Birthday weekend on the 39th floor. The room was 10/10, The view!!!! omg who wouldn’t want to wake up to a view over looking the city and the river everyday. The bathroom shower was Great, the bath tub I absolutely love it!  went in 2X and could fall asleep both times 😂, we had a suite which worked out perfectly for us,  we had more space to lounge out and kick back. We were  well taken care of ok, Don’t play with The Dominick ok! But Definitely on my top 2 best trip ever. service was absolutely to die for.

title: gaby is the BEST!
text:
we had a lovely stay at the dominick hotel.  what made it super special was gaby, at the front desk.
she was friendly, gracious and SO customer service oriented.

i was fighting a bad cold and needed access to my room before my long, evening flight.  she worked with me and made sure that i could get a late check out.

i am so appreciative of her incredible customer service.  a rare gem.

thank you, gaby!!!!

title: Well-located, clean, comfortable hotel with nice amenities and great service
text: Really nice, clean and well appointed hotel. The beds are insanely comfortable and the service was top notch. I wish they’d had a bar with food being served in the late evening, but the fact they have 24 hour room service is a huge selling point. I would definitely stay here again. The location and neighborhood are also great!

title: Great hotel but there's a few cons!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel overall. The staff was great and very helpful. My room was clean and the view was so beautiful. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. 

The hotel lost a star because I called in to book a specific room on the SoHi level with a view of the city from the bedroom and the bathroom. The person over the phone told me that this room was available and that I could reserve it. That wasn't the case once I checked in and went up to the room. It was a nice view but the bathroom did not have a window. I was then told that the rooms were first come first serve basis and that all of the rooms were reserved, even the more expensive ones. That honestly was very annoying and threw off my stay. Small details like this matter and I was very disappointed. 

Suggested improvements-
-Allow guests to reserve specific rooms so we know exactly what we're getting when we book.
-update the dessert menu in the restaurant with something warm. I ordered the recommended cheesecake with apple compote and it was horrible, especially for $15. 
-Make sure the iPad in the room actually works. Mine was broken. 

All in all, It was nice but probably won't come back.

title: Best service in NYC. Gaby is phenomenal.
text: I have been staying at this hotel all year.  The service sets it apart.  Gaby at the front desk always greets me and ensures a room is available.   She has helped me work through travel booking issues as well (not the hotels fault).   This is a great hotel and you’ll be treated like family at the Dominick.

title: Beyond my Expectations!
text: I went to The Dominick to celebrate my birthday, which has been an unforgettable experience! I want to give a very big, special THANK YOU to Tiffany, Luxury Ambassador for specializing my room! It was amazing! Thank you, Hector, for making this joyous experience possible. The front desk staff are just as exceptional, Thank you, Cassandra, Jose, and Sydeka for being extremely welcoming and friendly as I checked in. Also warm thank you to Felix, the bellman, and Stanley, the doorman, for being very hospitable. This hotel is a full package to experience. It is beautiful, unique, clean, and, comfortable. And to top it off, the staff are very accommodating and pleasant which makes this hotel a 10/10 stay in my book. Thank you and I will 100% be back again!

title: The hotel is excellent and all employees are so kind
text: I had a wonderful time in New York while in The Dominick. I really appreciate all the employees that were so kind with me, specially Gaby during my check in after a long flight and Luisa, the night house keeper that together with another women would leave a chocolate and water every night. All very sweet and nice! Would definitely come back!

title: 5 stars!!!!!
text:
The staff were incredibly helpful with some of the scheduling challenges I had (not their fault at all, due to company scheduling issues)
The hotel was immaculate, clean, well organized. I’m very happy with my stay and looking forward to staying again.

title: Terrific Stay & Service
text: This is a very good hotel, but the service takes it to the full 5 stars for me. Special call out to Gabriela Bucheli who helped me solve a small crisis. Thank you, Gabriela!! I hope to stay at the Dominick again soon.

title: Exceptional staff and Amazing Views!
text: Where do I start?? My birthday was amazing and I'm glad I spent it here. Let's dive in! From check in to check out my experience here was seamless. I had the pleasure of checkin in with Marlene and Cassandra at the front desk who were both amazing and pleasant. I had an issue with my room key on my second night and that was easily remedied with no hassle.  I had my bags brought up by Evans the bellman who gave us a full walk through of the suite. THE VIEWS HERE ARE AMAZING!!! Floor to ceiling windows that give a full view of the city and to top it off you get a beautiful view from the bath tub also!! Upon entrance to the bathroom we noticed the bath was decorated with rose petals and candles which was a great touch from Tiffany from the luxury team! My birthday couldn't have felt more special, the staff took great care of us during our stay. From a bottle of wine to fruit cups to chocolate ornaments we were definitely treated with prestige. Also the location of the hotel is close to everything (Tribeca, soho).  We were about 3 mins from Wolf Gang (hotel made reservations for my birthday) and a short walk to a number of other spots we visited. Eric the concierge got us a table at Mr. Purple rooftop which was a nice touch for my birthday. Overall it was a great stay here and we will deff be back. Excellent views, excellent services, short walks to everything and very clean. My only regret is that I had to leave lol 10/10 all around and would definitely recommend.

title: Fantastic
text:
Super friendly staff - the valet were quick to greet us and were attentive. Gaby at the front desk was fantastic - thank you Gaby!

The luggage arrived within 60 seconds of us making it to the room. The accommodations were lovely as well - fantastic views and great location.

Very much enjoyed our stay. Thank you!

title: Well-appointed, great service!
text: From beginning to end, the hotel staff paid attention to every detail. We were upgraded to a sizable room by NYC standards. Everything was perfect. The location is ideal with terrific retail stores, and restaurants within walking distance.  We were only there one night, and did not have an opportunity to experience the restaurant or room service.

title: Extraordinary care and service!
text: Simply can’t say enough about how outstanding the service is at Dominick. From my check in to departure everything was perfection. Housekeeping was excellent, all three restaurants provided first class service and it was consistently excellent across the board. Rare now a days. The furnishings and decor were a little tired as many properties are post Covid, but that will never keep me away as the customer service was among the finest I’ve ever encountered at any top tier hotel in the world! I also experienced a small crisis upon my departure; loosing my purse. Of course I was panicked but the staff members Ida, Mike, Albert and Hector all kept me calm and worked in unison to locate it, communicate, keep it safe, and return it to me with everything in tact. I will be forever grateful to all of them. Thank you Dominick Hotel, for a beautiful stay and exemplary customer service during my entire visit. Quite extraordinary in this day and age. I will most definitely return soon and often!

title: Best hotel in NYC ! View  Luxury and Location !
text:
100% recommended! Excellent 5 stars hotel located perfectly in Soho (3 min from La Durée!). The staff is very nice. A great thank you to the doormen and Evans. The view from the room is unbeatable. We will come back here when we get down to NYC. Thank you to Nicole J. who is fantastic.
Plus: there is one star Michelin guide restaurant in the hotel: Vestry

Check-in/Lobby: nice Lounge and super cozy library upstairs
Rooms: we had a one-bedroom suite with a view of the Hudson on the 25th floor. Very spacious, with 5 stars amenities.
Gym: Not too big but we had enough with cable fly and dumbbells
Service: very good
Breakfast: All good

title: A great stay at The Dominick!
text: The Dominick is a great luxury hotel in NYC with a fantastic location, short walk to Soho, Tribeca, and an easy stroll to ground zero sites & all the shopping. Amazing views & very quiet and comfortable room.The staff at The Dominick were extremely friendly & helpful. Thank you, we absolutely enjoyed our weekend stay!

title: Great experience
text: The staff was amazing! I was proposing to my girlfriend and they went above & beyond to help me execute the proposal. Everyone I encountered was friendly, personable and professional. The views were breathtaking. I will definitely be coming back again!

title: There are nicer hotels for similar price in NYC
text: The view from the floor to ceiling window was fun and the room was spacious and modern, but the hotel in general was just uncomfortable and sterile. The bathroom was too dark for putting on makeup (even with a makeup mirror), the room was always too warm (even when turning off the heat), and they charged a high resort fee that doesn't give you much - it didn't even cover my cup of decaff coffee and that cost $14!

title: Always love The Dominick!
text: We always stay at The Dominick when we can. Love the rooms - larger than most in NY, the service is always great and the views on the upper floors are wonderful. The location is also perfect - 5 minute walk to Soho but quietly on the edge of it. Great restaurants and shopping near by.

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff
text: Loved my stay at the Dominick.  Large rooms,  modern bathrooms with a deep soaking tub + rainfall shower.  Special shout-out to Gabriella who checked me in and made the stay so special with her warmth. She also upgraded me to a higher floor with a view, which made the stay all the better.

title: Perfect anniversary weekend!
text: Everything was perfect! From the early check in, to the delicious chocolates at turn down to the morning coffee service. And the views!! What a gorgeous, spacious room. We loved it and you can’t beat the location. We walked everywhere. We’ll definitely be coming back.

title: I keep coming back…
text: Customer service at The Dominick is impeccable, which is why it’s my go-to hotel in NYC. Mohendra at the front desk remembered me and also knew that I like a specific room. The view is unbeatable, both during the day and at night. And, they have a great gym for a hotel. If I’m staying in the city, it’s at The Dominick. Period.

title: Five star hotel with a staff that deserves a sixth star.
text:
I have been staying at The Dominick for over ten years now. The overall experience has always been excellent, and they haven't lost a step post-covid. 

They retained nearly all the of the same exceptional staff, and somehow they seem to have rallied to make things even better. 

The team that meets you - outside and at the front desk - is by far the best I have ever experienced. They take pride in the work, and make it clear they are available for whatever you need. They are buttoned up and professional...yet genuinely friendly. 

During my most recent stay, Gaby helped me check-in (she is one member of their All Star team). In the middle of a very busy time of day, she - like always - took care of me efficiently and at five-star quality. 

This is my first review of this hotel, which is a little embarrassing since I have had so many excellent experiences for so many years. Yes - it is expensive...yet worth every penny.

title: Great hotel. Rooms a little tired.
text: Really enjoyed my stay at The Dominick. The staff is top notch. The bed is super comfortable. The views if you have them are unbeatable for lower Manhattan. I, by no means, is a super luxury, high-end traveler, but I can say the rooms could use some investment in updating. That is the reason for the 4-star review.

title: Love this hotel
text: Wonderful stay at the Dominick. Staff and service were top notch. The hotel boasts some of the largest rooms of any hotel in Manhattan. Shoutout to Gabriella for being so accommodating. Highly recommend!

title: My New NY Fav Hotel
text: I come to NY  1-2x a month for a few days each. I recently tried The Dominick and will be switching to this hotel. First, I most appreciated Gabriela when checking in. She greeted my friend first and after conversation put us in the perfect room for us. I happen to also have Gabriela at check out who instantly recognized the room I was in and welcomed me back.  Next, is the size of the rooms and bathroom space! Finally a NY bathroom with a counter... See you all soon

title: Upgraded and grateful
text:
Do you ever get to a hotel exhausted from travel with delays and different hotel rooms.  Then the person in the front asks you are you afraid of heights, I say no and she says then I am going to upgrade you to this suite that is available since you are staying one night.  Walk in and the room and the view are breath taking! Take a long shower and sit down to work and just feel grateful to Gabriele in front desk.  This hotel and it’s service are top notch. Thank you Dominick for making me feel taken care of in your beautiful suite with amazing views.  Photos are taken on a night in NYC that is raining like crazy!
Y

title: Top NYC hotel in Soho/TriBeCa area
text: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at within New York City. Premises are immaculate and the service is top notch with surreal views of downtown Manhattan and the Hudson River. I will be returning to the Dominick when i’m back in the area.

title: Business trip to nyc
text: Truly one of a kind, perfectly located in downtown Manhattan with modern well-appointed rooms and great views of the city. But above all, the service is impeccable. Gabriela at the front desk makes sure everything goes smoothly and everything you need is catered for. I look forward to staying again and again. 5 stars!!

title: Exemplary
text: Highly recommended! Grabriela at the front desk has been very kind and accommodating. She remembered our names the next day and was able to extend our stay as we needed last minute! The grounds are clean and the whole staff seems friendly! 5 out of 5 stars

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: A special thank you to Gabriela Bucheli who always makes my stay special. Her personal service and that of all the staff is triple A rated. Always my first choice when in NYC. Do not hesitate to stay at this terrific hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Tutto al TOP
text:
Tutto al top. Camera rifatta anche 2 volte al giorno, letto di una comodità spettacolare, location fantastica, personale gentilissimo e servizievole.
Camere ottimamente isolate sia acusticamente che termicamente. Arredo elegante e materiali di pregio

title: Great stay - thank you Mohendra
text: One of the nicest hotels in NYC! Mohendra went out of his way to make our stay extremely special. He treats his guests as VIP. Thank you Mohendra! We will be back at the Dominick Hotel in the future, no doubt.

title: beautiful view
text: had a really nice view of the river and Jersey City. large room. very good location for the business trip downtown. only negative was I had a pillow sheet with a make-up or blood stain. very large stain. should not happen in a place like this.

title: Breathtaking views and excellent customer service
text:
My family (me, my husband & our daughters ages 9 & 5) had an incredible stay for 5 nights in October. We stayed in a So-Hi 2 bedroom suite and were blown away by the space and the breathtaking city views (even from the bathtub!) 

The customer service was amazing and the location was perfect. It’s a quiet part of Manhattan but is just blocks from two different subway lines that can get you anywhere you want to go.

I do wish they offered rooms with two queen beds to make it easier for families to stay without having to get such a large suite.

title: Amazing experience for a former New Yorker
text: A four night stay at the beautiful Dominick Hotel couldn't have been nicer in any way.  The hotel is beautiful, well appointed with luxury finishes and amenities.  The staff reminded me of what New York City is supposed to be...the best place on earth.  I travelled as a nanny caring for the daughter of two doctors who attended a medical conference.  The girl and I ran around the city every day taking in shows, museums, shopping, going to parks and having a blast.  The concierge was incredibly helpful in recommending ideas for us.  Actually, the entire staff was friendly, courteous, and quick to fulfill all of our needs.  One particular standout was the doorman, Marek, who was an absolute joy at every encounter...and we had several as we were in and out several times each day.  He was friendly and engaging, at the ready to hail a cab or offer directions (he even offered to run to Starbuck's for me if I told him what I needed!).  He is one in a million.  FYI - I lived in New York for 58 years and worked in NYC for 30.  Now, living in Vermont, that was the NYC I was happy to return to.

title: Favorite NYC hotel!!
text:
The Dominick is just the best!  I stay here regularly for work but today I came to NY with my daughter for a fun girls weekend. From
the moment we walked in the experience was great!
Mohendra welcomed us with a warm smile, was able to get us checked in a bit early and arranged a room with the most spectacular views of the city!  His customer service is what makes this hotel stand out.  
Thank you!!

title: spectacular views, great staff.
text: The view from the 24th floor was spectacular. Very comfortable beds and the bathrooms were luxurious, with great amenities. Friendly and helpful staff all round.

title: Great weekend away!
text: Great stay. The welcome from Mohedra(?) at the front desk was gracious and warm.  Great location, impeccable hospitality, and a  lovely room.  Everyone on staff worked hard to help make out special stay amazing.

title: Amazing!! Mohendra is incredible!! Location is amazing and the hotel is out of this world.
text:
As soon as I arrived I knew it would be an amazing stay! I had a terrible Uber driver who literally dumped my luggage on the road and the doorman came came out and assisted. He took my bags straight to my room that was ready early. 

Mohendra at the front desk was incredible. He was so lovely and chatty and made check in a fantastic experience. 

Room blew my mind and the location is perfect!

title: Best in the City
text:
We've stayed at The Dominick four times now. Each time we are welcomed warmly by the most wonderful staff. Mohendra in particular has been there each time we've checked in or out and goes above and beyond to ensure it is a good stay. It truely feels like a home away from home. 
The room is so comfortable and clean. The views can't be beat! 
The location is great for shopping and dining. This is the best place to stay in NY!

title: SoHo shopping boutique hotel
text: We love the location of this downtown Spring Street boutique hotel as it is close to top tier shopping and dining experiences away from the bright lights of Times Square. The beds are very comfortable the rooms and lobby all immaculate. Not sure why the hotel has standalone showers and bathtubs and do not supply The typical bath gels and shampoo next to the tub when I inquired at the front desk that I was told and discouraged from making a tub as there was a risk of slipping on the marble floor. Not some thing I’ve ever heard from the hotel front desk having stayed at the four seasons they fall all over themselves to ensure that the guest has every accommodation

title: Так себе!
text:
Начиная самого заезда. 
•В лобби жудкий холод. На улице было -14С. А у них настолько огромная дверь, что клиенты не могли сами Ее открывать и закрывать, так они ничего лучше не придумали, чем просто Ее застопорить, что бы она всегда была открыта. Пока мы получили номер, дети и мы окочинели. 
•Завтрак по плану должен был быть шведский стол, но почему то в это время они перенесли все завтраки в Японский ресторан в здании, где можно было заказать всего из 4 блюд. Вот и представьте, если три из четырёх блюда вам не нравиться, ничего не остаётся, как все четыре дня есть одно и тоже блюдо. 
•Парковка находиться по соседству на улице. 
В итоге ставлю среднюю оценку этому отелю.

title: New favorite hotel in NYC
text: New favorite hotel in NY.   We booked at the recommendation of a friend.   Our go to hotel for many years was The Nomad and we like to stay downtown.   The hotel is in a great location.  Within walking distance to a lot of our favorite haunts.   We were upgraded at check in to a room on the 28th floor.   The view, high ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, luxe bathroom are highlights.   The vibe is understated luxury with first class hospitality.   The staff is accommodating and welcoming.  We will be back

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed the weekend for my wife’s birthday. The location is so good: two good subway stations nearby, cvs and Trader Joe’s across the street, steps from soho and all that has to offer (best part of the city in my opinion). The room was big and clean with beautiful city views. The staff is top notch and very accommodating. Can’t wait to come back

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: I come to NYC often to visit my Daughters who live there. I make a point of trying a different hotel each time to "test" them out (always in the lower Manhattan areas). Honestly, this was by FAR THE BEST hotel I have ever stayed at in the city.  The service is amazing, the hotel is luxury level and the rooms are very spacious.  We also had massages at the spa and all 3 of us said it was incredible.  We ordered room service twice and the food is great.  I will be back for sure and stop shopping other options in the future.

title: Amazing time spent at the Dominick on the 39th floor with spectacular view loved it
text: 5 we had a spectacular time… Mohendra at the front desk was absolutely wonderful and attentive to fine details of special request. Loved that we got a man upgrade the whole staff was just super attentive 5 stars in deed… thanks so much again. Loved

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Staff was exceptional, so kind and catered to our every request and more!!!  Hotel is beautiful, rooms were large, super clean and had everything we needed.  El Ta'Koy restaurant was fantastic, great bartenders, great food, great atmosphere

title: Best in Class
text:
I always love coming to NYC.   I’ve stayed in several different hotels in midtown and downtown, and  the Dominick is the best.    The beds are the best.  The service, the view, and location are 5 star.   If you want spectacular views I would recommend staying the above the 23rd floor, it’s worth the extra money if your into views of the city.   There is a Starbucks across the street, and several great restaurants, and other great coffee shops within a short walking distance.   

They are also super close to subway access points to that can get you anywhere in the city with in 20-30 minutes.   I come to city several times a year, and I find myself always staying here lately because of the atmosphere, and best in class service the Dominick provides.   I would highly recommend this hotel if you’re staying downtown.

title: The Dominick met all expectations
text: The Dominick was centrally located. The decor is NYC swanky. The doormen were great. Staff was helpful. Room was nice. Housekeeping was on point. Room service was good. Would stay again next time we are in NYC.

title: Top of my list hotels in NYC
text:
I had a great time spending a couple of days in the Dominick Hotel. The Hotel is very luxurious and conformable. Everything is stylish. 
Gabriela in the front-desk was very nice and helpful. She helped me check in. 

I would totally recommend this hotel

title: Favorite place in NYC
text: I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. The people are so friendly, they are very personable. I was pleasantly surprised from the first time I walked through the door, until we left. The cleanliness is always a priority and the Dominick did not disappoint!! My husband and I went for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday and bravo con. I love the atmosphere and you are in the heart of the village…we walked everywhere And loved it! I will definitely be back! Another perk is how discreet the hotel is! Big celebrity to average people and it’s very safe for everyone! Hands down favorite place to stay in NYC. I go at least once a year.. this is my new home.
