Thank you

title: 1st class service all the way
text: Staff service is top notch…. From the moment I stepped out of the car and into the hotel, checking in until check out, I felt immediately at home. I will stay here again … with so many choices for accommodations, feeling  valued as guest is most important

title: Awesome hotel
text:
Great hotel. Very comfortable rooms and super friendly staff!
The views from high floors are incredible. 
My only issue was the bathroom mirrors. They’re lighted on the left side only. It’s a modern look I guess but when applying makeup I couldn’t see the right side of my face at all. Very strange

title: Amazing Service
text: I travel to NYC quite frequently and my first choice is always to stay at the Dominick.  The staff, especially Gabby, recognizes me the moment I walk in the door and greets me by name.  I am always welcomed with a smile and made to feel special.  No request I’ve ever made has been too small or bothersome.  They truly make a difference for me while I’m traveling in New York.

title: NYC PROPOSAL
text:
The thought over a proposal never crossed my mind until I met my fiancé! . It came to me due to the many losses I experienced this year. I lost friendship, my job of 14 years and 50lbs. She saw me at my worst and continued to be my biggest cheerleader. We’d planned this trip months ago without knowing what was in the near future for us. 

This was also a long distance “Lockdown Love” - we met in 2020. I decided to propose to her on her birthday because this would be the first time we’d been together since we have been dating. And why not in New York? I like to stay at different hotels every time I visit, but she did not want to stay anywhere else, but The Dominick. I called and spoke to Steven. We chatted, but then he went on vacation. Some how our chat fell through the cracks so less than 14 days out I called again and spoke to Nicole. Nicole not only cleared my cloudy mind for the proposal, but engaged me with ideas I’d never thought of! She spent almost 1 hour with my on the phone to ensure all details were etched out and I was comfortable with my plan. In this conversation I expressed my gratitude with her being so open to me as a minority and being a part of the LGBTQ community. She made me feel like she would have given me the same treatment regardless of who I loved! October 7, 2022 my life changed. This was the 7th day of our trip. I proposed to my girlfriend on a sailboat in-front of the Statue of Liberty that afternoon. She said yes! We came back to the hotel, changed and went to our reservations at RH on 9th Ave. When we came back to the room …………………………

Unbelievable! We were both gobsmacked with the attention to detail and the elevated ambiance. I sent Nicole a random email with a photograph of ring to let Nicole know she’d said yes to the proposal. Not only did Nicole accurately follow my pre planned asks, but she PRINTED OUT THE PICTURE I SENT HER! It was elegantly placed all through the rooms with our names on them! This small gesture over filled us with joy. It was honestly overwhelming. My fiancé and I sent videos to all of our friends and family and everyone wanted to know where we stayed. So here’s what I’m telling you. Not only are we going to begin to come to New York more often, but this will be the only hotel we will stay at going forward. Nicole’s dedication, communication and execution surpassed our expectations. We are forever indebted to Nicole. She deserves a standing ovation and a promotion to the moon!

 

 

My fiancé‘s perspective:

 

Dominick review

 

This trip was easily the best trip of my life. Already loving The Dominick and NYC I thought the trip couldn’t be any better but on Friday my partner proposed to me and it was a dream!!!! I am so grateful the Dominick made sure our day was extra special, from the kind staff to the suite it was absolutely perfect. Coming back to the room with it decorated was absolutely fantastic, I was speechless. Everything was sooo beautiful, I truly feel like the luckiest girl in the world. I never imagined a trip this beautiful.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: Great hotel, great staff, and unbelievable rooms. I travel a lot for business and stay in very nice hotels. This is probably the best hotel I have stayed in so far. Highly recommend it for business stay.

title: Two Thumbs up from an out of towner
text:
I had a lovely experience at the Dominick; all employees were friendly and helpful with any request I had.

The only matter I had an issue with was not having an iron and ironing board in my room when it was required to get ready for an event later that evening.

- DM

title: First time in New York
text: What a fantastic friendly hotel. The best bed I've ever slept in and a great view of downtown from our bedroom. Thoroughly enjoyed every minute in the Soho district. Great bars and superb food locally or lovely walk to Tribeca or Greenwich

title: Mostly good
text:
The hotel is great and the staff is amazing, however the quality of the room service needs attention.
We had a chicken sandwich that was dry and a steak that was ordered medium raw but arrived completely over cooked and inedible. When we sent the steak back the new one sent up was only marginally better and still inedible.
For a hotel of this caliber and price this shouldn’t happen.

title: Birthday weekend
text:
Great stay at an excellent property with very competent and caring staff. 
From Marek at the door with answers for all your NYC questions to check in to housekeeping- everyone here is top notch and courteous. 
Would stay hear again!

title: Amazing hotel experience
text: Best hotel experience I ever had! Service & attention to detail were above and beyond. Door men to greet you, complimentary waters delivered directly, elegant room service. Rooms are beautiful and the suites are very spacious!

title: over rated
text: It was just ok, the room was clean and but worn out. The gym was just average. No listing of channels on cardio equipment. Breakfast for two 120 dollars.  It was ok but not four star or five star. Buyer beware

title: Top notch hotel with all of the finest amenities.
text: SoHo area of town close to interesting shopping, great restaurants and Little Italy.  Close enough to Central Park (20-25 min Uber?) and 5th Avenue shopping if you want to venture in that direction.  Connection to the Highline is also close.  The hotel is superbly clean and rooms are impeccably decorated and meticulously maintained.

title: Great spacious stay in NYC!
text:
Lovely hotel, good sized rooms.  We checked out early from CitizenM because of the tiny rooms.  Dominick was a great alternative.  Stayed in room 1410 - lovely and spacious.

Great staff, bellmen, etc. - like a real hotel vs the new “pod” hotels.  Great pocation. 

Loved it!

title: Lovely staff, great rooms!
text: Stayed here 3x now, and the staff is lovely! The rooms are nice, and I really like the proximity to SoHo and the West Side highway and promenade. Bathrooms are really nice- occasionally, there's a slightly worn fixture, but overall, a really classy hotel for a NYC stay downtown.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We hadn’t been to New York in sometime but couldn’t wait to come visit. The Dominick had been recommended by friends. We were immediately welcome by the friendly staff. Every staff member went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable from the valet, to reception, to housekeeping and everyone in between. They made us feel like we were very much appreciated and were genuinely glad we were there. The accommodations were very nice and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning.

title: Perfect for long stay
text: We stayed at the Dominick hotel for 2 full months and enjoyed it! The view is spectacular and the door men are always helpful. Special thanks to Felix Penia und Marek. Our room was huge and had a lot of storage what was perfect for our long trip. We had room 3810 and can recommend all the 10 series.

title: Bel hôtel à Soho
text: Très bel hôtel situé à Soho, près de nombreux cafés et restaurants. Nous avions une suite très agréable, grande avec une magnifique vue. Notre chambre n’était pas prête à l’arrivée et on nous a mis une autre chambre à disposition en attendant et un crédit à dépenser à l’hôtel. Nous avons beaucoup apprécié !

title: Hotel muy descuidado, para ser 5 estrellas y por el precio. Es pésimo. No vale la pena.
text: Me desilusione bastante de este hotel. Lo elegimos por ser 5 estrellas. Y de 5 no tiene nada. Las camas horribles, los cuartos sucios, la comida del restaurante realmente mala. Y en general no hay buena atención de parte del hotel. No lo recomiendo nada.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
We really enjoyed our stay... Very luxurious and comfortable hotel. Best view and outstanding staff. Walking distance to many wonderful restaurants and Little Italy.
What I remember most is the intoxicating/wonderful smell as we walked into the lobby.

title: My favorite in NYC
text: By far my favorite hotel in NYC. Everything is excellent in terms of stay and service. The rooms are large, beautiful and so comfortable. The bathroom is large and in terms of cleanliness and amenities, this hotel is second to none. I look forward to my stay at the Dominick.

title: Nearly Perfect NYC Stay
text:
I stayed at the Dominick on a business trip for 5 nights in Sept 2022 and it was the closest to perfect that I’ve come to in NYC hotel in a very long time. I work for a luxury brand and travel around the world often staying at the most luxurious 5 star properties. NYC is…. Tricky. I lived in NYC from 2002-2019, so have only recently had to stay at hotels for business.  I’ve found unless you’re staying at one of the top tier hotel chains - especially in the past two years - the service has just suffered. Not at The Dominick. 
I stayed in two different category rooms - a top floor one bedroom suite and a standard (21st floor) king room. Both were spacious and clean, large bathrooms, great lighting, great closet space, very comfortable beds, beautiful views. Both had generous wet bars with sinks and microwaves which was an interesting surprise (would have been perfect if I was traveling with my babies) and both rooms were very quiet and comfortable. 

The staff - from doormen to check in to room service to housekeeping - were impeccable. Everyone I interfaced with was friendly, professional and kind. The housekeeping staff in particular went above and beyond. I was often in a rush in the mornings and left the room a bit disheveled. I’d come home to my clothes neatly folded in piles, and my bathroom toiletries precisely arranged on the vanity. I haven’t experienced this kind of service in NYC or perhaps anywhere in the US since the pandemic. 

The prices are high - (a chicken soup and bottle of sparkling water came to $60 after “service fees” and gratuity).  But not incrementally higher than other nyc luxury hotels. 

The one bedroom suite needed a few technical updates - the automatic light switches didn’t work, TV in the bedroom didn’t work, hotel iPad didn’t always work,  but I was too busy and/or tired to need to address any of these things - I’m sure they would have been promptly fixed or addressed. 

Overall I was so pleased with my stay at the Dominick and so impressed with the service. I hope to stay here anytime I need to travel to NYC for business.

title: Recent hotel stay
text:
I have been coming to the Dominick hotel since it opened. It is a 5 star gem in the heart of Soho, NY. I have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in NYC. This hotel is by far  my choice when staying in Manhattan. As a Platinum Amex member, I am afforded the percs that come along with the card. I was upgraded to a beautiful one bedroom suite overlooking the Hudson River and Freedom Tower. The appointments of the room and hotel are amazing. It was a hot summer day and to have an outdoor pool with chaise lounges and food service is something that is such a bonus in NYC. 
I want to give a great big shout out to Mohendra at the front desk who I’ve known for years. He is such an asset to this property and always makes me feel like this is my home away from home. This is a 5 star + property in every way. 
I can’t wait to return.
Danny from NY

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location
text: The rooms are modern, very large, with panoramic windows. Super clean, crisp and comfortable bedding. Jose at the front desk was very welcoming.  I wish I could have stayed longer. I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Somewhat unfair review
text:
This is a somewhat unfair review as we have not yet stayed at The Dominick.   Our travel agent reached out the hotel almost a month before our arrival to get contact info for the concierge so that we could book dinner reservations while we are In New York.  This is a birthday trip for me so I was really excited to try some of the new restaurants in the area.

Despite me following up, it took Nicole almost 10 days to respond, by which point one of our requested restaurants was already full - the reservations opened 3 weeks before and they were fully booked by the time we heard from the concierge.

We were also told that the concierge would monitor the reservations for our other requested restaurant.   It's now less than a week before we arrive and we haven't heard anything.  I checked myself and the restaurant we wanted is actually closed for renovations.   Luckily we made our own alternate plans.

Really disappointed that this is the level of service we are getting from a hotel that charges the rates The Dominick does.   Hopefully our actual stay will go better.

title: A bit disappointed 2nd stay
text: I stayed here at the beginning of the summer and again in September 2022 and the first time around was great. It was clean, nice room, everything was in perfect order, staff was friendly etc. This time around was not the same. We got in and the floors had a red sauce stain, carpet was dirty, the button for the curtains didn’t work, the elevators were slow. There was a notable difference during the second stay and I’m not too sure I would stay here again. I’m not sure if the difference was that the first time was booked through Amex fine hotels and resorts. Regardless, I’m surprised it made the list after this last stay.

title: Great experience
text:
Lovely hotel, great location, wonderful service. 
The room was beautiful clean and cozy
The staff was amazing, and attentive

Highly recommend  for staying dowtown
Walking distance to Soho , village, tribeca and much more

title: Incredible team and hotel, Cannot recommend The Dominick enough!
text:
I have just enjoyed the most wonderful stay at The Dominick, made possible by the amazing Hector and Daniel!
I cannot recommend the hotel enough alongside it’s absolutely incredible team, A big thank you to Felix and Scott, Maria, Ayda, Laby and Richard!
Everyone within the team exceeded all my expectations constantly going the extra mile to ensure my stay was seamless, 
The location of the hotel is ideal and with lots of shops and restaurants near by, 
My room was bright and beautifully set up, as I was visiting for work I ended up staying mostly in the room and the staff was exceptionally hospitable, A special mention to Maria for looking after my room!
I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone on the look out for remarkable service standards!

title: Moving in my freshman at NYU
text: I would highly recommend the Dominick to anyone looking to stay in this area, and especially to parents visiting their kids at NYU. To begin with, the staff here is remarkable. Everyone is so helpful, kind and friendly. It is a mere 10 min walk to most of the dorms and to some of the best parts of the city! I can safely say The Dominick will be my home away from home when I come to town.

title: Good sized rooms, nice location, excellent service
text: Easy to walk around Soho, to Greenwich Village, Chelsea, etc from here. The hotel and room has plenty of space (not something I normally say about staying in NYC!) and a decent gym (weights, treadmills, rowing machine, elliptical machines). The pool is fantastic and also has great service and a good menu (but be prepared for room service type fees and charges if you get food and drinks). Spa is also really terrific with excellent staff. I agree with another reviewer that the furniture and a/c could use some work. I did not find my bed comfortable at all and couldn't wait to get home to my own bed. Bathrooms are nice and good minibar selection.

title: Best hotel stay in the entire world!
text: I had the best time at the Dominick! Thank you to Hector, the manager who was super helpful. Shout out to Tiffany who arranged such a thoughtful amenity and to Gaby and Jenny at the front desk who went above and beyond for my stay! 5 star service! (Not to mention, I am still dreaming of sleep I had there! Those sheets and pillows are to die for)!

title: Best Visit Ever!!
text: We had a great time at the pool and the room had incredible city views. I went with Gaby’s recommendation at the front desk and it did not disappoint. She was very helpful when it came down to asking about the amenities and even suggesting great bars near the area. The neighborhood had great restaurants and a fun vibe. Would highly recommend.

title: Not  a premium hotel
text: Not recommending, Room layout is good but furniture already seen their best days. Loud Aircon makes it difficult to sleep at night. Extra pay for internet in rooms if you want it to work. Room service is forgetting orders. Front desk not good taking feedback unfortunately. Better find another place for your stay!

title: Amazing stay
text: It was my first stay at this hotel and I was beyond impressed.  The location is great, the staff if amazing and the rooms stunning.  I do not have a single compliant or request for improvement.  I look forward to returning.

title: Quick Trip
text:
The staff and accommodations at the Dominick exceeded expectations in every way. I was especially impressed by the staff who were accommodating, professional, and always willing to help. 

The location of this hotel is also convenient and easy to access.

title: .happily surprised
text: I was extremely pleased with my recent stay at the DominicK. The location is amazing right in the heart of downtown n- every detail is thought of in the rooms the beds are so comfortable s crisp and clean I loved the efficiency of all the staff. We were staying to put my niece into college so we had  many items delivered to the hotel mail room which was a great help on the moving day he staff kindly helped us in every way possible the pool area and Hawaiian restare alsoo very nice I would definitely wanto come back here thanks everyone

title: Dennis and Steve... the engineering Gods!!
text:
we have been at this Most fabulous hotel in Greenwich Village all week and had a couple of non issue issues and Dennis and Steve have come to our rescue in no less than 2 minutes and beyond fixed the issues in No time! there weren't any real issues as this hotel is the greatest i have stayed in after visiting here over 30 years! thank you fabulous team. You 2 went above and beyond to help out and we so appreciate you and the lovely guest services for sending you up to the fabulous 31st floor. no lie... i love so many hotels in this great city but the Dominick is far and away my new home away from home !! everyone we have met this week has been 5+ stars .... every single one !
spa is fabulous too ! keep it up Dominick. we love you

title: Stay at the Dominick
text: I stayed at the Dominick twice with my family and Gaby from the front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating. She helped ensure our stay was very smooth! I will be recommending the Dominick to all my friends and family.

title: Thank you SYDEKA!
text: This hotel is THE best! Thank you to the lovely and fabulous desk agent SYDEKA for saving the day. We are so happy here. It is gorgeous and perfect in every way ❤️The corner king room is Big and gorgeous and has fabulous views. The staff is so wonderful and we will be staying here from now on in NYC

title: Excellent customer service
text: I transferred to The Dominick hotel after staying in the neighboring Hugo Hotel. This hotel is the same price and beyond compare to the Hugo. Excellent customer service and staff help in every aspect of your stay. I will be returning to The Dominick for all my future NYC trips.

title: L’excellente à un nom : The Dominick!
text:
Magnifique, ont autorise un early check in des 10h du matin sans extra, le personnel est extremmement aimable, les chambres tres propres, exceptionnel !

La piscine est parfaite pour se reposer, le service est impeccable, rien n’est laissé au hasard, la vue dans les chambres dediees en hauteur est epoustouflante !!

Tres bien situe, metro boulangerie et commerces a proximite. 

A recommander sans hesiter

title: Great ny stay
text:
Great location in soho. Quick access to all of lower Manhattan tribeca Wall Street etc. 

Had a room with a terrific view of the Hudson River and New Jersey across the way. 

Had some meetings in midtown and there can be traffic in both directions fyi. 

Staff very nice. Front desk and doormen are just the best. 

Overall great stay

title: Great Service
text: Great service and room views in SoHi floors. Truly 5 star service. Pricing for hotel pool bar and mezz bar is well above average, but every bell-hop and concierge made sure the stay was exceptional and remarkable.

title: My stay
text:
I stayed for one night while I did some work in the area. It was a very nice stay, other than the thin wall behind a door in room 2506.  
 I was woken up to the sound of a guest in the next room vomiting all night.
Other than that it is a beautiful place to stay.

title: Amazing staff and great location
text: The staff is top notch.  They know their job and they treat the customer with courtesy while providing outstanding service and advice. Every person we encountered, front desk, bellman, room service, doorman, all treated us like we were the most important guest to walk through the doors.   The location is great if you are interested in the SoHo area.  The rooms are a little dated but the view was unbelievable. It felt like you were staying in the sky.  Highly recommend.

title: One-night mini-vacation away from the kids
text:
This is the second time we stayed at the Dominick for a one-night get-away.  Great location, nice restaurant downstairs, lovely little outdoor pool, friendly staff.  We generally like it, but there is a slight lack of maintenance on the refined amenities: buttons to open the curtains didn't fully work, couldn't get AirPlay to work on the TV...  1% problems.

I had booked a higher floor, but we were upgraded to a suite on a lower floor, which we took.  Next time I'll keep the higher floor.  We were awakened at 4:45 AM to thumping, loud music.  We were above the pool, so thought it was there, or some club outside the hotel, but no, it was from a room above us.  Two calls to the front desk, and by 5:30 AM, we were still trying to go back to sleep.  We put on more white noise and used earplugs, but we could still hear it. Security confirmed the next day that it was a room above us playing loud music.  Why it took so long to get it under control is unknown; why we could hear it so well, but no one else next to them complained is also unknown, but it really soured our stay.

title: Dominick August 2022 stay
text:
Stayed at the Dominick for two weeks and it was wonderful. The entire stuff was wonderful but Paola at the friend desk truly made our stay and went above and beyond for us. 

Thank you Paola and hope to be back with you again soon!

Thank you
Xoxoxooxoxo

title: Convenient hotel albeit a bit dated
text: Location was convenient for Soho shopping and dining. Room was spacious. It was quite dated with lights and curtain switches not functioning properly at times.  Toilet was also clogged when we arrived.  Hotel service was helpful to have these fixed.  Nonetheless, it knocked a star out.

title: Unvergesslich schöner Aufenthalt
text:
Wir haben hier vier Nächte verbracht und uns eine SoHi Suite gegönnt. Das hat sich wirklich gelohnt. Sehr schöne Zimmer mit wahnsinns Aussicht und wenn unsere Reisekasse es zulassen würde, würden wir hier jederzeit wieder in der Suite übernachten. Toller Poolbereich. Übers Wochenende war es sehr voll wir haben aber trotzdem immer ein schattiges Plätzchen bekommen, auch wenn es leider keine Sonnenschirme gab.
Das Barrestaurant am Pool ist super und man kann es sich hier richtig gutgehen lassen. Die anderen Restaurants des Hotels haben wir nicht ausprobiert.
Die Mitarbeiter waren immer ausgesprochen freundlich und zuvorkommend

title: Loved our stay!
text: The rooms are very big as are the bathrooms. The housekeeping is perfection. And the best part for us on a sweltering august weekend was the beautiful pool on the 7th floor that we spent the day at on Saturday. Great location, great service, great views. Can’t wait to stay there again.

title: Maravillosas vistas
text:
Nos encantó el hotel, habitación muy amplia, y con unas vistas espectaculares. La piscina es un plan perfecto cuando llegas cansado de hacer turismo. Personal muy atento, y fácil encontrar personal que hable español. El restaurante también nos gustó, aunque un poco caro, y no del nivel de una estrella michelin como los de España
En general, muy recomendable.

title: Way overrated
text: Not sure how this hotel gets its rating, but we had a very disappointing two night stay, especially relative to price and ratings.  Of note:  lobby is dark, poorly laid out and kind of dreary; our room was worn (rug stains) and bathroom was marginally dirty (eg., ball of hair on the floor); automatic curtains don't work (must be common issue as they have a chart of rooms with this problem); we were on a mid-teens floor on the Varick Ave side and noise from construction started at 5am; and finally, bed is placed directly in the path of air conditioning blower making it really uncomfortable as the unit switched on and off all night.

title: Superbe
text:
Un emplacement parfait pour visiter le sud de Manhattan.

Les chambres(suites) offrent des vues superbes et un équipement de grande qualité.
Le personnel est efficace, souriant et discret.
La (petite) piscine extérieure ajoute une note de fraîcheur très sympa au séjour dans Soho.
Une salle de fitness bien équipée est également à disposition.

Bravo !

title: Spectacular Stay
text: From the moment we were warmly greeted by Jose Guichardo at the front desk— who is marvelous- to the beautiful suite views of The City and our departure it was nothing less than impeccable service! Highly recommended if you want to have a tie luxury NYC experience.

title: Increíble
text:
Me encanto!! La habitación amplia, muy distinto a lo qué hay  en NU. Cama y almohadas exquisitas. Baño increíble con productos bulgari . En La piscina siempre había espacio a pesar de que eran días muy calurosos y la atención increíble.
El hall y todo el hotel en general muy lindo y moderno

title: Life Changing Moment
text:
I chose the Dominick after looking at every hotel in the city... this one really stood out and my selection could not of been better. Huge thanks first to Anna, Tiffany and Nicole... all of you worked with me to insure the most amazing moment in my life proposing to the love of my life who i found in NYC and we met for the first time during my stay. The attention to detail and the support EVERYONE at the Dominick is why i can honestly say that there is NO other place for us now... the spa was amazing .... the food was amazing... they set up all our dinner reservations outside of the hotel especially the proposal dinner at The Cut who's staff was also told this was a surprise engagement and the love and kindness with free champagne and flowers and chocolate covered strawberries in the room upon our arrival set the tone... honestly it was a whirlwind every moment was so precious. The room service was amazing and housekeeping... the pool area was really nice but on the day not to nice out... no worries the tub in the room looking out on the city truly took the romance to another level.

With all our hearts we are forever grateful for this life changing experience and it was worth the wait for both of us to find each other and express our love in the most amazing hotel. God Bless all of you and management running such a great hotel with amazing staff who went above and beyond always. We will be returning for sure we are both thrilled and thankful i made the right choice big time.

Sincerely, 
Christopher & Koko

title: Return to NYC
text: The staff could not be more accommadating, courteous and professional. The room was confortable and well serviced. The hotel lacks a cocktail lounge and the breakfast needs to be more inviting. We will be back.

title: Amazing NYC stay!
text: The Dominick is in such a great location with even better staff and services. Check in and out was smooth and timely. Lots of places to explore around the hotel as most things are walking distance. Close to the train for any other travel needs.

title: Dominick Delight
text: Comfortable bed and LOVED the nespresso machine big time. Pool was a bonus and staff was friendly and kind.  Was in town on business and flew in to Newark so it was a close commute in that was an unexpected delight. Would definitely recommend for business or personal travel

title: Stanley is the best!
text:
Overall a great hotel!! The pool/ spa is great, rooms are wonderful, and a killer location. 

I have to shout out Stanley at the valet stand. Truly an awesome guy. So kind and helpful. The type of person to make your day!

title: Wonderful Saturday stay at The Dominick Hotel
text:
I love staying at this wonderful five star hotel. We were able to check in early. We spent a lovely afternoon poolside at the hotel's pool! Food and beverage service was excellent. After the pool, we returned to our beautifully appointed room. Room service dining was very good. 

I highly recommend staying here.

title: Splendid hotel!
text: Staff is very friendly, rooms are very spacious. Great views and great location. It is my 5th stay at The Dominick! Always had great time and we keep on exploring the restaurants and shops of Spring street.

title: Feels like a small Boutique hotel
text: Planning my 3rd visit to the Dominick Hotel this weekend...this is the only place I stay in NY...traveling from Chicago...Each time I've stayed, I've been greeted by the smile, warmth, and accommodating personality of Gabriela at the front desk...I called to see if she still works at the Dominick, and she answered...I have some special requests traveling with children, and once again, smile, warmth, and accommodation over the phone from a long time customer service professional.  Thank you Gabriela and thank you Dominick...looking forward to seeing you again!

title: beautiful view
text:
lovely room 
bed had very comfortable blankets and sheets.
location in SOHO was very convenient to visit downtown and find our way uptown too.  Close to the NYC High line. 
If you have time ask a hotel person bring you up to a higher level floor to get the best views.
Great view of the One World Trade Center

title: Teures Frühstück, Preise Minibar unklar
text: Unser Aufenthalt in New York hat uns gut gefallen, einen Schock haben wir höchstens nach einem Frühstück erlitten, wo alleine der Orangensaft 50 $ gekostet hat. Gesamthaft mit Tipp für zwei Eier, eine Schnitte Brot und Fruchtsalat und Orangensaft 170 $ war schon übermässig viel. Scheinbar ist ein Refuel nicht mehr gratis. Womöglich hätten wir uns besser informieren müssen. Nur das nach Chlor  stinkende Wasser ist gratis. Bei einem fünf Sterne Haus, wo wir über 4000 Dollar ausgegeben haben, hätte man das erwarten können. Das auffüllen der Minibar hat zweimal nicht geklappt und auch hier waren die Preise nicht transparent. Der Schock kam dann bei der Abrechnung.

title: Unforgettable Experience
text: Our family's experience at The Dominick was unforgettable.  From the welcome as we pulled up to the goodbye when we left, we were cared for with world class service the entire time.  Our room was incredible, with views of the entire city and amazing touches of luxury. The food was outstanding and the service excellent. When we return to NYC, we will undoubtedly be returning to The Dominick.

title: Friendly and secure
text: Wonderful hotel located in Soho with a tremendous view of the city. Warm welcome every time we got back to the hotel - and were spoiled with iced cold water during this hot summer time - and room service was excellent.

title: Happy business traveler
text: I researched about 5 nearby hotels to choose one for a business trip. I chose this one for the simple but elegant design and square footage (I compared). I’ve stayed in matchbox sized rooms in NY and never again. The Dominick impressed me. I was on a lower floor per my request (I hate waiting on elevators) and Gabriela upgraded me at check in to a suite. It was very spacious and the bathroom was amazing. All of the features were very classy and I loved the elegant details in the bathroom with the large walk in shower, full size tub,  gorgeous tile, pull out seat, lighted mirrors and double sinks. The bed was also very comfortable. Will definitely stay again and ask for Gabriela who was gracious and kind.

title: Relaxation in a big city
text: I really got to rest during my stay at the Dominick. The staff was amazing, caring and the service went the extra mile. The pool is also relaxing and a beautiful atmosphere. The aesthetic is lovely. The whole experience was of an oasis. The Concierge helped me with wonderful dinner reservations. I had a lovely stay.

title: Un rêve éveillé
text: Un séjour extraordinaire dans un hôtel grandiose. Une vue exceptionnelle à couper le souffle sur NY. De jour comme de nuit, un ravissement, un rêve éveillé !  Un service irréprochable, des gens attentionnés, souriants et d'une grande amabilité. Un souvenir à jamais gravé. Merci

title: Amazing
text:
I guess it was a great experience ,in family ,cause the location is perfect,the service is amazing,and you are in the middle of everything in Manhattan.
Surround the Hotel you have a lot restaurants,coffes ,shops and plus
So is perfect

title: Sobel
text: Great hotel! Will definitely stay again! Our room was great with great views. Service was great. Room service very timely and friendly. We loved the location and can’t wait to come back to try the restaurant!

title: Quel désastre
text: La vue de l’hôtel est merveilleuse mais le service ne suit pas, la réception de nuit est un désastre absolu, pas de personnel disponible et quand il l’est, il est d’une nullité crasse, surtout au regard du prix des chambres, un vrai désastre en terme d’image

title: Electric and tv issues
text: Dennis and John L were efficient professional timely and handled all issues that I had with the upmost professionalism. When I found most impressive they were courteous respectful and understanding the time of night and I need it for the issues taken care of in a swiftly manner. There’s no question with that type of commitment to this hotel shows me The steps of service level every aspect of their work.

title: Prompt, Knowledgeable, and Professional
text: We stayed at The Dominick while setting my daughter up in her new apartment. Great location, views, and friendly staff! We noticed our room’s air conditioning had an issue and called engineering at 11pm the first night. Dennis and Steve responded within 10 minutes and solved the problem very quickly. Although it was 11pm, they were cheerful and answered all our questions about the neighborhood and the buildings we could see from our windows.

title: Special thanks to DENNIS & DOMINICK
text:
We ❤️DENNIS & DOMINICK. It is rare that people take the time to thank the people behind the scenes. These two gentlemen deserve a raise for their dedication and kindness to the guests at the DOMINICK. 
After going to dinner we came back to a boiling 🥵 hot room. The fridge and air were broken. It was late and would take time to fix and DENNIS & DOMINICK did not waste a minute and came to our rescue. So respectful and courteous they came and changed out the unit instead of trying to fix the existing one. They knew we were tired and wanted to quickly get things up and running. They were so fast and didn’t leave until they knew we were happy 😃. So remember to reach out and say thank you to those that go ABOVE AND BEYOND their jobs. So THANK YOU. 👏🏻  
I just thought you should know that THE DOMINICK is a spectacular hotel and so are the people that work there. 
See you next trip.

title: Perfection!!!
text: WOW!  Everything was total perfection with this stay. I could not be happier.  I lived in NYC for over a decade and have stayed in many hotels there since and this is hands down my fave.  Big shout out to Gabriela!!!  Who was super kind and made this single woman business traveler feel even more comfortable and at home.  Room was huge, bathroom huge, pool awesome, bed so comfortable, shower amazing, toiletries high quality, but the staff were all over the top kind, helpful, friendly, polite.  Cannot wait to come back here with my hub / girls trip / business.  Thank you all!!!!!!!  What a treat!  PS - obviously the location is amazing too but thought id mention :)

title: Very busy hotel, good location but horrible wifi
text: The hotel has an excellent location in Soho close to all the high end shopping and nice restaurants. We stayed in the one bedroom suite with a nice sized bathroom. We stayed for 5 days and on the last two days the wifi did not work at all and the IT people were unable to fix it. The gym is also a decent size but the pool is very small.

title: Our favorite New York hotel.
text: The entire staff makes you feel welcome.  Our room was spacious and quiet.  We loved sitting by the pool for a couple hours.  And breakfast in the hotel was delicious.  The service throughout was everything you would expect from a five star hotel.

title: 4 Nights with family
text: The hotel is in a great location - especially if you intend on staying mostly downtown. The staff provided great service. Rooms offer excellent views- especially those on the higher floors. Rooms are getting a bit tired and could use refreshing.

title: Luxury hotel with great rooftop pool
text: Meets all expectations of a luxury 5-star hotel. Amazing rooms, bed, views, service, etc. Rooftop pool is great although certain elements there fall short of a true 5-star. Only other issue was them not honouring my Preferred Hotel status with an enhanced upgrade due to “high occupancy” but then they offered me the opportunity to pay for an upgrade and the hotel didn’t seem very busy, so that was a bit of a turn off right away but then was impressed by everything else. Breakfast in hotel was fantastic each morning. Will definitely only stay here moving fwd.

title: The best hotel in NYC!
text:
Every time my husband and I are traveling to New York we always stay at The Dominick. This is the best hotel in the city! It is conveniently located in SoHo which has tons of shops, restaurants, and things to do nearby. Rooms are very clean, spacious and are equipped with a Nespresso machine, a microvalve, and even a tablet that allows you to order additional amenities without calling the front desk. Besides, the gym is fantastic! It even has a Peloton bike!

This time we stayed for a week and had a seamless check-in as usual. We were greeted at the door by door and bell staff who are very friendly and helpful, especially Chris and Marek. They were always there for us, ready to assist in all that we may need whether it is getting a car or directions. The front desk experience was even more flawless! We got a room in less than a minute and absolutely loved it! We also had to check out for a couple of days and come back and were concerned that this could be an issue since we didn’t book directly with the hotel. However, Gaby at the front desk explained what we needed to do and was able to resolve the issue very effortlessly and quickly! She was very kind, professional and knowledgeable, and picked an even better room with Hudson river view for us so that we could enjoy the Fourth of July fireworks.

This hotel really has all a traveler could need. And, if there is something that we’d wish to have we simply called housekeeping and talked to Mona. She’d make sure we receive that very needed steamer or extra hangers in a matter of minutes. 

We can’t wait to start planning for the next trip to NYC and look forward to staying at the Dominick again.

title: Great visit
text: We really enjoyed our visit to The Dominick. The views were incredible. The pool was a little crowded because there was a birthday party going on but the staff did their best to find us chairs and it’s a great space. Shon at the front desk was outstanding. We plan to return in a couple of weeks.

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: I absolutely love staying at The Dominick. I come to NYC once or twice a month for work, and have stayed at a whole bunch of hotels in lower Manhattan. The Dominick is hands down my favorite. It has great amenities, a fantastic restaurant, and a lovely atmosphere. The staff are very friendly and greet you warmly like an old friend. Gabriela, in particular, always makes me feel like I'm returning home after a long trip. The rooms are luxurious and make you feel very pampered. I'm always happy when I arrive and always slightly sad when it's time to check out. Looking forward to my next visit!

title: Vacaciones
text: The hotel is very nice the new gym it’s a plus also the restaurant by the pool El takoy it’s excellent.. food was a fresh and flavorful. We will come back to enjoy all the amenities service and especially the food by the pool

title: Some inconvenients , but overall very good
text: I love this  hotel for the location and helpfulness of the staff , this stay however we encountered some inconveniences with the -WIFI and the elevators , staff was very helpful through the  inconviniences , however we were almost a the full weekend without wifi and had to come down the stairs a couple of times due to the elevators not working

title: Amazing hotel, location, and awesome service!
text: Wonderful stay in the heart of Soho. The room was super clean and had nice amenities but what really blew me away was the warmth and friendliness of the staff. For example, when I asked Brendan at the host stand where I could get a cup of tea late at night because my throat was sore - he popped back in the kitchen and made it himself, wished me a good night and said "this one is on the house we hope you feel better" - Wow! At checkout I met the two people who run this place Justine and Sebastian, it was clear that they put a great emphasis on making sure they take care of their team. I cant wait to come back.

title: Grossartiges Hotel - tolle Stimmung
text: Wir waren 3 Nächte in diesem tollen Hotel. Sehr freundliches Team, schöne, komfortable Zimmer, coole Swimming-Pool Anlage. Die Lage zwischen Greenwich Village, West-Village und Tribeca ist perfekt. Wir kommen wieder.

title: Love this Hotel!!
text:
Every interaction I had at the hotel has been positive. Id like to specifically point out that Raquel was truly special. She made sure my fiancé and I had an incredible experience for our anniversary. All the staff were truly the best from start to finish. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and luxurious. Location is awesome. We are definitely going back whenever in nyc. 

-Alan

title: The best customer service of ANY hotel in USA
text:
Great room and outstanding customer service in a wonderful location
We had a great suite with separate air conditioning ,wonderful size 
and all the amenities in the right places.
Immediate responses to room service, engineering, and housekeeping

title: Sanctuary in SoHo
text:
Comfortable and lovely room , lots of light and warmth
Plenty of hanging space 
Unfortunately, no tea or kettle in room so unable to it, reception said they did not allow electric kettles in the room and tea was not provided, which is strange when you pay a fee to have coffee pods.

title: Incredible service and care thanks to Mohendra!
text: I have been coming to the Dominick for many years now and always come back because Mohendra delivers time and time again. This trip I had family visiting from London and he sorted us all out during a very busy time. Can't thank him and the team enough for creating a home away from home for us.  Looking forward to next time!! - Gina and family

title: Always perfect. Thank you Mohendra and team
text:
We’ve been coming here for 10 years now (when it was the Trump by name only) and on one occasion have we ever been disappointed for any reason. From the moment you arrive, Marek, Chris, Elvis and the men at the door could not be more genuinely caring about your experience. 
Mohendra and the team at the desk are incredible to say the least and always manage to get us in our room early or at least on time. In this day and age with COVID protocols this is a tall order. 
The property is the best in soho and deserves 6 stars if possible.

title: Increíble service
text: I came here a few weeks ago and decided to return mainly because of the service. In particular Gabriela at the front desk, who went above and beyond to make us feel at home during a family trip.  The rooms are very comfortable and the location is excellent.

title: A special stay in Soho
text: Luxurious room in great location. I booked this room through Amex FHR.  We were accommodated with an early noon check-in and upgraded to a higher floor.  We appreciated the view and macaroons waiting for us in a luxurious king bed room.  The hotel is in an ideal location, close to the subway, Trader Joe’s, a park for lunch like a local, assorted restaurants and of course shopping.  It’s a lively area and I’d be happy to stay again.  The 2nd floor lounge was comfortable and service was friendly and quick when we had drinks and an appetizer before heading to a show.  We both thought breakfast was disappointing, and it was just a standard eggs and bacon meal. Overall a great stay. Our one hiccup was the bill.  I checked out at the front desk the day of departure with no additional charges on the bill. You pay in advance with AMEX FHR.  However after checking my monthly statement, I realized the hotel charged my card for the stay too. AMEX is fixing and I’m sure this is atypical as service was consistently high throughout our enjoyable stay.

title: BEST hotel in NYC - Thanks to Gabriela at the Front Desk
text:
The Dominick is hands down the best hotel in NYC! I've been staying here for years thanks to the incredible hospitality, most importantly the staff. Everyone is very kind, but Gabriela is the most kind, helpful women I've ever met. From recommending great places in the area, to making the check in process seamless, and so much more, I look forward to seeing her smiling face every time I visit!
Highly recommend staying at The Dominick if you're looking for a beautiful hotel in a great location with the best service!

title: Loved every minute!!
text: Best service in New York. We love this hotel. The staff could not be nicer!!! Our room was exceptional. Every detail was first class. The staff at the pool are amazing and so attentive. Check in easy, great room service too.

title: magnifique
text:
chambre magnifique avec vue imprenable sur NEW YORK,Soho... accueil parfait, personnel bienveillant et aux petits soins
litterien et mobilier de qualité.
nous avons passé un merveilleux séjour chez vous!

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text: We travelled to NYC as a family of five with three teenagers in May half term and stayed in interconnecting rooms (a 1-bed suite with seating area where my daughter slept on the double sofa bed, and a second bedroom shared by my two sons - one in the king sized bed, and the other on a rollaway single) on the 20th floor. With the rooms on two sides of a corner, we had incredible views over the river to one side and the city the other - was really special. The hotel is great....very clean, friendly and attentive staff, spacious rooms, great storage, fab little outdoor pool with comfortable seating area, excellent location - walking distance to many of the tourist places we visited, and some great restaurants and shopping nearby. Would thoroughly recommend. The only slight drawbacks were the lack of a bar, and the fact that the 1-bed suite bathroom had no door!!! None of the kids were keen to use it! Luckily we also had the bathroom next door, plus an additional WC, so worked out fine. We found some great breakfast restaurant options nearby - Balthazar, The Butcher's Daughter and Three of Cups. We didn't try the hotel restaurant or room service, but made good use of the Starbucks opposite for takeaway hot drinks etc and Trader Joe's for bottles of water and snacks. Very happy with our choice and was a great base for a brilliant and busy few days exploring the city

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
I stayed for three nights on business. From the doorman to the front desk to the phone operator and even engineering I was greeted in a friendly, caring, and professional manner. The room was nicely appointed, spacious, had a nice view of the Hudson, and the bed was comfortable. 

A special shout out to a few people at the hotel, first Marlene at the front desk who addressed my room needs. Wow, what a responsive pleasant person who followed up to make sure I was happy with the room. And thank you to Dylan and Jose with engineering who quickly attended to unexpected issues in my room. They knew exactly what to do and cared about my satisfaction. And Maria, the hotel operator, who directed my calls. So nice and friendly. And Richard, who exchanged my room keys and helped with my inquiries. Thank you sir. Impressive staff who all understand customer service and delight.

title: above and beyond
text: my husband and i stayed at the dominick hotel last night for a staycation.  i cannot say enough incredible things about this hotel.  the service and staff are the most friendly and helpful.  the rooms are huge and comfortable.  the views on the upper floors are fabulous, with floor to ceiling windows.  location in soho is super convenient for shopping and dining, so many great restaurants and boutiques.  food at the hotel was fantastic too, had room service for lunch, the chicken sandwich and huge vegetable salad with chicken was fresh and tasty.  will definitely be returning!

title: Best Room Views
text: My boyfriend and I went to New York last week. We haven’t travelled in years due to Covid so this was also a nice stress relief from being a nurse. To start off, our concierge was friendly and had amazing service! I believe his name is Michael, he was the one wearing a white arm sling. He made the check-in process easy and quick, especially after being in the car for a long period of time. After having this experience, I had high hopes for The Dominick. We were lucky and grateful to have our room upgraded to the 38th floor with one of the best room views I have ever seen. I was in awe with the bedroom views, how spacious and clean the room was.  We were welcomed with a bowl of fruits and a lovely card. The card had a mistake on my name but that’s okay. These small gestures made the stay a better one. The view was beautiful during sunset. The area felt safe to walk around. Overall, I recommend staying here and would come back the next time I visit NYC. Thank you for everything :-)

title: No bar and no gym
text:
At the last minute I changed my booking from the Mercer to the Dominick on the basis that it had a full gym. 
On arrival we received a note to our room that the gym was out of action for refurbishment.
Wherever we are we like to go to the hotel bar at the end of a day out and again after getting back to the hotel from dinner.  There is no bar!  I have never stayed anywhere where there is no bar.  There is a lounge where one can order drinks until 10:30 but that is no good after dinner.
The rooms are big for NYC but looking a bit tired.

title: Incredible Customer Service
text: I usually don’t write reviews but this is my first stay at the Dominick and Gabriela B at the front desk took such amazing care of me. Because she noticed I was staying for four nights, she upgraded me to a gorgeous suite. Gabriela, you made my entire week! Thank you for the great customer service, I will definitely stay here again in the future. Stanley was also very welcoming and friendly!

title: My NYC Home Away from Home
text:
After living in NCY for over a decade, it was a challenge to find the right place to stay when I go back.  I tried several hotels that didn't fit the bill, but after my first (of many) stay at The Dominick, it immediately became my new NYC home.  

The most notable thing about TD is the level of service. I'd give it 6 stars if I could.  From the doormen the moment you step in, to the desk agents (especially Gabriela), to guest services and everyone else.  They are friendly, pleasant, warm and incredibly accommodating!  

The rooms are well appointed (including a discrete microwave and shelves, with small bar sink) spacious and tastefully decorated. The beds, sheet and towels are comfortable and clean. The blowdryers are fine, but could be better. The mini-bar has a solid selection.  The lavendar chocolate (and water) at turndown are nice treat.  The rooms are very clean, and well-maintained but some have small wear & tear that need attention (e.g. wall paper coming up in a corner).

Guest and room services are promptly delivered and attended to. Room service (and all 3 restaurants) are delicious with great service and nice range of items (though a rather pricy).  The pool area and grill is a real treat on a nice day to be able to take a swim while in the heart of NYC and looking at the building and skyline. The frozen drinks alone at the pool grill make it worth t visit. 

As hotel gyms go, the Dominic has a great one. Very easy to get in any type of workout you need (and I'm rather particular about gyms). If you want more, there is a Barry's Bootcamp just down the street, and and Equinox the other direction. 

The neighborhood is very convenient.  Situated between Soho, Tribeca and Hudson Square, there are lot of great restaurants and shops in walking distance, with a Starbucks and Trader Joe's right across the street, a Sweetgreens down the street, and short walk into Soho one of my favorite men's wear shops, Thom Sweeney.  Both the 1.2.3 and A.C.E subway lines are just a couple blocks away, providing each and fast access up and further downtown.  

All is all, The Dominic knows how to treat a guest well, and create a consistent hotel experience worth going back for time and again!

title: Amazing Stay in NYC
text: Traveled to NYC last week and stayed at the Dominick. This hotel is stellar! The doormen are wonderful and helpful, always asking if we needed help or directions. The front desk staff were also great. Housekeeping was always friendly and on it. In room dining food was great, prompt and delicious. Loved the robes, comfortable bed. Just a really upscale place. I'd definitely call this a luxurious hotel, but also not pretentious in any way. Located right in Soho a couple of blocks from some of New York's best shopping with cobblestone streets and great restaurants. I just don't have a single complaint. Book and stay here. You won't regret it.

title: Great Front Desk Service
text:
I stay here often. I am most impressed by the front desk service , namely Gabriela B. She always greets me with a smile and has accommodated me many times when I need to make last minute changes to my reservations. Always a pleasure to deal with. 
Rooms are spacious. Gym is clean. 
I will continue to stay here on my frequent business trips

title: Friends and the City!
text: I had such a great time at the Dominick! Gaby helped me at check in and I highly recommend upgrading your room to a Sohi room if it’s available. Fabulous view of New York City!! Friendly staff and excellent service.  It was so nice to be back!

title: Huge shout out to Gabriela
text:
The moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted by an incredibly kind doorman who welcomed me to the hotel and walked me to the lobby. The hotel is esthetically pleasing and cozy. They also have a Michelin star restaurant located in the hotel (haven’t tried it myself but heard really great things). 

Gabriela who helped me check in literally made my stay 10000/10! She was super easy to talk to and made me feel very welcomed. Not only was she personable but she was helpful in all the right ways. I typically don’t write reviews but my experience was so out of this world ,  I had to share it. If you need a place to stay in SOHO, a great area, great service , amazing rooms, and so SO SO clean (I’m a little bit of a self proclaimed germaphobe), book the Dominick!!

title: Amazing  hotel in Soho
text:
Simply the perfect staying in Soho !  
The hotel was very clean, the room super comfortable , the staff very kind and perfect location in Soho ! 
I will be back   to the Dominick on my next trip to NYC !!!!!

title: Fabulous
text:
Awesome stay . Initially Booked into different hotel , wanted valet parking  . When we arrived they told us it was “ self valet” parking …. Took 45 minutes to get refund from the Hotel then drove around the block to the Dominick . Front desk staff welcoming. Excellent service, great room service ( crab cakes and breakfast outstanding) 
Room large very comfortable beautifully appointed.  Lovely coffee bar in room . 
Very well located for soho Tribeca shopping! Felt safe secure -
Will be back

title: Hôtel parfait!
text:
J’ai récemment séjourné au Dominick dans une suite Sohi avec mes 2 enfants et nous avons été émerveillés par cette chambre! La vue est à couper le souffle, un véritable spectacle au lever comme au coucher! La taille de la chambre est grande pour New York, avec en prime une baignoire face à cette sublime vue et un lit très confortable. Le personnel est très aimable et serviable. L’hôtel est idéalement situé, en plein Soho, permettant de faire beaucoup de choses à pied. Nous avons pris nos petit-déjeuners chez Pi Bakery juste à côté de l’hôtel - délicieux produits.
Je vous recommande à 200% cet hôtel!

title: Great Service Great Stay
text: Arrived for a four night stay at the Dominick from April 12th - 16th. Gabriella was friendly and welcoming at the front desk and helped us with several unexpected opportunities. During our stay, we had the pleasure to speak with Chris and Stanley at the front desk and both of these men were amazing. Very service focused and friendly, and once again, elevated our experience every day were were there with helpful advice, directions, and  a smile. Our was on the 22nd floor and it was very comfortable and we enjoyed the view as well. Another great visit to the "Big Apple".

title: Business trip
text: I love love this hotel. It is walking distance to SOHO and easily located in the middle of everything. It is a full service hotel and their service is impeccable. From the doorman to the concierge, to the hostess in VESTRY and room service. I will definitely stay here whenever I fly to NY. I am IN LOVE with this hotel. You definitely get the service and amenities for what you pay for. Love the toiletries from Bvlgari as well. Bonus on that. Can't wait to come here again!

title: Wonderful stay
text:
In particular the beds are amazing, extremely comfortable. The cleaning is great and Mohendra at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful, great service!
Also the steam room was fantastic!!!!!

title: Welcoming stay
text: What makes this hotel so special is the wonderful friendly staff that aims to please their guests.  The standout staff member is  the front desk agent Gabriella who is so helpful and so friendly to everyone. She goes out of her way to make guests feel special and welcome.  The rooms are a nice size for NYC and have really nice sized bathrooms.  The higher floors have fantastic views. The downside is that the rooms can feel a bit corporate and the decor could use some refreshing but overall a great stay

title: Overpriced. Dated. Limited services. Not great.
text: Very outdated and overpriced. No drink services in lobby and small public food/bev lounge on mezzanine looks like an airport waiting area. Last call very early on Saturday night with sloppy service. Vacuum cleaners on in lounge at 10pm Sat pm to clear patrons which was appalling! Skip this one for sure too many other nice options in 2022

title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay
text:
The Dominick Hotel was located in SOHO which was a great location.  From the doormen to the front desk to the room service staff, everyone was fantastic and personable.  We were upgraded to room 3311 and what a magnificent view we had of New York City.  The bed was super comfortable and the room was quite large.

Highly recommend!

title: Awesome retreat in NYC!
text:
On a recommendation from a friend, we stayed at The Dominick in SoHo for my wife’s birthday, what an awesome experience! From the doorman, Merck, to the restaurant host, Taylor, to our waiter for dinner and late night snack, Fernando, to the front desk, Neferteri, we were treated 1st class. We go to NYC often and this was by far our favorite hotel and experience. 5 stars plus!! Planning a trip back for this summer. Thanks to everyone at The Dominick!
Ed L.

title: Great hote staff
text: The hotel is really well located! Rooms are very clean, cleaning/room service always does a great job. We had a problem with the first room, which was solves really quick by Mr. Mohendra Hallal. We had a great long staying there thanks to him.

title: Mixed bag
text: Staff excellent rooms nice and I tried suite and regular but I just don’t understand NO DOOR on a bathroom.  this alone regretfully will keep me from staying here again.  Coffee wasn’t available until 7am.  So those flying or leaving early were left without - should be available from 5am and continental.  Light controls in rooms I hate in the bathroom.  Let’s just go back to switches.  There is a dark area over desk in rooms and over lighting is difficult to turn on and off.  Room service is timely at 30 mins but food was not exceptional.  The best asset to this hotel is its staff especially the valets of all things.  They set the pace and Chris and Felix new my name and even ran down the block without me requesting to get a cup of coffee.  That gets a A+ and a first!!

title: Unbelievable service!
text: I love the Dominick solely because of the staff. Mohendra at reception always makes this home when I visit. I come for work frequently and exclusively stay here now due to his hospitality. You won't regret staying here!

title: Sets the standard
text: The staff is terrific, and the views to die for.  Lovely and elegant, yet still modern and hip---this hotel really has it covered.  We loved the staff---in the Mezzanine bar, as well as the bellmen, everyone takes pride in the hotel.  Our room was outstanding.  We will overlook the nicks on the furniture, as we were loving the bathroom and the view.  Great location and excellent place to stay.

title: great location great experience
text: We wen t for a spring weekend an could not have been happier with our experience.  The staff , the room and hotel services all contributed to a great weekend.  The location was great for all of out NYC activities

title: Good experience
text:
Booked here by chance after decideing to switch hotels during my last NY trip. 
The hotel is really good looking from the inside and feels new and updated. 
The technologial amenities in the room where just great. 

What the place lacks imo is that the hotel feels brand new and maybe lacks a bit of atmosphere. Staff also felt new and akward in some way. So despite having a good experience i just didnt feel like a valued guest or something like that.

title: My home in NYC
text: I love The Dominick, my preferred choice of stay every-time I am in town. The spacious rooms, amazing staff, and excellent service, makes this place home away from home. Special thanks goes to everyone I have interacted with, from bell boys, front desk, housekeeping, room service and all, you have been wonderful.

title: Nice luxury hotel
text:
The hotel is very nice and they even upgrade my room. But I think they are short staffed and the wait at the restaurant for breakfast and at the front desk are unusually long. I waited for 30 minutes in line to speak to someone at the front desk, finally I had to leave because my uber ride was waiting. 

The room was great and the views from the 37th floor were breathtaking.

title: Best place
text:
Hotel espetacular! Localização incrível, atendimento nota 10, limpeza 10, conforto 10
Só ficarei nesse hotel em Ny! Recomento!
Fácil acesso, metrô na porta, cafeteria, restaurante premiado! Adoramos nossa estadia, não poderia ser melhor!!!

title: Fantastic!
text: The Dominick proved to be the perfect hotel for our trip to NYC. From checkin with Mohendra, our ins and outs with Chris B, and Eleanor who be provided us with a personal aerial tour of the city- couldn’t have asked for more! Everyone on staff was so wonderful! Will be back without question….many times in the future! Thank you!!!

title: Best Hotel Service Ever
text:
When we arrived, the bellhop was friendly, quick, and very helpful. All the staff was amazing. The concierge upgraded our room to the Sohi room on the 37th floor. The views were breathtaking. 

The room was accommodating. There were 3 phones. One is even in the toilet room. The TV is large and swivels so you can enjoy tv from bed. The desk has all your important connections like hdmi, rca, and Ethernet. They even provide you with an Ethernet cable. 

We were also credited $93 towards room service. The food was excellent. They even have microwaves in the room in case your food gets cold. 

The robes were comfortable. The bed and pillows were comfy. House keeping showed up in less than 3 minutes of my request. It was unbelievable. We used housekeeping once on our 3 day stay and they did an amazing job. We love this Hotel and will stay here from now on.

title: Great Stay
text: The location, the friendly staff and the ambiance all make this the perfect place to stay in NY.  I have stayed here many times and will definitely return.  I highly recommend the hotel to travelers looking for a great luxury experience.

title: Another wonderful visit
text: The Dominick is becoming my preferred and favorite stay while visiting New York. From the service, to the location, to the rooms, it's always an amazing stay. They are always accommodating! Looking forward to my next stay later this year. Thanks Dominick & team!

title: Birthday trip
text: Visited NYC for the weekend and the service, room and location was excellent. Stanley greeted us at the door and the front desk was great in making sure all of our needs were met. Perfect location for shopping in SOHO and easily accessible via multiple train line. Would highly recommend.

title: Review
text: The hotel staff is great and the hotel is clean. Furniture in the room is starting to look warn and might need an update. the hotel doesn't offer loyalty program which is a shame - as my husband and i really enjoy this hotel and location.

title: A Delightful Stay
text: Shon and Mahatma at the front desk could not have been more helpful and courteous. Chris at the from door went above and beyond.  Eddie, a porter, gave excellent advice. Our room was excellent and kept in great condition. The meals in the restaurant were good although service can be a bit slow.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Great location for our family! Trader Joes right across the street and great restaurants within walking distance. Hotel was clean and well-maintained. Staff was friendly, knowledgable and helpful during our stay. Highly recommend!

title: Easy and convenient
text: We had a great stay. I was allowed to check in early, and the staff was wonderful the whole trip. Housekeepers all absolutely polite and kind, you don’t see that much anymore. The elevators alittle slow but still manageable

title: Great Front Desk!
text:
The customer service was amazing
Gabriela at front desk got us in a great room especially after long travel. Great room and kind upon arrival. The lobby is beautiful and the staff throughout has been very inviting. Definitely would come back and stay again

title: Gabriela is the best!!
text:
She made sure that my brother‘s wedding stay was completely taken care of from A-to-Z thank you so much Gabriella!

A few things were taken care of complementary which is awesome and unnecessary again thank you so much Gabriella!

title: Beautiful Hotel, Good Location, Bad Staff
text:
The hotel is beautiful and the views were spectacular. Good location. I happened to stay there during fashion week, so it was a bit busier than usual. The neighbourhood is nice and very walkable. The staff are not what you expect from a 5-star hotel: expect for them to walk in on you naked. 

I arrived at the hotel early (~2 pm or so) after flying since 5 am that morning and my room wasn't ready, which was fine. They were able to store my baggage while I waited in the lobby then walked around Soho for a couple of hours. It was check-in time and my room still wasn't ready. I waited an hour or so more and it still wasn't ready. There were no other rooms or upgrades available. The front desk offered me a complimentary room so I could change and shower while my room was getting prepared.  I wasn't completely happy with this but there was no real alternative. After I showered and was exiting the bathroom, a hotel staff member (I assume a bellman) entered the room unannounced while I was naked. After I got dressed, I went down to the lobby to inform the front desk of this. I was told that there was nothing they could do because I booked through a third-party website. I was understandably upset and had to plead with them for something; still nothing until my boyfriend intervened and voiced his concerns. I was eventually told that they would offer me $200 in complimentary room service/restaurant charges off my incidental bill after my stay. 

My boyfriend and I stayed for over a week and our stay was fine, but not up to the standard we're used to at comparable hotels near Central Park in terms of treatment from the staff. 

We spent several hundred dollars on room service and hotel restaurants, but there was only $100 taken off the bill I received via email once I was home. I emailed and called the hotel several times about this but never got a response. This, again, is not in line with the type of treatment I've received from the Park Hyatt or the Ritz.

title: What a wonderful staff & experience!
text: From making the first reservation to being taken care of every single day personally by *Gabby (who is WONDERFUL!) at the front desk and then the awesome Lindsey and concierge… The Dominick is now my new favorite hotel in New York! Thank you for hiring such a great staff and for such a wonderful experience!!

title: Classy and Excellent Hotel
text: Excellent hotel for those of you who need to stay near Hudson street. The hotel also offers a great restaurant and is very well located. The quality of the rooms and the noise level inside is very good. Great place to rest up and relax..

title: Beautiful Room & Experience
text: Booked this hotel through the AMEX Fine Hotels & Resorts Program. It did not disappoint. The check-in process was smooth - my girlfriend and I found Gabriella to be extremely helpful in getting us settled and giving us an overview of the hotel. The room had gorgeous views of the Hudson and did not disappoint! The room + the hotel felt very clean. Additionally, the 4pm checkout offered as a special FHR benefit was very helpful. On the more expensive side of hotels I've booked but it feels the value is there. Would definitely look at the rates here the next time I plan on staying in NYC before looking elsewhere.

title: Excellent stay...Great location
text: Special shout out to Ellie, James and Perla who were very accommodating, I hardly remember anyone's name so you know they did their thing. The property is located near the Hudson which provides an excellent view, There are tons of shops and eateries in walkable distance. Staff throughout the hotel were friendly and greeted with a smile (a rarity in NYC). Breakfast was delicious and came in a timely fashion. I definitely will be back.

title: A luxurious property away from the Midtown crazy
text:
The staff was pleasant and accommodating from the front desk to the spa to the restaurants. We loved the technology in the rooms and the ample square footage - a rarity in NYC at any price range. The bed was extremely comfortable too.

We took several Ubers during our stay. The Dominick is conveniently located on the corner of two main streets, with the front drive on a one-way street. This made is easy and convenient for pick-ups and drop-offs! No issue with drivers trying to find your location.

The Soho neighborhood is easy to navigate and has all the food, bars, shopping and things to do that a visitor could want. Our favorite was the short walk over to Hudson Park.

We will definitely return!

title: Nice Stay, but Overpriced!
text: My wife and I arrived a bit early around 1230 and attempted to check in early since we booked under FHR through AMEX.  Our room wasn't available so we decided to upgrade to a Skyline Suite for an additional $200 which was ready.  We were impressed by the size of the room and the master bathroom, but were left in disgust by a room that was not thoroughly cleaned.  The minibar area was filthy, the carpet smelled of smoke and the bathtub had hair in it!  Later on, our experience improved after ordering room service and being taken care of by hotel staff.  The food was okay but we definitely expected more from the $34 short rib burger (missing lettuce and tomato as advertised) we ordered that failed to outperform the $10 Shake Shack burger we had the day prior.  We ordered room service again the following morning which was much better this time around.  Overall, for the price we paid... we expected a higher quality experience and more luxury.  Though we would give The Dominick a chance again in the future, we would most likely decline to upgrade and to order room service.

title: Nice room. Great location. Helpful staff.
text: We just stayed for 3 nights. We really liked the room, bathroom, housekeeping staff, service etc. Great location. Highly recommend if visiting NY. The location is good. Decent value. Lots of celebs sightings too.

title: Wonderful stay at The Dominick
text: The view was perfect from SoHi suite 3910, looking up 6th Ave to The Empire State Building. Staff were all very helpful. Perfect, stress-free visit. Prior to arrival, mentioned I was there celebrating my birthday and had chocolate covered strawberries waiting for me in the room.

title: Great stay !
text: I spent 8 days on a combination of work and social trip. Loved the house , mainly due to positive service  and ‘can do’ attitude from all the staff.  Very convenient location . Great that it is pet Friendly

title: The best hotel in Soho
text: Room was amazing. Location also. One negative thing is building works on opposite the side of the street. The staff  was friendly and sympathetic. Very good spa and fitness room. Easy and fast check in and check out.

title: Best hotel in New York City!
text:
Everything about this hotel is just perfect. From the elegant architecture, interior design, incredible amenities, and exceptional customer service, the Domenick hotel really has set a new standard for hotels in NYC. Everyone at the hotel goes above and beyond to ensure that your stay exceeds expectations, and that you have everything you need to make your stay at the hotel just perfect. Gabriella in particular at the front desk was extremely helpful and extremely sweet to interact with during my stay, and I am grateful to have met her, and thankful she helped make my stay at the hotel so wonderful. 

As for the rooms, they are extremely spacious, elegant, and just wonderful. The bed was ridiculously comfortable, I never wanted to get out! My personal favorite feature in the rooms were the electric black-out blinds/curtains that covered the floor to ceiling windows with the push of a button....I love the "good night" and "wake up" buttons that controlled the blinds and lights in the room, that turned your room into a dark cozy cocoon for sleep, or bright gorgeous space to wake up to! I was also very impressed with the Bvlgari toiletries provided by the hotel. Very nice touch. 

Overall, I would say this hotel is hands-down the best hotel in NYC. I will never stay at any other hotel when I am in New York. If only there were a Domenick in other cities..one could hope!

title: Gabby is the best
text: I really appreciate all the special unexpected accommodations Gabby made to make sure me and my fiancé had the best views and GORGEOUS room! Best Valentine’s Day EVER thanks to the warm and welcoming staff at The Dominick! We will definitely return!

title: Best hotel experience in Manhattan
text: Great location, wonderful service! I travel to NYC many times every year, this is my first time staying at the Dominick, I have to say this is the best hotel experience I ever had in NYC. Definitely will come back!

title: Wonderful experience
text: We stayed in a SoHi View 1 Bedroom Suite and it was worth every penny. Clean, spacious, comfortable bed and breathtaking views (floor to ceiling in the bedroom and living room) in each room. The doormen and everyone at the front desk were very polite and helpful.

title: Great Experience
text: I recently had a staycation with the wife in the city. I had an amazing time. Mo at the front desk along with gentlemen at door were simply amazing. I will definitely come back and I strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Quick 1 night stay in Soho
text: My wife and I visited this property back in October 2021. We came in for a quick 1 night stay as we wanted to meet up with my father in law while he was in town. We had dinner at the restaurant while we were there as well. The hotel is in a great location and the staff, facility and service were all of a luxury caliber.

title: Amazing Experience, Great Staff, Clean
text: Great check in, Chris Bethel is a special and talented door ambassador, in fact the whole team and the overnight doorman are great. Front Desk and Concierge (Michael Davidson) was exceptional. The rooms are phenomenal, spacious and clean! Hands down one of the top 3 hotel experiences I've had.

title: The Dominick dominates!
text: After visiting the Dominick yet again, we can truly say it is one of our favorite hotels in NYC.  The location at the edge of Soho and the West Village is great. The rooms are large (by NYC standards) and very well appointed.  The views are fantastic and the staff is always very helpful.

title: Quick trip
text: Ideal location for shopping, restaurants and enjoying the city.  Everything about The Dominick was first class.  The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the common areas and lobby are inviting and clean, and breakfast at the restaurant is great.
