title: Two thumbs up 👍🏼👍🏼
text:
We really enjoyed staying at The Dominick Hotel. 
Here are some pros and cons
Pros: friendly staff, cleanliness, our regular king bed was spacious, shower pressure was good, pillows and sheets were just perfect .
Cons: 0
We will definitely go back.

title: Great experience!
text: I could talk to you about subtle things like linen and towel replacement, or the fact that the doorman brought me my UberEats order without being asked. When I needed a bag to hold some loose papers, your waiter in the mezzanine restaurant never hesitated and took care of it. I can tell you about the tone of voice your staff used or how they made sure that no problem was out of their scope. I loved your restaurant but the in room dining came at perfect temp and the waiter was just lovely. I don’t think I can stay anywhere else in Manhattan and you have absolutely ruined me.

title: Celebration
text: Absolutely loved this place. Me and my significant other enjoyed our stay. Beautiful view and great location. The staff was wonderful and polite. Definitely will return to this location. Well worth it.

title: Amazing weekend getaway!
text: My husband and I had such a great experience at the Dominick for a night away from the kids. The service was timely and excellent and whatever we needed was delivered immediately. We also enjoyed a spa treatment which was so nice. Walking distance to tons of amazing shops and restaurants. We will definitely be back!

title: Stunning Views and Spacious Rooms
text: We usually stay on the Park, but this visit to NYC we  decided to stay in SOHO as a recommendation from people who live in NY and know the city very well.  We had a room on the 27 floor overlooking the river.  Clear view all the way to NY.  Amazing views.  Room was plenty spacious for my wife and I.  The only challenge was the bathroom.  Only 1 sink, but a large jacuzzi tub.  I'd trade the tub for another sink.  Staff was excellent.  Location was ideal to walk to restaurants, shopping, mass transit.  Perfect access to the tunnel if you plan to venture off the island.

title: On paye la vue ….
text:
L’emplacement est en effet parfait  avec une belle vue , si bien sûr vous êtes du bon côté et surtout si vous payez le supplément ( non annoncé) de 100€ par nuit .
Les chambres  et son personnel , plutôt bien  mais pour le reste , 
Hôtel sans service et un peu à la dérive .. pour ma part ce sera sans nous la prochaine fois .

title: Amazing Engagement Night
text:
I called their team the day of to get floral arrangements for my engagement and they did an excellent job with the room.  Really nice view an an accommodating front desk that offered some creative solutions. (We wanted to have a romantic bubble bath so they brought up extra shower gel for us to use). We were a bit nervous about Omicron, so we opted to go with room service instead of the on site restaurant and all the food was delicious.  

We'll definitely have the Dominick in mind for future staycations!

title: I never want to stay anywhere else in NY ever again
text: WOW! My girlfriends and I stayed at The Dominick for a friend's bachelorette-stay-cation-weekend and we were SO pleased with our stay.  All of the staff were so warm, friendly, and accommodating, our rooms had absolutely stunning views, and the food at the pool was delicious. And the pool itself was gorgeous and relaxing.  The location was also ideal as we planned our dinners, a boat tour, and a cooking class all within walking distance.  I highly, highly recommend staying at The Dominick!

title: Lovely Family Holiday
text:
Tutto perfetto 
Dalla vista in camera che spazia sull'Hudson  al cibo buonissimo  sia ai ristoranti (soprattutto Vestry, una stella Michelen!) che al servizio in camera 
Ottima location  a Soho a due passi dai negozi della Mercer e ai locali di Tribeca

title: Wonderful view!
text: We were on the 32nd floor with a breath-taking view of lower Manhattan with the World Trade Center.  Room great.  Bed and pillows and linens were great!  I loved the bathroom amenities especially the soap and the body lotion.  Great bathtub!  Very attentive hotel staff that always called us by name.  Fabulous location right across from subway station.  Very easy to get back to after our Broadway shows, either by cab or the subway.  Some wonderful restaurants in the area.

title: Excellent Hotel !
text:
We had a wonderful stay . The hotel is very clean , good located, not faraway from important points to visit . 
The staff was always friendly and ready to help . Our room was cleaned sometimes twice a day. 
Safe area and a big variety of restaurants in the near.

title: The best in NYC
text:
The best hotel in NYC. Very classy, comfortable and the best location, in Soho. 
Big room and bathroom, decorated with Fendi furniture. 

The Dominick has no crowd, it’s very important for the new era. Pos pandemic. 

It’s really a gem in the city!

title: Amazing Stay
text: My husband and I stayed with you a few weeks ago. We loved the views from the 41st floor and loved the location of the hotel in SoHo.  It was an easy subway ride to Rockefeller and Times Square and not a far walk to 911 memorial  and Wall Street.  Despite Covid cancelling our Broadway show we had a wonderful time and got to see the city at Christmas!

title: Definitely worth a visit
text:
This is a great hotel with big, well-appointed rooms and a friendly, helpful staff. We would definitely recommend this spot.  We also love the location in SoHo and near the West Village.  Great views from the higher floors and Vestry right downstairs.  

Who could ask for more. A fun get-away.

title: The Dominick Delivers
text: My family and I enjoyed the Dominick for 4 nights. Our stay could not have been better. Rooms are modern ,clean and floor to ceiling windows had unbelievable views. The staff was friendly and accommodating, especially at a tough time when city was shutting down. We would stay there again.

title: Overall, very good!
text:
Our 1 bedroom suite was very spacious and had great views of the city.  The service was prompt and attentive. The room service was delicious, the cleaning staff was awesome.  The construction early in the morning was disturbing,  though I know it's not the hotel's fault. The room temperature was a bit hard to control -- one hour it's really hot,  the next, it's very cold.  

Minus 1 star: there was hair in our food on our last order of room service. 
Also,  I asked Kristen with their luxury services to decorate our room with petals and champagne-- it all looked great! Except the name on the card they sent was not our name. Oversight, I'm sure,  but it's important to send the right gifts to the right rooms.  

Lastly, I found a passport under my bed -- needs to be slightly more attentive to cleaning under and between crevices.

title: Excellent
text: It was a very pleasant stay, excellent reception and good service, exquisite restaurant dinner, the team super attentive at all times. The suite was clean and in order in our stay, taking care of the details with an exceptional view and pleasant amenities, thank you very much.

title: Awesome Service and location
text:
Right in the middle of Soho, with awesome views of the skyline. Lots on your door step and Michelin star restaurant on site. A haven in New York.

Clean very comfortable rooms, with great showers.

Little Italy and Chinatown on your doorstep for a myriad of culinary choices. Try Wayla for Thai, Kimika for cocktails and Three of Cups for breakfast.

title: Loved this place!
text: Love the location, amenities and the rooms.  Beds were insanely comfortable - we actually inquired about the brand so we could purchase a similar mattress for our master bedroom!  They also have a great gym.  The spa experience certainly exceeded our expectations.  We will come back!

title: Great rooms, good location, the floor of your room really matters
text: The best thing about the Dominick is the staff who are helpful and friendly - a really big deal in NYC. I had a Skyline View room, which was on too low a floor to really provide the kind of view that would have made the trip memorable. The room itself was well appointed and comfortable. A very good size for NYC. The bathroom was wonderful with both a full sized tub and shower stall. The hotel lacks a comfortable bar where you can meet friends. The bar at  the Vestry is small and crowded, and the bar in the mezzanine cafe is just a characters-less space with a bunch of tables. The gym is large and has both cardio and weight options. I would stay at the Dominick hotel again only if I got a high floor and didn't need a bar in the facility.

title: Terrible service
text:
I am paying 1000$ a night for a suite and the wait for a boiled egg in the morning is a minimum of an hour wait. 

I then went to the restaurant and it took them 45 min to bring it. 

They also have no room service after 10:30 pm. 
They should not be considered a 5 star hotel.

title: A plesant staying
text:
We would like to say thank you and to show our appreciation in regard the to the service and total atmosphere in the hotel. 
We would like to mention Gabriella from the reception
She was super nice and did the extra miles for us, thank you!

title: Best option in soho
text:
We stayed here and fell in love with the location and property. We were on the 29th floor and had a great view of the city and the water. We were welcomed by Gabriella and she was as fantastic as the reviews say she is. She is very friendly and was able to check us in a little early. Every one we encountered inside and outside working at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The location is close to so many places to shop and eat. We could walk everywhere. We enjoyed the museum of ice cream nearby. 
The hotel was clean for the most part. The bed was comfortable and I love the automatic control for the shades. I can’t wait to return

title: A five star experience!
text: I stayed three nights at the Dominick and absolutely loved it. Gabriela checked me in, ensured I had an incredible Manhattan view and went above and beyond during my stay. She is outstanding! The staff at the Dominick provide the best customer service, paying attention to the smallest details. The rooms are spotless, the gym has modern equipment and the overall experience is wonderful! Highly recommend.

title: Mid-week NYC visit
text: Outstanding Preferred Legend property in NYC. Welcoming staff, from the door to front deck and bell attendants.  Rooms are spacious, modern, and immaculate. Housekeeping was prompt, and I never felt concerned with the COVID protocols New York, and the Dominick has in place.  Thank you to GM Justine for an outstanding visit.  Looking forward to returning soon.  Michael Briggs

title: Girls Soho Getaway
text: Hotel was lovely, clean, staff very friendly and accomodating. Restaurant had good selection for light lunch/snacks. King suite was a  great size, very comfortable for our group of 3. Lobby decorated very nicely for the holidays. Definitely recommend!

title: Wonderful NYC Experience!
text:
We had the most wonderful experience this week at the Dominick. Little did I know, my boyfriend (now fiance) was planning to propose during our stay. The staff was so accommodating and celebratory and kind, they made the our stay so special and unforgettable. The staff is attentive, friendly, and professional. Felix, one of the employees, helped us during our checkout and he was quick, efficient and friendly. The Dominick will always hold a very special place in my heart! 

Couldn't recommend enough! 10/10!

title: Tired and not as it was before
text:
We have stayed here many times as the Trump Soho, when I have to say it was run better. We decided to reserve 3 rooms for a 4 night stay for a family reunion after 2 years of covid, and our expectations were high. 

The rooms we had were tired and not updated. The service from front of house was a bit dismissive and non personal. On the contrary the staff in the bar and housekeeping were spot on and lovely. It would seem back of house are enjoying the job. 

On our next trip to NYC I’d try somewhere else as at no time did we feel as welcomed guests. We appreciate that things are only returning to some restricted normality but for the price we’d look for a better standard of accommodation and service.

title: Best of the best 5 stars
text:
The gold standard of service.

I proposed to my fiancé in this hotel. Top notch attention to detail and truly the best customer service I’ve EVER received.

Tiffany , Matt, Kristen , there were so many more stars that were a part of this story.

I had a plethora of hotels to choose from, and i chose the Dominick because of their attention to detail.

My fiancé can tell you — decision was well made. Truly the best hotel experience We’ve ever had.

I think our suite got cleaned 3x a day. Every time i came back to the room it was cleaner than before.

Room service made me a custom vegan menu for my girlfriend — unheard of at other hotels. 

Concierge got me cufflinks when i forgot to bring my own.

Truly the hotel is the definition of 5 stars.

Recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a personalized vacation with care and attention.

So thankful to the staff . Beyond words.

title: A+
text: The Dominick is a beautiful hotel, and we will definitely be back. The location is perfect to walk to many restaurants and nightlife or take the subway. The staff was pleasant and most importantly the hotel was very clean, the view doesn’t hurt too!

title: Don't waste your money
text: Whether you pay full price via their website and specifically call to request certain amenities doesn't matter to them. They'll even promise you things they don't have or can't do.  Completely average, run-of-the-mill rooms. They have an overpriced restaurant and spa to go with their overpriced rooms (seriously, I've seen better in a 3 star at less than half the price). But I suppose every mistake has to be made once. I'm just thankful I didn't make the horrible mistake of booking this place for my consultants.

title: Family NYC favorite
text: Love this hotel and location. The staff is friendly and attentive. The rooms are huge for NYC. We had a two bedroom corner suite that was perfect for our family of 4. There are 2 close subway stops that easily get you around the city and the SOHO shopping and dining are great.

title: Wonderful expierience!
text: My birthday celebration started right from the front desk with the most amiable and wonderful Gabriela, it was an amazing experience, I loved it: the room, the view from the window, the hot tub with foam and movie, all the shower accessories smelled divine! Thank you very much for such a wonderful stay!

title: Perfect location for enjoying Soho and the West Village
text: When we are visiting NYC to see plays or musicals we often stay at the Dominick Hotel so that we can spend time walking around Soho and the West Village, and enjoying the wonderful restaurants and shops in this area.  It is easy to catch the subway on a near by corner to go to the crazy, touristy area around the Broadway theaters, and then an easy ride back to this more interesting area.  The service at the hotel is great, the rooms are quite comfortable.

title: Spacious, comfortable and greatly located.
text: The hotel is great. Second time we stay there. We love that rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is perfect and the view from our room was stunning. The hotel could be more sustainable by not replacing towels and soap bars unless guests request it, by having refillable shampoo, conditioner and lotion bottles and by not using plastic water bottles. Also a vegan menu or vegan options would be amazing!

title: Mom/Daughter trip
text: We had a great experience. The hotel was beautiful and clean. Staff was so kind and professional. Room service was prompt and delicious! Large rooms for NYC and couldn’t believe how quiet for sleeping. We would highly recommend!

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text: As a New Yorker of 20 years until recently - this place is absolutely spectacular. Gorgeous hotel, great rooms, incredible customer service and lovely staff. Worth every penny. The location is perfect for anywhere you need to go in the city. The restaurant is cool and sexy and a great spot. Views from the room are unmatched. Room was clean and spacious. Comfy bed, gorgeous bathroom, and loved the iPad, TV, lighting and shade buttons - state of the art. Hotel is fantastic overall - staff makes it that much more special. I would tell anyone and everyone to stay here and I can't wait to come back. The Dominick for the win!!!!

title: 5th Stay at The Dominick
text: Great room. Amazing views. Love The Vestry Michelin star restaurant in lobby. Marek the doorman is wonderful.  This is our 5th stay at The Dominick though Inspirato. Michael the concierge also very helpful.  My son and girlfriend also loved it.

title: Julia
text: My home away from home. Gorgeous hotel with the most attentive staff. Gabby at the front desk is absolutely terrific. The hotel is lucky to have her. Always smiling, always caring, always making you feel welcomed. A true gem. This is how you want your reception to make you feel. Thank you Gabby and thank you Dominic for all these wonderful years. So good to be back!

title: Fantastic Staff, weird suite layout, loud construction noise all day, no lobby bar.
text:
The staff in every department were absolutely fantastic. We had a corner suite on the 34th floor and even that high up the constant construction noise from a new adjacent high rise being built was a real bummer. The suite was disappointing in that the bathroom opened into the bedroom so when you closed  the divider to give the person sleeping privacy while you were in the living room area working you would still have to disturb them by opening the divider and going into the bathroom that had no door. My wife could get no rest if I wanted to get ready in the bathroom while she was sleeping. The living room TV was placed above the work desk so if I was on my computer my wife would have to look through my head to see the TV. Also the couch in the living room was placed  so that you had to sit sideways on the couch to see the TV. They had a nice turn down service but they did not bring ice with that service until late in the evening. Thus, you had no ice to make a happy hour cocktail.
Carpet was stained. Nice robes and bed. Beautiful views of the Hudson. Great room service breakfast included in our stay.  They need a lobby bar!

title: Great location
text: Location was great.  Service overall was excellent.  Room well appointed.  We enjoyed the view from the higher floor.  Our only concern was the quality of the towels, old, scratchy and should be replaced.   Otherwise, excellent hotel

title: Great Return
text: I gave been staying at this hotel for 10 years. The new management and Michelin Star restaurant have turned a good hotel into a great hotel. The large rooms, incredible city views and professional staff are a unique mix in the city. A true luxury hotel with daily housekeeping, room service and concierge all in place - another unique feature among other so call "luxury " hotels these days.

title: A room with a view
text:
First class service from getting out of the cab to answering the phone upon entering our room because Gabriella from the front desk called to see how we liked the view. She’s great! 

Gabriella asked if we are afraid of heights. We said we love heights (we are tall). So she moved us up 14 floors to a corner unit. Awessomness. She was authentically excited for us. 

We still have three sleeps to go and couldn’t be happier.

title: Great Rooms with view
text:
The rooms are great and have great views of the city. Soho is full of shops and restaurants so if you dont mind not being close to central manhattan this is a great choice. 
The concierge was super helpful on finding a restaurant late at night. You might consider room service is not available after 10:30 pm

title: Excellent Hotel In Heart of Soho!
text: We had the opportunity to stay at the Dominick for one night on our way through New York.  We can't say enough about the service from the Doorman, Bellhop, Valet, front desk and Waiters...Everyone went over and above to make sure we were happy.  Rooms were beautiful and well appointed with linens and accessories...Room service was prompt.  The only negative was no usb outlets next to the beds....Would stay again for sure!

title: Soho visit
text:
Very nice room 
Amazing service. 
Great location. Close to dining and shopping in Soho. Easy walk to subway. Our room had nice views of Brooklyn. Twice daily housekeeping. Reasonable rates. Will stay again.

title: A++ Service & Stunning Views!
text: I had a second lovely stay @ The Dominick.  Thank you!   The staff was so warm, welcoming and accommodating.  Every interaction I had was positive.  My room was extremely comfortable and the view was absolutely stunning.  Mohendra Halall in Guest Relations exceeds all expectations!  He is so warm & welcoming,  positive and accommodating.  He exceeded expectations on every count and should be applauded for his excellent service.  Thank you, Mohendra!  The doormen, valets, room service staff & housekeeping staff all did an amazing job.  I don't know how you do it during these difficult times, but thank you so much!  Five stars!!!!

title: Luxury hotel in Soho with very spacious rooms.
text:
Overall very good. Breakfast service in the restaurant was sub par. In-room dining made mistakes. 
We got a So-Hi corner view rom on the 28th floor which was amazing. Very spacious with a double sink bathroom. Would stay again if I were to stay in Soho.

title: Very Fun and Accommodating
text: Wow what a great experience even for only one day - my wife and I had business to attend to in the city and picked the Dominick because it was close to our appointment and we were not disappointed - not only did they help us out with an early check in but everything just got better from there - we only had time for lunch and breakfast which were both very delicious - the room was the best and the service was even better - we will be returning very soon for a winter stay - so don't miss this gem of a hotel which is not that far from all the great spots in SOHO and the Village

title: Clean and friendly
text: The hotel is our go to for business trips but what makes the stay extra is the impeccable service. All people have been top notch but especially Gabriella from the front desk. She always makes sure we are happy, have water and answers any questions we have. Her customers service is far above the rest and we always look forward to being greeted by her upon arrival!

title: Fabulous
text: Absolutely loved my stay at The Dominick. The staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating.  The view from my room was spectacular (see photo). Both my room and the greater hotel itself felt luxurious. I really enjoyed the location of the hotel- close walk to restaurants and bars as well as major subway lines which was ideal. It was a great place to treat myself, and I will definitely be back!

title: AMAZING Experience! Thanks to Gabriella!! :)
text: We loved our experience at The Dominick because of Gabriella!! She is the best and wouldn't have had the experience we had without her! She is amazing and accommodated us during our stay :) She goes out of her way to be provide exceptional service. So happy we met her :)

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Beautiful hotel. Top notch service. Luxurious and very comfortable rooms with elegant bathroom. Staff is friendly and helpful. Cozy and intimate feel. Great location close to all Soho has to offer. Looking forward to my next stay.

title: Amazing
text: Loved my stay at the Dominick! Everyone greeted me with a smile. A special thank you to Gabriella who is truly a gem. I upgraded my room with her when I checked in and the room was stunning. She made sure all my requests were met and always remembered me by name when I came back to the hotel. This is the service that will keep me coming back.

title: Wonderful stay
text: My stay at the Dominick was amazing. Gabriela helped me by picking an awesome room and the views were incredible. She even followed up with me after I checked in to make sure I was happy with the room. Truly amazing service, great restaurant and friendly staff!

title: Excellent service, staff, and views
text: We had an incredible experience at the Dominick.  We were able to check in early and the staff were all fantastic.  We spoke with Mohendra at the front desk who was amazing.  Could not have asked for a better stay for our quick weekend getaway.  The restaurant Vestry was also super delicious, huge thanks to the staff there as well.  Hope we can come back again soon!

title: Thrilling to be back to such an amazing hotel and staff….
text: This was my first time back to New York in almost 2 years and it was thrilling to be back at the Dominick.  It’s always been one of my favorite hotels in SOHO and it was wonderful to see that it is even better than before. The staff is remarkable and deliver equally remarkable service.  The front desk agent Mohendra Halall, helped coordinate a slightly complicated and tight schedule and stay with other family members arriving at different times with multiple rooms . He took the time to listen to my needs and made the stay flawless. Rooms were impeccable and the entire property was always clean. In room dining was terrific and breakfast at Cafe Mezz was a wonderful experience because of the food, the space and service.  The suites have always been worth it especially if you are traveling with family. Gathering in the living room of the suite to take in the views day or night is another wonderful experience.

title: Great for a Staycation!
text: My friends and I stayed in a suite, and the room was incredibly spacious with beautiful views of downtown NYC!  Service was amazing and everyone was super helpful.  We all made appointments at the Babor spa, and it was one of the best massages I have ever gotten!  The hotel is also conveniently located within blocks of some of the best restaurants in SoHo for a fun night out.  I couldn't recommend this hotel more!

title: Not a great experience
text:
We had an unpleasant experience at the Dominick, mostly involving the staff and customer service.  We checked in very late and were up-sold a room that was supposedly bigger, but was exactly the same size.  

I got the impression that the staff just did not care about our satisfaction.  The fact that there is a $10 "Admin Fee" above the typical hotel high prices for room service ($44 for eggs and sausage) with myriad fees for room service, this is an insult.  When I addressed it with the staff I was told I could have eaten elsewhere.  Doubtful that I''ll be staying at The Dominick in the future.

title: Wonderful staff & comfortable stay
text: Great location for wandering, with many bars & restaurants nearby in addition to the onsite Mezzanine, a delicious spot to grab a bite & drink.  Warm and welcoming staff, comfortable beds, great views.

title: Fabulous Dominick
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Dominick. Great room size, bathroom, view of the city and service!! The staff and restaurant were fantastic. Loved the location and amenities. Thank you for the warm welcome.

title: Great!
text: Incredible stay and very accommodating. I would recommend the Dominick to anyone of my friends or family hands down. The staff was great and they truly did care about their customers, we were all treated with the highest level of customer service.

title: Magical NYC Experience w/ Stunning Views
text: Great location in the hip SoHo area. The views from the rooms are hard to beat. You can basically see the classic NY skyline from many different vantage points. The service is top notch and the rooms are beautiful. Hotel amenities are also great. Will definitely be back!

title: Amazing service and big rooms however needs refurbishing.
text: I usually stay at what was the Tribecca Grand (now the Roxy, which lost all the sexiness with the change IMO) and decided to try The Dominick. The service is amazing, location is great albeit Soho-ish but I like it better than Soho proper. Big glass boxes in the sky is hard to beat and the rooms are the size of a suite in some NYC hotels. HOWEVER, the room I stayed in on the 40th floor corner was a little worse for the wear. Lots of stains on carpet & chairs. Hard surfaces and walls scuffed and scratched, not what you see in a 5 star hotel. I am not sure they can call it a 5 star as room service is not available after 10:30 PM. We stayed in mid-October and NYC was very busy and back to "normal" in most areas. Restaurants and most all attractions require Vaccination proof (which they DO CHECK) THANK YOU! Masks are also enforced but not consistently. My only complaint is the Doorman inconsistency. Marek was very helpful and genuinely friendly and a pleasure to interact with. Some of the other fellows not so much. Specifically in needing assistance in securing transportation. I like to use Taxi's and can usually get one myself with little trouble but part of the benefit of this kind of hotel is asking the doormen to do this for you. If you are a huge tipper or want to use their private car service connections you get taken care of. If you are a regular person, you are on your own. I find this distasteful. Marek did not fall in this category, he treated everyone like they were a priority and had a sense of urgency when needed. THANK YOU MAREK for being a great person. I also want to commend the housekeeping service. They were PERFECT and turndown service was given (other reviews mentioned this was not available but it was during my stay, likely COVID related in the past). I have also seen many mentions of the pillows. The feather pillows are very squishy and you will need at least 2, however you can request foam which are much better if you want something firmer and not flat. Lastly, if you like a big tub with nice hot water you will be very happy. My wife was in heaven as our room had a large window by the tub which was amazing at any time of day or night.

title: Classy and comfortable.
text: The Dominick is a classy, gorgeous establishment with great amenities, wonderful service and stunning rooms that will give you just the NYC experience you've been wanting.  located to shopping, food, and travel options.

title: The Dominick Hotel is the greatest place to stay in NYC.
text:
As usual, a tremendous stay. I feel like home here. And people like Mohendra behind the front desk make things even easier for us. Got me in early and helped accommodate me with extra time before my flight on check out. Cannot wait to be back. 
Thanks again Dominick Hotel.
Craig Felhandler 
Birmingham, Michigan

title: NYC Broadway Trip
text: It was my second trip to the Dominick. I love the hotel and the staff. It was a great stay. The rooms are perfectly appointed Ted and the staff are helpful. The concierge made amazing restaurant recommends and made sure we got into our favorite choices. Excellent trip!

title: Soho sights, service and spa
text: Soho is the place to be and you can beat the views, the quality of room or the service standard.  Ritz without the stuffiness, Greenwich with larger rooms, and soho grand but taller. If summer traveling poolside is rare commodity but spa time is a favorite for my husband and I.

title: Top rate hotel in Soho!
text:
The most wonderful stay in Manhattan 
I had a one night business stay in Manhattan. I chose the Dominick because of the excellent hospitality and welcoming staff. From the doormen to the check-in staff everyone is truly professional. And the room!! What a finely appointed room with stunning views of the city. I will be back soon!

title: NYC weekend
text:
I stayed for three nights (regular room) and had two suites for my family for one of those nights. Every person at the front desk was friendly and accommodating as we tried to get rooms near each other and ready early. In addition, I felt valued and I appreciated the kindness of the staff beyond the front desk -- Mezzanine, front door, and bell service. 
Great location in Soho - easy access to great shopping and food.

title: NYC trip
text: we had a SoHi suite (corner suite) with city views which were almost 360 and it was so cool to see all of uptown both during the day and at night. The staff were courteous and attentive to our needs; there was a mix up in our room the first night which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 and after I pointed out that this was not the room we had booked, it was changed the next night for the rest of our week long stay. Our daughter was thrilled as this was her first visit to NYC.

title: Long weekend / Staycation
text: Everyone working hard and very pleasant at The Dominick. Concierge very helpful. Room comfortable clean and well maintained. Requests for ice were attended to right away.  Liked the in-room iPad for requests like pillows, extra shampoo / conditioner, bathrobes, extra towels, etc....they pay attention and really take care of their guests.

title: D Grade for Dominick - holiday inn experience
text:
D is for Dominick and also the letter grade id give this property upon grading it. 

This is a hotel that used to be a luxury hotel, now it's a holiday inn without standards. Rooms smell like mold, half the lightbulbs in the hotel were out, first answer to any question was always "no."

Have you ever tasted or smelled burned eggs? That's what was received through room service two days in a row. Vile

One positive standout was the mezzanine bar. That was the only time I experienced luxury services at this property.

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
I stayed with boyfriend at the Dominick for 3 weeks. Its hard to stay in a hotel for 3 weeks and not complain even once, our stay was PERFECT!!! 

The room was always super clean, the housekeepers were always smiley and so pleasant to be around. 

Felix, who always checked if I needed anything, wrote down my requests and always delivered with a big smile on his face. He was amazing! 

I felt like a part of family! This is definitely my hotel of choice in NYC. Will be back ♥️

title: To me the best 5* hotel in NYC
text: Location is amazing in Soho right be some of the best restaurants in the city. The hotel itself is wow! From the impressive lobby to the pool and sauna down to the rooms with their amazing views, I haven’t found a better 5* package. The staff has been there for as long as I remember, always smiling and going out of their way. And the hotel is always buzzing. And when you retire to your room, it all quiets down and you have an amazing bed for much deserved sleep. PS turndown service is flawless. Dim lighting , ice, chocolate, water and fresh towels.

title: Location, views, vibe
text:
second time since the start of the pandemic that we stayed at the Dominick. 
The So-Hi type room is modern, very nice views, quiet and equipped like a mini apartment. Weekends at Spring street are triffid, felt safe and vivid.

title: In town for a wedding and to visit with friends...
text:
We had a great experience at the Dominick!  The rooms was great, service as great, didn't want or need for anything.  We even had dinner downstairs at the Vestry which was superb!  So close to so many things, especially a walk/run down the Hudson river. 
 Well done!  Thank you.

title: Best worker
text: Felix is the best employee at this hotel. He is so helpful and so sweet and we appreciated all of his hard work!! He was always making sure we were satisfied with our room and was a friendly face to see.

title: wonderful hotel terrific staff.
text: luxury hotel with beautiful rooms.  location is in soho near shopping etc and the restaurant in the hotel (Vestry) is Michelin star rated and delicious.  shout out to the doormen for helping with check in!

title: Best stay EVER!!!
text: Absolutely amazing! Customer service phenomenal!!!! Location is perfect for food & shopping 🛍 My kids loved the massive views looking out to the city. The room…the room, words can not describe our awesome accommodations.

title: Our favorite hotel
text: We have stayed at The Dominic for years and we always enjoy our time there. We always stay in a spa suite due to the amazing shower and tub. Its also right next to some of our favorite restaurants and shopping. We can’t wait to come back!

title: Can't wait to come back!
text: I visited from Wisconsin this past weekend and I can not stop talking about how luxurious this hotel is. I spent my evening in a bubble bath, watching tv in the bathroom, overlooking the New York skyline. Everyone should experience New York this way :). The views were jaw dropping. The staff catered to our every needs. My sister is pregnant so they brought up a body pillow for her. The beds were so comfortable, I slept like a dream. Not to mention, this hotel is in the middle of SoHo and walking distance to all the best shops and restaurants that New York has to offer. Highly HIGHLY recommend!

title: Overall great stay
text: Excellent room with great city views and very helpful and supportive staff. There is a very nice but smaller rooftop pool on the 7th floor and the food in the restaurants was excellent. The only downside was that the main restaurant was closed on Sunday making it necessary to leave the hotel to eat on that day.

title: Way below what it used to be
text:
Soho hotel without room service at 8pm, not even a bottle of water. This hotel used to have a much better service. In-room breakfast for two costs about $200 for nothing special. Yeah. And I am not even talking about the rude answer when I asked for cutlery. 

Used to like the hotel. Not again

title: A world class experience
text: Had an amazing stay at the Dominik. The view, the service, the entire experience was the best way to celebrate with friends in town. My guests were blown away and will rave about this for a long time. If you want to have the total New York experience then create amazing memories here. Can’t wait to go back!!

title: The FIVE STAR TREATMENT
text: Five star experience!!!! This hotel is exactly what you expect from a chic downtown NYC hotel- tasteful, sophisticated and was blown away by the service.  Our room has the most breathtaking views of Manhattan from the north, west and south and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in in a hotel.  They even brought me a luxury body pillow because I’m pregnant!  I wanted to move in! Highly recommend.

title: amazing hotel and room
text: beautiful room, clean, modern. valet parking. great location. we got upgraded to a higher floor upon check in and the staff even got us late night pizza when we were craving it and delivered it to our room!

title: 5 Star Luxury Experience in Soho
text:
Wow… this place is incredible! Hosted a small gathering in one of the suites are couldn’t be more
impressed with the room, the staff and the service really was above and beyond! Thank you! The best part was the views from every window, you’ll never want to leave!

title: A great trip to NYC
text: Favorite hotel in NYC feels like home! Gabriella at the front desk is the best she always take good care and goes above and beyond! New spa is great as well! Perfect location. Sad the room service is limited during Covid by they say in October will all be back to normal.

title: Fabulous Stay
text: If money is no object, this is your place!!! My room (as most of them) had floor-to-ceiling windows, facing Southeast, on the 18th floor. I had a beautiful view of the World Trade Tower. The room has lots of techno upgrades, bed is comfortable, bathroom has a shower &  soaking tub (ahhhhh). Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance. My only wish was that I could have stayed longer

title: Our Stay at the Dominick Hotel
text: The Dominick Hotel was a great pick. Sometimes you just don't know what you are going to get when you book on line. In this case the Dominick not only delivered but exceeded all our expectations. The Hotel was very clean. Staff was friendly and very attentive and we felt valued. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the The Dominick Hotel. My wife and I recently stayed for 5 days to celebrate her birthday. Our room was clean and spacious. At night we found it to be very quiet on the 39th floor and was able to rest after a full day of sightseeing.

title: Amazing views and service!
text: My family of 6 just spent 4 nights at the Dominick and we would return again in a minute! We had a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the Hudson River on the 40th floor that was amazing! We also had a 1 bedroom overlooking the city on that floor (4 adult children with us so we needed more room) Incredible views day and night! Very comfortable beds and linens.  The room has nice amenities, Nespresso, microwave, dividing door.  Parts of the room felt a bit dated, but overall everything was clean and comfortable. Service at the front desk, concierge and door was perfect! Everyone was friendly, helpful and professional.  The location is great for exploring the areas of Soho, Greenwich... Highly recommend!

title: Always a great stay
text: We stayed in 4203 2 bedroom penthouse. From door man ( merick ) to front desk ( Nefertiti) everyone bent over backwards to make sure I was taken care of. First class service and amenities. The spa and restaurant were great. Would recommend to anyone. And great location to fly into Newark.

title: Still better then most but they slipped up for us.
text:
I have stayed here quite a few times dating back to the Trump Soho era. This was my first visit as The Dominick. 
I still love the hotel.
The rooms and staff are superior to anything else you will find anywhere near soho. They are professional and go above in most instances. 

For us, they slipped a bunch.
The valets seemed awesome and said they take care of my car but I ended up getting a ticket anyway. I guess take care for them meant leave it out front but not actually watch for the agent. Disappointing to get a ticket after a $50 tip. 

Our room didn’t have any nesspresso pods or a microwave. Asked for them to be brought up, never arrived. 

And a bill for room service that didn’t belong to me ended up on my account. 

None big deals. But minor annoyances that shouldn’t happen at this caliber of hotel. 

If you say you’ll take care of my car you better mean it. And if you say you’ll bring up a microwave and coffee you need to follow thru. And someone should have caught that 2 bills for breakfast over $100 on the same day for 2 people wasn’t normal. I should not be the one to catch it a call to reverse it. 

Probably would still go back as they are the nicest hotel anywhere south of 14th street.

title: Amazing views and rooms
text: The room was incredible (one bedroom suite). There was a wall that closes off the living room where there is a pull out and the bedroom, which kinda made it a private 2 bedroom.  The electric curtains are a nice touch for lazy nights and mornings to open and close with the NYC skyline as the backdrop. Almost looks fake, although spectacular.  The service was more like 3-3.5 star.  Manager on the 7th foor was snarky. The hostess at the VESTRY wouldn't let us in for 1 drink even though they weren't schedule to close for another 10 minutes and the restaurant was full. I would expect nicer for people spending that kind of money at a hotel.  The concierge was delightful and introduced us to Jane, a lovely breakfast spot and was full of nice ideas.  The front desk staff and housekeeping also very lovely.

title: Great stay
text:
Staff was great. From when we first arrived and left our auto at the curb,everyone said hello and made us feel so comfortable.
Area is very lively and restaurants are plentiful.
Room was impeccable.
Beds so comfortable.

title: As always the Dominick is GRAND
text: The Dominick hotel is the perfect hotel. Why? Because it does everything well and it does it with an efficiency that is uncommon. Even better is how nice the entire staff is to any and all guests. I have stayed at the hotel often and each time I leave refreshed and smiling.

title: Maskless
text: This is an extremely busy hotel, conveniently located, well appointed.  Unfortunately there is zero mask enforcement.  If you do not want close contact ( door people, elevators, front desk staff) with maskless people, choose another property.

title: Dominick hotel stay
text: We always stay at the Dominick when we come to NY and it has never disappointed us in the 5+ years we have been staying there. It’s in the perfect location, beautifully designed, and service is great. We have stayed there at least 10 times and we will continue to stay there when we visit the city. We love it!

title: Amazing hotel, great location, very accommodating
text: Everything was perfect at The Dominick. The rooms are great and spacious. The staff are all very nice and very helpful. Gabriela at the front desk is the best front desk workers I’ve ever encountered. She was very accommodating and made sure the room was perfect. Try to check in with her if you can. All around amazing stay definitely would recommend if you want to stay near soho and don’t want to be right in the center of it. Perfect location. 5 stars!

title: Never want to leave!
text: From the A+ location to the incredible team, we have had nothing but the best experiences at the Dominick. We have stayed here many times over the years and compared to the many many hotels we have stayed at in NYC, this is by far my favorite. The rooms are so comfortable and I highly recommend Skyline or Sohi rooms for amazing views! Everyone who works at the Dominick is just so nice and everyone goes above and beyond to help you. Special shoutout to Gaby at the front desk who has taken special care of me and made my time at the Dominick so incredible! Thank you to the team! SO happy you have reopened!

title: Service not consistent, not luxury category
text:
The hotel is in a great location and some of the staff are lovely in particular the doormen and housekeeping crew.  
However service is not what I expect from an Amex preferred hotel.  The front desk staff are horrible which results in a bad experience from the start of your stay.
We are here for a family function that includes 6 events.  I knew my husband and I would need plenty of closet space and a large bathroom so we could change quickly in between events.  So I called in advance to ask which category I should reserve to get the larger rooms (2 closets, large bathroom with 2 sinks, etc) which is the room I booked.  Upon check-in, Gabriella made assumptions about me before I even said hello and proceeded to make our check-in a stressful process (after a long night and 5 hour drive).  We had to wait until 6pm to get a room with a large bathroom but tiny (2 feet wide) closet.

Trust me - there are much better hotels that are part of the amex preferred program with better front desk staff in NYC (at similar price point).  I agree with the other 1-3 star reviews here and more people should inform Amex so as to remove the Dominick from the preferred program.

title: Great Hotel with Attentive and Welcoming Staff
text: I stayed on the 29th floor and had sweeping views of the river and city. The room was clean, spacious and had a large bathroom with spacious walk in shower. Above all, the staff was warm, welcoming and very attentive without being overbearing. I look forward to staying there again.

title: Great experience
text: I had a great time! The staff is really friendly ! Specially the security guys always so kind  and helping with taxi/Uber or any informations i needed! The room is big, new and comfortable.. the view was amazing.. The soho area is amazing for food, shopping and meeting people !  I love it! Already missing 💙

title: Spacious Rooms; Great Service; Lovely Hotel
text: The Dominick is a lovely hotel with spacious rooms (you can get adjoining rooms as well) and top-notch service. All staff members are friendly, helpful, and attentive. The service is great and the rooms have fantastic views. The first floor restaurant (The Vestry) is Michelin starred, and deserves it. The 7th floor has a pool, a pool bar, and garden-like seating areas with comfortable couches and chairs. The surrounding area is full of fantastic restaurants of every type, all within walking distance. Great location, well-appointed and spacious rooms, great service. We'll be back!

title: The Dominick Hotel, SUPERB!!!
text:
This stay in New York was made all that more amazing by the attentive staff, and beautiful views from our suites. From sun up to sundown these are the most amazing views I've ever seen. The staff was amazing and super helpful no matter what crazy requests I had. Top to bottom; managers, bellman, doormen, maids etc.
Stay here if you ever get the chance, it's an AMAZING hotel

title: weekend stay
text: great service, great price, and great location - everyone was so accommodating and helpful. Never been there before but will definitely continue to stay there - one of our best experiences at a hotel, thank you!

title: Even better than the last time...
text:
We'd stayed at The Dominick three years ago and really liked it. We stayed again earlier this month and absolutely loved it. Given that the pandemic has made even the finest hotels a bit less fine, we were surprised to see that we loved The Dominick even more than we had the first time around. For one, Gabriela at the front desk is amazing. She gave us a wonderful upgrade and provided individual attention and care. It's a big hotel, but she made everyone feel special. 

The valet staff were kind, patient and attentive -- which really meant something to us given that a five-star hotel in midtown we stayed at recently had dropped valet service entirely and sent us to a public parking lot two blocks away. That other hotel's restaurant has cut its menu, its hours and its offerings, but The Dominick has not. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast, grabbed complimentary coffee throughout the morning, and had dinner at its chic Asian-inspired restaurant that night and everything was exceptional.  Plus the rooms and suites are large, spacious and elegant -- and The Dominick seems to be the only hotel in Manhattan that actually provides enough bath towels that we didn't have to call down for more. We will absolutely be back!

title: Always love The Dominick....perfect Soho location, staff and rooms
text: Another great stay at the Dominick.  Love the view, bathroom and rooms!  Staff is friendly and attentive.  The pool is the perfect getaway from the bustling neighborhood.  Your hotel is one of the reasons we love New York!

title: Best hotel in the city
text:
Absolutely. Absolutely. Absolutely. Wonderful. Service was phenomenal. Everything from personal shopping. Couples massage in the room. Room service. Haircut in the room. The pool. The housekeeping. Just everything. Yes might but a little expensive. But so worth it.

Most of all. Tiffany. Absolutely brilliant. I’ve never had a hostess treat us with so much care and respect. She went way of of her way to help Emili and I. She literally landed me a job by picking out the best outfits for us. Could not thank her enough.

title: ¡Excelente!
text:
Maravilloso. Pasamos cuatro noches en una suite de un dormitorio y nuestra estadía fue perfecta! no tuvo ningún inconveniente. 
Gabriella, en el front desk,  nos atendió de maravilla. Nos dio una habitación hermosa con vista al río.
Limpiaron nuestra habitación todos los días, el servicio a la habitación siempre estuvo a tiempo y delicioso y la locación del hotel es insuperable.
Definitivamente volveríamos.

title: Great Hotel, best location
text: I love this hotel. I never want to stay anywhere else in NY. This is our second stay here. The location is perfect, the views are gorgeous. It’s a clean, modern hotel with great service. Very friendly staff who take care of your needs.

title: Best NYC Trip Yet!
text:
My fiance & I were visiting New York for what was originally a two night stay. Right from check-in everything was impeccable - Gabriela went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. When she found out it was our first trip as an engaged couple, she personally made sure it was a stellar stay. Both Gabriela and the doorman remembered us throughout, which was a nice personal touch in a city that often feels so impersonal. In fact, we loved our stay so much, we ended up extending the trip by a night and Gabriela assisted with that too! 

The rooms are spacious (not just for New York!) and well equipped with everything that you need, plush robes + views for days. You could literally see all the way uptown straight to Central Park from our 'SoHi' room. 

I don't often write reviews, since stays are usually so uneventful, but this was one we'll definitely remember. We visit New York often and usually always stay at the same hotel but you can consider us converted! Thank you Gabriela & everyone at the Dominick, we'll be back soon.

title: Above and Beyond Service!!
text: Amazing hotel with AMAZING SERVICE. Huge shout out to Grabby at the front desk. We had a long trip in and we were in sort of a cranky mood and she immediately changed that and made our day!! Shes the best! She gave us a better room than what we previously ordered. The hotel room is beautiful that she gave us and far exceeded our expectations. Thank you Gabby!!!

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE/IMPECCABLE SERVICE!!
text: My sister and I stayed at The Dominick recently and we were beyond impressed with the simply amazing, dazzling service we received from the entire staff!! Mohendra at the front desk found out it was our very first visit to New York and he kindly upgraded our room to give us an even better view!  He was SO friendly and positive- and gave us a level of service that you unfortunately do not encounter that often anymore. He was AMAZING.  Then our bellman Evers escorted us up to our room and helped us with our luggage and could not have been nicer! That was the beginning of our encounters with the fantastic staff at The Dominick- and we will always be grateful to them for making us feel like family! While there- my sister had a medical emergency (she is fine now luckily)- and we met the hotel manager (sorry I don’t have her name) and she could not have been more helpful! It was a stressful time- and she and another employee (male, possibly the concierge?)- went above and beyond to assist us! Literally- every single employee we encountered treated us like family. I also want to recognize the doorman- Chris- who always had a twinkle in his eye and a beautiful and genuine smile that brightened my day- as well as Stanley and Christopher. They were great too. The housekeeper Igor took care of a situation that went above and beyond the call of duty- and he did so happily. Then our waiter Jonathan at The Mezzanine was a sweetheart, and gave us impeccable service, along with Aaron at the Vestry. Not to mention- they are a Michelin star restaurant- and the meal was delicious! Forgive me if I left anyone out, but every single person was really wonderful. We will be forever grateful for the experience we had there- and can’t wait to return to The Dominick!! Oh and our view was TRULY BREATHTAKING!!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
Location in SoHo was great
View of the river and Manhattan from our room outstanding
Service was 5+ which included everyone from the doormen to the maids
Very clean 
Room service was very good 
We did not eat in hotel restaurant but understand it is excellent

title: The very best service
text: From Stanley, who remembered we were guests (after only one day) and greeted us at the door to our quick and pleasant check-in, room service, bellman and concierge - every person working at the Dominick was attentive, polite, smiling, helpful and kind. The room (we enjoyed a skyline room) was clean, bright with thoughtful details for our comfort. The bed and pillows and comforter were perfect. The location was also excellent. The very best service and lovely accommodations were all here. We cannot wait to come back for another visit.

title: Great hotel in Soho
text: Stayed for 3 nights.  Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Room was spacious, not just by NYC standards.  Old school plush with automated lighting and drapery, but the phone in the toilet (gross and unnecessary) and the tv at the vanity need to go. Mini fridge was well stocked, but didn’t have room for leftovers from fabulous area restaurants nor a microwave. Snacks were okay, but definitely not allergy safe or healthy, lots of candy/sweets. Bathroom was clean and well appointed.  In-room dining was nice, hot and prompt in the AM.  View from 17th floor was lovely.

title: Best weekend, best hotel, best customer service
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at the Dominick in August 2021 where I planned on proposing. When I told the hotel about my plans, I was immediately connected with the Luxury Ambassadors team who treated the proposal like it was their own. I was instantly upgraded to an amazing room with breathtaking views of the city on one of the top floors. The hotel has several fantastic event spaces but we ultimately  decided that it would be the prettiest and most COVID friendly to propose at one of their private cabanas on the rooftop by the pool. It turned out to be such a perfect night and weekend and we even had another bottle of champagne waiting for us back in the room courtesy of the hotel and events team. The doormen are super friendly and the staff responsible for cleaning the rooms do a great job. Thanks again for such an unforgettable weekend Tiffany and Paige!!

-Spencer

title: Loved every minute of it.
text: The friendliest staff! literally every one we met was kind and helpful and made us feel special.  The room was clean and spacious. Great mini bar. Amazing water pressure in the shower.  The views from our room were spectacular! The location is perfect for getting anywhere in Manhattan.  We had the best time and will definitely stay at the Dominick again when we come back to NYC.

title: Perfect location to take in the best that NYC has to offer
text: We had a great time at this hotel. It was a no brainer to book this spot as the Hotel is gorgeous and the location is so good for travelling to a lot of great spots in Downtown NYC. Upon arrival everyone is very polite and welcoming. The elevators are wicked fast, the restaurant has a Michelin star and much lower prices than what we had come to expect for high class dinning in NYC, and the service is fast with an Ipad in the room to order anything you need (towels, pillows, and water bottles). The views from this hotel are surreal and rooms are larger than other good NYC hotels. The best part is that it's close to some really good food if you're up for a 10 minute stroll. If you're thinking about booking here just do it!

title: Highly Recommend
text: I decided to surprise my husband for our anniversary with an overnight in NYC. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly by the valet. Next it was on to check-in where I was offered a bottle of water, and the process was super easy. I booked a king “SoHi” room and it was beautiful!  Very clean, spacious, and the bathroom...amazing!!  We did leave the hotel for dinner, but then came back for drinks at Vestry. Again, a wonderful experience.  What really stood out though was the impeccable customer service. I have never, in all my years of traveling, come across so many incredible employees!  Every single person that I encountered was friendlier and kinder than the next. My only regret is not being able to acknowledge them by name to really compliment their service.  This is my first review on TripAdvisor, as I have never felt so compelled to share my experience before. If you are headed to NYC, I encourage you to try this hotel.

title: The Dominick
text: Lovely fully staffed hotel. Great check in process, spacious room, good minibar snacks and excellent food.I am adding characters because they want more for this review. I think I said it all  but here are more characters

title: Great Hotel, will stay again
text: We had a 1 bedroom suite, and we pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, the quality of furnishings and the bedroom view (even from 12th floor) was excellent. We originally booked at the equinox, but cancelled once we found out our 14 year old was not aloud in the pools. The Dominic was very family friendly and friendly staff all around. While we typically stay in mid town, we found this to be a great intro to the restaurants of SOHO and west village. We’ll stay here again.

title: Best View Hotel in Manhattan!!!
text: Love this hotel. Everyone there makes you feel like it is your home away from home. I have been going for years and the staff always recognizes me and welcomes me back. A special shout out to the Front Desk Team! Especially Gabriela Bucheli. She always goes above and beyond to honor my room request and makes sure that I am happy and my stay is perfect! Thank you Gabby for making my stay so comfortable. I will be back soon!

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
text: Great room with an incredible view.  The staff in every area was courteous, professional and friendly. We enjoyed delicious appetizers  and a drink and  relaxing in the lounge chairs near the pool. Breakfast at the Mezzanine  was also great! Hope to be back soon.

title: My Favorite Hotel!
text:
The professional and extraordinary personal service is beyond anything I have experience in my travels around the world. From Marlene and Gabrielle at the front desk who always go above and beyond to make sure I have the best stay  (and always seem to remember me each time I come to NYC!) to the amazing staff that greets me at the door, this remains my favorite hotel! In the spa they also have the best masseuse: Slavic!
I just can't say enough about the employees who are really the reason I keep coming back to this hotel again and again!

title: Magnificent and extraordinary hotel!!
text:
Where do I begin. The Dominick hotel is magnificent and extraordinary.  I will first talk about the hotel , then the staff. The hotel has the bets views of Manhattan. My room had a 180 degree view of the city .The rooms are huge compared to most NYC rooms. The hotel was so clean. The decor was great and the room was updated. 

Words cannot express the amazing staff at the Dominick Hotel. Staff that care is paramount in a hotel. This hotel has extraordinary people. Sydeka was so awesome
 She smiled Everytime I saw her. She would answer any questions I had and was always willing to help. She is an example of customer centricity. I would love to hire her.

Marek, Francisco and all of the front staff were so friendly and helpful as well. I loved staying at this hotel. I wish I didn't leave. Everyone at this hotel made my stay in NYC a memorable experience.

Thank you so much for everything!

title: Highly recommend!
text: I had a wonderful stay at The Dominick! This was my second stay at the hotel and it is even better than I remembered! I remember liking it, but overtime, forgot how just wonderful it is. All of the staff are super friendly and helpful. The rooms are a great size and huge compared to other Manhattan hotel rooms. The beds and robes are so comfortable! I slept amazing which isn't common when I travel. The room and bathroom had a great amount of storage and more than the average suite I've stayed in! The roof deck pool and lounge is so relaxing and special. I love everything about The Dominick and you can't beat the Soho location.

title: Mark Espinoza
text: My first stay at The Dominick was a pleasant surprise. The stay turned into an extended work trip and I am grateful to the staff for their hospitality. The room was lovely and above average as far as acoustics, rarely a sound from outside despite being a full house. Again, kudos to the staff from door to room. Special shout-out to the young lady in housekeeping who took care of the floor, she was exceptional. My only grouse (minor one at that) is elevator access. Without stairwell access you were at the mercy of timing and long waits depending on time of day. Smiles and willingness to make your stay pleasant were plentiful however and the occasional long wait became trivial. Would recommend!

title: A Great Stay (again) at The Dominick, the Staff going Above and Beyond.
text:
The Dominick delivered an outstanding experience on all fronts for my second stay at this hotel. Most notably, the staff went above and beyond in their commitment to service. Mohendra at the front desk was outstanding in every way, providing a one-of-a-kind experience from check-in to check-out, including a pre-arrival call to confirm some details!  His colleague Jenny always greeted us with a smile as well.  The doormen always greeted us as we entered and exited the hotel, offering cold water on a hot day, and umbrellas on a rainy one. Housekeeping and room service also did their jobs efficiently and thoughtfully, with a smile and pleasant greeting. 

The rooms were well appointed, clean, and convenient with a well stocked bar, nespresso machine (complimentary), and microwave, as an unexpected convenience. 

It’s location in SOHO, near Greenwich village, and TriBeCa, made dining options simple,
with more good restaurants than you could ever want within walking distinct. But sampling the light fare and cocktails on the seventh floor,  poolside,  is a must. 

Traffic along Varick street can be a little rough as your Uber/taxi navigates around the nearby  Holland tunnel traffic, but that is quickly forgotten when you are greeted by the front doormen and make your way into their peaceful lobby—with an extra hello from Mohendra at the front desk!

Well done.

title: THE PERFECT HOTEL!!!!
text: Loved every part of our stay!  From the moment you arrive you are greeted by the nicest doormen in the city. Followed by a welcoming and friendly front desk crew that made sure EVERYTHING  was to our liking. The rooms were extremely clean as well as spacious. The Housekeeping team was amazing and quick with any request we had. The room was beautiful with the most perfect NYC views!!!! The beds were so comfortable, the linen was so SOFT and relaxing I didn't want to get out of bed. So much that I went online and ordered a full set from the brands website. Loved our stay so much we already booked our next visit in a few weeks. Thank you so much to the entire staff for making our special weekend so AMAZING!

title: AMAZING!!!
text: We've been to NYC many times and stayed many different places. We went this time for our 5 year wedding anniversary and it was phenomenal! The Dominick is now by far my favorite - The SoHi corner room we had was incredible and views were break taking! The hotel staff were very hospitable, hotel was clean, food was great, and the pool was amazing! Can't wait to go back!!

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We loved staying at the Dominick. It exceeded expectations pretty much all around - super friendly staff, awesome location, great room with amazing city views, comfortable bed. I feel the need to comment on breakfast which we normally would not get at a NYC hotel but it was included with our Amex deal. It was so very lame and we would have been pretty pissed off if we had to actually pay the exorbitant prices. The pastries were stale, not fresh - guessing frozen and re-heated - just no excuse for that when it's $30 for the continental breakfast. Also, the breakfast room was so bitterly cold - every guest was shivering and complaining but the staff called to the engineers and were told they couldn't adjust it.

title: Friendly staff and great place to stay
text: I was greeted by Gabriela who was all smiles and provided me a very warm welcome. It was so nice to come back after such a crazy year. The staff was as friendly as ever and I’m glad the Dominick has opened it’s doors once again.

title: An incredible experience, so grateful to Gabriela Bucheli, and The Dominick team!
text:
Over the past few years, I have stayed at The Dominick roughly a dozen times.  The hotel itself is in a location I love; convenient to SoHo, TriBeCa, the Hudson River, and offers amazing walking proximity to many of my favorite parts of NYC, alongside easy access to the subway.  Alongside that, the rooms at The Dominick are beautiful, spacious, and incredibly quiet.  Without a doubt, the hotel itself, and the rooms, make it one of my favorite places to stay in New York.

What truly makes The Dominick special is the staff.  During one of my first stays, I met Gabriela Bucheli at check-in, who went far above and beyond anyone I’ve ever met in a hotel before.  During one of my first stays, Gabriela walked me through (even showing me on a map) where the rooms faced, and took into account my preference that I was hoping to be on a high floor so I could overlook the city.  In future stays, Gabriela remembered my preferences, and often, would have my room prepared for me before I reached the check-in desk.  This is a hotel where I truly feel like a valued guest, and is an experience that makes New York special.

Everyone at The Dominick has always been incredibly kind, friendly, and helpful throughout my stay.  For anyone visiting New York, I absolutely recommend staying at The Dominick.  The neighborhood is fantastic, the service is fantastic, rooms are well furnished, and the staff makes you feel like you are the most important person in the world (I’ve been able to communicate with the hotel via e-mail, too, which really makes communication and requests so easy).

Truly, I think this is the best hotel in New York City with the best team of any hotel in the city.

title: Awesome week!
text: My week started off talking to Slava in reservations.  He couldn't have been more helpful.  When I arrived at the hotel, at 1 am, Sean was efficient at registering me, and getting me to a great room.  The room was spectacular on the 27th floor with an epic view of the river and the city.  You could actually see all the way to Central Park.  Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and always went out of their way to be helpful.  There were 3 of us in the room and it was absolutely big enough.  The bathroom is amazing.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Wonderful stay and wonderful service by all staff, especially the front desk, operations and concierge.  We originally planned to stay at the Dominick for 4 nights. After having to change our plans, we wanted to add 2 nights. The hotel was fully booked but Mr. Mahendra at the front desk assisted us greatly, checking frequently and reserving a room for us when it became available. He was even able to make sure we didn't have to.move rooms, kids and all. We will definitely be back.

title: Special thanks to Ms. Gabriela Bucheli
text:
While the hotel was pleasant the service from one particular front desk agent was amazing. 
Ms. Gabriela Bucheli greeted me like we were old friends. 
The next day she was back at work again and recognized me by name. 
It was a great pleasure interacting with you, Ms. Gabriela Bucheli.
I truly look forward to staying in this hotel again. 
They truly understand what hospitality and running a good hotel is all about.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Dominick. The view was stunning in the SoHi room and the staff was really pleasant and accomodating. We had an issue with our room safe which could not be resolved and the front desk agent Mohendra quickly and kindly upgraded us to a room that had an even better view than our original making our anniversary celebration even more special. Mohendra was truly a pleasure to deal with along with the other staff in the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel for its stunning views, amazing staff and walking proximity for shopping and phenomenal restaurants. Looking forward to going back again in the near future.

title: One Night Get Away
text: My wife and I stayed here for a one night get away, we live in Manhattan. The Dominick Hotel was absolutely amazing. The rooms, the pool, the service, location, all perfect. Best of all was the restaurant, Vestry. My GOD what an epic and amazing culinary experience. The menu doesn’t jump out at you but when the food arrives you’re in for an off the charts meal. I’ve had dinner at the best restaurants in NYC and around the world. This was an exceptional experience.

title: Wonderful Visit
text: This was our 6th stay at The Dominick. Once again it was wonderful. From Chris who unloaded our car, Brandon who took up our luggage, Hector who changed our room when we needed a bigger one, Tiffany who went above and beyond to have cupcakes waiting in our room for my son’s college graduation, all of Security who were always smiling when they brought up our Uber Eats, and the front desk that made check in a breeze. In addition, breakfast room service was excellent and housekeeping was great as well. I do miss the all day room service. Hopefully it will be back soon. Can’t wait to stay here again in the future.

title: Spa sauna room
text: Amazing stay! The room was incredible! Amazing staff!! Really made my birthday special! The shower and spa tub is so incredible, best shower and bath I ever took! I absolutely recommend staying here for a special special night!

title: Amazing hotel, location and views!
text: In the heart of SoHo, the views from my room were amazing! Love this hotel, the location was close to my work and in the evening the restaurants and bars are all within walking distance. My views from my room where magical!

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at The Domick.  Located in SoHo, slightly west of the heart of Soho, this hotel was fantastic.  The bell hops were very eager to grab luggage and bring up to our room in short order.  The room was very clean and beautiful.  Most of all, the views were fabulous!  We stayed in a 2 bedroom corner suite and the views of the Hudson River and Manhattan skyline were breathtaking, especially at night.  We could see south to the Freedom Tower and North, most noteworthy being the Empire State Building.  Service was great.  We were even able to hang out at the pool deck between summer rainstorms, which is a fabulous treat in the middle of Manhattan.  We had a great stay and would gladly come back (even though we live only 35 miles away).

title: Best Hotel in NYC hands down
text: 2nd time staying here in 2021 since they re-opened. These are by far the best rooms in NYC. Spacious, super clean, fllor to ceiling windows and tatstefully furnished. There is nothing like this in Soho. Mohendra at the front desk is the traditional world class Hotel persona. Those looking to work in hospitality should spend the day with him and see how it is done! This is  a true 5 star hotel that was built from the ground up and not in some old building. There is nowhere else to stay in soho, or in NYC for that matter. I would live there.

title: Above Average NYC hotel
text:
Just stayed at the Dominick and thought it was barely above average.   Check-in line was a mile long with only one hotel operator working at the time.  I was expecting a package in the mail upon arrival and it took them almost an hour to locate it.  I was given attitude from the concierge when I tried to express that the package was urgent.   The pool was closed on a Saturday because they couldn't find a lifeguard that day....Our room had a strange musty order and the alarm went off at 6am for no reason.  Closet light was also not working.   

Simply put, too many issues for a supposed 5 diamond hotel.   SOHO is a great area but I suggest you stay elsewhere given the price.   On the plus side the doormen are very nice and courteous...

title: An absolute delight!
text: The rooms are comfortable and well appointed with breathtaking views, but the best part of my trip was the truly extraordinary staff. Everyone I encountered was cheerful and helpful, especially Gabriela at the front desk who went above and beyond my expectations to assure I had a wonderful stay. It was my first time at the hotel and she treated me like a beloved regular. With staff like this I will definitely be back!

title: Expensive enough to make you question the Value...
text: Booked through the Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts program. But I must say, this is wayyyy overpriced for the value. The ambiance + staff are lovely, and Bonus points to them for having a pool in NYC. But that's as far as it goes if you're paying out of pocket, not on a company sponsored trip. I booked a rate that had a daily $100 credit for breakfast...and surprisingly I needed it. My SOLO breakfast bill was $72, but I suppose it came with a free laugh.

title: Incredible Stay at the Dominick
text: We stayed at the Dominick for my sister’s bachelorette party and had an incredible time. From the concierge’s selection of our suite with phenomenal views, to the hospitality we received, everything was perfect. I would highly recommend staying at the Dominick.

title: NYC Visit 2021
text: Very nice staff.  Clean.  Great location.  I would consider this hotel again.  There were minor issues, such as the A/C vent rattling (which I fixed myself by stuffing a little paper between the vent and the wall), or one of the curtains not opening with the button.  But, overall, very good.

title: Awesome mini vacation for the July 4 holiday weekend!
text:
Booked two nights, Friday and Saturday for the holiday weekend. We stayed in the Spa One Bedroom Sauna Suite. This Suite is unbelievable! Suite was bigger than my NYC apartment. Beautiful decor and furnishings

The crown jewels of this suite are the in-suite sauna and double-size Jacuzzi tub!

Food and service in the hotel's poolside dining venue, El Takoy were excellent.

I cannot wait to return to this magnificent five star hotel.

title: Anniversary celebration
text: Excellent service, great accommodations, and cleanliness.  Very good location with a lot of places to visit nearby.  The room was beautiful and with a wonderful view.  Definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed in a long time.  Highly recommended.

title: I loved it
text:
I looked for a 5 star hotel in Soho and stayed in the Dominick for 6 nights
Rooms are spacious and view is amazing, its clean, great service, the reception lady allowed me to keep the umbrella as a gift without charging me :)
Most amazing thing is the proximity to Soho to the Spring street subway and to the Citybikes.
loved it.

title: Wonderful Stay at the Dominick Hotel and Great Location
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Dominick Hotel! The location of the hotel is amazing, just a very short walking distance to all the shops and dining options in SoHo.  Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and in particular, Sydeka was amazing! From the time I spoke with her over the phone when I called the hotel prior to our visit I knew that she was the sort who goes above and beyond for the guests.  This was proven correct when she placed us in the most perfect room in the hotel with an amazing view of uptown and the river.  She was very attentive and so welcoming and is a great asset to the hotel.  We also ate at the Vestry which was very delicious and we enjoyed room service breakfast which has many great options.  The pool on the 7th floor was  nice and the food and drink options by the pool were great.
