Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would love to stay at the Dominick Hotel again for the great service, wonderful views and amazing location!

title: Fantastic Soho hotel!
text: This place might be my new go-to hotel in NYC. The rooms are very spacious, clean and well appointed. The bathrooms are huge with a large shower, a TV and a big soaking tub. My room had amazing city views and floor to ceiling windows. I loved the blackout curtains, strong AC and the C&O Bigelow toiletries. It was really hot when I was in NY so I appreciated the rooftop pool and the food served by the pool was great. The service was also really great. And the location was perfect -- lots of stuff within walking distance and easy access to the Holland Tunnel since I was flying home from Newark Airport. Overall this place is a great hotel!

title: BEST OF THE DOWNTOWN HOTELS
text: They have not skipped a beat, post pandemic. It's a testament to the organization that the staff stayed in tact. So may familiar faces. More importently, I was recognized by all of them. Friendly "on it" staff. Large well appointed rooms, with great tech, complemtary nesspresso coffee. Great housekeeping, and clean inviting workout facility overlooking the stylish pool.

title: Unclear if Trump still has equity in this hotel.
text:
Enjoyed a 4-day stay at The Dominick.  One of the better hotels in Soho, very large rooms for NYC and nicely furnished. 5-minute walk to the restaurant scene in Soho. Rooms are larger and more polished than the Soho Grand, but the bar scene is less “happening.”  

On pulling up, immediately recognized it as the former Trump Soho from when the hotel was failing in 2017 and advertising a lot. Heart sank. 

Searched extensively on the web and asked but unable to determine if Trump still has an economic interest (e.g. equity and profits) from the hotel. They took his name off and he lost the management contract after visitation slumped in 2017, but he had a 14% equity interest when the hotel was built and nowhere could I find that he had given that up. 

So, despite a very enjoyable stay, we won’t go back unless the hotel makes clear that there is no association with an insurrectionist. Publishing their ownership and management contracts is the only way to make a clear break. Yes, we believe in voting, and voting our wallet.

title: WONDERFUL STAY!!!
text:
We arrived at the Dominick and were greeted by Chris the doorman who was so friendly and helpful!  He took care of our car, the luggage and was so welcoming to all of us....even our dog.  The front desk staff was great and check in was smooth and pleasurable.  They accommodated all our requests.  
The rooms were quite nice and clean.  The housekeeping staff was so attentive and friendly.  During our stay guest services helped us with many of our needs.  Aida, Bobby and Maria took care of us so well.  They were always so personable and professional. We had an issue with the room and Mo took perfect care of us!!  The doormen were all so wonderful!  Chris, Christopher, Axel and Marick were all so friendly and made us feel like we were VIPs.  They are all so dog friendly!!
We had the pleasure of visiting the 7th floor for dining and the pool.  It was terrific!  Dominick was incredible!! He set us up so we had great food, and such comfortable seating in a cabana!  We felt like we were truly on vacation!  Felix was so friendly and amazing.  His happy personality is a gift.  He took such good care of us!  Catherine served us by the pool and was so pleasant and caring. What a delightful experience it all was!! We will keep coming back to the Dominick Hotel!!!

title: Excellent location, nice hotel, not a 5 star!!
text: This is a nice hotel with an excellent location. I have nothing bad to say, but it is definitely not a five star hotel. It is undoubtedly a 4-star hotel, you can notice it in the services it offers, for example the reception staff are just friendly they just don't do anything beyond what is strictly necessary .The amenities in the rooms are simply good but not like those of a five-star hotel, do not have night turn down service to the room as in any hotel of this category. The pool is very small, it is more a wading pool, and full to the top, you practically have to queue to find an available sunbed. The hotel is undoubtedly nice , the staff is friendly but if you are looking for a 5 star hotel this is not the place.

title: Great hotel!
text: This hotel was beautifully designed. The rooms were very large and were very techy which made it cool. The service at the front desk, the doormen, cleaning staff, etc. were all very kind & helpful as well. Will definitely make a point to come back & would recommend to anyone taking a trip to NYC!

title: super night at the dominick
text:
super service
from before we checked in ans throught our stay , the receptionist , the front desk and the room service team were all exceptional and went above and beyond.  special shout out to Mahindra at the front desk for helping us with super early check in and  late check out.  
just was a wonderful experience

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
My wife and I recently traveled to NYC to visit our daughter in the West Village and The Dominic was recommended to us as a great place to stay close to her new apartment and all the restaurants/activities in the Village.  In all the years we've been visiting her I think we've finally found our Go To spot.  We loved of course the location (close to everything), the nice staff, the multiple/roomy elevators (never had to wait long), and most of all the large/modern equipped rooms (spacious bathrooms and loads of technology).  We didn't have time to use the spa, fitness center or dine in the restaurant, but we did enjoy a nightcap on the rooftop lounge by the pool (great cocktails and friendly wait staff).  

A couple things of note we picked up on this visit was the relative parcity of available taxis and likewise Lyfts/Ubers.  In particular we noticed that the ride sharing services were surprisingly expensive and also not easy to find, so not wanting to risk any early morning issues getting to JFK we ordered a car (shout out here to Precision NY Chauffeur Airport Transportation).  The morning bellman made sure the guy had a place to park in front and advised us he was waiting outside.  The gentlemen working the front door were extremely friendly and helpful.  We always felt safe coming and going to the hotel (we walked around a lot and at all hours) and did not pick up on any negative vibes whatsoever in the surrounding area.  

The Dominic's lobby is large, cool and comfortable, and there never seemed to be a notable queue of people checking in or out.  That process we found to be smooth and speedy.  Again our room was huge, the king bed very comfortable, automatic everything it seems, big shower and tub, large closet (with plenty of space to store our suitcases, which is a pet peeve of ours not wanting to always be tripping over them in the notoriously cramped NYC boutique hotel rooms we've stayed in), good sized safe, etc.  We did need to have an iron/ironing board delivered to the room, but that process was quick and no big deal.  It was also nice having the guest services phone actually answered after a couple rings and the person on the other end addressing you by your name and having an accommodating demeanor.       

Well, The Dominic is where we'll be staying on all our future visits (finally we don't have to look around anymore).   The rates all considered we felt were quite reasonable based on the overall quality we received for our money.  Honestly you can't go wrong if you stay there, and I venture to say you will be pleasantly surprised.

title: Staying at The Dominick is a MUST!
text:
The property is very well appointed. Upon check on the staff was friendly without being phony. Every bellman was quick to assist. The room was beautiful. Requests through the tablet (towels, ice,etc) were taken care of quickly as well.
The location is fantastic! Walkable or a quick trip to many amazing restaurants, shopping, sight seeing.
So happy we found this hotel. Very seem less stay. You would never know they had only been back open for 1 month. We will be back!

title: Friendliest staff and great location!
text: The hotel was in the best location - Starbucks and Trader Joe’s across the street and close to the best Soho shopping and restaurants. The rooms were very spacious, modern and clean.  The best part was the service - everyone was so friendly, welcoming and ready to attend to your every need.  I couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay!

title: Soho terrific
text:
Great property. Huge rooms. Location was in soho and soho is busy and great shops and restaurants. 

This area of town seems very busy but midtown was still very quiet. 

Most of the hotel is open. The spa and some other areas are still closed. 

Their restaurant is great. Just received some great reviews.

title: Love this hotel and Mohendra at the front desk is the BEST!!
text: I have been coming to New York for a long time and I always struggle to find a comfortable hotel that is spacious and in a central location. The Dominick is IT! Mohendra at the front desk made our stay so special that I have exclusively been coming back to this hotel for the past two years thanks to him. He has honestly made this a home away from home and I can’t wait to go back.

title: Wonderful 9 night stay!
text:
We had stayed at The Dominick a few times pre-Covid and loved it.  We came to stay for 9 nights in early May and were a bit hesitant when we found out it would be reopening just a few days before for the first time since it closed for Covid, but we needn't have worried at all!!  The hotel was fabulous as always and the service top notch with many of the old employees returning.  We started staying here before our kids moved to the city and even when one lived UWS and one in EV we chose to stay here, now that they both live in WV we DEFINITELY won't be staying anywhere else.  So conveniently located to WV (about 10 min walk or one subway stop, or just turn to the right outside the front doors, walk two quick blocks and you are in the heart of Soho.  Tons of good restaurants, bars, and shopping in easy walking distance and a 1 min walk to the ACE and 2-3 min walk to the 1,2.  So easy access to anywhere you might want to go in the city.  

Because of staying there 9 nights we opted for the one bedroom suite - but even the regular King rooms are bigger than your average NYC room with very large bathrooms with tub and separate shower, and most also have a separate toilet room.  Our room was on the Skyline level which had amazing views, we had a corner room so could see One World, Hudson River, Empire State and our son noticed we could see all the way up 6th to the entrance of Central Park.  We have stayed in a So-hi level before which of course can have even more incredible views - and you won't  find views like that anywhere else in Soho.

Our breakfast was included in our rate, and though the breakfast restaurant was still closed we had room service every morning and you could put your order in the night before via the iPad, or we often called every morning and our breakfast was there in 20 mins max.  

This is our go to NYC hotel.  We are so glad NYC is back and so is The Dominick!!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: We stayed at the Dominick for a long weekend to celebrate my son’s 9th birthday. Great location and walkable to everything in the area. The hotel had a fantastic view, and the staff made it perfect - especially Mohendra, who knew our names and made sure we had everything we needed. They even surprised our son with a special treat on his birthday! Bravo, Dominick! We will be back.

title: Top Shelf Experience - doorman to bedroom
text: The property is high touch and high quality. Didn't stay long enough to settle in, but enjoyed the few hours I was there. The mini-bar was extreme, but as expected. The bath had both a shower and tub I greatly enjoyed. Top quality.

title: Wonderful Room and Location
text: This may be our new spot in New York.  This hotel is in a superb location and the one bedroom suite was the perfect room to be based in the Big Apple.  The staff was great and very helpful.  Shout out to Chris at the front door and all the staff that made our stay so nice.  The room had a lovely bathroom and nice sitting area.  Views are great and the location is perfect for exploring Soho and the Village.  This is a great spot and very dog friendly.

title: Disappointing experience, poor service
text:
In early April I booked a night at the Dominick for my wife’s birthday on May 1st.  The day of check in we called ahead  to ask about parking at which time were informed that the hotel was not opening until the following week. Nobody from the hotel called to let us know our reservation could not be honored or the delay in opening and we found out minutes before check in. This left myself and my wife in NYC trying to find somewhere else to stay for the night. 

The most disappointing part is that I have since called management at the hotel several times to ask how the mix up could have taken place.  I was only able to leave voice mails and a month later have still not heard back from anyone. This poor service is not something you would expect from such a highly rated hotel.

title: No better spot south of Times Square, Outdoor Pool Deck is a must have on summer trips!
text: Been here four times over the last decade, both as Trump Soho and The Dominick.  While in need of a slight refresh on decor, the service more than makes up for it, as the staff at this hotel are incredibly friendly, anticipate guests' needs and make a trip to NYC feel like you could just as easily be on a Caribbean vacation.  The pool deck for both lounging and getting a meal is a very unique amenity in NYC as well, most hotels just don't have the space for an outdoor pool.   On par with the Mandarin and Four Seasons uptown in my opinion, as I've stayed at both, and while the lux factor is a bit lower, the service and general vibe are equivalent.

title: AMAZING!!!!!
text:
It was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in.
I decided to book it for my sister's birthday! We had a blest in Soho! the staff and service was so accommodating, I cannot wait to visit again, I am recommending it to everyone.

title: A true 5-Star Experience
text: My girlfriend and I spent our two year anniversary at the hotel and it was amazing. We were recommended to the hotel via Amex platinum concierge service and we are very happy we followed their recommendation. The room was unbelievable, the best room and view I’ve ever seen of Manhattan. We splurged and went for breakfast in the room (well worth it). The staff was very friendly and they were kind enough to include champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in the room for us. If I were to ever stay in soho again, I’d for sure stay at the Dominick again. Thank you!

title: Great hotel, staff, and location
text:
This is the first time back post pandemic and the hotel has not missed a beat.... A lot of the same people are back at work and the service and amenities are still fantastic. 
The rooms are large by NY standards but it's a great hotel for walking.

title: Husband’s birthday!!!
text: It was so beautiful and amazing view we will definitely be returning for a longer stay. The rooms were perfectly 😍😍😍😍..... guest service was on point and there wasn't anything I needed that you guyd couldn't handle.

title: Phill - Stellar Bellman
text: Phill was exceptional to work with. I’ve stayed at this hotel for many year and the service is top notch. It has the best views of the city. Phill went above and beyond to accommodate me. I love this hotel!

title: Worst customer service from what is supposed to be superior hotel
text:
I just got off the phone with Musa, your Front Office Manager, who informed me that the hotel will not be honoring my reservation at the price that I discussed with your reservations representative on Monday May 24th.

All he did was :
1. Tell me he would honor today’s Agoda price, not the price when I made the reservation on May 24th, see below as I was promised and advised by YOUR representative.
2. He told me he was the highest ranking person a the hotel and there was nobody else I could speak to to fix the problem.
3. The only option he gave was to cancel my reservation.
4. That although there is an investigation into finding out who this person who called herself Lisa is, they won’t do anything about it now. I asked them to listen to the recording of my conversation, because I know she said when I made the reservation to take a screenshot of what I had found and the hotel would honor the price, Musa refused.
5. I asked him to listen to the recording they took, her refused.

My family and I travel often and we stay in many superior Hotels all over the world. I am beyond upset at the treatment I have received, basically being called a liar and now being put in a position having to find a hotel in New York 2 days before traveling I am not a complaining kind of person, or someone who writes reviews but this time I will be commenting everywhere including the BBB, Tripadvisor, yelp and anywhere else I can find. The feeling of being dismissed and given only the option “to cancel my reservation” is horrendous customer service. On Monday starting at 3:52pm Los Angeles time. I called 3 times to make a reservation. The first time I was on hold waiting for the reservation department for 10 minutes (I looked on my phone), I hung up and called back. Waited 8 minutes on hold, hung up and called back. The third time I asked Veronica who answered the phone again if there was a problem with the reservations department and if I should leave my phone number or call some other time, she said no, she would put me through. This time it was not that long. The representative who answered seemed very busy and short. Wanted to make the reservation immediately, I told her that I wanted to ask a couple of questions, she didn’t seem to care wanted my information and what kind of room I wanted immediately. Only after giving her all the information, but before giving my credit card she finally allowed me to ask my questions. I had a question about the bathroom wall, because in the pictures they seem see-through to the room and I didn’t want that, she said no they weren’t. After clarifying that, I asked her about price matching, that I had found this rate and I had it right in front of me. She said just to take a screenshot and to bring it with me and the price would be matched at the reception. I confirmed this with her I think 2 or 3 times. She went ahead and took my cc information and only then told me the price that the hotel was charging me and I said wait, that is even higher than the hotel website. She said well maybe it’s because those rooms aren’t available anymore. I said but you are matching the price I have right, she said yes again. I asked the representative her name, finally after 4 times I could finally hear her name and she said Lisa. Musa told my husband there is no one in the reservations department by that name. Convenient?
My husband emailed the hotel just to confirm even though I said that wasn’t necessary, he was right we have defrauded by your hotel. 
Not only am I not getting the price I was promised that I had found online, I would have to pay the higher price than I had seen on your website while I was talking to “Lisa"
 

Outraged and cannot believe your customer service.

title: As cool as advertised
text: Had a west facing suite on the 37th floor. Incredible views and a tub right at the window. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Decor both modern and comfortable. Bed so big my wife was in a different zip code. Great location in SoHo; able to walk to dinner every night.

title: Lovely Stay
text: From the moment I entered the hotel I was greeted by lovely hospitality. Neferteri, who checked me in, was friendly and gracious and even surprised us with a gift for our anniversary celebration.  The room was well appointed and clean.  We purchased the room with breakfast - the Americana breakfast is delicious and enormous.  Well more than we needed, but good.  The location is great for exploring Soho.  The view from our room was very NY, not gorgeous and quite a clear view of the Holland Tunnel below, but the floor to ceiling corner windows were great.  We ended the last night with a drink at the Vestry which is beautiful and again, service was impeccable.  We will definitely return.  Thank you.

title: Amzing views great staff
text: After a year of waiting, I am very happy to see The Dominick is back in business. The views are amazing (you most book SoHi view), the staff is very accommodating. The Dominick is a great addition to SoHo, close to great restaurants and shopping.

title: Amazing night at The Dominic
text: Hotel was fantastic and the staff is super nice.  However, I would like to send a very speacial THANK YOU to Perla who went out of her way to assure that we had a wonderful experience at the hotel.  Upgraded room and a very special gift for my wife and I once we arrived.  We will be back mainly due to Perla and the rest of the hyper vigilant and responsive staff.

title: Opening Day at The Dominick Hotel
text: I was very apprehensive when I heard that the hotel was reopening after a year of being shut down (on the day I checked in) however, all my expectations were exceeded from the moment I walked  in. The extremely knowledgeable and friendly front desk staff (Sydeka,  Marlene, Raquel, Shaneek along with Phil made me check-in seamless and made for the absolute best solo travel experience. The team even sent a bed, bowl and snacks for puppy. I would not stay at any other hotel while in New York unless the Dominick was closed. You can’t beat the view, service and amenities, oh and the view is the best I’ve ever seen in NYC, depending on the room you can see the city and Hudson River!

title: Phenomenal rooms
text: Excellent service during a storm, and one of the most phenomenal rooms I've stayed in. The small 1-bed suite is spacious, cozy, with multiple bathrooms (good for guests), automated bedside switches for blinds and lights, and a bathroom with separate tub and shower. Felt a dream.

title: Love this hotel and staff!
text: I stayed at this hotel earlier in the year and it's one of my company's preferred places to stay.  The rooms are very clean and updated.  I particularly like the staff.  Gabriela upgraded my room and made sure I had the best stay possible.  I'll definitely be staying here on all of my work trips!

title: One of the best in Manhattan
text:
I really love the hotels that have a residential feel, and The Dominick is it. The lobby was great for gathering,  the rooms are spectacular (the views of the city from the one bedroom suite!) and the staff is on point. 

I only stayed one night but I’d love to return to check out the pool and the spa. The concierge team was exceptional in getting things done.

The location of the hotel is close to SoHo, shopping and boutique restaurants.

title: Service
text: Really nice place! Felix was a great doorman and very nice and helpful with us. Definitely will visit again hotel very clean, didn’t have any problems, everyone was very helpful  my guest didn’t have any complaint

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Loved this hotel!  Great location, easy walk to restaurants in Soho.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Hotel was clean and room was large by NYC standards.  Bed was comfortable and bathroom well laid out.  Would stay there again!

title: A wonderful stay!!!
text: A really nice spot!  Book it, especially during these times, and treat yourself. The most comfortable bed, amazing views, warm customer service, Nespresso machine in room, quality bath products...:I could go on and on. I’ll stay again.

title: Amazing customer service and amazing views
text: My wife and I stayed here in March 2020 right as the U.S. COVID-19 infection rate was spiking. The hotel itself hits every note, gets everything right. The physical environment is gorgeous and tastefully decorated. Our view of the city from our room was amazing. The room was comfortable, stylish, well-maintained and clean. It lacked nothing. Customer service is second to none - every interaction we had, from check-in forward, was warm, efficient, and generous. This applies to everyone we interacted with, but a special shout-out to Felix! He helped us out and helped us save money when it would have been easier to just let us make our own mistakes.  I can't say enough good things about our experience at the Dominick Hotel! If you're staying in SoHo, this is the spot.

title: Proposal!
text:
On February 29th I propose to my girlfriend at the Dominick Hotel, we stayed in the SOHI King bedroom suite with the bed and breakfast package. The View was amazing in the day, the city Skyline was breathtaking at night. We had ordered room service for dinner which was unbelievably excellent. The tomato soup with grilled cheese, Bell & Evan's roast chicken breast to the coconut sorbet, creme brulee and the bottles of champagne. The only negative things would be I find the bed to soft and I prefer a slightly firmer bed. However, my fiance finds nothing wrong with the bed or anything else other than breakfast. She's right other than the bed and I guess we have to agree to disagree. So I guess we'll be getting a Sleep Numbers bed, soon enough after the wedding. Breakfast did not live up to dinner expectations we had the American breakfast. The fingerling potatoes were dry and hard the chicken apple sausage was overcooked. The eggs, toast and juice was good. Overall the staff was so polite, kind and helpful. From Room service, the doormen to check-in with Tajeena. She's a doll, we love her, so cool and down to earth. She was so helpful and she saw how nervous I was checking in for my proposal. She was patient with me and towards helping me get it done properly, by making sure the room was to my liking and to anything else I needed. Even check-out with Gabriela, she was cheerful, friendly and very helpful in explaining to me the bill and how everything is broken-down. She took her time and went over everything twice to make sure there was no mistakes. I love how everyone who works there gives you that personal attention and care. Thank you to everyone that works there and to those who I've mentioned by name for making our first time and hopefully not our last time at the Dominick such a special and an amazing experience. A special thanks to Slava from in house reservations for helping me make the right decision picking the Dominick and towards making our proposal a memorable one for years to come. Thank you for your help and patience.

Sincerely Ryan C.

title: My favorite hotel in the city.
text: I have been staying at The Dominic for years and thoroughly enjoy each visit. Its next to all of our favorite restaurants and shops. Each time we stay in a different part of the city, we find ourselves regretting not staying in The Dominic.

title: Amazing
text: This was a memorable experience at this hotel i  will be booking here again in the near future. It is a must to book on the higher floor as we did its worth the money privacy and  most of all the view  in a word  memorable!

title: Birthday getaway
text:
Great hotel! Very convenient to everything!
Very clean, updated, attentive staff, and overall would definitely return! Starbucks across the street, Color factory also across the street and fun for all ages, in SOHO, shopping galore!

title: Great location and design
text: Great location in NYC. The view from the upper floors is excellent. Service was great and professional. The Gym is a bit small, but has all the necessary equipment. The restaurant, including the breakfast, had great service too and a lot of options.

title: First time in Soho, Amazing hotel
text: I just spent a few days on business at the Dominick. The arrival was awesome - greeted by smiling doormen. Check in was easy, room was great! I've stayed in a lot of  great NY hotels, but the view from my room was one of the best I've had (Get the SoHi room category) The staff were all incredible: welcoming, kind, proactive, consistent. I didn't get a treatment, but asked to see the Spa (knowing I'll be back) aand all an amazing stay. And for those of you who are still, for whatever turned off that this used to be a Trump property, it IS NOT anymore! You are doing yourself a disservice  by not going to enjoy this place. Can't wait to go back in a few months to try their new Michelin restaurant.

title: Exceptional
text: The staff & accommodations were exceptional. Stanley, one of the doorman, brought our stay to a new level.  He helped us  find our way around town, recommended places to go, places to eat, where to pick up certain items.  What a treasure the hotel has in him.  It was truly a wonderful stay.

title: Amazing guest services
text: Had an amazing experience at this hotel. All the guest services (minus the room service) was on point. Especially the front desk Gabriela was extremely helpful and accommodating. Facilities and room was nice.

title: Absolute excellence in the heart of SoHo
text: This hotel has left nothing to chance.  The lobby is beautiful, warm and inviting.  Up 1 level is The Mezzanine, I used it for several business meetings.  Everything is simply superb quality here.  My room was spacious, bed was comfortable and IMPECCABLY clean.  The Dominick was also a great value, pricing was well within expectations for a luxury hotel in SoHo.  I have to recognize front desk employee Dominique, she went out of her way to help me with a mid week room transition and simply went beyond what I would ever expect to make certain my trip was perfect.  In short, you cannot go wrong staying here.

title: Dominick Review
text: Superb service as is expected in a 5 star facility. Front desk agent, Mohendra, was incredibly efficient and friendly. Took the initiative to suggest a crib and room upgrade which we agreed to. Made our stay much better and less stressful, very important when traveling with a 7 month old infant.

title: My new go-to hotel in NYC
text:
I travel to NYC every month and have tried over 20 different properties over the years, unable to settle on one until now.  Here are all the reasons why I’ll never stay anywhere else, if possible - 

Rooms - spacious, clean, with AMAZING views.

Staff - the staff is incredibly friendly.  Especially Raquel at the front desk who remembers me every time I return to the property, and has done a wonderful job of explaining the property, amenities, and nearby restaurants.  The bellman are awesome - Chris is a really nice guy and they have the BEST recommendations for things to do and places to eat nearby.

Location - it’s in SoHo near some amazing restaurants and literally across the street from Starbucks.  Whether I have meetings in downtown or midtown, there’s no place that’s more than a 20 minute Uber drive away.  

Other perks - 
You get a great big desk in the room that lets you get work done 
The Amex FHR benefits are excellent
Free coffee in the mezzanine 
Bathroom amenities (Bigelow) are nice 
Nespresso machines in the room

Only suggestion is that the rooms need a little modernizing - lighting systems are old and not connected, mobile application that lets you check in and use your phone as a key, Also the destination fee ($45 per night) sucks.  Really wish hotels would just build that into the room price.  

Overall, it’s an amazing property in a fantastic location with wonderful people working there.  I can’t wait to go back!

title: Great hotel, a few issues
text:
The hotel is great and most everything is in step.  A few things could use an adjustment.  We went to the spa for a pedicure, and although the operator was great, the equipment was sub standard for a 5 star hotel; more in line with a budget manicure place. 
The front desk; check in was great, but check out; when i questioned the destination/resort fee (it was not on the quote from American Express) the girl was fairly rude.  If you cant deal with people asking questions about things that dont match up with their paperwork, dont work in hospitality.  I still gave them 5 stars as overall we liked it.

title: WOnderful Stay at new hotel
text: Rooms lovely, staff lovely. Unfortunately the bar and restaurant were not open during our stay. Front desk staff were delightful upon our arrival. They gave us a room as soon as we arrived although it was prior to 3 PM. The day of our departure they held our bags until after theatre so we did not need to carry them with us all day. Staff was ready for food options and appeared to know the area well.

title: Birthday visit
text:
We visited the Dominick for 4 nights in February. We booked a sohi room on the 34th floor. The room was a good size especially for New York. The view was incredible!! The bed was very comfortable and the room clean. 

We booked through grand luxury hotels which meant we got $100 credit to use in the hotel and an allowance for breakfast each day to be used either in the restaurant or for room service. 

The food was delicious. We had breakfast in the restaurant 3 days and room service 1 day. We also had dinner on room service 1 day. The chicken wings were delicious. 

Stanley the doorman was especially helpful and lovely. He was there when we arrived. Helped us inside and gave a great recommendation for dinner. He also helped me with my shopping bags on another day. 

The only negative was housekeeping clearing away half a bottle of champagne. However when I complained the housekeeper manager did send a fresh bottle. It did take quite a long time for this to arrive. I chased it up after an hour. 

We’ve visited New York 3 times now and this was definitely my favourite hotel so far. We will be back.

title: Our third time, still 5-stars but a few things need improvement
text:
Our third time at The Dominick and we really got to like the place. Amazing location and quite envious at that, for there are not that many SoHo/Tribeca/Village hotels that can boast spacious rooms and luxurious amenities. 
Great service, a perfect check-in experience meriting more than 5 stars. 4 quick and smooth-riding elevators, spacious fitness center with excellent views, big rooms with breathtaking views, all of the above are essential components for a good and relaxing stay. 
However to be fair and objective, there are several things that require improvements, and a few problems that do not befit to a hotel of that rank. 
1. The overall upkeep is starting to show some wear and tear, such as stained carpet or bathroom lightswitch covers that come apart falling on the floor. 
2. Even with our registered 4 PM check-out, the programmable room keys stopped working precisely at 12 PM, involving the inconvenience of going back to the reception and getting new keys. 
3. No turndown service, even though a hotel employee had stopped by our room in the evening for a complimentary fruit plate. The absence of the turndown service is a major... turndown, excuse the pun. 
4. No shoehorn, no clothes brush in the room, even though the said items were available during our previous stays.
5. The TV streaming is only enabled for iOS/Apple devices and not for Androids, that is despite almost equal amount of Android phones vs Apple phones in the US. 
6. Even after 1 year, the former Spring and Varick restaurant that has been touted as a long-awaited venture of a Michelin-star chef Shaun Hergatt, still hasn't opened its doors.  
7. The bathroom lighting is way too low, making it virtually impossible to shave or apply makeup. To be fair, the bathroom lighting scourge is very common, even among the top luxury hotels.  
8. Now, there is a certain incorrect advertisement regarding the Varick Street Icon parking, for which the hotell allegedly validates its guests' parking. True, for 25 hrs parking, after presenting our validated parking ticket, the price was reduced from $130 to $84. Great, isn't it? The problem though is that $130 is not the real price but the advertized price. If you are using the ParkWhiz app, the same parking, for the same time would cost you exactly the same $84, whether you stay at The Dominick or not.  Otherwise, the parking price is fair for the area; it is impossible to find anything more affordable in the immediate vicinity. 
To sum up all of the above, only out of our dedication to the Dominick we rated it as 5 stars. A more unbiased approach would necessitate a 4-star rating.  
We are looking forward for the Management to take care of the above. We will be happy with another pleasant stay at the Dominick.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Hotel não muito grande p padrão NYC. Mas de excelente qualidade. Café da manhã divino, a lá carte ( não tem buffet). Apartamentos ótimos. Com maravilhosa vista da cidade. A localização deixa um pouco a desejar se vc pretende ir museus etc pois no extremo sul da ilha. Próximo do one world tarde Center. Funcionários muito atenciosos e prestativos

title: Southern Hospitality
text:
I celebrated my 60th birthday with my three adult children in NYC and we thoroughly enjoyed staying at The Dominick. Their entire staff is by far the best trained and most pleasant employees in the industry. The In Room Dining servers heard it was my birthday and when bringing my breakfast order up they surprised me with a cake, complete with candle, and Nicole and Elaine sang! Our housekeeping staffer, Vera, was very professional and very kind. The linens were incredibly soft and the bed was the perfect comfort for my liking. The Mezzanine was a great spot to grab a quick delicious bite before the Sunday matinee and the bar was a festive place to join local friends. While coming and going we always were politely greeted and we always felt safe. 
Before we returned home I stopped at the front desk to be sure to compliment them in all aspects of our stay. I also left notes and gratuities for those that served our three rooms. They deserved it! I highly recommend The Dominick. And just as an added note, whenever we were asked where we were staying EVERYONE said they love The Dominick!

title: Great stay at the Dominick
text: Beautiful property and great staff. Nicole in room service was exceptional. Felt like we had a new friend in NYC by the time we left. The only surprise was that there was no door between the guest room and bathroom. Would have preferred a bit more privacy. Would still return. Location is fantastic.

title: Great customer service
text: Front desk staff is warm and  welcoming.  Sydeka made sure I had the perfect room. Room was comfortable, views were great.  All the staff, from front desk to cleaning staff were warm and professional. Close proximity to subway stations in a walkable area. My only negative note was the towels were a bit rough.  Hotel robes were wonderfully soft & comfortable.

title: My stay
text:
The Dominic is a home away from home in a full service luxury environment, inside a hotel. The staff is dedicated to their clients. Gabriela, 
  , Talia , Stanley, axel, Chris and housekeeping, bell staff and concierge provide support which is indispensable. They make it my home .

title: Love the Dominick!!
text: We have been staying at the Dominick at least once or twice a year for about 7 years now.   We love everything about this hotel; the location, the view, the service, the beautiful rooms and suites and the wonderful staff!

title: The Perfect Escape
text: My recent stay at the Dominick Hotel was marked by incredible service and a beautiful room looking out on both the river and up into town.  The doorman, the front desk and everyone in between was welcoming, helpful and gracious.   The hotel itself is beautiful with high ceilings and the room was perfect with an incredibly comfortable bed and classic luxury decor.  I wished I had more time to spend.

title: Hotel is in a great location and has great views, but the food and service are lacking.
text: we loved the hotel location, the rooms and the wall of glass in each room had great views of the city.  However, (i) the snack menu was very bad and (ii) the built-in tip didn't reward the good servers and didn't provide a learning opportunity for the bad servers.  The breakfast menu/food wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good either, and some of the service was quite bad.

title: Terrific hotel
text: This hotel was terrific and we will most definitely stay here again. We travel to fine hotels all over and the Dominick had staff that stood out. Nicole delivered our breakfast and was outstanding, thinking of every detail. The same with our housekeeper—professional, warm, wanting to make sure our stay was perfect. These details count. We had a suite with a killer view.

title: Weekend get away
text:
Everyone at the hotel was great. Check in and check out was seamless. The bed is amazing as well as the shower and bathtub! The location is convenient to other bars and restaurants In the area.

Will definitely be back.

title: Our Elopement
text:
The entire staff was fantastic.  The front desk rep Mohendra started off with upgrading us when he saw the wedding dress on tow.  Then Nicole and my wife were speaking about our “wedding cake” would be canollis at Grimaldys. A few hours later a hotel Rep showed with a Weddding cake.  Nicole was so engaging and helpful, even Volunteered to take some pictures for us.  
Facility wise, the hotel is gorgeous. Perfect location near shops and dining. 

I could go on and on.

Thank you for making our elopement more special. We’ll be booking for many anniversary’s to come.  

The Mayeux’s

title: Overnight in the city
text: Great experience. Everyone was super nice and easy to check in and out. The two doormen (both names Chris) were very welcoming and helpful. Spa was great too.  The restaurant had a very good breakfast.

title: Awesome!!!
text: Overall it was an overall great  experience. We were able to upgrade our skyline king room to a studio suite. The Views of Manhattan and Downtown Jersey from our room on the 32nd floor were amazing!!! The room was cery clean and well designed. Staff were excellent. The location of the hotel was also great, a lot of shoppes were in the area and was close to 5th ave.

title: Awesome room, great service, great food
text: The room was fantastic. Quiet room & comfortable bed. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The breakfast at the restaurant was great too! I will definitely be looking for availability at The Dominick first any time I’m visiting SOHO.

title: Great front desk staff
text:
I've stayed at the Dominick for business at least once a month for the last year.  Far and away the best NYC hotel I've experienced and in a fantastic Soho neighborhood location. 

The rooms are gorgeous - lovely spacious marble bathrooms, rainhead showers, soft sheets and a comfortable bed. Gym facilities are very nice with plenty of high end treadmills, Peletons and equipment.  The food, while pricey, is always first rate.

Far and away what separates this hotel from other luxury hotels in NYC like the Four Seasons, Conrad or St Regis is the front desk staff. Specifically Gabriella and Caesar who always take good care of me and have saved me more than once when my business needs have required me to stay an additional night or shift my reservation.  They're both exceptional in going above and beyond and much of the reason I continue to choose this hotel.

title: "Fancy" and upscale hotel
text: Despite the fact that it was a Trump hotel at some point in its history, I very much enjoyed my stay at the Dominick.  This is definitely a high-end hotel and the service was great, though at times bordered on the "fancy" and uptight versus the all-encompassing warmth I prefer from service.  The spa was pretty magnificent, as is the location.

title: Could have given 4 starts but...
text: Obviously the location is great and the suites are nice but there were a few details that matter in the luxury business that make me only give 3 stars. I say that in comparison to hotels that truly deserve 4 and 5 stars. Service is basically average +, not stellar. It is a bit random, some staff are great, others don't care. Room service is OK, and very expensive. For example:  we ordered a steak medium cooked, it arrived very well done. Small detail but not in this type of hotel.  We weer told that we could get 3 garment pressing for free , but instead they delivered a steaming machine for do it yourself :-)  etc etc

title: AMAZING!
text: The Dominick is absolutley beautiful. We celebrated my husband's 40th birthday with friends and everyone was blown away by the hotel. They have the best views and the best doormen in the city. All of the staff was incredible. We will be back!

title: maryg
text: Very nice hotel in Soho.  Modern decor.  Clean.  King room was spacious.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The massage at the spa was one of the best massages I have ever had; my daughter also had a massage and said the same thing about hers.

title: Best hotel in lower Manhattan
text:
I travel to NYC a lot for work - about 4 to 6 times a year. In the beginning, I would try staying in a different hotel each time just to explore the many options this city has to offer. Eventually, I got sick of the trial and error. I hate Times Square with a passion, can’t stand the amount of tourists in Midtown, and uptown is too inconvenient for my meetings at Hearst and WTC. SoHo is my favorite neighborhood in all of New York, and The Dominick is the only 5-star hotel in this area. Naturally, The Dominick became my 2nd home.

First of all, I’d like to applaud their doorman Stanley. He always greets me with a smile and a warm welcome, offers directions when I leave the hotel on foot, helps me with my baggage without me having to ask, and walks me to/from my Uber with an umbrella in hand when it’s raining. He truly makes my stay so much more wonderful than it already is.

The reception staff are courteous and polite, and hotel management is quick to address any issues I have with my room/stay. Rooms are extremely spacious - a rare sight in NYC. My favorite rooms are the 1-bedroom suites facing the Hudson River. The housekeeping team does an amazing job, and the ladies greet me kindly with offers of water and chocolate even when I decline turndown service. In fact, every hotel staff that I’ve encountered would greet me politely as I pass them by - I’ve stayed in too many notable NY hotels with staff that lack basic courtesy. Need I even mention the location?! You have Trader Joe’s across the street, Dominick Ansel Bakery a couple blocks away, plus some of the best shopping and restaurants in SoHo.

To give a fair review, I have to mention some areas of improvement:

- I’m quite sensitive to smell, so I’ve had to switch rooms many times due to a weird stench that smelled like some sort of chemical. I’m also not a fan of the air freshener that they use in the hotel lobby - it makes me feel nauseous.

- I wish they had a real business center. Since I’m primarily in NYC for work, I’ve had to use the business center quite often. It’s not really much of a business center - simply a computer and a printer located in the corner of the mezzanine level, where people often dine or congregate in big groups. They charge you for time spent using their computer, and for each piece of paper printed. Their printer does not have scanning or faxing abilities, which is really inconvenient. 

- Lastly, I think their elevators are quite old and in need of an update. (But I’ve learned that this is super common in NY buildings.)

If The Dominick’s management were to improve on the above, this would truly be the best hotel in New York. Regardless - The Dominick delivers on its promise of a five-diamond stay.

title: Fabulous experience
text: From the very start of my experience at the front desk with Gabriela to the day to day treatment by all the staff it was first class.  I always felt like I was the only guest and it was everyone's sole job to take care of me!  The locations was perfect, the room exceptional and it was always super clean.  This will be my 'go to' hotel for all future visits.

title: Great rooms, great service - a lot of construction
text:
Booked a SoHi View two bedroom suite at the Dominick for a family of four. 

The room consists of a one bedroom suite with a massive bathroom and a separate king room. You go from one room to the other via external foyer that has then an additional door to the general hallway. Not the best but not the worst solution either. 

Views from the corner suite are absolutely fantastic - Hudson, Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building all. Really enjoyed the set up and the whole family loved to hang out in between walks around the SoHo and Tribeca areas. 

Location is absolutely fantastic with the best places for food and shopping in New York right around you. 

The interiors in the rooms are not exactly new but nothing to fault there. Set up is good and beds are great.

Couple of weird things: nowhere to hang your hand towels and single-ply toilet paper (which you really should not have in a five star hotel). 

If you wake up early (like we do) then a highly recommend hotel. If you’d like to sleep in, then that’s probably not going to happen due to the construction noise which starts very early, every day of the week.

title: Wonderful Hotel & Service
text: We always stay at the Dominick on our trips to NYC. We lived in the West Village for years and love the proximity to the neighborhood. Gabrielle at the front desk is always so kind and remembers us every time we check in. She even figured out a way to help us when I accidentally booked the wrong dates for our trip and the hotel was full. She is the best! I highly recommend the Dominick.

title: wonderful location
text: We stayed for three nights in December. The location is fabulous, We would walk everywhere or hop on the subway. The hotel smelled amazing. Honestly, I would buy the candle or whatever it was that scented the lobby and elevators. We stayed on the 17th floor and did not have view and it was perfect. The place was quiet and clean. The room was huge for New York. The staff were friendly. I would definitely go back and recommend it. And I am picky.

title: Great front desk treatment
text: It is always delightful having a person greet you so nicely after a 12 hour trip @Gabriela Buchelt definitely did so and did everything to accommodate my needs. @Hector Aquino has also been extremely accommodating and helpful. Overall its always a pleasure seeing the familiar faces of the staff that make the stay very home-y!

title: Cheaply finished and tired
text: I was so disappointed in this hotel given the price and some of the reviews I had read. The rooms were cheaply finished, tired and not well cleaned (dirty shower screen, filthy coffee machine, generally very dusty). Service was painfully slow to non-existent, particularly at the front desk. The whole place just had an attitude of not caring; which made it such an unpleasant place to stay. The rooms were also poor for working - most of the powerpoints didn’t work (or even better, worked intermittently!) and there was inadequate lighting in the room. Honestly don’t waste your money and stay somewhere else.

title: Its nice but def not 5 stars
text: There really isnt any staff anywhere.  The Mezz bar , I think was supposed to be an office center?  It is really strange.  Rooms are nice but not comparable to other 5 star hotels.  No turn down service and none of the little extras you would expect with the price or 5 star.  They are clean but I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are banged up and showing wear and tear,  No concierge, no neighborhood recommendations or reservations available.  the bedding isnt great and Its just not 5 star.

title: Ótimos dias neste hotel
text: Estivemos neste hotel por 8 dias. Ótimo hotel, muito limpo com atendimento excepcional e uma localização privilegiada. Muitos restaurantes nas proximidades e uma infinidade de lojas. Recomendo aos brasileiros que viajam a Nova York se hospedarem neste hotel.

title: What a stay!
text: The rooms are beautiful and have absolutely stunning views of the city day and night. From check in to check out we were treated very well by all of the staff, including Gabriela Bucheli who went above and beyond to ensure our stay was one of a kind. We will be staying here again for sure.

title: A true 5 star experience.
text: The hotel offers stunning views of the city and is kept very tidy. Every member of the staff was extremely courteous, respectful and helpful. Gabriela Buchelli made sure our experience was nothing short of perfect during our stay, and we will definitely be returning.

title: Expensive views
text:
The location for us was superb and super peaceful. Walking to the Village or SoHo, TriBeCa, Little Italy, Nolita, etc, is dead easy.  If you want midtown madness on your doorstep then this maybe isn’t your best bet.

The views from our suite (SoHi two bedroom facing north and east) were breathtaking.  Could spend literally all day looking out of the massive windows and not tire of it.  The rooms were very nice, beds super comfy, shower nice and large.  It was kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff.  However we did notice a few things looked a bit tired (hinge falling off a cupboard door, laminate starting to peel back, etc).  It’s a shame they didn’t have Netflix or a Bluetooth speaker, both seem like they should be as standard.

I had thought we were entitled to a welcome drink, and coffee every morning, and decent WiFi without extra charge, as part of the SoHi booking.  When my husband checked he was told it was because we had booked through booking.com so weren’t entitled to those enhancements.  However on our last day were were told by another member of staff that we hadn’t used our ‘room credit’.  It was disappointing to be honest as for the money we spent on this stay you’d think a glass of Prosecco on arrival would be the least they could do!  It also would have saved shlepping over to Starbucks in the freezing cold.

The staff were great, very helpful and in particular we want to mention Dominick, who was delightful.

On the whole I would recommend this hotel, but would say they squeezed every last dollar out of me and I don’t feel like I was getting anything ‘extra’ even though I paid ‘extra’ money.

title: Polite and helpful staff with nice accomodations
text: Only a one night stay but the staff was very helpful and polite and expertly handled any issues we had. Room is nicely appointed and bed was very comfortable. Only negative was all the door slamming early in the morning for some reason.

title: HOTEL is in a great position , close to restaurants and shopping.
text: I had a corner suite which gave me great views of Hudson River and Empire State Building , Walked down Spring Street to Soho shops and restaurants.  Lola Taverna served the best wagyu steak ever.  Close to Trader Joes and CVS pharmacy.

title: Great Hotel and Service
text: This was our sixth stay at the Dominick (stayed there when it was Trump Tower as well)...our whole family stayed in your hotel one daughter, one son and family for Christmas to spend it with our son who lives in Soho....it’s our favorite hotel, service has always been impeccable. We all stayed for a week and hope that when we return again, usually once a year we will be recognized as frequent guests and given upgrades like others mention...please keep everything the same, front desk,. doormen, housekeeping! Hope you work on the destination fee charged...not sure I understand why when we already pay so many other taxes...is it a New York law now?

title: A Favorite in Lower Manhattan
text: We love staying at the Dominick when we visit SoHo and the Village area.  Very convenient to shops, restaurants and much activity.  Also easy access to Broadway for a show, etc.  The Dominick adds to the experience being an elegant hotel with every luxury in the public areas and the rooms.  The rooms are large, comfortable bedding and great hotel facilities like a gym and spa.  The rooftop pool in the warmer months is also a must and relaxing getaway from the hustle 40+ stories below.  Best of all are the staff, every one of which are friendlier than the next with a sincere willingness to help.  Chris, the doorman, was especially helpful whether it came to finding a parking spot, or pointing out places to visit or just providing a very friendly welcome after a long walk.  Mahindra at the front desk, always friendly and helpful,  sharing some terrific stories.  Best of all, he remembered us from before even though we hadn't been back in a year.  The Dominick is truly a vacation within a vacation.

title: Back in my favorite hotel!
text:
This is one of the most wonderful places to stay in New York City. I make it a point to stay here whenever I come up on business and I’m always greeted by my favorite lady Gabby! She makes me feel like I’m at home, remembers my name and places me in a room w/ an amazing view!  

Comfort, beauty & the friendliest staff in the city! You won’t regret choosing The Dominick.

title: NYC Birthday Celebration
text: My best friend and I have birthdays a day apart so we celebrated with friends and shared a suite. The rooms were spacious and the service was excellent.  I never expect space in a NYC Hotel room, but the bedrooms were spacious and the bathrooms were luxurious. A great shower that was "everything" and a soaking tub. We could not have asked for a better place to spend our special birthdays.

title: Great stay for a girls weekend!
text: My girlfriends and I had a great weekend at the Dominick. The suite (with rollaway) was perfect for 3 of us...very spacious and comfortable. The staff was wonderful and professional from the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping. The location is perfect for shopping and there are tons of great restaurants nearby. I highly recommend the Dominick and will definitely be back!

title: Amazing Staycation
text:
We took the opportunity for a Staycation (all the way from Brooklyn!) and The Dominick was an outstanding choice.   Neferteri at the front desk was amazing and gave us an upgrade when she found out it was the anniversary of the day we met.  A bottle of champagne was also delivered which was a very nice touch.  We had a beautiful room with a killer city view, early check in / late check out and the hotel itself was fantastic...could not have asked for more!!

Only gripe was that the bathroom light refused to turn off but that did nothing to dampen what was a wonderful stay.  Would definitely recommend and will probably return!

title: Awesome
text: Beautiful.. I highly recommend this property - People were very friendly - Staff was great Hotel was in a great location and the hotel rooms were beautiful -  I would absolutely travel there again.. The only thing I can tell your for sure is to make sure that you utilize your PR to say who owns the hotel because people think it is a Trump property and that is not a good idea these days..

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: I’ve been to NYC for work several times in the past & I have to commend The Dominick for their upscale amenities and outstanding customer service. My husband made the trip with me and our room was large enough for the both of to feel comfortable, which is hard to come by in the New York. You can find housekeeping working around the clock to ensure that your room is kept up to a high standard during your stay. The front desk is extremely accommodating, they allowed us to check-in very early since our got in that morning and they had the availability. Just ask. There’s also a doorman at the entrance for what felt like 24-hour service. The Dominick puts their best foot forward everyday and I appreciate them for that. I will make this my preferred hotel when I’m in NY for work or leisure.

title: Really great spot
text: location is awesome. staff is pro. rooms are big. the ONLY reason I didn't give it a full five stars is because every once in awhile something will be broken - but all in all this place is my fave in NY

title: Amazing, One of a Kind First Impression by Staff!
text: I want to start off with at the time of this review I have yet to stay at The Domenick, as my stay is two days from this review. However with first impressions I received with our Front Desk Agent Gabriella B. I felt compelled to write this review. I was looking to book a hotel to 'Wow' my wife for a romantic getaway weekend in the city and was stuck between this hotel and two others that I visited prior. The staff upon entry were very hospitable but that of which Gabriella displayed was just beyond words. She listened with an engaging ear and it felt real not cheesy and was very helpful in accommodating my every request, therefore it was a no-brainer in sealing the deal. I look forward to staying at the Domenick this weekend, and wonderful first impression, Thanks Team!

title: New favorite hotel in NYC!
text:
The Dominick Hotel does everything right!  From the moment we arrived, the entire hotel staff went above and beyond to make me and my daughter feel welcome and special.  I booked through Amex Platinum, and we enjoyed the extra amenities- especially the late 4pm checkout that the hotel graciously extended to 5pm for us as we had a late night flight.  

The breakfast through room service was a highlight.  It arrived all 3 mornings within 20 minutes of ordering and the omelette, pastries and coffee were especially delicious.  It was my daughter's birthday, and the wonderful gentlemen brought her a cake and candle and sang Happy Birthday to her!  

The doormen were always so friendly and kind.  We felt like we were staying in our own NYC apartment building rather than a hotel.

The location can't be beat!  Within easy walking distance to all the best restaurants and shopping in SoHo!  I especially recommend Dominique Ansel Bakery right down the street.  The hot chocolate is the best in the city and so are the pastries (the famous Cronut deserves the hype).  Also Pinch Chinese is not to be missed. Trader Joe's and CVS are right across the street if you need anything!

Our SoHi view room was perfection on the 41st floor.  Huge for NYC and thoughtfully appointed with every detail for comfort.  I recommend upgrading for the view- it is worth it!  The tub sits in a huge window and taking a bath looking out over the city is heaven. The bed was very comfortable with nice quality sheets.  There was not a door separating the bedroom from bath.  This was a bit awkward for privacy.  Loved the rain head shower and C.O. Bigelow bath products.  I do think the quality of the towels could be better.  But the robes were wonderful!!  One touch controls to open curtains and turn lights on/off are very nice features.

I think this is the best value of any hotel I've ever stayed in!  Very reasonable for NYC. Superior customer service, large rooms and bathrooms, and the best location.  I will never stay anywhere else!  I have stayed at The Plaza, Mandarin Oriental and Ritz, but I can honestly say the staff at The Dominick are the very best!

title: They are too nice.
text: The service at the Dominick is uniquely American. Relaxed but efficient. Friendly but never fake. Hard working but they make it look easy. I truly enjoy staying here. The rooms are lovely. The views are classic. The breakfast is delicious (Maple pancakes!). And SoHo is footsteps away.

title: Magical
text: For the past several years my family has celebrated Christmas at The Dominick (and former Trump Soho.)  We love obviously love the experience (amazing accommodations, great shopping, delicious local restaurants, and NYC at Christmas) and keep coming back.  But this year was simply over the top.  We were given the most amazing accommodations on a really high floor and the two bedroom suite had two huge rooms PLUS a half bath!  I was - almost - embarrassed to occupy so much square footage in the city.  And the view straight down 6th Avenue was breath taking.  Almost like its own little Xmas tree.  It should be marketed as a Central Park view - because you could see Central Park and even beyond!  My husband didn't want to leave the room!  And neither did my family of young adults.  We all hung out in the room, played rummy, and even watched the Wizard of Oz together.  As my family leaves the nest, moments like this are so precious.  The Dominick set the stage for a magical Christmas for my family.  Thank you!

title: Great hotel great location
text:
We stayed at the Dominick for 4 nights. The staff of the hotel are very helpful and friendly, the design is modern and warm and the level of service is excellent.
The bathrobes are a unique treat.
There is a Starbucks Coffee across from the hotel, 2 Subway stations and bus stops within a few minutes of walking from the hotel. There are places to eat (restaurants, fast foods, supermarkets etc.) all within a walking distance of between 1 min up to 10 minutes from the hotel. Overall, it is one of the best hotels I've been to lately and has a great location. I warmly recommend :-)

title: Amazing Service, Amazing Room...Once Again!
text:
My family has stayed at The Dominick Hotel a number of times, both before and after its change in management, however, this time was simply exceptional. 

We stayed in one of the Landmark Penthouses (Rm 4201), which had exceptional views of downtown, the Hudson River, SoHo, and Midtown. The room was very spacious and had amazing floor to ceiling windows. It felt more like a luxury apartment than simply a hotel suite.

At our previous stay, some of the furnishings seemed a bit worn, but it appears that the hotel has taken steps to replace old furniture and finishes. The room felt fresh, new, and exceptionally clean!

The service, while always very good, was especially good during this stay. The doormen put in effort to remember my family, the cleaning staff was always very attentive to whatever request we had, and the receptionist went out of her way to ensure we had the best room possible. In addition, we were pleasantly surprised by the free breakfasts for every member of the family and the generous hotel credit which we put towards the spa.

Perhaps one of the best aspects of The Dominick is its location, very close to all the best shops and restaurants in SoHo.

It is without a doubt that I will be returning to The Dominick for future stays in New York City!

title: The Dominick Doesn’t Disappoint
text: We have consistently chosen this hotel since coming to NYC for the past 10 years. We are always pleased with the service, clean rooms, amazing views, and easy access to the subway. On this particular visit we were able to stay in the same room we had last year. Thank you to the desk staff for the extra effort to make that happen. The So-Hi view is worth the extra cost.

title: Super et quelle vue sur Manhattan
text:
Très bel hotel luxueux super bien placé à Soho, et le métro au pied permet d'aller partout très facilement. Les bell men sont adorables, le staff au front desk vraiment efficace et serviable, les serveurs au petit-déjeuner efficaces et sympa.
Et une chambre magnifique au 40è étage, avec vue incroyable sur Manhattan et Brooklyn. Mention spéciale à la salle de bain avec une baignoire qui vous permet de profiter de la vue, en récupérant des km de marche dans Manhattan en prenant son bain.
Avons réservé via Grand Luxury Hotels et bénéficié d'un upgrade et des petits déjeuners offerts.
Petit bémol sur le bruit des ascenseurs qu'on entend passer, mais pas vraiment génant.

title: The dominik hotel soho, NY
text: Very nice hotel; pricey but good, attentive staff & clean rooms. Food is good not amazing but very good. The linens for the bed are very comfortable it is a busy hotel but again managed nicely. I will stay again when I have to head back to NY and hope to try the spa this time...

title: Perfect Experience
text: My husband and I went for a spontaneous trip over New Years to New York and found by accident The Dominick Hotel. And we couldn't be more please. The value for money is incredible! We had an amazing room on the 41st floor with stunning views over the city. But the best thing we can say about that place is the staff. The service wasn't only impeccable, but everyone was so exceptional warm and friendly. We really felt welcome and appreciated. Spa treatments were perfect too.

title: Great Stay with Amazing Service
text: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Dominick several times. Each time was an amazing experience. Every time I stay at the hotel I work with the front desk agent, Gabriela Bucheli. I wouldn't stay at the hotel as often if it wasn't for this kind, hard working, friendly individual. Every time I came back to The Dominick she made me feel as though I was home. Always a smile on her face, I have only amazing things to say about her.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Just like to thank the Dominick hotel for a fantastic stay we booked 2 rooms on the upper floors all of our requests was meet, the staff I cannot think of any faults, the doorman are a credit as you can ask them anything and you will be pointed in the right direction. 

I took me some time to pick a hotel and cancelled one stay at another hotel before making the decision on the Dominick so I have all ready done my homework so if you would like a hotel that has great views, great location, great staff then go with this on we spent 6 nights in all at the hotel.

title: Convenient and spacious, what a view!
text: We were very pleased with our stay as a family of four. Location was perfect. We had a corner suite and no visibility from any other buildings and the view was unbelievable. Unlike hotels in older buildings we could control the temperature in our room. Our kids are messy and housekeeping did a great job and it was nice coming back to a clean room at the end of our busy days. The amenities were great. Some people had delays with breakfast but it never really bothered us. The king sized bed in our room was really comfortable. The only drawback was that the bathroom had no door and the door to the WC was only frosted so not a lot of privacy.

title: Great stay
text:
All around a great, great stay.   Staff was super friendly and had nice, thoughtful touches on virtually every thing we requested...    or didn’t request but was provided.   We had a deal where we had free breakfasts and some credits.   Made the stay for that neighborhood actually quite inexpensive.    Rooms were quiet and nice, quite large for NYC.   Great neighborhood on the edge of soho. Easy walk to shopping and great eating. 

Special thanks to Nicole who served us breakfast in our room every day (part of our deal).   Super friendly and thoughtful.  The door staff were exceptionally helpful and proactive with suggestions.  Even when you called for something the telephone responses were great.   

Overall a really great, friendly, nice place.   We will return for sure

title: Best Stay Ever! Amazing views and A+ service
text: This year our family spent Christmas in NYC From the moment you walk in to The Dominick everything was A+. Our family of 5 had the most magical time at The Dominick. For a larger family who normally would book 2 rooms regardless I highly highly recommend the 2 bedroom suite. With floor to ceiling windows as walls you can imagine the views. We had a high floor and are completely hooked; can’t imagine ever staying anywhere else in the city 😍. Can’t wait to go back. Best family vacation ever!

title: Great Location in SoHo
text: Located near terrific restaurants, good shopping!  Check in was a breeze, very proessional, Rooms are spacious, clean and  comfy.  Breakfast was delicious.  Hot chocolate in the lobby in afternoon was a nice touch, especially since it was cold out!   I loved my stay at the Dominick!  Will definately be back!

title: Stupendo
text: L’Hotel The Dominick gode di un ottima posizione , strategico per girare per le magnifiche strade di New York . Il personale è disponibile e gentile . L’hotel è semplicemente bellissimo .  Tornerò molto volentieri . Consigliatissimo

title: Very nice, with a few small drawbacks
text:
Most of what I would write is already written in other reviews, so just to quickly note a few things:

- I booked this hotel through the Amex FHR program.  The hotel honored the upgrade, and I was pleased to learn there were no restrictions (other than the destination fee, below) on use of the property credit.  Even the minibar is included.  The upgrade to a "Sohi" room was quite nice -- though the room is the same as elsewhere in the hotel, the city view from the 37th floor was pretty remarkable.

- I realize that most hotels in NY these days are including a silly "destination fee" to mask higher room rates, and this one was no exception.  To be fair, this is all clearly disclosed at the time of booking, so there's nothing really dishonest about it, but I'd much prefer the rate simply includes the cost.  It's really quite silly to charge me $40 a day for things that should either be included, or which I have no desire to pay for: 
 coffee and tea (which is complimentary in literally every decent hotel anywhere), garment pressing (which most travelers won't use), a $40 spa credit (which many travelers won't use), access to the fitness center (which is complimentary in literally every decent hotel anywhere).  The fee also "includes" Wifi (which should be included anyway), shoe shine service (which most luxury hotels provide), and local phone calls (seriously?).  I don't fault The Dominick for having to compete in the NY market, but this list of included items is pretty ridiculous -- there is nothing special for The Dominick to offer for this fee, so it really just should be folded into the room rate.

- The location is fabulous:  just enough away from all the crazy, while still being right down the block from multiple subway lines, with a Trader Joe's and CVS right on the corner.

- The rooms are fine -- quite big for NYC standards, with a great bathroom, comfortable bedding, etc.  I wish they could have put in a decent lounge chair, however -- the one chair in the room was not particularly comfortable.

- Service was extremely friendly -- both at the front desk, and housekeeping.  

- Breakfast was very good, though the bar and restaurant area are tiny.  For a hotel of this size, I would have expected a bigger bar area.

Overall, this was a nice hotel for a fair enough rate for NYC.  With the extra amenities of the FHR program, it's worth the stay.  Even without those amenities, this is a nice, quiet hotel in a great location.

title: Fabulous Views, wonderful rooms and staff that goes above and beyond!
text: Good size rooms with great light and breathtaking views from the bed room and bathroom. Convenient to Soho, TriBeCa and the West Village. The staff was all friendly, courteous and knowledgable. In particular, Sydeka at the front desk went above and beyond to help find the perfect room and answer any questions we had - she had all the info we needed and gave it to us with a genuine smile. We will definitely stay here again!

title: excellent experience
text:
Excellent staff and service.  Crystal the luxury concierge set up my Christmas packages and decorations perfectly for our arrival.  We celebrated Christmas with our daughter who is living in New York now, and we live in Los Angeles.
Erik the front desk concierge went above and beyond to ensure a document was messengered to the location in Brooklyn, which had a very specific deadline.
I will always be grateful for his assistance.  Happy New Year to everyone at the Dominick, we can't wait t come back!

title: Great Location.  Staff is top notch!
text: The location is perfect.  The Doormen were so helpful and their recommendations for restaurants were always spot on.  Our only complaint was that our room was uncomfortably warm.  Even after the thermostat was changed, it was till too warm - and kept the ac on 66 - even though it was very cold outside.

title: Our new home
text:
On this , our second trip to NY , we decided to be adventurous and try a new hotel and new part of town. A quick note our last trip  We stayed at The Dominic and were blown away.  
So to make a long story short , this time we settled  on another so called 5 star hotel.  On our third night at the new hotel we decided we could  no longer take the noise from outside construction, the young staff, that you can confuse for  interns , the hot water fluctuations , Poor room service, I can go on. 
We decided to throw in the towel on our kick to be bold and adventurous and decided to go back to the trusted Dominick. 
On our arrival, at a real 5 Star Hotel, Cesar A. (hotel p.r. ) was a God send and sympathetic to our plight.  He made sure we got a room we were happy with and even threw in some extras to make up for the other hotel ! Each and every  hotel staff from the smiling door men Chris and friends, To Solomon and Nicole at room service  all made us feel like we were at home ! 
Cesar even checked back with us to see if everything was to our liking. 
The room was large, quiet and cozy with great views. The bathroom  a great size full of new plush towels  and the shower flowed  with consistent pressure and hot water !
We really couldn’t ask for more.   
Thank you for turning our trip around.  And when it comes to accommodations   in New York there  wont be another home for us but The Dominick

title: Amazing Christmas Stay!
text: We stayed at The Dominick for 3 nights over the Christmas holiday. Our suite on the 34th floor was incredible! The views looking out at the Hudson were breathtaking. The setup was incredibly spacious and comfortable and so lovely to come back to after long days enjoying NYC. The suite was modern in every sense, but also had a vintage NYC charm to it. Water pressure was fabulous and there was an abundance of hot water. The gym was terrific, including Peloton bikes. Every employee we encountered was very friendly and accommodating. Our adult son is living in the neighborhood and The Dominick will now be our hotel of choice when visiting. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Nice place
text: Big rooms. Good value for money. Great showers. Staff responds quickly. The lobby and restaurant aren’t great but it’s an amazing location with good value for product. Will definitely return to stay at this hotel.

title: great views, fabulous bath tub, great location
text: This hotel is really conveniently located in Soho.  Beautiful views and really fabulous bathtub with a view of the New York skyline from the tub. Comfortable beds and nice sofa. Really friendly staff.  This is a winner!

title: Fabulous
text:
(+) Spacious room. Big windows, plenty of light and amazing views. Courteous, attentive and efficient staff. Room service twice a day. Clean rooms. Amenities & toiletries restocked daily. Nespresso coffee machine. Room features a remote control for the curtains and lights.

(-) No rooftop or terrace to take advantage of the amazing location the hotel has. There is limited space for a “living area”.

title: exquisite hote
text:
spacious modern hotel with prime location in SOHO. Wonderful for dining, shopping and strolling.  The staff is obsessed with outstanding service.  Your wish is their command.

Suites are spacious and elegant. Bathrooms are tip top and beds are heavenly!
