title: Wasted so much time dealing with horrible service!
text:
I don’t like negative reviews, but this hotel earned this one. Our rooms were not ready at check in time at 3pm, we were told to come back at 4, rooms still not ready. At that point we had show tickets followed by dinner reservations we didn’t want to miss so we left. The hotel finally called at 6pm to let us know our room was ready, 6pm! By the time we got back from dinner, it was 11:30pm. Not fun unpacking your bags with 2 kids at 11:30pm. 
The other huge fail was paying for a 2 room suite with a skyline view. Our view was far from that!! False advertising at its finest. We talked to 3 mangers over our 2 day stay, none really cared that we got our room late or that we didn’t get the room we prepaid for. Because it was prepaid they had us, no credit for their mistake or misleading us. The waiter in the restaurant was rude and bothered, it was just not a welcomed feeling. 
The website pictures of our room and our actual views were just wrong. The only thing they offered was for us to move again! We were only there for 2 nights, such a waste of our time and added unnecessary frustration to our holiday weekend. We have stayed in hotels all over the world, this was by far the most misleading experience coupled with terrible customer service! There are so many amazing hotels in NYC with great views and excellent customer service. This is NOT one of them!

title: Excellent staff, room, location etc
text: Have now stayed at the Dominick a number of times with my wife and kids and every time the hotel surpasses our expectations. From the doormen to the reception desk and concierge, room service and the housekeeping staff, you can tell service is preached throughout the hotel by management. Everyone you run into here, super polite and caring.  In particular one manager we dealt with, Cesar, was absolutely exemplary, going out of his way to solve a challenging issue we encountered. We rarely post reviews but were moved to take the time by the level of service at this place.

title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Service, Simply Perfect
text:
I've just returned from the most amazing trip to New York after an exquisite 8 day stay in The Dominick. I couldn't recommend this place enough. 

Their amazing rooms are complimented with perfect customer service from the moment we stepped through the door to the moment we left. 

Of particular note was Tajeena attention to detail and eagerness to please. She is an absolute credit to the hotel!

Thank you so much for an amazing trip, Tajeena, you made our honeymoon magical.

title: Honeymoon at the Dominick
text:
We visited from the UK for our honeymoon, the hotel is absolutely beautiful, and the views from the rooms are amazing but what was even better was being greeted by Tajeena, who was super friendly, had a huge smile on her face and provided such an excellent service.
She went above and beyond to tailor our room perfectly for us, allowing us to make the most of the views and the spacious rooms.
Can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and that's mainly thanks to the excellent customer service we've received.
Thank you!!

title: Un-empathic and poor service. Wonder how it’s still a 5 star hotel
text:
Booked directly through their website, paid extra , emailed to ensure corner room with view but room was not ready. We have a 9 month old and check out from Mandarian was 1:30 so asked for early check in here but instead our room was not ready till 5:20 pm and when our poor 9 month old was absolutely drained out of this wait-  another front desk personnel gave us an “available room”. We were told to “speak with manager” like it will magically rectify our misery. 

No crib in room in spite of earlier requests. Rooms not kid friendly as power sockets on floor-uncovered. Dirty floor Carpet on arrival and agree with previous reviewers about bedding. We decided to spend couple of nights here for view and service and preferred it over midtown 5-stars but felt made serious mistake.

Our experience- this Dominick has lost touch and standards have dropped. Not bad to book through 3rd party websites for last minute deals but definitely not a 5 star luxury anymore like plaza or MO etc.  insensitivity towards customers destroy hospitality businesses and they need to realize it. I also am a member of their exec club but Of no avail. Even the room they checked us in had a pre-filled breakfast order card with someone’s name on it (probably prior guest). 

I don’t write reviews often but this treatment prompted me to share this experience at Dominick - NYC.  Happy Holidays !

PS; will update you guys further once check out about that experience.

title: Short city break
text: Great hotel. Location perfect. Many restaurants in walking distance.  Rooms spacious and great views. Staff all very responsive and helpful.  A great place to stay. Lots of room options so best to discuss with reception at time of booking.  2 room suite worked well for us with 2 kids

title: no mojo or boho a the dominik soho........
text:
I have stayed here about 7 times over the past 10 years (the last time being early 2017) during my annual trip from the UK. 6 times were perfect, unadulterated uncompromising luxury on all levels - the staff, the rooms, the food - all beyond expectations. This being my 7th visit, but now under the 'Dominik' brand, 
Oh dear, from the moment I turned up, it was not looking good. A lot of familiar faces still working there but compared to all previous visits, there has been an unacceptable & endemic change in their attitude to service. No more fresh 'macaroons' & no other options for mattresses apart from 'super soft' - used to be choices for medium and firm. 
The upsell started on checking in - 'as I had booked directly with the hotel, how about moving from your dark lower floor room to a bright city wide view - for only $150 per night'. Clearly lots of better rooms available, but no free upgrade for a repeat customer.
I was told there was a package waiting for me and they would send it straight up to the room. Porters how bought up the baggage, asked if I needed anything and i requested some Ice and a kettle and tea bags. Ice arrived 5 minutes later.
2 hours later, still no package & no kettle and the TV was on the blink, switching itself off every 10 minutes. Went to reception to remind them about the package and kettle and went back to the room to meet the 'IT'  engineer. He fiddled with a few knobs, pointed the remote control in various directions, and said all would be fine with the TV. 
10 minutes after he left, the TV kept on switching itself off again and again and again. 
Had to leave to go on an appointment reminding them for a 3rd time that the 'package' & kettle still had not arrived and that the TV still not working.
Got back 2 hours later, package and kettle arrived, TV - not working and now TV in Bathroom not working.
Next morning, told them yet again about the TV and they promised faithfully to get it fixed.  Went out for breakfast meeting, returned around midday - room not made up, TV not working yet someone had clearly been in to check the fridge to see if I had used any of the apparently solid gold drinks (apparently according to the prices).
Reminded them yet again about the TV. Went out for afternoon, returned around 5pm. Room made up TV not working!!!!
Went to reception to complain. Receptionist suggest that they send up the IT engineer to check out the TV. Pointed out that they had apparently been in 4/5 times already and clearly could not fix it, but did not let me know. I told receptionist enough was enough and wanted to move to a room that had a working TV. Despite all the problems i had encountered, I was moved down three floors to an even darker room with a kitchen space half the size and a smaller living area. 
So, here I am, 2nd night of a 3 night stay and decided to go through previous recent reviews for this hotel and low and behold, the TV problem is quite clearly endemic for many other customers - but clearly is the case that its ok to 'twiddle a few knobs and look as if it it fixed' knowing that the problem is most certainly not fixed. A bunch of reviews highlighting the same problem.
Now, lets get to the food ...................er..............what food. Restaurant closed and a mezzanine level cafe serving $30 sandwiches with room for no more than 25 people. That area used to be a lovely space to just sit, read, relax, get a coffee. Now, no lounge and unless you are there before the germans bag the tables, Uber Eats appear to be the better option. 
Shower pressure very low, have to pay for milk for the tea (which turned up 3 hours after request)........................(if you've made it this far, then you need to get out more!).
So as long as you dont need a TV, bring your own milk, don't mind sleeping on a mattress no firmer than quick sand, not expecting any packages, dont need to eat, don't want to relax in a lounge/bar area, prepared to use your own netflix and amazon on your own devises, happy with being downgraded after complaining,  all for a bargain $700 a night, then this is your dream hotel. 
"Stick then in 1209 as they don't look like they want to watch the TV'. In the meantime, I've already booked an alternative hotel for my next trip, in the hope that my 'new lover' will be more appreciative of my custom.

title: Awesome birthday weekend!
text:
The Dominic was in a super location and service was above and beyond. So glad I spent my birthday there. I am not giving it a total of five stars only because the first morning we stayed there was a jackhammer noise that woke us up and we listened to all during our breakfast. Our breakfast in the restaurant took over an hour before we were served any lukewarm food. In addition, upon looking at my bill, I noticed I was charge $24 for two local phone calls. I Just called accounting (because I remember upon check-in they told me I would receive local phone calls free) but after 12 1/2 minutes The woman trying to research, decided it was not worth the fight. I would definitely go back to The Dominic, just being aware nothing is ever perfect! 

Front desk staff and Bellmen are delightful!

title: Really deserves 10 stars!
text:
From moment we arrived extremely friendly smiling door men created a great first impression followed by Gabriella at the front desk who handled our check in and did everything possible to get us a fine room with a great view without us having to ask. 

The hotel is first class, but more importantly it is filled with first class team that is friendly, smiling, polite, nice and kind that deliver a first class experience.

It’s really hard to find anything wrong, but when my lunch order was delayed it was delivered to my hotel room with an apology and no charge again without me having to ask. 

As a business owner for more than 26 years I know it’s people that work a business that create the experience and the first class team at the Dominick create a great experience!

title: Amazing Stay at the best property in lower Manhattan
text: The Dominick is my go to business hotel in lower NYC. I have tried all the other 5 star properties and nothing beats the Dominick for amenities, location and service.  Gabriela at reception greets me by name, knows my preferences and always goes out of her way to make me feel welcome. Axel at the front door is also very welcoming.  My wife joined me on a recent stay, which she does not often do, and when she arrived before me, both Axel and Gabriela recognized her and welcomed her to the property.  This level of service is what keeps me coming back.

title: Excellebt
text: Everything you need for a great stay. Hotel rooms are spacious, very updated, and overall beautiful. And the hotel is a great location. Several amenities are offered complementary to ensure a great stay. One being great spa, great fitness center and complementary daily dry cleaning.

title: MAJOR REMORSE! Could have stayed at MUCH NICER hotel for HALF the price!
text:
I booked the Dominick through JetBlue vacations accidentally because I didn't calculate the per night price correctly in my head and then I couldn't change the resy. Since there was nothing I could do about it, I made peace with it, but for $700/night (!!!!!!!), I naturally had very high expectations. 

All I can say is, don't stay here. I've stayed at the Empire Hotel, the Standard in MePa and others for exactly half the price and they are far superior to the Dominick. Sure, the view from our room at the Dominick was amazing, but the flaws are oh so many! For just a taste of them...

1. The room itself is nothing special and in fact, felt shabby around the edges--the closet door, for example, really needed to be repainted. The furniture/furnishings are quite outdated. The water pressure in the shower is lacking. 

2. The toiletries are cheap and my hair looked terrible the entire weekend. You think for $700 a night, we could get decent shampoo! Even the disposable slippers in the room were cheap.Worst of all, the towels in the bathroom are thin and scratchy. I have nicer towels in my home that I bought at Bed, Bath and Beyond. Maybe the owners of the Dominick should go shopping there. Also, the blow dryer was a cheap drugstore kind.

3. There was a non-operational Nespresso machine, and as it is, we were given only three pods--all decaf! We had to call down for more (we didn't know at the time the machine wasn't even working) and when they brought a handful, most of them were also decaf. We asked for just a bit of regular milk (as opposed to those awful creamers) and were initially told we'd have to pay for it. Seriously? To be fair, they eventually brought us some, but the machine didn't work anyway and we gave up.

4. The bed was uncomfortable and the room was HOT. It was winter, but we had to put the manual fan on and turn the AC (!!) on to 66 to be able to sleep at all--and that wasn't much. The sheets are not cozy and I think it's a memory foam mattress--and those mattresses sleep very hot. We barely slept in the three nights we stayed.

5. We were on the 39th floor--nice!--but as opposed to most tall NY buildings, this one did not have elevators split up, meaning that all elevators serviced all floors and so it took a really long time to get to 39 and to get on an elevator back down.

5. The night before we were leaving--when it was already raining--we asked at the front desk about a cab to the airport in the morning. We were assured there would be plenty of cabs outside the hotel and we just needed to be down there an hour before we needed to be at the airport. They knew it would be raining at that time and we were quite emphatic that we'd be leaving at 7 am. They assured us, no problem. Next morning: zero cabs and the doorman said the front desk was wrong--that there are not always cabs there. On top of that, he suggested we walk to the corner to try and hail one, but did not offer to do so for us. Again, for $700 a night? And speaking of which, the front doors of that hotel are super heavy and only one time when we were going in was there a doorman to open the door/greet us.

6. To say the service was unexceptional is not quite right, because really there was no service at all. I have never in my life stayed at a hotel so expensive and yet this was the least remarkable hotel experience I've had. It could have been a Holiday Inn!

I could not be more disappointed about this experience, and I am so angry at myself for putting myself into more debt to stay at a place so undeserving. I had hoped for a very special and romantic weekend with my husband in NY and this was not the place to make that happen, but given the exorbitant cost, it will be a long time before I can return to the city.  :-(

title: Fantastic Experience for a Meeting  (or pleasure)
text: I had a truly fantastic experience at the Dominik Hotel. I am an event planner and I found myself needing to find a hotel last minute for a very important meeting for about 30 people. The Dominik and the staff came to my rescue. Right before the Thanksgiving holiday, I had  to get a contract, arrange catering, AV, and find some places to bring 20 or more people for dinner within walking distance of the hotel. Yikes. We made it happen and it was easy. Every single staff member I met was amazing. From the turn down service where they left me extra chocolates after I said I liked them,  the fantastic food, the bellmen who gave me extra directions and an umbrella, The staff who gave me printing paper (without me asking) so I wouldn't have to trudge out into the cold, Eric the concierge who found me 2 amazing restaurants for my team on Thanksgiving, to Gabriela at the front desk who handled all of my last minute attendee requests (and errors) with ease. Ser Del in AV helped me fix a projector issue I've been having for ages with ease. Paige and Nico took the best care of me as I planned the meeting. I could not have been in better hands. By far, this was one of the best experiences I have ever had with a hotel through the meeting planning process. Also - my room was great. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The meeting was flawless. Everything was spectacular. Amazing hotel.

title: Super service, well-located and up to luxury standards
text: I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at The Dominick in SoHo over the weekend. As someone who stays VERY frequently in luxury hotels and needs to work whilst traveling, I think would find this hotel extremely comfortable. It's kind of nice being out of midtown when 7 o'clock strikes. This stay has exceeded the last few of my luxury stays in the city. It was very comfortable, cozy and exactly what we didn't know we needed! :)

title: Great for Families
text: We recently visited The Dominick with our 15 month old. The hotel provided us with a crib and high chair. There’s a 24/7 cvs and Trader Joe’s on the corner- super convenient. It’s a great location to get anywhere in the city. Everyone from the doormen to the entire breakfast crew to the housekeepers (especially Aisha!) were fantastic! It was our second stay and it will be our third the next time we’re back in nyc! Thanks guys!

title: Thanksgiving Holiday away from home...
text: Great service and clean rooms. Slightly disappointed there was no bar or true restaurant or lounge to hang out in (I believe they were renovating) But overall it was a very nice stay with excellent service being at the center. Make sure to book your reservation through the hotel as they have us immediate upgrades upon arrival for doing so.

title: Thanksgiving 2019
text:
Great hotel!  Love the location.  Great service!
Views from the rooms are wonderful.  Our view was West and North!  It gets no better if you love cities and skylines. There is a Starbucks across the street.  The 6 subway is an easy walk.  Love the place!

title: Tired and in need of a refresh
text: For a claimed 5 star hotel this place does not cut the mustard.  Its  location is on the edge of Soho, not its centre. Its decor is getting rather dated, having (it seems) been inherited from its predecessor the Trump Soho (yes, it was one of his). Facilities are not up to 5 star standard - no Netflix, Amazon Prime etc, meaning nearly all TV is constantly interrupted by inane ads.  Maintenance not up to scratch - air con vents covered in dust, wallpaper peeling, doors in bathroom not fitting correctly. Lighting poor, especially in the bathroom, which is dingy, with light only on one side of the mirror. And ridiculous prices for services etc - $14 for a can of nuts! Plus cleaners rearranged EVERYTHING in the bathroom  on one day so we couldn’t find anything. The place needs to wake up and get into the 21st century.

title: Perfect from check-in through check-out
text:
Not only is the Dominick an ideal Soho location, the rooms and staff are excellent as well. I’d especially like to mention the incredible service provided by Gabriella at check-in and Nicole from room service - absolutely TOP NOTCH. Thank you for making my best-friend and my yearly girls trip to NYC the best ever!

Dana Schindler

title: Awesome front desk help at the Dominick Hotel NY
text:
We checked in with Tajenna and there were some issues with our reservations.  She worked very hard to get everything resolved and we ended up with exactly the room we wanted.  She was great and it started our trip on exactly the right note! 
* I wish more hotels had people like Tajenna.
Thank you!!

title: To improve
text:
- Few lights in the bathroom / pretty bad luminosity 
- À la carte breakfast / I’d rather buffet 
-  There isn’t netflix on tv
- Nothing special about the food and room service
- Service is a bit slow
- I expected more from the spa

title: Perfect spot in the city
text: Modern hotel with first class service. We had a room on 32nd floor with stunning views of Manhattan. Hotel location is also great as it is in Soho district next to shops and restaurants. Highly recommended.

title: Great hotel!
text: Highly recommend staying at the Dominick - walking distance to all the great things SoHo and the W Village have to offer. Lost my ID and Gabriela at the front desk was super sweet and even upgraded me to a corner room to make up for it!

title: Great experience and fab location
text: Modern interior and better quality than many similar priced in NY. Food very good. Bar was not great, but some nearby. Staff very helpful. Close to Spring st shopping and lots to do. Would recommend overall.

title: Ótimo hotel no Soho
text:
Com localização perfeita para quem quer estar no Soho e com metrô (Spring) em frente.
Fiquei no apto com vista para cidade , barbara ,no 22 ºandar.O apto é muuuito espaçoso com lavabo , sala , closet  , banheiro enorme ... ( poderia ter uma porta ) O hotel não é muito grande o que é bom ,pois os elevadores chegam rápido e não se escuta barulho do corredor. Voltarei com certeza.

title: Mi Boutique- Mi 5 stars. The best combination
text:
I had a perfect stay at this hotel.. Told the staff I was there because Con Ed had turned off the gas in my entire building in Tribeca. They were so nice, from the reception to the room maid not forgetting the bar waiters and the oh so nice doormen. Each day their warm welcome would make me smile even though I had spent a horrible ay with plumbers and contractors.
Did I say I LOVE this hotel?

title: Melhor do soho
text: Todos os anos vamos para Nyc. Sempre experimento novos hotéis . E esse sem dúvida foi o melhor. E da próxima vez vou ficar lá novamente . Super bem localizado, quartos amplos com vista, silencioso pra Manhattan . Café da manhã demorado , não vale a pena . Mas tem Starbucks na frente e muita opções . Cama super confortável , quarto escuro e banho maravilhoso. Com certeza vou voltar.

title: Lovely hotel!
text: The lobby is very cool and hip, a place where you'd want to hang out and just relax.  The check in process was quick and the front person was quite pleasant.  My room was lovely, very comfortable bed, huge bathroom and all immaculately clean.  The room was easy to control the temperature and (thank god) no smell of smoke.  I highly suggest the Dominick hotel.

title: Simply Excellent
text: Great location in SOHO. Beautifully appointed spacious rooms. Outstanding quality room service. Friendly attentive staff. Peloton bikes in the fitness center. This is one of the best hotel experiences I have had in NYC and look forward to a return visit soon.

title: What a nice surprise!
text:
This was previously Trump SoHo.
The hotel was understated elegance. All muted tones and stylish furnishings.
My room was spacious and nicely appointed. The bathroom was really great with plenty of room. The only draw back is the restaurant. Nothing special there. I must say, all the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating.

title: Great experience
text: We spent three nights at the hotel and had the best experience. We booked a room with a view and it was incredible. The room was amazing, service was great, the facilities are all well equipped. Location was very convenient to subway and many attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: True 5 Star + AMEX Platinum Perks
text:
Wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at The Dominick in November 2019.

Getting to the gist of it:

While there are phonies out there claiming to be one... this is a true 5 star hotel. Not the nicest we’ve been to, but for sure 5 star.

Service was excellent. Area recommendations on point. Always helpful.

AMEX Platinum holders... do yourself a favor and book through Fine Hotels and Resorts.

We got a double upgrade to a 36th floor room with Hudson River / Freedom tower view (of course this is only on availability, not guaranteed). Plus, the resort credit, breakfast, late checkout, etc... perks.

Location is within walking distance from any type of shopping or restaurant you could practically want.

Hotel transportation available if needed. Friendly, professional drivers.

Would love to return when the outdoor pool is open because it would only make it better.

Great stuff.

title: Perfect location and beautiful rooms and attentive staff
text:
This was my first time to The Dominic Hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. The accommodations were  very spacious and had all the modern day amenities I needed for a comfy stay during this quick 4 night business trip to NYC.  Loved the view from my bedroom and spacious bathroom! Housekeeping staff were wonderful and the restaurant recommendations the Front Desk gave were great. 

Will deff. Stay here again and will recommend to others.

title: Excellent stay
text:
The ideal location, just off the crazy crowds of SoHo.
The hotel has fantastic views, and has a very relaxing layout and decor.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.
The only issue was that the pool was closed for the season, although we were already in May.  There was no mention of it on the booking nor the website.

title: Perfect Hotel to Discover Soho
text: Have only positive things to say about a recent 3 night stay here. Hotel staff was attentive but not overbearing, spa was perfect for a quick massage and you are close to some of the best shopping and dining in the world. The hotel will be even better when the restaurant/bar renovation is completed. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family for a fabulous NYC getaway!

title: Phenomenal customer service
text: Gabriella made our stay absolutely perfect. From check in to check out, she went above and beyond to ensure our vacation transpired seamlessly. I guarantee we’ll be back! I have no doubt in my mind that this is best hotel in NYC with phenomenal staff. Thank you, thank you!!!!

title: Really nice, but...
text: The Dominick, formally The Trump Soho, is a very nice hotel, with an outstanding location but... if you enjoy watching TV, do not stay there. They have issues where as you watch TV, about every 20 minutes the cable or satellite goes out for about three minutes and then comes back. Very frustrating if you are watching a game or show, you miss the action. Stayed 8 nights, spoke to IT and others. They knew it to be an issue, but seemed unable to do anything to repair issue. The restaurant was hugely inconsistent with heavy construction going on in the adjacent space, so loud you could not hear yourself think. That said, many outstanding employees in the hotel committed to service and their guests. Really too bad but until the TV issue, restaurant inconsistencies, and construction are rectified, it will hard to return. Disappointed that after at least Four comments to front desk and IT, never heard anything from management.

title: THE DOMINICK HOTEL/ONE OF A KIND!!!
text: The Dominick Hotel has been like a 2nd home to me since my Stage 4 Cancer Recovery just this past year. I’ve been gracious enough with the presence of such amazing people here, starting with Gabriela, who is the “Rock Star” at the front desk, but make no mistake about it, the “amazing”ladies who work with Gaby, are just as awesome as she is, starting with Marlene, Neferteri, Sydeka, Tiffany, and Tajeena:). I’ve been honored and grateful that these outstanding young ladies have gone above and beyond to make every stay of mine more memorable than the last!!!! But let me be perfectly clear hear, because of the way these young ladies “Rock”, is because of the 2 Outstanding Gentlemen behind the scenes at The Dominick, The Director, Hector, and The Assistant Director, Ahmaed!!! I’m so very honored to have gotten to know these fine gentlemen as well, and the entire hotel staff, and i will be returning again very soon. The Dominick Hotel definitely is in a class by itself!!!!  A++++++++++

title: Views for Days
text: I audibly gasped when I walked into my room. The space itself was not only pristine, attractive, and inviting, but the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking a perfect NYC sunset left me stunned. 10/10 would recommend this stay.

title: Another great stay
text: Our favorite hotel in soho. Accommodated our family quite well.  Asked all the right questions to understand our needs and then delivered with an amazing room.  Thank you front desk check in team.  I wish I had written down your names when we arrived early Saturday morning before Veterans  day! You rock!! Well worth the wait which wasn’t even that long after arriving on a red eye from the west coast.  Upgraded to 25th floor and we all enjoyed it. Beautiful large room, clean, friendly staff and well located.  We will be back!

title: Weekend get away
text:
Great hotel- spectacular views from SoHi rooms , beautiful room & bathroom, exceptional spa facilities. perfect location for walking around Soho/West Village.
Very polite and helpful staff- Mohendra at the front desk took great care of us.

title: Worst hotel experience ever !!
text:
This was by far Literally "the worst hotel Experience" I had in my entire life. Long story short, night shift Manager is rude and actually shouted at me when I was speaking politely! Their security guys are rude too! I was accused of being a liar, insulted and humiliated- by being shouted at- in front of my friend, hotel staff, and other customers by the manager.

I spoke with higher management just requesting an apology from the same guys that insulted me, and they said: "we will try our best to ask them to apologies!" and no one did !!

The bottom line here: if and only if you would like to be mistreated, insulted, ...etc, while paying for a "5 Stars Hotel" This is the place to be.

title: The hotel is fabulous I enjoyed the mezzamine bar I also love the friendly ness of the personall
text: My room is fabulous amazing views of the empire state and battery .east river and views of brooklyn The manager hector was so amazing He took care of all my needs as well as a support cast Mohendra halall was so incredibly detailed orientated .marlene jenny omg.all so great

title: Tolle Tage im Dominick
text:
Tolles Hotel in sensationeller Lage in Soho... mit einem atemberaubenden Rundumblick über die Skyline in NY...
Wir wurden bei Anreise für einen angemessenen Aufpreis auf eine SoHi-Suite upgegradet und dies hat sich unendlich gelohnt inklusive Rundumblick auf den Hudson, Downtown und auch den Financial District... einfach amazing...
Der Service war stets unaufdringlich und zuvorkommend...
Wir kommen auf jeden Fall wieder...

title: Incredible Stay at the Dominick Hotel
text: Beautiful room and best night's sleep ever! Super friendly staff.  The attention to detail at the Dominick is incredible.  When you walk in, you are greeted by a welcoming staff and an aroma that reminds me of staying at a luxury hotel in Europe.  Can't wait for my next trip to New York and accommodations at the Dominick!

title: Great hotel, central location in Soho.
text: I had a beautiful corner room with amazing views from the 37th floor of the Freedom Tower and Hudson River.Great amenities included free wifi and fresh bottle of water with turn down. Great service. This was my first time in Soho and it was walking distance to many great restaurants and top retailers incl. Chanel.

title: Excellent service and Beautifully appointed hotel
text: Located midway between the south end financial district and the areas near Central Park.  Loved the corner room facing southwest, the World Trade Center Building, Hudson River and New Jersey to the West.  Super service from the staff even when impacted by Professional basketball teams who love the place.  Great visit.

title: Great Room
text:
Loved the room and the central location.
I was traveling with two of my riends - one slept on the sofa sleeper and my other friend and I shared a king.
Even with three women in one room, plenty of space for all of our stuff! 
Would do it again!

title: Amazing gem in SoHo!!
text: First time staying at a hotel in Soho, I am an NYC resident, and I was not disappointed!  The staff was courteous and  friendly, room service was prompt, and the stunning views from the 41st floor were amazing!  Full view of the sunset over the Hudson, breathtaking!  Our room was upgraded two levels, thanks to the lovely front desk receptionist Gabriella, who overhead it was my birthday and gave us one upgrade over the American Express platinum upgrade we automatically received.  She went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and explained the various ammenities and perks we received.   My friend and I were treated like royalty for our one night stay, and we are sure to return soon!

title: Lack of service and low value for the money
text:
After a red eye and over an hour ride from JFK, the doormen literally just watched me with two luggage walked in without offering any help. I’m shocked by this as this is supposed to be a 5 star hotel.

As I encounter the front desk, the man seems to be nice and offered a few descriptions of the hotel. He also complimented my VIP status...

Being that it’s 9am he mentioned the room isn’t ready despite the fact that I booked a suite and gave advance notice via my travel agent. I was actually fine with it until what happened next...

He checked around and says, actually we have a room for you ready then spoke to someone and proceed to tell me I need to pay 100 per night over my current rate.

Out of curiosity I asked to visit the suite. It turns out it’s the exact same suite I booked🧐, and he says I have to pay more because it’s on a higher floor.

Even at this juncture, although upset, I simply asked to be placed in any room so I can fresh up for my meeting in an hour. He refused and said they are fully booked and it will trouble the hotel to clean the room. 

There is a certain level of hospitality that 5 star hotels garner. Even if they are fully sold out... this place isn’t remotely close to match the service with the price it dictates. Even at Le Meurice, Paris, I was treated with significantly higher curtesy. Unfortunately some hotels such as the former Trump Soho will never live up to expectation.

title: Great views
text: Nice hotel, great location for everything you could want. Dining, shopping and much more. Definitely will stay here again! Staff were friendly and service was top notch. Room service was quick and delicious.

title: Halloween Central
text:
The staff is always smiling very helpful and gracious.. the amenities are a A + best kept Manhattan secret 
Great location in SoHo my favorite neighborhood for shopping eating away from tourist hot spots

title: Another wonderful stay
text:
Stayed here earlier in the year with my mum and have just returned from a trip with my husband. It is the best hotel I have stayed in whilst visiting the city. All the staff are friendly and really seem to care about your stay. The room was great - spacious, clean and the bed was really comfortable. Views from the 37th floor were amazing. On top of this, the location (away from midtown) is brilliant.

Only small area for improvement is consistency around turn down. We only received turn down twice in our four night stay (and one of the times we did not receive it, we had specifically requested it). 

Can’t wait to return. Thanks to everyone for a great stay.

title: Big Suites
text: Nice hotel, the jr.suite was so spacious we laughed as we had just come from a shoebox-size hotel elsewhere. It was definitely from a past 90's era, controls everywhere with LED lights everywhere, power curtains, etc.  We really loved the space.  Comfortable bed, good location in Soho, good service.

title: Very Good Hotel
text: Located just outside the hustle and bustle of New York City. The hotel is very nice and the staff are very friendly. My daughter wasn’t feeling very well and we bought her some medicine which required freezing. The gentleman behind the desk saw I was carrying the medicine and immediately offered to put it into the freezer for me. The door staff are very efficient and very helpful. Getting in and out of a taxi with kids and luggage is made a lot easier with the help the door staff gave. If you are visiting New York and want to stay close enough to the city but just outside so your away from the major rush I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff were very helpful and made our stay that much better. The view from the room was amazing could see the Empire State Building and the beautiful sky line and New York bridges.

title: Decent Hotel in Soho
text: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter for one night before NYU move-in. It did not live up to the ads touting it as the only five star hotel in SoHo. Our room was nice and the location was great, but the lobby was small and lacked a wow factor. We had to wait for elevators, and the hotel felt crowded. The main restaurant was closed for renovation, so we ate at the restaurant on the second floor where we were the only table on a Saturday night (awkward!). The menu was limited but the food was good. The steep charge for a rollaway was off-putting, as was the resort fee (they comped it when asked). The woman at the front desk who handled checkout was not very cordial,and it took a very long time to complete a simple transaction.

title: Worn furnishings, odd pricing: beware the loud air conditioning units
text: I was looking for a quiet hotel with a good view and booked a quiet SoHi room.  As other reviewers have noted, the hotel charges a non-refundable $40/per night resort fee, for which one gets a cup of watery coffee and supposedly three items of clothing pressed, in addition to the high price of the room. Very strange! When I called to ask if I could get my clothing pressed, I was told it would take 24 hours to get it back. The view from my room was great, as advertised. The couch was very worn and the carpet  had some filthy spots on it. The windows don't open and the air conditioner was extremely noisy.  The motor switched on and off intermittently and when it was on, it made a loud and persistent banging noise.  This can be expected at a budget hotel, but should not be a problem at a luxury hotel.  I asked the front desk if the unit could be repaired or if I could change rooms, as I am a light sleeper.  They sent a repair man up and he listened to the motor and laughed and said that the noise was totally normal, then shut the door of the unit and left.  I was woken up several times by the motor. I turned the unit off but it was very hot and stuffy in the room without it.  So I wore my noise cancelling headphones for the rest of the night in order to sleep.  The next morning, I asked if I could change rooms.  Staff helpfully showed me another room, where the air conditioning unit was nearly as loud. There were no other rooms available.  I said I would like to leave the hotel and the staff graciously waived the penalty I was supposed to pay for leaving early.  Overall: great views, good location, comfortable bed, worn furnishings, strange pricing strategy, and odd approach to customer service.

title: Outstanding!!
text: When I arrived I was greeted by Mohindra at the front desk. He was gracious and professional and attended to all of my requests, exceeding them all, to my great satisfaction. Mohindra made my stay so very special, and helped me to familiarize myself with Soho and its environs. He was very knowledgeable about all of the services offered by the hotel including the spa services. I’m a Langham devotee but now I prefer the Dominick. I will stay here in the future. I recommend this hotel unhesitatingly!

title: Five Star Hotel in SoHo
text:
We stayed in SoHo at The Dominick based on a recommendation from our travel agent.  The Dominick is centrally located in SoHo so it’s close to all the shopping.  The Dominick hotel is the only five-star hotel in SoHo.

Once we arrived at this luxury hotel, we were greeted by a bellman who took care of our bags and gave us directions to the lobby/check in area.  This property has a modern high end feel to it.  At reception, we received an upgrade to our room (nice!)  Once we completed our check in, we were given our key and made our way up to our room, which was a well-appointed room with amazing views of the city.  Our room was a King SoHi Guest Room on the 31st floor (room 3104).  I would recommend staying SoHi or Penthouse to get the views.

Note: When staying in NY the rooms can be on the smaller side.  It is city living!

After settling in, we decided to go check out the hotels bar. The bar is just one floor above the lobby and opens up to the downstairs area a bit.  It is very small and more like a lobby bar than a true bar.  There are no views from this bar, and it isn’t a place you would want to spend a lot of time.  We grabbed some drinks and headed back up to our room to freshen up for dinner. 

In our room we had a cheese plate delivered and it was yummy.  The room service breakfast for each morning we were there wasn't the best.  I would say moderate and not one of my favorites.  

We also tried out the spa, Babor Signature Spa.  I would use the word spa loosely as this spa is very small with limited options.  When we were there the sauna was not working for the ladies area so they opened up the men’s as a co-ed.  Um, no thanks...  Also the pool and jacuzzi were under renovations.  Perhaps soon all of the renovations will be done, and it will be a better version of a spa.  The spa staff also seemed a bit disoriented.  My massage was amazing, so if you can get past the smallness of the spa, it works for the purpose of a massage.  However, the massage was expensive considering the spa is so small and doesn't offer a lot of options.

Overall it is a nice hotel, but still has some kinks to work out with the spa and room service.

title: Excellent!
text: I stayed on 10/29 and the staff was great. Emily at the front desk was able to upgrade my room due to my repeat visit. In, addition she was very helpful and answered all my questions. I will come again!

title: Sooo Awesome in Soho!
text: LOVE this location! Love being near all the shops and restaurants in Soho plus this hotel ROCKS. Extremely clean, friendly staff, has all the amenities one needs and we slept great (amazing beds and bedding; seriously, where can we buy/purchase for our home). A wonderful stay.

title: Mr. Metzker
text: The hotel was great we had amazing views at our SoHi suite. The person who made it an even better experience was Gabriela B from the front desk. She was truly helpful with all my questions and a few requests. She honestly made my stay from great to amazing!! Thank you!

title: Perfect hotel experience
text: The Dominick Hotel is our favorite hotel in NYC.  We always seem to be greeted by the front desk agent Gabriella...she is constantly in a cheerful mood, extremely polite, and bends over backwards to accommodate our desires.  The Dominick has become a home away from home for us, as we like to travel to NYC every other month.  It seems more spacious that other hotels, and is within a short walking distance to wonderful restaurants and shopping in SOHO.  Also, the rooms are quiet as we never hear people talking in the hallways, the mattresses and pillows are wonderful, and the towels are large and luxurious.  Highly recommend this hotel!

title: amazing week
text: what can I say: perfection.  I stayed at the 2804: amazing view on the freedom tower and the east river. vibrant neighborhood, amazing restaurant...didn’t wanna go home. The personnel is discrete and efficient. the room is done multiple times per day.

title: Excellent stay, love the space
text: Our second time staying here - we much prefer this hotel over the usual mid-town 5 star ‘grand dames’ such as the Palace. The rooms are amazing - large bathrooms, high ceilings, floor to ceiling windows with electric drapes which open to reveal the bright New York mornings, genuinely friendly staff... plus plenty of restaurants and local shops close by in the Village and Soho. If you want to travel uptown by subway rather than car, the closest station is on the 1 line which is super quick.

title: Visitor
text: Nefratilli and Gabriel at the front desk are amazing, they go above and beyond with professionalism and savvy. They and together with the frank, Stanley, merrick, axel and Chris make it my home away from home.

title: Home away from home
text: I have been staying at the Dominick for 2 years almost every 2 weeks and it is like a home away from home.The people are fantastic. Marlene, Mohindra, manager Ahmed and the whole front desk team, as well as the entire bell staff all make you feel like you are at home. Marlene in particular has been  The hotel itself offers the best views in the city if you are above the 20th floor and the pool in the summer and the spa in the winter make this a destination. The neighborhood is wonderful with Soho's most famous 5 star restaurants and world class shopping right outside the door within walking distance. The Dominick will always be my first choice in Manhattan

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Friendly team, luxurious experience, outstanding Soho location.
This is a great NYC hotel within walking distance of great coffee shops and restaurants, central park luxury with a Soho address, this is my hotel of choice in NYC.

title: Great Place to Relax
text: I must say that this hotel was one of THE BEST I have ever stayed at. From check in to check out, this place deserves an A+. Very modern, sleek and clean! Great location, great service, great staff! Highly recommended!

title: Disappointing
text: Just completed my 5th stay in two years at this property. All previous stays were excellent, marked by great service. This time, however, the service was substandard, from the three-hour wait for a room change on check-in to the failure of the hotel to fix a room phone with no receiver volume and the failure to replace a leaky Nespresso machine to the surprise of a daily "destination fee" on my bill. Re the room change, the hotel clerk first attempted to interest us in an "upgrade" in the form of a suite on the 17th fIoor with a depressing view of a couple of industrial-style water-tanks. I expect more for being a frequent guest. On the plus side, the views from the upper floors are phenomenal, and the doormen are great.

title: One of the best in NYC
text:
The staff and service goes above and beyond. Anything you need, whirling minutes.
We were upgraded to a suite. The room is large, clean- and has everything you need.
Pool construction (ie noise) at 8 am was the only thing that bothered us, but we were told there was an emergency. 
We will be back!

title: great value for NYC
text:
We loved our Soho Suite w a view-spacious and comfortable. 
The food is less than great-eat elsewhere-there are lots of options around.
The hotel and restaurant are in transition so the food issues may be resolved soon.
Pool service was at times odd-the life guards spent most of the time chatting w customers and then would get ready to leave 30 mins before closing time. 
At other times there was a great manager in charge that controlled things-overall a bit unpredictable.

title: Best in Class!!
text: Mrs. Coates and I had one of our most memorable experiences courtesy of the amenities and the extraordinary staff at The Dominick. This speaks volumes given the fact the we have traveled the world.  The room had sweeping views of the Hudson and the city's breathtaking skyline. The front desk was exceptionally accommodating when we requested late check out and the concierge, Peggy Madrid, worked wonders regarding evening endeavors!  She really put the icing on the cake!  We definitely will recommend the hotel to our friends and colleagues! Bravo!!

title: Will definitely stay again.
text: Went there on a mother/daughter trip and the staff was amazing.  Made our reservation through AX and received a free upgrade and all sorts of free goodies along the way.  Michael and Eric at the concierge desk were both very helpful.  Room Service was the friendliest I have ever encountered.  Property was clean, conveniently located and has a great bar/restaurant.

title: nice location but quite old decoration and furniture
text:
ideal location very convenient direct access to this lively part of new york citeverything is at a walking distance
but atmosphere, equipment,design really old fashioned
which is giving you a kind of mix feeling

title: Visit good visit but delayed refund
text: The visit was fine. They put a $150 hold on my debit card and three days later i am waiting  for the hold to be released.  This seems a bit long....I did not charge anything or use mini bar. I would have expected an immediate refund.

title: Favorite hotel in Soho
text: The Dominick is ideally situated on Spring Street and walking distance to shops and restaurants.  The staff and service is outstanding and so is it's newly renovated spa.  Rooms are modern, very spacious and have a great view of the city.

title: Very nice high end hotel in a fabulous location.
text:
The Dominick Hotel is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location in the Lower East Side.  One can easily walk almost everywhere and the choices of shopping and restaurants in Soho and the Village is extensive.  The rooms are very large and nicely appointed and the staff is friendly.  We had a high floor room with a wonderful view.  They offer free coffee and small pastries in the morning.  Pricing is high ( look for a deal or promotion) and there is a $40 destination fee plus tax ( about $45 extra per night) that you don’t find about until you check in.  I am not sure if this is something new for all hotels in NYC or not, but you might want to check about that before booking.  Parking is also very expensive, so park in a different lot close by.
Other than the hidden fees, if you can afford it, I definitely recommend the Dominick Hotel.

title: Excellent Customer Service and Accomodations
text:
We took the red-eye into NY and went straight to the hotel to put our bags down thinking we would just head out without resting. We did not expect our room to be ready at all. However, to our very much pleasant surprise, Mohommad (very professional and very helpful!) found us a room that was available and ready for us to use. We were overly ecstatic to say the least. The rest of the stay was equally amazing and we will no doubt stay here again.  

Aside from the spacious room and great customer service, the location was perfect. It was close shopping and restaurants/bars in SOHO.

title: Business/pleasure
text: The room was lovely; very spacious and great view.  Bed was not easy to sleep in and pillows were WAY too soft.  A/C was awful.  Either so hot you had to take the covers off or so cold you had to pull blankets up to chin.  Temperature never what you set it at.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
We enjoyed everything about out fabulous visit to this hotel. Our suite was so beautiful and comfortable it was hard to leave to go exploring. We had a view of the river and had a beautifull sunset each night. The bathroom was very nice yet the garden tub was such a treat with view from the  tub! The service was 5 star. The roof top pool and bar was the best part.
When we did leave the hotel, everything was so close. You have a Starbucks across the Street, a groucery and drug store a block away, a liquor store just a little bit futher. There are so many great restaurnts nearby with Little Italy still in walking distance. We will be back.

title: Loving this hotel
text: Always enjoyable stay. Amazing staff. Rooms are big and views are one of the most amazing on Manhattan. Probably one of the best values in the area. Even rooms on the lower floors are far situated in a way there is no noise from the streets.
